description:
Loving the view and the vibes at The View! It is pretty amazing! This is my second time coming here and I still really enjoy it. My friend and I thought our drinks were pretty cute and delicious! The first time I came I ordered the charcuterie board and I liked their presentation of it. During my second visit, we ordered poké and it was something I would totally order again except I wish they gave some more chips to eat it with! 

I visited on a Monday night with my friend right at opening and we were able to sit at a table right by the window. I highly recommend coming a bit before opening time to ensure you get a nice view!!
author: Katrine U.

description:
I went here on a weekday night but the view is well worth it! I can see why they call it "The View Lounge" This place is packed, a lot of the crowd are often business people probably staying at the Marriot hotel. The day we went, the place was so crowded, I honestly felt like a sardine in a can. We barely found a place to sit at the bar but luckily found a two seater once someone left! 

A little expensive but the drinks were extremely strong, maybe even too strong to enjoy...after one drink my friend was tipsy but I guess you're getting your moneys worth!
author: Amelia L.

description:
My friend and I came on a Monday evening - it was crowded but not so much that we couldn't get a nice seat by the window! Of course the view was gorgeous. We both got the Black Bay - it wasn't too sweet. We also shared the cheesecake, which was absolutely delicious. It was light and fluffy, and the little white balls added a nice crunch with the frozen, tart blueberries. I would highly recommend getting the cheesecake if you're looking for a dessert option!

Service was great. I'll be back again!
author: Stacy L.

description:
We had a few hours to kill before a red eye flight and decided to check out The View Lounge located inside the Marriot Hotel. Since we were headed to the airport a hotel lounge made sense because we wouldn't look all that out of place with luggage. We found couch seating in the corner near the entrance with plenty of space for our bags, and our hostess was great about getting us menus and starting us a tab. I don't typically order much other than a glass of wine or a vodka soda, but the atmosphere here made me feel like I needed something fancier in a fun glass, so I ordered a cosmopolitan. SO good. I have to be honest I'm not sure I've had a cosmo since college when we used to buy the bucket of mix for movie night in the dorms, so I had no idea how good an appreciated a well made one would be. I ended up ordering a second. 

I would say the inside atmosphere and the window that displays the view is a little more impressive than the actual view itself, but not disappointing by any means. There were plenty of food options, but we just shared some chips and dip, which were delicious. Drinks were a little pricey in my mind, but given the city and the hotel lounge with a view it was probably par for the course.
author: Jessica G.

description:
As soon as I saw the pictures of that amazing window and it's view I knew I had to go.  That window looks straight out of a fantasy story, like one hiding magic on the other side.  But what you get to find out is that the magic is right there, inside the bar.

We went on a Friday night, late. They had just did the "last call".  I was still able to see the window and the view, but I wanted more.  
First reason why they get a good review...  they immediately apologized for the inconvenience (even though it was us who got there late) and proceeded to recommend other places for us to go, all walking distance.  And asked us to please come another day.

As luck would have it, we did have time to stop by again on Sunday afternoon before our flight.  We were there, with all our luggage, but managed to get a spot, right at the entrance.  They have so sofas and our luggage fit perfectly without being in anyone's way.  

The bar is first come first serve, so whatever table, or seat you see available, take it!  it does get crowded with locals, and tourists alike.  Although, honestly, if I lived there I think I would frequent other places... this is definitely a beautiful spot but mostly because of the novelty of that window, after a while I think it would loose it's enchantment.

As I mentioned, we got out seats, looking straight at the bar, and to our right that amazing window.  Inside is dimly lit so you can enjoy the city lights through the window regardless of where you are seated or standing.

The server came to us in no time with menus, drinks and they have a nice selection of bar bites to accompany them.  She gave us a minute to decide and was back to take our order, at the same time that she brought us water.

I opted for their cucumber mint refresher.  This was exactly that, refreshing.  Clean, simple, and very welcoming after 3 straight days of wine (Napa trip...)  As you can imagine prices are a bit high but not terrible.  Signature drinks cost from $15 - $20.  They also have a full bar, wines, scotch and whiskey, and beers.

To snack on something while we killed time before our flight, I ordered the house-made chips.  Generous amount of perfectly crispy and salty chips, with a delicious scallion aioli on the side.  One order was enough for 3 of us.  Drinks, well, those had to be refilled  :p

I was happy we got the chance to get the full experience before we left, and see with my own eyes that (magical) window.
author: Greshka P.

description:
I'll start with what I didn't like from The View Lounge: the wait. I thought it was a little weird how there is no waiting list. You just have to depend on lady luck and pray that the people sitting on the table you're standing behind are leaving. 

However, let's focus on the good things. I went with my roommates and we honestly had a great time. We had the tuna tartar, which was decent and I had the cosmo. Everything was great, and even if the price was a little bit on the high side, I was fine with it because I was also paying for the view and the atmosphere. The space was breathtaking! It was absolutely magic! The huge semi-circular windows seem to be a newer addition to the building, but what do I know? I loved the place. The view was amazing and I got there around 6 and stayed until around 8, so I was lucky enough to catch the sunset. 

I would definitely like to come again, hopefully with my boyfriend. My TIP: split your group up when you're looking for a table.
author: Shannen B.

description:
One word: sensational!

Located inside the historic San Francisco Marriott Marquis hotel, this interior rooftop lounge has it all by giving an aspect, breathtaking views and assortments of drinks and appetizers every year. It's called, "The View Lounge." The atmosphere is very laid back and active as I welcomed there. The concept is pretty modern and sleek thanks to the late 20th Century look of both sided half-circled window and contemporary decors.

The employees here from bartenders, servers and a host are doing an excellent job for making the customers like me a spectacular service despite the busier environment. No cons.

Now onto the drink! On 9/1/2018, I ordered one of their signature cocktail drinks from the menu. It's called, "Cucumber Mint Refresher" which it contains the mixtures of Vodka and club soda topped with a slice of cucumber and a fresh mint. As I drank it, that cocktail drink was such a spell-bound drink. With the help of fresh cucumber and fresh mint, it did enhanced both Vodka and club soda very well; perfectly balanced. I didn't get a chance to order their appetizers and small bites after my first visit, so I'll be back next time to try it out in the near future.

Parking at the View Lounge at Marriott Marquis hotel can be challenging to park. You can park at the nearby surface metered street parking nor the parking garage if its available. Alternatively, you can also ride a bike, walk, carpool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

In the end, The View Lounge at Marriott Marquis hotel is the most iconic, and magnificent modern interior rooftop lounge that I've ever visited for the very first time! Perfect for friends and co-workers gathering especially for date nighters too! A well received! My rating: 4 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
Haight-Ashbury, Soma Spritzer, Creme Bruleé and the Cheesecake. This re-shoots and lives up to the Four Stars I marked on my previous review.

I'd go back to have all items for myself and in that regard, the view and the motion sickness to get up here are the bonuses. Great.
author: Jason A.

description:
A and I had tried to come to this place twice before finally getting drinks here a few weeks ago. It is always crowded and not in a fun, lively way. People are just standing around, unaware of their surroundings, gawking at the view which admittedly, is gorgeous. The setup of this space also is peculiar and could be much better utilized. There is so much low seating that it makes it hard to walk and the separate rooms, in my opinion, really reminds you that you are in a hotel since it feels like conference rooms. Add to that the children running around what is a BAR (don't fall for that "lounge" BS) and it really takes away from what could be a lovely experience.

The drinks also are okay, nothing spectacular. I had a Blood Orange Margarita and A had a Manhattan. It was $30 for 2 drinks without tip which is a bit expensive, even by SF standards. My drink was fine, I have had better for less. A felt similarly about his drink. One big plus is that there is table service so you do not need to crowd around the bar, though tons of people still do. Plus, The View serves food that actually looks good even though we didn't order any.

Is the view beautiful? Yes. Is the decor nice, if impractical? Yes. Is it worth the money, discomfort and frustration at being jostled by tourists who have no concept of space? Absolutely not. Cityscape at the top of the Hilton is a much better execution of the same concept, more efficient use of space and better drinks. Go there, the views are just as good (if not better).
author: Carrie W.

description:
I recommend coming right when they open if you want the full seating view, drinks/food experience.

Unfortunately, we came a little later and it was busy. Since it's opening seatings everyone is watching each table like a hawk. We ended up getting seats but not with the view. 

Ordered the sausage flatbread and it was okay. Nothing to rave about. The bottom was just really soggy. Seems like the menu changes so I'd like to explore their menu a little more. 

Drinks took awhile to come out and they accidentally charged us twice. The view is nice so it's worth going and checking it out. Hopefully I'll get lucky and get window seating next time. It's such a cute place for date night.
author: Amanda N.

description:
Come for the stellar views, stay for the delicious drinks and good vibes. The View Lounge is on the 39th floor of the Marriott Marquis Hotel. There's a bar, ample seating, and great couches by the large windows. 

Our group of 5 was lucky enough to score those good seats, but there was some confusion over who would be serving us. Apparently, we were told another server handles our side, but no such server appeared. We ended up having to go up to the bar to order the drinks ourselves. No biggie, but it would have been nice to know before we waited ~15 minutes.

The drinks were about $15-$18, a bit on the higher end but expected for San Francisco and the Marriott Marquis. The drinks had cute names, too, like Fab-VIEW-lous and Haight-AshBERRY. If you're looking for fruity and sweet, I'd recommend the BlackBerry Bay and the Haight-Ashberry. If you're looking for something stripped down and simple, I'd recommend the Cucumber Mint Refresher.

We didn't get to eat, but a lot of other patrons around us did. Seems to be a great lounge to relax and spend happy hour.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
Came here with a group of about eight people for a drink and to check out the beautiful view we'd heard so much about. Unfortunately, Karl the fog rolled in to obstruct our view. I've seen photos and the view is stunning so I'll be back for that alone.

We did find a window seat but there wasn't enough chairs and we didn't feel like rearranging furniture to sit down. Plus there was the no view thing going on so we sat at a big U shaped table with plenty of space. We sat at the first table and then our second choice table for quite a while. Nobody came by to drop a menu or let us know that they'd be back shortly. Eventually our server came by and she was on top of things after that. 

I had an old fashioned and it passed the test. Nothing stand out about it except I love those bourbon soaked cherries... more please! Everyone else's cocktails looked well crafted too. The prices were up there but it was to be expected as you're likely up there for the priceless view.
author: Scotty C.

description:
Before visiting San Francisco I created a collection on Yelp of places I had to go to while in the city. The View was the #1 place.

I visited Sunday afternoon around 4:45 and was lucky enough to get a table next to the tall windows before it was busy. I ordered an $18 glass of Sequoia Grove Cabernet (more than I usually pay for a glass of wine but it was worth it for the view and ambiance) and enjoyed it while reading a book. I didn't stay for dinner due to dinner plans but was planning to eat there. Unfortunately I never made it back. If I visit again, I will!

I highly recommend getting there at 4 if you're wanting a good view and table or arriving before dark so you can get a table when one opens up for the nighttime view.
author: Callie R.

description:
A 'must' while in San Fran!  Look it up and go.  You won't be disappointed.  

I dropped in for a few drinks and appetizers before going to dinner.  Very very good experience.  The views are amazing and atmosphere is contemporary and excellent.  

Lounge seating is perfectly nestled around the areas , so there not a bad seat.  See pics.
author: James R.

description:
Want an amazing 360 view of SF in the heart of Union Square? Look no further because The View Lounge has plenty of views!  Stayed in the Marriot Marquis hotel and this is located on the 39th floor, but you do not have to be a hotel guest to enter the lounge. We came in on a Sunday night at around 8pm to catch the sunset and were able to marvel at all the buildings and the glistening ocean at the golden hour. Cocktails are a little pricey, but nothing unexpected. I believe I ordered the skyline punch and it wasn't bad.

Tip: come early for a spot by the window! You seat yourselves so it's first come first served. We stood waiting near the bar watching and waiting for a party to leave for a while. No dress code enforced. We came dressed in jumpsuits and heels but noticed people inside wearing hoodies and sneakers.
author: Mindy D.

description:
Wow. This is a must see in SF. The 39 floor of the Marriott marque opens up a world of sights and sounds of the City by the Bay. 

Take out of town guests for the evening of a lifetime.
author: Kevin C.

description:
The View Lounge is one of 'the must' visit lounge in SF. It's on the 39th floor inside the San Francisco Marriott Marquis Hotel. 
Parking inside the hotel could be very expensive so if you want to save money, there is a near by garage that cost reasonably unexpensive.

This place open at 4pm but it gets packed very quickly. Make sure to come early so that you can grab the seat which has the best view and enjoy the spectacular view of San Francisco while drinking cocktails and enjoy the small plates which aren't small at all.

They have wide variety of cocktails selection including classics like Old Fashioned, Manhattan also specialty cocktails that could not be missed.
We had 3 small plates which are cheese plate, ahi tuna, and pork belly. They all taste great.

Whether it's weekday or weekend... if you want to enjoy sip of cocktails or having dinner while watching the incredible view of SF.. The View is The Place To Be!
author: Irene X.

description:
Stayed at the Marquis during my recent visit so decided to check the View Lounge out since its in the same building, i love convenience!

Place is a total gem! Wish i had the chance to swing by during sunset to see the view of the city during the daytime.

I only got a chance to visit during the night. Its find your own seating, you can order drinks at the bar or service will come to you after you find your seats.

Obviously the best seats are along the windows since you get the view of the city, but if your coming up with a big group, good luck!

Drinks were great & would totally come back up here if i happen to be staying at the Marquis again.
author: Steven H.

description:
Came here for a night cap with some coworkers after a big dinner. This swanky lounge is located at the very top floor of the 39 story San Francisco Marriott Marquis.

Once you walk in you'll be greeted by huge arched glass floor to cieling windows and an Art Deco inspired lounge which has been recently revitalized after undergoing a multimillion dollar renovation just a few years prior.  The windows are simply beautiful and opens up to an incredible view of San Francisco... almost as if you can touch the skyline.  If you're lucky enough, you can grab a seat next to these windows and enjoy the view.  However this seems to be quite a popular spot so competition is fierce.  It may also be hard to find a seat, especially if you have a big group.  We found ourselves squeezing into a small corner couch near the entrance and about half the group were left standing.  

Despite the hustle & bustle, the service was really fast and efficient.  We got our menus and were able to order & receive drinks quickly. I got myself one of their specialty cocktails, the Skyline Punch (I think?).  It was nice & strong and I really enjoyed it. The cocktails were $14 & up, a little pricey, but this is San Francisco.  They also have wines, bourbons, scotch, and a great mix of other libations.  If you're hungry, they do offer food service with snacks, small plates, hot plates, & desserts.  

I would definitely come here again even just for the view.  Maybe next time during sunset?  I imagine the views are spectacular on a clear day :)
author: Maria P.

description:
If you're in San Francisco this is the place to have a romantic date for drinks! Located on the top floor of the Marriott this places has an amazing view of the city on both sides. Make sure to arrive at the time of its opening because the shade seat are take the quickest. The sunny side is nice, but can get a little too hot! 

The location is amazing! You have an amazing view of everything which is the whole base of "The View!" It's very romantic and sweet! They have plenty to drink and a delicious selected cheese platter. I love wine, but this time I got a couple of Stellas and the view was fabulous! 

Restrooms are in tip top shape and very clean. Our waitress was very sweet and they were very hands on by keeping your table clean. More room for drinks! I am definitely coming back for a fancy night out!
author: Marina M.

description:
Came here with my husband for our first month anniversary celebration and such a great vibe!
It was packed on the weekend but we managed to snag a corner table with the view.
The food and alcohol is pretty much average but its the view that makes this place so popular.
author: Mehak C.

description: I will definitely come back to the view- we got there around 6:30 and had no trouble finding a seat. Everyone there was so thrilled to see the sunset that the vibes were great. Once it gets dark, I do wish that some mood lights came on and some soft music because it ended up being very dark and quiet. 10/10 recommend bringing friends from out of town because the city looks phenomenal.
author: Sydney G.

description:
This lounge is located at the top of the Marriott Marquis and let me tell you, this place is amazing!!!! You can see the entire SF UNION SQUARE.  It's a good place to grab drinks and just take the excellent view that SF has to offer. They open at 4 and seatings are first come first serve. 

We didn't try their food but drinks were ok. I got the blood orange margarita and was kind of sweet but strong! My friends got the blueberry drinks with a hint of whiskey, and must say it was excellent! Will definitely visit this place again once I'm back in SF and will try to come during sunset which we did not get to to.
author: Mia A.

description:
OH MY GOSH. Salute to Yelp and my trip to San Francisco. I was in SF for 72 hours and ended up at this place twice!! LOVED it - it is totally a touristy situation and a very elite spot. The view was AMAZING. The buildings were so tall into the fog and was such a gorgeous view. I can't get over it. 

The menu is slightly expensive, but I am used to something else. This view and this lounge is red carpet, dress up, lipsticks vibes all the way. The service is great and we ordered a ton of appetizers. The wings, charcuterie, veggie plate....all was delicious. I am so glad we visited this spot. SO close to our hotel too.
author: Josi H.

description:
Overpriced but the cocktails were good (just not really unique enough to warrant the price tag, IMO) and the view is, of course, beautiful.  Definitely a romantic spot for a drink before an evening out.   

It's challenging to get a seat near the windows but most people who were lucky enough to get one don't seem to mind if others lean over to look or take a photo.  

I would stop by again if I was in the area.
author: Shanna K.

description: Some nights you just want to enjoy a glass of whiskey and the phenomenal SF view from above. Pleasantly surprised that we were able to find a seat and not be crowded throughout the night. Hostess provides you with a menu when you sit down and their is a wide selection of drinks with punny names. Prices were high but you're paying for the view. The drinks were strong and gives you a good bang for your buck. Great place to lounge and relax while sipping on your drink.
author: Ronald M.

description:
**** Review 113 ****

This is definitely one of those hidden gems of San Fran, blink and you miss it.  Located at the top of the Marriott hotel, this place has a view second to none, and if you're there around dusk you'll enjoy seeing the city come alive, calling on all of those getting ready for the night life.  
When you're here you'll experience an upscale atmosphere, where the city's lights, elegant mood lighting, and sexy vibes from all the well dressed patrons combine to put you at ease. 
The bar area is large, and even though they have plenty of waiters/waitresses, you'll still have to wait longer for service if you decide to sit at a table or areas around the large windows. Drinks are a little pricey, but you won't mind it too much with the great views you'll be enjoying. I would highly recommend this place to grab drinks during a date, or even with a small group of friends.
author: Luis S.

description:
I'm a Chicagoan, so I know high places with breathtaking views. This is as good as it gets in San Francisco -- and it's GOOD.


Feeling lazy, so here's The View Lounge in bullets:

- Hard to find a seat. You'll probably be standing and/or be a table vulture.

- Steep prices, but you're paying for the view - and the view is spectacular.

- Waitress screwed up my drink order but got it right the second time around.

- The beer nuts were stupidly delicious. Must-have.

- SOMA Spritzer is like a mimosa with the correct bubbles-to-OJ ratios (spoken by someone who doesn't even like mimosas). It's crisp and refreshing, with a hint of citrus.

- I feel like a pretentious drink snob after that last sentence.

Love this place! Will definitely be back.
author: Nic Z.

description: Get here before 5PM to grab a seat by the window. Make sure you check out both sides before you call it quits. Don't be afraid to share a couch or table with another couple. $$$ cocktails. The service isn't the best, but the view makes up for any qualms, plus, the wait is totally worth it.
author: Adriana G.

description:
We were staying in the Marriott hotel, so decided to check out the top floor lounge bar. The view is really nice from this bar. However, that's all the good thing I can say. We were there on a Friday night at midnight. The music was loud and the people were louder. The place was very busy with not enough people working. There were many empty glasses on the tables from two groups of people ago without any servers in sight. 
I understand this is a downtown hotel so there are always going to be a mixed bag of guests, from older travelers to young club goers, creating a experience far from elegant. If you are looking for a place at night to quietly sip drinks and enjoy the downtown view of SF, this is NOT the place.
Also, I ordered a glass of port for nightcap, and the port was served waaaay too warm. No good. 
Being the spouse of an Elite member. Marriott establishments usually have way better serve and products than this place.
author: Mandy G.

description:
This place is great! And worth checking out if you're visiting the city or a guest at the hotel or just looking for a place to have a drink by yourself or with friends.

But as stated in most of the reviews the place fills up super fast! I went on a Saturday evening and was able to weasel my way in by the window only because a couple was leaving and this was approximately 8pm. 

I also have been here on a Wednesday and got there a little after 5pm and the place was already packed, but my mom and I were still able to get a really good seat with an incredible view. The place definitely has a great 360 view of the city! Very beautiful. During night and day. 

They have a good drink menu! I did not try any of the food there but there's always next time. 

Oh and I was their for Memorial Day weekend Saturday and celebrity Jay Sean was there, so this place is a big deal wouldn't surprise me if there were other celebrities in the hotel or the bar itself. 

Enjoy your time as best of luck to getting a great seat with a spectacular with for you and your company
author: Laura C.

description:
I only sent for drinks so I cannot comment on their food, BUT, the view is amazing! I went to The View twice and even on a cloudy day it's an great view and perspective of the city! 

The lounge is located on the top floor of the Marriott Marquis and you need to take the high-rise elevators (as opposed to low or mid rise) to get there. The prices are somewhat high but seem to be comparable to other places in SF (similar to most large cities like NYC or Chicago).
author: Matt M.

description:
I haven't been here in a decade, it's been that long since 2008 - wow!  I sure miss the days of Carnelian Room and the rotating restaurant Equinox.   It's still over-priced, a tourist magnet, and no room for dancing unlike the Starlight Room.  

They revamped the menu, and I was quite impressed with the high quality charcuterie and cheese board.  There are other items I wouldn't pay an arm and a leg for when I can get it elsewhere.  Countless places in SOMA, FiDi, Embarcadero, and North Beach.  Yes, the ambiance/view will be different, but not far worse.  The extra star is given to our bubbly and attentive waitress Eva.  She knows all about "hospitality", our glasses were never empty, and she came back to check on us more than once. 

Somehow, back in 2008, they weren't on their hospitality "A" game, even though they're situated in a luxury hotel.  I guess the era of techies changed all that.  I will come back in the future, only after the movies around 9pm on a week night.  Extremely packed, cramped, and loud during sunset on a clear day aka no fog in the city.  Management should also tell the snooty patrons not to save seats for their invisible friends, as we all know they want the window seats to themselves. 

'Til we meet again ~ cheers & see you on Yelp!
author: Christine R.

description:
We had high(ish) hopes for this spot for our night out in San Francisco. 

The drinks were strong, and the view was great, albeit a bit foggy. It had the potential to be a really fun spot, but the crowd was a real mix- something you get when you're on top of a hotel, I guess.

The atmosphere felt dark, almost in a club way, rather than a lounge way, but without the music. At least, we couldn't hear any since it was so loud with the crowd talking over eachother. 

It was packed! Difficult to find a seat with the large crowd, and only a Tuesday! Perhaps it was a fluke, if I was back I would probably try again since a couple of my other friends enjoyed it when they went.

Overall it was a different experience, I'm not sure I would add it to my "must see" list for San Francisco, but the view of the city was pretty nice.
author: Samantha M.

description:
My favorite bar in San Francisco.

You simply cannot beat the view. On both sides. Plus, they make a mean mojito and have a very complete bar. There is no cover. They even have some food plates, like the charcuterie with cheese and salami. 

Even though it is not a quiet bar, I find it perfect for a romantic evening with my wife or for a drink with good friends.
author: Gerardo D.

description:
This place is great for drinks and small appetizers with friends.  I would even recommend this place for a nice and romantic date location.  It gets quite busy, so it's not that intimate, so keep that in mind.  Seating can also be hard to find, so come before the dinner rush around 5 to get a nice place to sit.

The 360 degree views are amazing, so having that as your backdrop is great.
author: Krys T.

description: Located at the top floor of the Marriott Marquis hotel, which was perfect for us since that's where we were staying. We went on our first night in SF but the lounge was way too crowded and we couldn't find a window seat to admire the view. We came back on our last night and was able to snatch a window seat right when we got there. We were so lucky! Drinks were great and the view is spectacular. Wished we stayed another night for 4th of July cause that view would've been perfect. Definitely recommend if you're ever in town visiting.
author: Debby S.

description: The view is amazing, if you sit next to the window. the drink look actually really good too. I'm still waiting on them, but so far the waiter was really cute and nice. The place is definitely nice tho and very comfortable. But tbh, idk why all these places are cold AF. THE DRINKS CAME!!! They are strong AF, but the D' blood orange margarita was amazing. And the waiter sat us closer to the window and the view is actually quite breath taking and continually so, as you get drunker of course. You almost feel like you could fall out the window. Definitely so far my favorite roof top bar if you can get seated next to the window.
author: Marcus-Alex G.

description:
Expensive drinks
Good view
Great Vibes 
Causal 
Ok music
Hip crowd 
You'll love it
Elevator takes you to the top very fast
author: Jay D H.

description:
Class. Elegance. Grace. Oh yeah... and the VIEW! How could I ever forget the very element that makes this place even that much more amazing?!

The View is an enchanting rooftop bar located on the 39th floor of the San Francisco Marriott. You will get swept away by the gorgeous views of the city while relaxing in this stunning lounge. It's dimly lit and has an aerial setup with breathtaking views of San Francisco from each side of the room. The decor is classic and full of comfortable couches and lounge chairs. 

The ambience is amazing! If you're looking to impress, this is your best bet city-wise. I've taken many out of towners here and they are often impressed with the entire setup. It's also the perfect place for a romantic date night! With that being said, I must mention how insanely busy it can get. Reservations are highly recommended, especially if you are planning on coming on the weekends or during the holidays.

Is it pricey?! Yes of course, but it's a rooftop bar located in the heart of SF... what else would you expect? This isn't a lounge that you would come to regularly unless you're planning on shelling out some serious dough every time. But, it's a nice place to visit every  once in a while to splurge. Speaking of splurging, the cocktails and the wine here are both fantastic! You get what you pay for, and the wine is really exquisite! They have a great wine list and the bartenders really know how to whip up a delicious cocktail. 

The food is also pretty good here, but I usually just come for drinks. They have a really delightful cheese and charcuterie plate and you can never go wrong with their chicken wings. It's more of a bar bites menu rather than a full on entree selection. The service has always been really good when I've come, and they offer full table service If you're not sitting at the bar. 

If you've never experienced The View, you must do it! The views are amazing and it's a wonderful experience just waiting to happen!
author: Shayla B.

description:
Hey you! Yeah, you! Do you like looking at cityscapes? Cool, go to The View! Once!

It's no secret, the view itself is phenomenal. SF is a beautiful city (as long as you're not stepping in feces or on needles below), and nowhere is that more apparent than the top floor of a skyscraper. Were it just for the view, this'd be an easy five stars.

But this is a bar, and they serve cocktails. I had a Sutro Smash (splash?) and it was decent-to-good. Boozy, but not too much, just how I like it. It wasn't anything memorable, but I enjoyed it in the moment. It was expensive, though, with most of the cocktails being $14-$16, but you're paying for the view. And I can't in good conscience wholeheartedly recommend a place on a single aspect alone, and once you've had your fill of the San Fran skyline, you're better off going to another bar with (slightly) lower prices and better cocktails.
author: Shawn W.

description: This lounge has THe most amazing view from the 39th floor of Marriott marquis hotel. The cocktails are super expensive but it is kind of obvious. Take an Uber because parking can be problem around this area. You can see the golden gate somehow visible through the building. Must go place to enjoy a cozy and a beautiful evening. Sunset is beautiful from up here.
author: Shruti M.

description:
Located at the San Francisco Marriott Marquis, The View Lounge is just simply impressive!   

Now I can't say it's breathtaking like Yosemite, but the views of good ol' San Francisco can definitely make for a memorable visit.  You can pretty much capture majority of the city from end to end, but more like from east to west.  

As for the small side dishes and cocktails, I pretty much enjoyed them too.  The only thing I really remember trying is the creme brulee and the flourless chocolate torte, and a few drinks.  Both desserts were decent and comforting as you relax with friends in the clouds.  Or more like fog and overcast, lol.  Service wasn't an issue either.  

I'd say the only issue is the amount of people they allow up there.  It can be difficult to find a table, chair, or couch at times.  It just gets pretty busy, and there's always someone stalking a table once someone leaves.  If I were a tourist, I'd come up and just act like a tourist!  And hopefully you land a chair.  You want pictures, take pictures!  Don't let the wannabe high-class folks deceive you.  Let them stare all they want!  They don't own the view, it's for everyone to enjoy.
author: Ron R.

description: A very nice spot to check out in the city. The view is beautiful and the drinks we had were quite boozy- no complaints there! You can see the inner city or out to the Bay. Certain areas are louder I.e the bar facing the bay and the one facing the city has more of an intimate feel (perfect for dates). It is self-seating and no reservations.
author: Kimmie H.

description:
This place is so cool! Located on the 39th floor of the hotel. It's not a huge space, but my friend and I, were able to find a place to sit down and catch up. It's a seat yourself type of establishment. Someone will come and take your order. Prices are on the high side, $16+ for drinks and food.  Adds up super fast, which is why I minus 1 star for high cost. You come here to treat yo'self.

It felt like we were in a scene of Batman Returns at some Bruce Wayne event.

The drink I ordered was really good!  Had jalapenos and lime inside of it. Just the right amount of spice..
author: Michelle M.

description:
Good drinks.
Beautiful view. 
Great service. 
Clean bathrooms. 
Hard to snag a good seat.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
The View is right around the corner from Union Square and was very crowded when I came on a Saturday night. It's actually on top of the Marriot hotel if anyone gets confused. 

The seating here is open - if you find a table you can seat yourself and a waiter will come by to help you. It may be a little hard getting a hold of someone though since it does get pretty busy.

The lounge has a great view of SF and really worth visiting if you're someone who loves views. Drinks were decently priced and they come with a full menu so if you're hungry there's def food.

I'm an octopus lover so whenever I see an octopus dish I HAVE to order it. I decided to order their octopus.. and it was decent, but nothing mind blowing. For the price of about $15-$18 it legit ONLY came with 4 pieces no more no less. So.. I don't recommend it! But for just drinks and light snacks like chips I think this is a nice place.
author: Jodie S.

description: Had drinks, dessert and appies.  Tons of people so expect that.  But try hard to grab a window seat to maximize your visit.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Great bar at the top of the Marriot. We came here on a Saturday night, not surprised it was packed. I ordered the blood orange margarita, she had the Haight-Ashbury. Both drinks were really good, slightly overpriced, but expected for the city.
author: Omar S.

description:
A bar with a breathtaking view of the city, assuming Karl the Fog is taking the day/night off. This establishment is located on the 39th floor of the Marriott Hotel and is one of my favorite bars to frequent in the city. The tables closest to the windows are highly sought after, as they provide the best access to the view. 

My go to drinks are the skyline punch (packs a punch with minimal taste of outright alcohol) and the highrise pom cosmo. I'm also a fan of sweet dessert wines, and have tried the Pacific Rim Ice Wine (but this one is sweet to a fault). The desserts on the menu change, but I have enjoyed the various cake samplers when featured. 

My only complaint is that you have to self-seat at this location, which means standing around waiting for tables to clear up during especially busy times. A bit annoying to deal with, but the city views (at night especially) plus great drinks still make this a wonderful place to visit.
author: Karen Y.

description:
A bar with one of the most breathtaking views in San Francisco!  It's very easy to find, but snagging a seat during prime happy hours is a battle in itself.  The seats are first-come, first-serve!

Drinks are a bit pricey.  But a great place to come for the rooftop experience with friends!
author: An Thien T.

description:
The name says it all- The View. The view is spectacular. At night, tall skyscrapers and the Bay Bridge light up the skyline. From the 35th floor, you can see everything as if you're on top of the world. 

My friends and I have always wanted to check out The View and we finally have the chance to last Friday night (cue Katy Perry song). 
There are two rooms, the main room with the bar when you first walk in, and another one across from it in the back. The main room has full service but the other room doesn't so you'll have to make a trip to the bar. But whichever  room you decide to choose, they both have nice views of the skyline.  
Also, the tables and couches are on a self-seating basis, so you have to find a table yourself. This may be a struggle during busy hours because it's usually very crowded and there are only a few tables right by the window to see the great view. If you want a seat by the window, you'll most likely have to linger around and wait until someone leaves. I would suggest taking an empty seat first then move to another table by the window when someone leaves.

Drinks: 
Loma Prieta ($16): This will shake up your world and make your head spin like the 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake. Joking, but seriously, this tasted like juice. If I was handed this drink without being warned there was alcohol in it, I would have chugged it all in less than a couple minutes. The fresh slice of grapefruit is refreshing after the drink.  It wasn't bad overall.

Sutro Splash ($14): You will enjoy this drink if you like fizzy soda, more specifically ginger beer. It reminds me of a moscow mule with a splash of cranberry juice. It's sweet and not too strong of the alc taste even after seeing how much alcohol the bartender poured (my friend and I were standing there in awe). I liked this one a little more than the Loma prieta. 

The drinks are overpriced for what you get, especially with the ice filled to the brim of the glass. But remember, you're paying for the view also. The view is perfect for any occasion- after work drinks, celebrating a birthday, catching up with friends, etc. The dimly lit atmosphere is especially perfect for date-night. If you're in downtown sf late for the nightlife, visit the other bars or clubs first and chill here after. It will definitely be a great way to end the night!
author: Michelle F.

description:
If you can look past all the bougie people, this place can be pretty nice. 

We came up here one night randomly for a few cocktails and dessert. The dessert to be honest was fair. We had a creme brulee and it didn't really amaze us. The drinks on the other hand were beautifully crafted. She had a mocktail and I got a shot to implement into it to spice it up, and I stuck with their old fashioned, which was done right. It had the sweetness of the brown sugar but still smokey. Seating is first come first serve, so if you want a view, come early, or prepare to wait. Luckily, as we got there, a couple saw us and offered us a place to sit by the window. People do watch you as you sit because they want your seat once you have a window seat. The view was really nice. You're up high and positioned in a place where you can see most of the city. The service was also pretty nice. 

Overall: if you can really look past all the bouginess of this place with its people who all think they are better than you, you can have a good time. Good drinks, great view, awkward atmosphere.
author: Bruce's A.

description: One of the best views of San Francisco I've ever seen. It feels like I was in a clock tower with the sprawling windows. I went just as the sun was setting and it was one of the best setting I've seen. The noise level was not overly loud but it was packed so that was to be expected. The staff was quick despite the crowd and the drinks were very good and not overly expensive.
author: Ryan W.

description: We had friends visiting from out of town who wanted to visit this bar. The Marriott staff would not allow us into the building unles we were hotel guests apparently because of the employee protest demonstration that had been occuring thst weekend Marriott does not want our business nor do they want to pay their employees so it seems. I'll take my money and good times elsewhere
author: Marshall T.

description:
Awesome, honest bartender. Outstanding view. And never a happy hour in its existence. The fact that people are here for the view isn't lost on me, however, $15.00 cocktails at 4pm with no view does. 

If you are lucky enough to secure a window seat, it's worth it. Just make sure to queue in line before it opens at 4:00pm or you'll be sitting at the bar, with no view, wishing things were turned around. 

My opinion is the architect missed the mark on the use of space. Unless you're the bartender because he has the best view.
author: Guy S.

description: A pretty view for sure. No argument there. Service though a little spotty..with drinks coming only with the hailing the cab type gestures..a little rough. Everything else...great.
author: Danielle K.

description:
"I feel like Batman," a friend of mine noted as we looked out the glass wall overlooking the nighttime skyline of San Francisco. Yes, the amazing view from the View Lounge does live up to its name.

You have to enter through the Marriott Marquis hotel entrance and take the elevator up to the top (39th) floor. My friends and I came on a Thursday evening around 7pm, and this place was already fully packed! The tables and couches are on a self-seating, first-come, first-serve basis, so it took quite some time for us to find empty seats.

We ordered a round of vodka shots. $12 (before tip) PER single shot of straight-up vodka! The vodka was nothing really special. I might as well ordered their specialty cocktails for a few dollars more instead (around $16-20 per cocktail). I'll be back to try those another time.
author: Hailey K.

description:
GRAND VIEWS...but impossible seating.

Our group of four walked around the floor around 5 times within the span of 15 minutes, but alas, no luck.

We managed to easily order at the bar (the bartender was accommodating and acknowledged us quickly when we approached), but then just stood around with the drinks while still waiting for something to open up.

It's a good place to start the night. You can see the skyline all around, which is perfect at dusk. Then, you can hop your way to the next stop of the night!
author: Janelle W.

description: Been up here a few times with friends and with family.  Its pretty much a good hotel bar but with an amazing view this makes it a great hotel bar.  It is usually pretty busy at normal drinking hours but I have found ordering drinks from the bar and just hanging out at a tall table is easiest.  Staff is fast and friendly and drinks are crafty without being too hipster.
author: Nadine K.

description:
I love this place. Yes, it's expensive but the view is absolutely beautiful and the atmosphere is very serene. It's a great place to go with 1-2 other people and enjoy a drink and watch the sunset. 

I've always ordered wine here so I can't speak to the cocktails but the appetizers and desserts are great to nibble on here. Come right at four when they open if you are looking for a table by the window because those are the best spots and they fill up quickly. Highly recommend if you're showing someone around the city for the first time :)
author: Megan K.

description:
I have been living in the Bay Area for a little over 2 years now and I must say, this is my favorite place to drink, lounge, and take in the view of one of the most beautiful cities in the world. I also ALWAYS take out-of-towners here and they absolutely love it.

The view is the main attraction of this place, but it's only made more sensational by the amazing drinks and food options. Everything here is just divine. I still frequent this place at least once a month.

This is one of the few "touristy" things in SF to partake in no matter how many times you visit SF, even if you're local to the area!
author: Toshi P.

description: Lovely place !!! I have never seen this place before. You can see all view of San Francisco. I recommend booking a table before visiting this place because it can be crowded.  A bid selection of drinks and appetizers. Quick service.
author: Linda P.

description:
The view here is pretty amazing, which is my reason for the good review. We were able to get seats near the window relatively easy around 7 pm on a Thursday night even though it was really busy.  The drinks we had were good and were the price i would expect at a place like this in SF ($16-18). 

The service here left a little to be desired. Our drinks took awhile to arrive and our waitress wasn't around much.  

Given that we primarily came here for the view and we got that, we were happy!
author: Rachel B.

description:
The other reviews pretty much sum up this spot - the name says it ALL. The VIEW is incredible, in fact, it is very hard to beat. Perfect place to take in a cocktail (or two or three), especially if you happen to be staying in the hotel (Marriott). 

I wanted to make it up at sunset, but my work schedule just didn't allow. Therefore, I only have experience at night, but I can say it is strikingly beautiful. 

Seating can be tricky. We were able to grab a high top upon arrival and neither of us minded standing, so it was all good. But, if you are looking to stay awhile, you might have to play the game of watch and grab as other patrons prepare to leave. 

Not surprising, the prices are high, but it is San Francisco and offers impeccable views from the 39th floor.
author: Amy S.

description: It's a beautiful place with a beautiful view and not too expensive drinks.  The surroundings are cozy and make you feel comfortable.
author: St Giles I.

description: Be sure to show up early if you want a prime table with nice views. Plenty of seating all over the top floor with service members found on every corner. Enjoy a nice appetizer and quality drink while you enjoy the views 40 floors up. Great stop to experience while in town
author: Justin S.

description:
This lounge atop the Marriott hotel has a fantastic rooftop view (all indoors, FYI) of downtown SF. For a nice lounge, the vibe here is surprisingly laidback...You're welcome to come in and seat yourself anywhere you can find a table/chair -- even on a Friday night at 8pm!  

We arrived at 8pm and managed to find a table, albeit it wasn't by the windows, plus it took a while to find a spare chair. We left a few hours later and saw a long line of people waiting to enter the place. 

Service was great. The hummus platter and list of drinks were pretty good, too. I'd definitely come back and take visitors here.
author: Cece Y.

description:
Was looking for a place to grab a drink the night before Christmas Eve and this place was open. Didn't expect to find myself in a hotel bar but I was really pleasantly surprised. There's a cool view and Gotham-esque windows that have a view of the city.

Our waitress was super nice and recommended some great glasses of wine. I'm just bummed that the kitchen closes at 11 so I couldn't try their house made chips. Next time I guess. 

I started with the Smoke Tree Pinot which was yummy. If you like a nice red, try the Daou Cab. Definitely the standout of the night.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I came here on a Saturday around 8pm but they had a private event until 9pm or so. The lounge itself is smaller than I had pictured. Don't get me wrong, the views are lovely but I think it's probably much better during the day or during sunset. It was dark at night and the views were obstructed. 

The actual seating area off to the side probably had like 3-5 small tables. We were hoping for light bites but since there was a private party earlier, they restricted access to food so we were only able to order beer nuts and chips (in which the busy waitress gave us by mistake). 

Despite the free munchies, I didn't have a grand time here. Not a place you'd take your date or a place you can kick it with chums. It's boujee but with no character and the only thing it has going for it is the landscape view of SF through its interesting windows. Drink selection is rather depressing as well. I haven't had any cocktails but the wine and beer spread was the saddest thing for a fancy bar. When it gets busy here it's hard to flag down the waitress. I'm not sold on this place and I'm glad I passed up on it when Yelp was hosting an event here for Elites.
author: Connie M.

description: Beautiful views of the city. Good selection of drinks and food. The service is very good and accommodating. We shared a bottle of wine and enjoyed our conversation.
author: Elsa C.

description:
Awesome view of the City Skyline and the new Salesforce building.  Would been better at night but we weren't staying that long.

Reminds me of a scene from Return of the Jedi.  Any Star Wars fan know which scene I'm referring to?
author: Robb M.

description: This is an excellent spot. Easy to find and access. I enjoyed an old fashioned and took pictures. I went by myself so I didn't stay too long due to the lack of finding a good seat near the view. Next time I'll go at night and bring a long a friend. Hope to make this 5 stars next time!
author: Darnell M.

description: The view is unbeatable, but window seating is very limited.  Mixed drinks were less than impressive and service was not great. This is definitely a place for tourists or to bring visiting friends/family.
author: C T.

description: The view lounge is such a wonderful and elegant place. Great to bring a date or your girlfriends/boys here. The vibe is marvelous. A place to enjoy one another's company. Located on the 39th floor of the Marriott. If you are lucky enough as myself lol, we got seating towards the window. The view of SF is breath-taking. Went on a Sunday night and it can get pretty crowded but there are a lot of available seatings. Ordered a bottle of BedRock Wine Co Zinfandel . Excellent taste. Expensive but the experience was pleasurable.
author: Jassy P.

description:
Take the high rise elevators to the 39th floor.

Make sure you order the lollipop wings and you're good to go!   The hummus dip appetizer wasn't bad either and their drinks were delicious! 

Only thing, is that they don't take reservations so finding a spot to lounge for you and your friends to comfortably sit is a pain in the arse!   You have to keep circulating the floor like vultures waiting for a group to leave.   Then once you find a spot, you have to track someone down to order.   The view is amazing if you eventually get a spot next to the window... and so relaxing, when there are not guys trying to peacock for your attention.   

It's a good view to show the city lights at night!
author: Roxana N.

description:
I guess it's named "The View" for a reason because this place has views, on views, on views. San Francisco scenery is definitely something that should be appreciated, preferably over a cocktail, some tasty food, and good company. This hot spot is definitely one of the best ways to see San Francisco. 

We got here fairly early (5:30 and they open at 5) on a Thursday evening and luckily were able to find seats next to the beautiful floor-to-ceiling windows right away. If we had waited any longer though we probably would've missed the opportunity to sit directly next to the window because we snagged the only table left - score! 

Once you get to the 39th floor of the Marriott and the elevator doors open to this magical place, prepare to be amazed at how beautiful the scenery is. The moment you step out of the elevator there are floor to ceilings windows on both side of you that are shining all that natural light in (perfect opportunity for selfies ;) ). There are comfy lounge chairs and tables aligned all along the windows perfect for ample viewing time. 

To end our long work week, Tomas R, Diandra S, and I decided that wine and charcuteries plates were the best way to celebrate. Service is a wee bit on the slower side, but with a view that beautiful and company that great, there was definitely no rush. The wine was light, fresh and crisp. The charcuterie plate, perfectly presented with crackers, cheese, prosciutto, jam, and honey, was the perfect pairing.  

Sipping on rose, eating cheese crackers and soaking in all the San Francisco beauty was the best way to end my SF trip. I'd gladly come back to The View on any trip I have to SF. Even if I lived in SF I'd try to come visit every week - it's just that beautiful.
author: Issabelle F.

description:
Views aren't just for Drake. The View San Fransisco has sights to take in that would be acceptable for any grammy award winning artist, at a surprisingly decent price.

Many members of my work fam suggested this place, and so on our last afternoon in San Fransisco after a busy event-filled week Issabelle F and Thomas R decided drinking in the views of the city would be the best way to end the week.

It does not disappoint in any way. From the moment you step into the lounge, you are captivated by the natural light, floor to ceiling windows and breathtaking views.

Want to take a look at the bay with a cocktail in hand? You can. Want to sip on rosé while taking a gander at the expansive cityscape? Yup, you can do that too. Or maybe you just want to take in the hills and mountains while exchanging stories about the week's shenanigans. Yassss, still possible here.

The View is located on the 39th floor and it is a wonderful way to relax, unwind and take in the beauty of San Fransisco. I was surprised at how inexpensive the cocktails were. I mean, this place can definitely up charge based on the scenery (people and views included here) but I picked up the tab for two rounds of drinks and a cheese plate for a cool $63. 

The ambiance is great. I'm not sure what the normal music scene looks like here, but its worth noting that I walked in to hearing Mariah Carey Honey and continued to be serenaded by the sounds of Aaliyah, Destiny's Child, Boyz II Men and other nostalgic 90s tunes. The View, you got me hooked on youuuuuuu. 

The charcuterie plate was beautifully presented and filled with tasty prosciutto, spicy sausage and cheeses. Perfect for sharing over a crisp California Rosé. The furniture includes lounge-y seats that are window-front (is that word?). Don't look down or you may get a little woozy from the height. Or at least, I did.

There is seats all around, plus a bar. I would advise to get there early because the prime seats will get snatched up rather quickly.

The View, what you've got is far beyond compare and I can't wait for another taste of honey...i mean your views!
author: Diandra L.

description: Came here after a long day in the city running around. Had the Manhattan. Excellent drink. Smooth and delicious. It's made with a luxardo cherry so extra points for that! Seating is grouped in 2's and 4's. Very romantic and great views.
author: Crystal R.

description:
I've been to this place multiple times for date nights and GNOs.
It's a great place to catch up over food and a few drinks. This isn't really a place for dancing... i mean they play music but there's no dance floor and it usually gets really packed! All the times iv'e been here i was only able to sit by the window once and that's because we came around 5pm and caught the sunset which was beautiful! If you come any time after 6pm.. good luck getting a window seat... you'll just have to stand around and wait for people to leave. The servers here are great, they are pretty attentive and will still help you even if you are not yet seated. The drinks are very pricey but that's expected since it is in the city. I would recommend coming early as soon as they open if you can, so you get seated by the window and enjoy the beautiful city view :)
author: Joanne L.

description:
The View, located on the top floor of the Marriott is the most breathtaking rooftop bar I have ever stepped foot in. We took a quick elevator to the top floor and just like that, the doors opened to one of the prettiest sites I've ever seen. The set up is unlike any other roof top bar I've been to. The rooftop is completely inside with tables and sitting areas on completely around the entire rooftop, with the bar and elevators located in the center. There is a great view of the city, the water and one of the bridges!

We came around 5:00/5:30pm so it was pretty crowded and we were unable to snag a table right next to the window (believe me I gave people the stare down). The seating is first come, first serve (if you're in to throwing bows for a good seat this is your kind of place). We arrived just in time to find a pair of seats at the bar and still were able to take in the beautiful view from our seats at the bar.

As bourbon-holics we were over the top to find several unique bourbon and scotch cocktails on their beverage menu. The bourbon cocktails were unique, delicious. All of their cocktails are fresh made, hand crafted cocktails. We were able to watch the extremely talented bartenders craft several delicious looking cocktails of vodka, bourbon, tequila, champagne..  

The View is a place I will tell everyone visiting San Francisco to stop at and look forward to visiting again myself.
author: Caitie S.

description:
This place has the best views of the city and is the perfect place to get drinks. You can see all the important landmarks form here. Ideal for a memorable occasion and to enjoy the city lights. The wine list is  great and the experience is unforgettable. We celebrated a birthday here yesterday and got excellent service and a very delicious chocolate dessert. I highly recommend this place to go hang out or take someone visiting the city. :) 
Note : There are no reservations so go a little before to find seats so you feel you are floating above the city enjoying your fav drink.
author: Shivani B.

description: Best place to relax and have a drink in SF it sits on top of the Marriott and you have to pay for valet but it's all worth it. You might want to dress up or you will feel out of place the drinks and food are excellent.
author: Dewayne J.

description: The View Lounge is an experience, a thrill; I mean seriously. If you visit before 4pm you will be met by other enthusiasts ready to get on the elevator and go up to the top floor, the View Lounge which doesn't open until 4pm. The elevator will take you to the floor before it and you will see a ton of people eagerly waiting for the elevators to light up going UP. If you get there after 4pm good luck finding a seat, the lounge is small and the seats by the windows get taken up by the early birds who waited on the floor below before 4pm. Its a hot ticket and I suggest you bring your patience, thrills, and good vibes...along with you wallets by 3:45pm to guarantee a good seat. The drinks are $15 average and meals are around the same; a cocktail and a snack plus tip you're looking at $30 easy. The View is best at night, I suggest weekdays at the view.
author: Karlos G.

description:
If you spend the entire time looking out the window, or aren't paying for drinks, the view lounge is definitely a 5 star experience. However, the majority of us aren't doing one or the other, which tends to diminish the experience.

Came here one weekday evening after work with a co-worker. On the 35th floor of the JW Marriott, you pass through the lobby to get to the elevators up. When you arrive at the lounge, you may wonder if you should head left or right. Answer: it really doesn't matter, so just choose one.

Of course, you should try to grab a seat by the windows. The views afforded from this height are quite lovely. However, the seats are oriented to face each other rather than the view, which makes sense for conversation but not for maximizing experience. Also, some seats are directly below lights, making it so that you're blinded and the center of attention. Avoid those at all costs.

The cocktails are expensive, but what you would expect given the location. About $16 a pop. However, they are quite yummy and potent, so at least it's not a complete charge-up. My north beach negroni was on point.

During our time there, we also opted to order warm cheesy bread, which was yum. The honey butter was a nice complement and the bread really was filled with cheese!

All in all, a nice place if you want to get classy, but not the most stunning ambiance I've experienced.
author: Angela C.

description:
5 starts for the breathtaking city views. Whether it's raining, daytime, or nighttime, the views are beautiful.

Perfect for dates, classy happy hours, or small celebrations. Seating can be hard to find, but if you circle a few times, you can usually nab a spot.
author: Michelle B.

description: While visiting the city, we decided to take our friends to experience "the view" at The View Lounge. We had some time to kill before the doors opened at 4:00 PM and hoped to beat the crowd by arriving there at opening. Boy, were we wrong! We got onto the elevator at 3:54 PM and it would not take us to the 39th floor (where the lounge is located) before 4 PM so we decided to go up to the 38th floor. As the elevator doors opened, we saw a huge crowd (just as smart as us) anticipating the moment when access to the 39th floor is granted. More people joined us as we patiently waited for the clock to hit the fourth hour and once the elevator gave us way to the lounge - everyone started packing into the elevators like sardines. We finally got onto the third elevator and made our way up to the lounge only to find it packed! We did manage to get a fairly decent spot with a view (but not the best spot there). Once we settled down, I ordered the High Rise Cosmo ($16) and finally relaxed! It was definitely a chore to get to this lounge (especially at opening) but "the view" was worth it. Despite the difficulty in acquiring a good spot by a window I experience every time I visit - I will continue going back here for at least one drink when I am in the city! I recommend you pay this lounge a visit at least once.
author: Ella M.

description: If you want a good view while sipping that evening drink in the beautiful city of San Francisco, this could be your place.  I have to admit that I have seen better views from other places, however, this place has its unique charm. Though you don't get to see the best parts of the city, it nevertheless doesn't fall short of giving you a great bird's eye view of the city. This place gets filled really quick even on weekdays, especially and obviously the window seats. So get there a little early to grab a nice spot and spend the evening while watching the city lights come up. The choice of food and drinks are good. The mushroom pizza was good and appropriate for two people to share. Would recommend this place for a nice social evening in a grand style.
author: Premila M.

description:
Beautiful place to be. With the price of the drinks and food here, you're basically paying for the view as well.
For a first timer, I would say it's worth it. The place is gorgeous and drinks are only about 3-4 dollars pricier than your average lounge. I haven't tried the food, so this review only judges the drinks, ambiance, and service. 
Service was nothing special. Our server came around once to ask if we were ready right when we sad down, and we said we needed another minute. It seemed like eternity until she finally came back around.
If you are trying to get a window seat, you need to line up at the elevators a bit before 4pm to get a good seat. The elevator floor for the bar does not open until 4, so people are literally waiting in the elevator until they can select the 39th floor.
The drinks are pretty pricy, but they are very strong and good. I got a grapefruit drink and it was absolutely delicious. 
Make sure to take the time to wander around the place. You can see all of San Francisco and even Alcatraz from their windows.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
What a gorgeous view!  I came here after walking around Downtown to catch the sunset.  Located on the 39th floor of the Marriot Hotel, this place provides a breathtaking panoramic view of the city.  On one side, you can see the Bay Bridge and tall buildings, and on the other side, you get a view of the Sutro Tower and Bernal Heights.  The place opens up at 4pm and seating is on a first come first serve basis.  You just take the elevator up and seat yourself.  It can get pretty crowded up there.  If you wait around a bit, you can find a group leaving and take their spot.  I ended up getting a seat by the bar and enjoying the sunset view.  It was so gorgeous.

I tried the Skyline Punch ($15):
(Captain Morgan white rum | fresh citrus | pineapple | brandied cherry juice)
It was good, but I wasn't crazy about it.  Definitely refreshing though!

The menu items are pricey, but pretty typical for a lounge like this.  I say it's worth it for the view.  It's difficult to take nice photos at night because of the reflection of the window.  Come for the sunset, take photos, and enjoy some drinks or food.  Watch out for Karl the Fog!  Hopefully he doesn't ruin your view haha.  I love that this is indoors because it gets chilly at night in SF.  Also, the bartender, Steve, was friendly and surfs!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Attended my first Yelp Elite event here last night and it was incredible!! I had absolutely no idea what to expect and almost didn't go, but it was completely worth it.

When you walk in, the bar splits into two sections: on the right is views of the bay bridge with lots of open seating and to the left was where Yelp had reserved our party. The right side was packed so I imagine it's hard finding a table during regular hours.

The catered party was beautifully presented; there was a cascading buffet of appetizers, small plates, cheeses, and desserts. All the food was from the hotel kitchen and it was amazing. I was totally impressed at the quality and presentation. I tried everything and I couldn't even begin to pick a favorite (okay maybe the pork belly and risotto plate and the beets). 

I can't get over how amazing this event and location was. Thanks, Yelp!
author: Nikki I.

description:
Came here as a continuation of a happy hour. Even when it's foggy, the view from this bar is great. Usually not too busy when I go, around the tail end of happy hour time. It's a good place to bring tourists or newcomers to SF. Reminds me of the John Hancock tower bar in Chicago, but not as high haha.

Drinks are very expensive but you're paying for the view! 

Also, I tried the flourless chocolate torte. It is very indulgent and VERY delicious. Usually I'll get the cake OR a drink, never both because I don't want to die from a sugar overdose.
author: RachEl L.

description: Absolutely beautiful bar and lounge. Came here a little after 6pm to enjoy the view and grab a drink with the wife. It was a lot bigger and a lot busier than expected. Most people came just to take photos of the view and not enjoy a drink but if you can manage to find decent seating it's more than an excellent spot for a drink. Wife enjoyed both their Skyline Punch and Loma Prieta while I enjoyed The Rock Old Fashioned and Frisco Smash. Along with out drink we had a couple orders of their house chips and dip which were excellent munching choice. Will be back next time in SF.
author: Harman B.

description: It wasn't even that busy but we sat 40 min to get a menu. Don was the most terrible server I have ever had, he didnt even apologize for that . When he came back to get the order we were ready to go,  and he didnt even attempt to keep us in, it was a cold "ok" . If you want to see the view go ahead  but dont waste your time and money on overpriced drinks and horrible service.
author: Gergana N.

description:
This place is definitely a tourist trap although it can provide some nice views of The City's skyline.  Didn't have a chance to try the restaurant side although I would say the view is nicer from that side.  Drinks are pricy and given that it's located within a hotel, seems like a given.  Can get seriously packed bar side with tourist and business folk on some nights.  

If you're a local, come by once and again to show the out of towners.  Parking is scarce although the mission parking garage is across the street
author: Joel Christian A.

description: Came here for late night drinks with some of my friends. This place is pricey, even by SF standards (I mean $9 for an Anchorsteam?), but the view is truly amazing. Make sure to come here when it's dark so you can really appreciate it
author: Aj B.

description: The view is everything at this lounge. I don't even remember the drinks we had or how much we paid. But I certainly remember the company (happy anniversary, babe!).
author: Greg H.

description: Great vibe, really friendly bartender, and nice space. Bathroom is the public bathroom nearby. For the area and the general vibe of the lounge, I expected that the bartender would be a bit more knowledgeable on how to make different cocktails but, then again, it was around 3pm on a weekday, so it could've just been an off time. Spent about 2 hours there, and wasn't rushed at all to clear out.
author: Kimberly K.

description: I'm only giving this place 3 stars for the view. There's nothing special about the drinks, appetizers, and small plates offered here. Also, the service here is probably some of the worst I've experienced in the city; bartenders and servers are not friendly.
author: Israel Y.

description: So pretty up here! The views are everything, which I would expect with the name. You need to get here early - like at the time they open if you want a seat. We got in 3 minutes after opening and only seats at the bar were open. Everything else is standing room or if you get lucky and snag a seat when someone leaves. The drinks are super expensive, but worth it in my opinion. They weren't overly sweet and you get enough alcohol for what you pay for. Cute spot!
author: Ashveen S.

description:
Decided to play tourist for the day in San Francisco and found our group craving a fun cocktails with small bites.  The View was a perfect fit.  It is around the corner from BART and sits 39 stories atop the Marriott.  The View of San Francisco is breathtaking on both sides and a unique look at such a beautiful city.

The View opens at 4PM and is first come first served.  You seat yourself and naturally all of the on the glass seats fill up first.  We arrived around 4:20PM on a Sunday and all of the group tables at the windows were taken, however it wasn't much more full.  I do wish the staff seated people, that way they could be more efficient with the tables.  We saw a single woman sitting on the glass at a table for four when there were tables for two open.  That was a little frustrating as a group of four looking for a table.  They could then also double up couples of two if the parties were comfortable since they know all window seats will be filled.

We grabbed some seats at the lounge style tables facing towards the windows.  We ordered cocktails and wine amongst the group and all enjoyed our drinks.  The Charcuterie board was incredible!  Lots of meals, cheeses, and extras included.  I would highly recommend it.
author: Stacey C.

description:
I mean, what else can you say besides the view from this place? Ok fine, I won't end my review there. But that is what gives it any stars at all. If this place is sitting ground level looking out over a parking lot 3 stars most likely. But if you want to see San Francisco for real while sipping a tasty beverage, there really isn't another choice.

Finding a seat is tough during most peak drinking times. Our last visit, I was fortunate enough to have co-workers that posted up early to get us a window side seat. The service was pretty decent. The prices were a little high. And the selection was kind of slim. But with good company, cold drinks, and a spectacular view, this provided a great happy hour spot for us.
author: Will B.

description:
All I have to say is that the view from up here is gorgeous!! My friend and I decided to grab some drinks around sunset, and we made the right decision coming here. The lounge gives you such a great view of the city, and when the sun sets and the city lights start coming on, it's such a spectacular view.

When you first enter, it says to seat yourself. Of course, the seats near the windows were already taken, so we sat down at a table. Someone came and gave us a menu immediately, and she also brought us water. I settled on the Skyline Punch, and my friend got a malbec. The mixed drink was delicious, and the wine was nice. Overall, the two drinks were around $15 each.

This spot is definitely a spot I would want to visit again for a small snack and drinks with friends. If you're ever in the area, definitely check the place out!
author: Tricia N.

description: One of my favorite spots to enjoy the SF skyline, the View Lounge never disappoints! We went on a Thursday night and were able to get a window chair within 15 minutes. The drinks were good and service was prompt which made for a lovely evening. Can't wait to return!
author: Karen M.

description: Needless to say, absolutely stunning views and nice cocktails! Expect a fancy crowd and a lot of talking! They also have some snacks which is hard to come by with a bar.
author: Riya S.

description: This place is dope to kick it if you have dinner reservations near by or just want a glimpse of the the nice view. Definitely a sophisticated ambiance.
author: Vinayak P.

description:
The name of this place pretty much says it all. You get a great of San Francisco when you come up to this bar/lounge. I would come here early to get a window seat as they fill up really quick, but they have plenty of other seating as well. The drinks here are super pricey and there is definitely an upscale vibe.

Overall, come here for a nice night, and not to get super drunk and act like an idiot.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Up on the top floor has a cool swanky city vibe.  At night the view of the stars and building lights looks really cool.  Drinks are also well made.  They have some apps, but I'd come here for the drinks and the view (the name makes sense).

Drinks: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5
Service: 4/5
Overall Experience: 5/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Had an amazing girls date with my best friend.
The lounge lives up to its name! It has a beautiful view of the city with huge windows to look through. Obviously to match their #cocktails their #food was yummy!! We had the #roasted #redhummus with warm #pitabread and fresh #veggies. Secondly, was the super delicious  #beetsalad. Huge thank you to the helper Don and GM Amanda that we got to meet last night. They definitely provided an amazing experience!
author: Lisa D.

description: This place is the BEST!!! I took a date here and had a great time. The views are spectacular, the food is delicious, and the drinks are not too shabby either. The only problem was that we had to wait a while to find a table because it was so busy.
author: Steve C.

description:
Lady luck was with me tonight.

I got into the elevator with a bunch of hotties.
I found a view seat right away.
They have my favorite drink.

I knew I had to battle it out with a bunch of tourists to find a table, but hey...they pay the bill and allow us locals to enjoy what the Bay Area has to offer.  The View isn't on my regular rotation, but I may have to sneak it in once in a while.
author: Ron L.

description: This is a MUST place to visit when you are in the city! It isn't called the View for nothing. The views from the top floor is amazing at all hours of the day. I have been here on several occasions to meet up with friends after work and on the weekends and it is one of your favorite spots to met up. Parking is terrible here but luckily there is valet parking downstairs for a pretty penny. If you rather not drive, you can always take bart in and get off at the Powell st bart station. The place is near union square and close to everything that you will need. Definitely a must see in the city!
author: Anne R.
