description: Definitely a place you will want to take your friends from out of town. Hand crafted cocktails and they do offer food as well. I wish there was more of a beer selection but it's a cocktail bar so that's okay. The drinks are as much as you would expect, $15-$17. Fortunately it is possible to find a place to sit also. I plan on coming back next week
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
The View is good for exactly what the title is. "The view." AMAZING! The floor/bar area doesn't open until 4 pm so the elevator literally won't take you to that floor until then. The seating is first come first serve. Our server was very nice, and at the end my husband who has diabetes needed juice and she was quick to provide that to us which was very much appreciated.

The price of the drinks is a bit up there, and we had a flatbread to just try and get a bite in while we were there from walking around all day. The green sprouts on it with all the oil made it less than desirable. 

I recommend going here for sure for a drink to take in the city, and snap some photos. Then I would move on. I would suggest a better and broader menu to the hotel. Tapas are good, but the choices could use some work!
author: Skye A.

description:
If I'm in SFO you can find me here without fail definitely one of the best places to chill,
breathtaking views of the city.I absolutely love a good terrace/top floor/rooftop lounge restaurant the likes-" I'm Sold".

The View is mostly crowded be on the lookout for those window seats, they get snagged pretty quick.

We are Marriot loyalists, so if you choose to stay at Marquis (which is a beautiful property) chances are you can come and relax especially Mondays through Wednesdays when it's not as crowded.
Avoid coming on special days because they do not hold tables and you will end up walking around/standing near the bar.The good part being you will still have a view.

The food menu is mostly small plates like charcuterie, cheese plates, chips, salads etc.
Wine and cocktail lists are extensive.
Service is great, I have never had a bad experience.

Cheers!
author: Pratishruti M.

description:
The view is spectacular here. One of our favorite things to do is to find a hotel bar up in a tall building somewhere and just look at the city lights while having a drink. 

From here you have a view of the Bay Bridge along with the brand new Salesforce building which is gorgeous. 

The drinks are large, strong, and are had at a fair price. We had the Manhattan and there was nothing wrong with it. Did I mention it was huge?
author: Ben E.

description:
Pretty lounge, couldn't really see the view everyone was raving about but I can how this can be a good spot for happy hours or dates. Decent menu list to choose, good ambience as well as crowd.

Will go again
author: Nina N.

description: I thought the venue was spectacular and beautiful. It was hard finding a window seat, but my husband and I got very lucky. I couldn't wait to try the food and drinks. The only reason why I gave a four star is because the service was very slow, it took 20min to get a waiter to our table (Thursday night). Once we got a waiter, everything was better. I recommend the ahi tuna appetizer and  Sazerac cocktail  (if you like whiskey recommend this drink, it's not on the main menu but the bartender made it very well). The view of the city below was breath taking and I was grateful to have a wonderful moment with my husband, I can't wait to come back.
author: Michelle H.

description:
It was very very crowded. probably because i went on a saturday evening lolol
So we couldnt get good seats by the window but it was really glam! Had a lot of fun. Servers are super nice and they had good music. Go early if you want good seats!
author: Yeonhwa S.

description:
If you come with tempered expectations and during the right times, you will be rewarded many fold with some amazing views and that's really the bottom line.

This is not a place where you should expect cheap drinks, great specials, or even good service. They're busy because they're a killer view lounge with a bunch of tourists hogging up every seat for a good view during sunset. 

However, sunset here during a clear day in SF is absolutely incredible. It is definitely worth the overpriced beer and wine or anything else you'll be getting here. Again, you're not here for spectacularly mixed drinks or an extensive beer list, you're here for the amazing sunset views on both side of SF that this unique, no cover spot affords. So eat up and drink up because it's totally worth it!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Well worth fighting crowds to find a table.  Luckily a couple shared their table with us.
One of my fav places to see amazing city views.  Never got service for a drink.
author: Jill S.

description:
We came here for drinks maybe around 9:40pm on St. Patrick's Day and it was pretty busy.  We managed to get a table and eventually made our way to the window with the view of the city.  The city looked great from the view and I thought it was always cool to see a city from a different time of day.  The interior was dark with lights here and there.  

The drink menu had a lot of choices depending on what you were feeling.  I chose the Soma Spritzer ($14) and everybody else had the Frisco Smash ($15), Valencia ($14) and the Pacific Heights Gimlet ($16).  The drinks came out after a few minutes of waiting.  

The Soma Spritzer was light to me (or everything was mixed well) but I was fine with that.  It looked like I was drinking water. lol  The Valencia and Frisco Smash looked very similar to each other in terms of color.  The Pacific Heights Gimlet was also not bad as well as everything else.  You can't go wrong with any of those drinks unless you prefer a certain drink over others.

If you want to get a table near the window, then come early or be patient.  Good place for drinks in SF with a great view!
author: Daniel H.

description:
I've heard this place is crowded during happy hour and I can see why. I visited after 9PM on a Monday and was lucky enough to catch a window seat with a "view". It was really awesome. I wish I could have come sooner or even known about this place to catch the sunset, however I'm sure it would have made for a totally different experience.

Handmade cocktails cost a pretty penny here. My old fashion was properly made with bourban and the Hendrick's gin cocktail was tasty with the cucumber garnish. Four mixed cocktails at regular menu price ran about $60 bucks. You definitlely pay for the experience and the ambience of the "view" on the 39th floor of the Marriot hotel. Still overall it's a nice experience overall and suitable for a nice date!
author: Shane T.

description:
The view is unreal! I love the vibe here, it's casual yet classy. Every seat here has viewing access of the city out of one of the two giant windows. I came around 5pm on a Sunday, just before the rush (10 minutes after we sat down, there were no open seats left). 

I had a glass of wine here and it was great, my friends had cocktails and were raving about them! I definitely want to try the cocktails when I come back next time. We also got some finger food and the selection was amazing!
author: Eunice T.

description: Went there for my gf's birthday. Fully packed but managed to get a window seat even tho I arrived late in the evening. Lucky me!  drinks were reasonably priced and got a little cake too which was really good.
author: Aditya B.

description: What a beautiful place. Came here for a birthday and as a visitor to SF and a place like this is severely lacking in LA. I don't drink alcohol so I can't comment on their drinks but the food was delicious! This is a great place to just relax with good company as you watch the sun set from its architecturally beautiful windows overlooking a good part of SF.
author: Widad D.

description: Well the name says it all. A very unique view of the city. And as luck would have it, it was one of those picture perfect come to California postcards kind of day. After reading yelp reviews and recommendations my friend and I arrived just as they were opening at 4 and we did indeed get a window seat. It filled up VERY quickly after us. Be forewarned, this is a much smaller space than I anticipated. It's comfortably casual which I liked very much. We had dinner reservations up town at 5:45 so the timing was right for us. We each had a Bloody Mary. Not too strong which was just fine with us. Waitress was super nice gal. I'd recommend planning on tipping well here. It's an impossible job. As soon as we made movements to get up and go, totally surrounded.  But definitely come for the View.
author: Marguerite S.

description: I visit the view on a Saturday night around 5pm the place was full and it was hard to find a spot/ table for two. The service was slow but the food was delicious ! The view from the top floor is so nice ! I recommend to any couples who would like to enjoy themselves and have a good time. Their playlist was a good one. This was one of the things we ordered from their menu. What's on the back is their flatbread which was really good !
author: Vanessa L.

description: Amazing place with views that will captivate and put you in awe. This is truly a spectacular place to come to when your in the city and if you live here like me! 10 Stars! Edwin helped us out and the customer service was magnificent! Thank you, Edwin!
author: Ron M.

description: This is a very good place for drinks and spectacular views of the city. I recommend that spot for everyone guest and locals.
author: Mikhail M.

description:
Where do I sell my soul to live here? I've been thinking of ways I can just build a fort in a corner and get away pretending this is my penthouse but so far no idea seems reasonable.

After an amazing conference with my amazing work colleagues we decided to embrace our recent learning of LIFE PROFIT (yes it's a thing) and make the most of a beautiful Thursday in San Francisco. After a hungover search for Acai Bowls we decided the best way to fix this was some drinks overlooking the skyline of this city. I expected views but hot damn was I blown away by the portrait The View provides you.

It's one of those situations where you almost feel like you didn't dress up enough for the occasion because The View spoils you- more ways than one. Not only are there superb drinks and small bites; however, you can pick, YES PICK, your scenic experience.

Want to feel like you're on the set of "The Sound of Music" then take a left from the elevators and see the scenic hill country of California. If you're more in the mood for a "Sex and The City" skyline view then definitely go towards the edge of the glass dome and take in the views.

As you're on the 39th floor you can't help but wonder what all those little dots on the ground are up to for the day...

Aside from taking a few, maybe 15 minutes, for photo ops and selfies. You can't help but be amazed that this site hadn't been brought to your attention sooner. 

My group was wanting to nibble on something so we opted for the charcuterie board which had your staple pairings that opt well with a glass of rosé. I can't wait to come back and show everyone my new penthouse (at least until security or the staff ask me to stop telling people that).
author: Tomas R.

description:
We came here for some drinks and appetizers around 5:45 on a Saturday. The place was bumpin'! The music was loud and it was packed with people. We were able to grab a table when I noticed a cute older couple were getting up to leave. The table we got had a wonderful view! Granted the views are good all around The View but some tables aren't right near the window. 

The service was slow at first that I even questioned if there was table service. Not sure if they were just understaffed that night or if it was just because it was so busy but regardless, a place like that is most likely always busy, so they should be prepared. 

I got a glass of white wine and we shared the tuna poke and flatbread. Both were good, I wouldn't say amazing though. The flatbread was kind of hard to eat; definitely not sexy food. The drinks and food were pricey however that is expected since you're at the Marriott in downtown SF. 

Overall, great place to grab a few drinks and maybe some apps but not a place you'd stay all night. You come for the view (which is fantastic) and move on to the next event for the night.
author: Katlyn H.

description:
Says open till 1. Sat down around 12:00. No one helped us. 20 minutes later at 12:20 the lights came on and they closed. Waitress walked by multiple times but decided not to tell us they are closing. Waste of time. Didn't end up having a drink. 

It's extremely loud in here and there's no music playing. Very weird vibe in here. I would not recommend.
author: Mark A.

description:
I had originally planned to visit the Westin St. Francis and try to figure out how to get up into their glass elevator that supposedly has a fantastic view of the city. I asked a Yelp friend about the Westin, and she suggested that I come here. Thank you Alina M. for pointing me to this place.
     I had been walking from where the cable car let me off about a half mile away.  I'd walk a block or so, pull out my phone and ensure I was walking in the right direction. Eventually I came to the Marriott.  According to my phone-map I was close. I asked the doorman about the bar, and with a smile, he pointed straight up, and said "Head up to the 39th floor." I thanked him and turned into the Hotel, and then found my way to an elevator. 
     Inside the elevator were ads wallpapered on the back of the car. "See the View on the 39th floor!" it exclaimed.  A couple stared romantically out over the city. I knew I was in the right place and I punched the button for the 39th floor. The doors opened up and I heard the sound of dining. I stepped out of the elevator and looked to my right to see the great big window that looks like I was sitting in the pilot seat of the Millennium Falcon. The view was spectacular.
     The seats by the windows were obviously very popular and all were occupied. I had to awkwardly hover by one for a lil bit by a standing table before one opened up. I swooped in as soon as it's occupant vacated, and I dropped my camera bag on the floor at my feet. I looked out at the city for a moment and had to zen for just a lil bit. Wow. Lookit the city down there. A waitress swung by and asked me if I'd like anything. I thanked her and looked at a menu. Holy CRAP! This stuff is kinda pricy!
     Further examining the menu, the appetizers weren't too bad. The Housemade chips and charred scallion dip were only seven fifty. There were a few other seven fifty items, then the 'small' plates jumped to nineteen dollars. The bottle of beer to enjoy with the chips however....eight dollars. That was even a bud light! Welp. Fifteen dollars for some chips and a beer. But lookit the window. It's incredible. We're way high up...and it's a huge window. I'm paying for Ambiance.
     I stood there for a bit. Staring out into the city. I enjoyed my chips and my beer, I took some photographs, and after a while I stood at the table, staring out into space. My empty bottle, and my empty basket in front of me. Waitress came by again and with a smile asked if I'd like some water. Thank you waitress. You get me. I enjoyed my glass of water for as long as I could; and eventually left my table. I watched as somebody else swooped in mere moments after I vacated it. 
     As I walked back to the elevators, I finally noticed that this place has two sides. The other side seems more of a restaurant dining area than a chilling bar area. But still. Lots of great big windows overlooking the city. I walked over and took some more photographs from this side, and finally returned to the elevator. 

    As I exited back onto the street, I again thanked the doorman who was still there. I then continued my adventures in the city by the bay.
author: Scott B.

description:
Gorgeous view of the city night life! Nothing better than feeling fancy on a random Wednesday night. I am a sucker for breathtaking aerial views, and couple that with dim romantic lights and fancy schmancy drinks. I'd call that a successful date night!

Drinks are way $$$ but they were admirably strong. Oddly, it was pretty busy on a weekday night and we were told there were various conventions and conferences. And of course, post-TEDxSoMA. Our server was friendly but clearly overwhelmed with the number of customers. So we were understanding of her lack of attention. The crowd here is definitely swanky fancy and we fit right in looking fly ;) Overall, a chill place to check out for the ambiance and view but def would not recommend the food; maybe just 1 drink?...
author: Donna T.

description: Came here with my best friend for a drink and to check out the beautiful view we'd heard so much about. The rummors are true, the view is stunning!! Don't hesitate to visit this place, it's so worth it just for the view alone.
author: Alex R.

description:
Finally! After waiting a couple years, I finally got to come here and experience the view. It's a lot bigger than I actually thought? There are two sides inside this bar. One view shows the panoramic view of the buildings and sky scrapers while the back end of the view displays more of the outer part of the city including hills and Twin Peaks. 

The bar is circular and has top shelf drinks to local wines/bubbles. The food menu looks pretty decent too but of course this is a hotel so expect hotel portion and prices on both food & drinks. There are comfy lounge seating with standing tables, etc.

I defintely recommend coming here during sunset or during the night when the music makes the atmosphere. This is a lounge to get dressed up for so fellas, prepare to put on a button-up and some dark denims or slacks. I will be sure to come back again with some friends and enjoy more of the evening here. It's an amazing view of the city and also one of the best I've seen in any city. It's upclose and pretty damn personal. Good Job Marriott!
author: Allister D.

description:
Classy yet unpretentious, The View Lounge on the 39th floor of the Marriott Marquis is definitely worth a visit.  

Just let your cares slip away with a well-crafted drink, high above beautiful San Francisco.  I recommend the Sutro Splash (vodka, cranberry juice and ginger beer).

Naturally, this place is popular, so be patient with the servers. 
Movable ottomans make the seating flexible, which is convenient.  My server was friendly, efficient and upbeat.

The View Lounge will very likely become a tradition when visiting San Francisco.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
My lady and I came here for the view obviously, but also to FEEL RICH AND POWERFUL.

As we sit down looking over San Francisco with our legs crossed and eyes squinted because of the direct sunlight hitting us, we pretend we embody the souls of those who own the companies we work for. 

And with each bite of the deliciously baked chips served in a nice cup we savor, we remember where we once were in life before this, down at the bottom floor looking up. 

Thank you The View Lounge, for giving a young, up and coming broke guy and his wonderful lady the chance to feel special.

FOOD
We had chips because we just wanted to eat something fairly inexpensive before we got tacos. Since we had been drinking the night before and didn't want to feel like alcoholics, we had non-alcoholic drinks which were pretty good.

CUSTOMER SERVICE
They do a good job sectioning out the area so that a waiter/waitress could service each section.

Your Slogan
The View Lounge: "We Give Special"

Thank you The View Lounge!
author: Jonathan R.

description: You go to the View for the View! Nuff said!
author: James L.

description:
Came here to celebrate my sisters graduation, and let me start by saying even on a Sunday night you are SOL trying to find a seat after about 8pm. I wish we could have made it in a bit earlier for sunset but time gets away from us all, and one of the bartenders said it was even more packed at that time. 

The drinks-
Good, but over priced, as with many bars and clubs. I would come back mostly for the 360 degree dazzling view over the city rather than for the 17$ cocktail. 

There is food offered, I did not order any. From the menu looked like reasonable 10$-20$ a selection, and from what I could see the food brought out to others were small portions. 

All in all, come for the view alone and stay for a few drinks. Expect a hefty tab but a great experience. But be sure to get here early, by 9:00 it's pretty much standing room only. Although service is attentive, once it gets busy it does become difficult to get an order in.
author: Raylene B.

description: I liked the view drinks everything. It's really nice place to see San Francisco. But I think especially on Friday better come early. We came abt 5 and it opens at 4 was packed and it was difficult to order things and just stand there wasso difficult
author: Melody A.

description: 39th floor of the Marriott with amazing views before the fog came in. Very touristy but exactly as expected being an observation bar.
author: Joe W.

description: Whether you live in San Fran or are visiting- YOU MUST GO TO THE VIEW.. because WOW! What a view for sure. Tip: Go as soon as they open to get "the spot" you desire. If not you definitely will not have the same experience standing around looking for a seat like a hawk. We arrive 30 minutes in and got lucky with a corner seating area. We stayed for 4 hours, drinking, wishing and eating! I mean, #isthisreallife?? What a view! The sunset is to die for no matter where you sit! BEST HONEYMOON EVER!!!! The most epic #lounge!! Thank you for having us!
author: Kathy I.

description:
If you like having your drinks with an amazing city view "The View" is a place for you. The place is perfect for an after-work​ affair if you are going out with your bosses, Date nights or for catching up with friends. 

I love their skyline punch with the cheese bread! My go-to​ options!

TIP: They do not take reservations so try to get their early to get the best seats by the windows
author: Avantika S.

description: Great selection of wine and great atmosphere nice bartenders and quality people that tend to crowd around this bar I would recommend it to any of my friends and family
author: Shanta L. M.

description: Came here on a Tuesday night, it was pretty empty towards 11:30PM. I ordered a cocktail with pineapple juice (Skyline Punch), and they were nice enough to swap it for cranberry juice (pineapples don't sit well with me). I came here at night because it was a bar, but I would definitely recommend coming here at sunset instead because the view would have been amazing from the windows. I have FOMO now!
author: Rosey L.

description:
I luv this spot. A good girlfriend of mine invited me along with others to celebrate a birthday after party. The atmosphere is great . It was nice being surrounded by San Francisco yuppies( do we still use this word today????)
The breathtaking view of the city is spectacular. I tried taking pictures of the bridge but I was too drunk to accomplish this.
author: Arthur M.

description:
We came here for our anniversary and enjoyed the appetizers and drinks. It was pretty difficult to find seatings here, we had to wait for people to get up and order to get a seat. 

I thought they would have more food options, but they didn't when we came here. Just small plates/appetizers. The food was pretty damn good, I really loved it! It is very pricey here though; we ordered 3 plates of appetizers and two drinks and it came out to $96- including tip.

The view is OKAY! Not wonderful, and I say this because it really depends on where you sit, and it gets really crowded here so you can't see much -____- 

I definitely want to Come back For the food
author: Be H.

description:
Had a great old fashion, GREAT finger food/app selection. The Poke is solid, flat bread short rib  and of course the view is to die for. 
Only knock was how packed it was, BUT once you get up there you'll see why. 
Def check this place out.
author: Bart B.

description: Pricey but very strong drinks. The ambiance is reallly nice and the staff really cool. Ordered serval drinks and enjoy the view as a group.
author: S W.

description:
Good drinks and nice view, but the service SUCKS.

My advice, take your snaps with your overly priced drink, and then leave to the nearest bar you could find!
author: Genesis E.

description: It was a lovely place with relaxing ambiance. The server was very busy so he didn't seem to attend to us enough. However, their creme brûlée was perfectly prepared! Definitely a must to attend at sunset!
author: Meiky H.

description:
Tips for parking:

1. There's an hourly garage at 5th & mission (1 block away) with rates between $2 & $3.50/hr depending on arrival time. 
2. Parking on Geary is free on Sunday after 6am
Valet parking is $72/day but a parking ticket on Geary is just $71!  A comparable bargain!

Pro tip: bookmark and use xtreet.org which has a map & schedule of street cleaning by locations & meter hours. Also, holiday schedule: 

https://www.sfmta.com/getting-around/parking/holiday-enforcement

That is all that you require.
author: Athonia C.

description: This is an AMAZING place to see the city! Beautiful views. Busy, but relaxing atmosphere. Our waitress was incredibly kind and attentive. If I am ever back in the area I will come again! You may have to sit at a table and wait for a window seat, but it's worth the wait!
author: Jamey W.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend to have some drinks and appetizers to hold us over for an event we had later in the evening for my birthday. We talked to some people in the hotel prior who said to be up here at exactly 4:00 pm when they open or else you wouldn't find a window seat. They were definitely correct, we arrived around 4:05 and it was already packed! But luckily enough we snagged a window seat and the views were amazing! We sat on the bar side which gives views of the water so if you want to see the sunset be sure to sit on the opposite side. We would definitely come back!

The wine and apps were also yummy.
author: Annmarie G.

description:
I highly recommend The View Lounge at Marriott Marquis NYC.
I had been there before and remembered that it was nice dining in a revolving tower, with a view of New York City, but when I went there June 2, 2018, I was reminded of other benefits. 

It seemed a bit confusing about the hotel, the restaurant and the lounge, and going to the third floor to get an elevator to the 48th floor, and minimum charges, etc., but when I got there, it was no problem. There were staff members everywhere, who were friendly and helpful and made it all easy.

The ride in the special elevator made me feel like I was in a science fiction film. In seconds, we flew from the 3rd floor to the 47th and 48th, where the restaurant and the lounge are located. The view was fun to watch as we ate and the lounge was very nice.

Wait staff took orders for beverages and brought them, but everything else was buffet. Usually, when I eat out, I can only find one thing I like, but the 2 buffet tables, one for the main meal and one for desserts and cheeses, were like heaven. There were so many choices that I like and I was able to try a little bit of everything. I felt as if they had been reading my mind, when they made these choices available. Everything was very well prepared and totally delicious.  The chocolate fountain was like a fantasy and it really was easy to use. Even though it was self-serve, the wait staff was very helpful, with drink orders and answering any questions. Our waiter, Pete was excellent. So friendly and helpful.
author: Nadine R.

description: Gets way too crowded during sunset and can't reserve your own tables. Basically it's a free for all up there at peak hours. Good for taking a pic or two only.
author: Frank H.

description: Great view. Great drinks. Great food. Minus 1 star because it's really difficult to get a nice window seat. I arrived at around 6:30pm the first time I went. We got lucky and got a window seat but it wasn't the view we wanted. We were surprised by how good the food tasted. We didn't really expect much. The mushroom flatbread was very delicious. We also had a complimentary creme brulee because it was my friend's birthday. We didn't ask for it but the server was so sweet and gave us a free dessert with lighted candle. And of course, the dessert didn't disappoint us. Learning from the first time, this time I got here exactly at 4pm when they opened, and guess what? I still couldn't get a window seat. But I managed to get a seat on the side with the nice view. Plus the window is huge I was able to see the view even if I was sitting a little further from the window. Their menu changes daily or monthly because I didn't see the delicious mushroom flatbread on the menu this time. I ordered a grilled octopus and it was delicious as well. I hope I can get lucky and get a great seat next time. Even if I don't I will definitely come back for the drinks and the food.
author: Lisa M.

description: Pricy but the view is worth it! Great place to go after work with your coworkers to just chillax!
author: Tammy P.

description:
Very Nice bar! There is no dresscode so you can come as you are right after shopping or in the evening. You have drinks, snacks and some hot plats. The service is very nice and they change the cocktails a little bit for you if you want to! You have free wifi as well :) 
The cocktails are around $15 and very good! I really recommend it! Just the view depends on the weather. Now it's foggy but nice anyway. Come early to catch a window seat :)
author: Alina B.

description: This place is seat yourself which is good because you can relocated if you spot a free table with a better view of San Francisco.  It gets busy so they require a room or credit card on file in case you decide to leave. Drinks were flavorful and strong. What a great way to end the day with a friend.
author: Jamie P.

description:
Free to get in, and a really great view of the city! However, it was very crowded and a struggle to get a table since it is such a nice view. Still, I was glad to be up there!

Drinks were $16+, so I wouldn't recommend multiple rounds!
author: Riley J.

description: One of the best views in San Francisco. If you are looking for hidden gems with views well this is your place to be at. The drinks are amazing. The view is great. The snacking food is great as well.
author: Akshay B.

description: Very touristy joint so I advise to get there before sunset to get a good view on the sun setting and stick around for the skyline view. The prices are Vegas prices $15 cocktails. You honestly come here for the views. Nothing else, We went on a Thursday night and it was slammed. There is no parking so you have to find parking somewhere else, we parked in a free parking in the city and Uber'ed there. There is no seating, you just seat yourself. I am coming back again soon!
author: Esteban I.

description:
I've been here a couple of times and I love this place. 
We got lucky cuz some window seats opened up and we scooped right in. Cocktails are kinda pricey but u get killer views.
Nice way to spend a Saturday night.
author: Linda W.

description: Beautiful view, great service and a nice scene. Never really noticed how lucky we are in the Bay Area, until you're that high up, looking at how beautiful everything is. Definitely will return....
author: Aiga B.
Stephanie W.

description:
39 floors up, the view of downtown SF is so beautiful. There are windows everywhere and you could literally pick which spot you'd like to sit in and what view you'd like to take in for the rest of the time you decide to stay there. It gets SUPER packed, anytime. My boyfriend took me here for our anniversary and it was so amazing. Prices are usual range for drinks and food. And they were so great, so many options! We were still full from our late lunch so we decided to ask the waitress what kind of appetizer she suggest we order, and we ended up ordering the home made potato chips, it was so good, especially with the ranch dressing they served along with it! You can never go wrong with ranch! They also had some small hot plate options and as the night progressed, we tried  asian chicken wings and they tasted boom! 

I wish we were able to sit near the glass dome, maybe next time when we're in town we will. But for now, even without the glass dome view, we were able to take in the city view and enjoy our evening. It was very romantic, we even got to catch the sunset. The only thing was that at night, the dim lights from inside the buildings glared on the windows, so it made it a little bit hard to see the city lights outside. But nonetheless, a breathtaking experience. We will definitely go back here again!
author: Jeanneen M.

description:
I've been told to avoid this place. I was told this would be touristy, lack authenticity and overpriced. Is it as bad as people say? 

Fundamental things I look for in a bar: make me comfortable, serve me delicious drinks and be interesting. So, why not break it down according to those criteria...

Comfort: the place hardly had any seating, nobody is there to arrange you a table and trying to get a really expensive drink at the bar was quite a wait. Now, I am cool with some of those things at a cheap bar, but this was up there in terms of price and I'd say the comfort level here not great. It is a decently fun place, solid crowd of yuppie looking people on weekends.

Drinks: the Moscow mule I had was not the worst I had, but not far from it. I genuinely hate when bartenders can't make a simple drink like that correctly. This was sugary and disgusting.

Interesting: Well, the view is cool. The semi circle window is interesting. The design is very average otherwise. So, it does get some points on the interesting front and I don't think this place was too bad, but it frankly wasn't anything great. Chances of making a return visit here are pretty low for me.
author: Alex P.

description: This is a fantastic place to have a drink and get a good look at downtown San Francisco from the 39th floor. Give the flatbreads a try while you are there. You will be glad you stopped by.
author: Erik O.

description:
Amazing place to watch the sun go down over San Francisco. It's not the cheapest place for drinks but there is no charge to enter and you can stay as long as you like. Get there early for a window table, but I recommend one of the cosy corners with Alcatraz view. You'll get the best seats for the sunset and won't have people hovering over you table taking photos. Friendly and efficient staff.
In New York this place would gave a $35 entrance fee!
author: Paul B.

description: When you get a seat by the window, the view is incredible. Every time I have been there, the place is really busy. The last two times I went, i wasn't able to get a seat or a drink. I ended up just leaving and going somewhere else. I loooove rooftop bars, so I wish it was easier to find seating and get drinks here. When you do get a seat and drinks here, it's a very pleasant experience. It's definitely worth checking out if you're in the city.
author: Amanda P.

description: If you like hotel bars - complete with tourists and pricey drinks - this place is not to be missed. The View has wonderful vistas of the entire city, including views of the Bay Bridge that are glorious at night. Especially with the beautiful bridge lights, there's a show from every window. The added benefit of this lounge is that it's open on holidays even when everything else is closed, because it accommodates guests of the Marriott hotel who are in town for big occasions like Christmas and New Years. Drinks are pricey at $15-$17 a pop, as are the small plates, but it's really nice to have food options when you're sucking down cocktails a mile above San Francisco. Try the cheese plate and the braised shirt rib flatbread - together they comfortably feed two. And try not to flinch when your bill comes to $110. Smiley face.
author: Ray J.

description:
Absolutely stunning views of the City and the Bay. Cocktails are pricey but it's a warm and welcoming environment. Occasionally you'll get a little shitty service but that can and does happen everywhere.

10/10 would recommend bringing your out-of-town friends here.
author: Sahil B.

description: The View is located in the Marriott (just take the elevators up) and seat yourself. The actual view is amazing but the rest, as somewhat expected, was very expensive and just okay. The service was also mediocre and pretty slow for such a nice looking place! Of course, come here for the VIEW.
author: Alaina P.

description:
The top Floor of the Marriott Hotel on Market Street is called The View.  It is one place I never fail to bring visitors. Its view is one of the very best in town.  The Marriott provides a fast elevator straight to the top.

The View is a cocktail lounge, so do not expect lunch or dinner.  The drinks are exquisite and you can expect some seasonal creations. Appetizers are delicious but not particularly creative and not particularly ample. This area could be improved.  

The lounge is very, very popular. I recommend arriving early during the late fall and winter and early spring, around 5:00 or 5:30 and enjoy the day time view as it segues to evening. This is quite memorable.  I also like to drop in late night, after an event. Window tables are more likely to be readily available at that time..

The decor in the lounge and in the rest rooms is first class and the rooms are sparkling clean.
Waiters are very professional and I have never been rushed.
author: Linda B.

description: This lounge has always been my favorite chill bar and very under rated. Almost an unknown gem with amazing views of the city. But now it has changed. It can get very crowded and hard to find a seat and the drinks, although delicious, are a bit overpriced. Haven't tried the food yet.
author: P S.

description: Great sky high bar in the city. Drinks are ok and pricing is decent. I go here for the view more than I do for the drinks. Great atmosphere and service. The view during dusk and at night is a sight to see. Only downside is that there are no reservations, whatsoever. Having been to other similar rooftop/sky high bars nesting inside of a hotel in a metro area, this kind of came as a surprise. If you're a go-with-the-flow kind of person, this won't bother you. If you wanna grab a nice spot with a great view (and without constantly being on the look out), come early. If not, you'll still grab a decent spot... but you're going to need to constantly move your party around until you have the perfect view of the city.
author: Ana Q.

description: I love the view!! who wouldn't if you're on the 37th floor Mariott hotel w a cocktail in hand and overlooking beautiful floor to ceiling fan-like glass into Downtown SF and its beautiful skylines!  I think i'll love it more if i have a seat by the window! so Come early when they first open. I had an old fashioned which was pretty well made! it's $15 but you're paying for the views too, coming from NYC, it's pretty standard cocktail prices these days! They serve food but i did not get to try it, maybe next time when i get a seat and can linger a bit longer :)
author: Karry L.

description: Stayed at the Marriott Marquis for a weekend getaway with my girlfriends so it was super convenient for us to get to the view lounge which is located on the 39th floor. Great vibe, lots of places to sit at.  I was hoping to give this place at least 4 starts But it took forever to get just one drink...waited at least 30 minutes.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Mind blowing views & delicious food!

It's my favorite lounge in the city to hangout with friends.
Love their sliders, house chips and crepe brûlée!

I also love the fact that they listen to your drink choices!

The only problem is the crowd! It's getting very crowded and to get a seat with a view it takes a bit of waiting! But it's well worth it!!
author: Deebs M.

description:
We came here on a Monday night for food and drinks. The place was packed with SF finance professionals. We were able to quickly snag a table next to the window for the perfect view of the city. There's a nice 360 degree view of SF from here. It's a great way to enjoy some cocktails and appetizers with some coworkers or friends. We ordered a ton of food. Some of the food we ordered:

Beet salad- Pretty good for what it is. The goat cheese adds a tangy flavor that pairs well with the beets and clementines in the salad. 

Yellowfin Tuna Poke- Fresh tuna! The thick chunks of avocado with this went very well. 

Bloody Mary prawns- This was average, just seemed like shrimp lightly dipped in Bloody Mary drinks. Nothing special with this small plate.

Braised short rib flatbread- Pretty good. The short rib tastes good and tender, it just has a lot of cheese on top that covers a lot of the short ribs flavor, but I'm never really going to complain about extra cheese in my life, haha.

House smoked lollipop wings- These were very good. Nice and crispy and flavorful. Finger licking good.

Pork belly tacos- the pork was very tender and the cilantro and Mexican cheese on top gives it the perfect authentic taste. 

--------

We drank Moscow Mules with our food. They were good, I just wished they were in the typical copper Moscow mule mugs. Overall, this was a unique and fun way to enjoy dinner and a view at the same time in SF. I definitely recommend this for tourists!
author: Monique W.

description: One could think my review is a little biased as I just attended a Yelp Elite Event yesterday. Yet, as it was my third time at The View, thought I could allow myself to review this awesome spot. Cocktails are great, food is awesome and best of all the Marriott team is adorable. I had a lovely evening and will definitely come back to enjoy more cocktails. Don't hesitate to walk around: you'll enjoy a 360 view of the city!
author: Clémentine C.

description:
Amazing view of SF with fairly priced drinks and snacks. We had a really good table just by the window and enjoyed the beautiful view of SF in night. I had skyline cocktail which was delicious , highly recommended.

Down side, there is no waiting list and guests wander around and sit wherever they find an empty table/chair. This makes finding seats tough and the floor is always crowded. The servers have to dodge wandering people to deliver the orders. 
Also, there were no draft beers on the menu, which was disappointing.
author: Ali M.

description:
So I was a little intimidated that this bar would have outrageous prices, but that wasn't the case at all. Very standard for cocktail prices, so me and my wallet left happy. Great way to get a fancier feel for a city overlook. Seating however was a free-for-all. We started at a standing high-top and had to eye different parties at more opportune, window-adjacent tables in order to gain better territory. Overall, I got my table, view, and drink. So I left a happy camper.

I will add that it seems to be easier to score a scenic table on the side of the establishment oppose of the bar.
author: Andrew W.

description:
The great view with the great food & drinks!! 
Thanks to kind staffs, Made my special day memorable!
author: Kay K.

description:
I am given this place a 5 stars for the beautiful view at the "the view lounge" on the 39th level. It is voted one the most gorgeous view of SF. I came here with 6 of my girlfriends for a get together on Tuesday evening. The lounge wouldn't be open after 4PM so you can not go up the 39th floor after 4PM!
I arrived there around 4:20PM on Tuesday and there are half of people there in the lounge already. I was lucky I came early to have a beautiful seating facing the awesome view of SF. The view is breathtaking!
The bar foods is decent not that great or variety but there are a lot of options for the drinks. By 5PM the lounge is full house even if it is on a weekday. So if you plan to come here on the weekend, make sure you comes  here right before they open to get a seat next to the windows for the view. 
You can park yourself far for self parking or go valet parking at the hotel which I did because I don't want to walk out drunk at night time especially the cold weather at night in SF.  
I am here just for the gorgeous view!
author: Kim T.

description: Great views of the city from pretty much everywhere! On the 39th floor of the Marriott hotel on Mission St, it's actually a lounge, not a fancy, expensive restaurant like you might expect. A lot of appetizers options (tacos, beets salad, poke, and others). Quite expensive for what they are, but it's not like you have to buy an expensive entrée just to get in. Drinks are good and strong (or it might be the altitude, I don't know!) and quite a good variety, but both the food and the drink menus are fairly small. The whole place is open seating and they have couches, arm chairs and ottomans that you can pretty much arrange any way it suits your party. They have tables too if you are a large group or a family event. Great service and good vibes that make everyone look happy! (or it might be the strong drinks, I don't know!)
author: Gabe P.

description:
On a random Thursday night, my friend and I decided to spontaneously go into the city for drinks and dinner! One of the first places we went to after getting off the Powell Bart station was The View located the top floor of the Marriott. I had been to Cityscape before at the Hilton, but the view was even more amazing at the View because of the architecture! I loved how the frames complimented the city views and depending where you sat, you can actually see the bay bridge!

My friend and I got to The View around 6pm and the lounge was already super packed. But if you wait around for a bit, you can spot a group leaving and you can scoop their table. That's exactly what I did and it only took less than 10 minutes! I got a table right by the windows which really set the mood for the night just overlooking the city with the sunset in the background. We ordered their flatbread with some drinks - Skyline Punch and Mission Margarita. The flat bread was presented on this cute wooden board and it was so pretty! I loved their bean sprouts with tomatoes and goat cheese. It was so delicious especially paired with the drinks. My Skyline punch was pretty good, but what was really amazing was the Mission Margarita. Before my friend ordered it, the waitress told him it was going to be spicy, which he was okay with. When I tried his drink, and I normally don't like margaritas, the drink definitely had a kick to it! I would definitely order that next time I'm at the View.
author: Ada C.

description:
Checked in to the hotel for my birthday and while I had some time to myself before the night started, I decided to come up here to grab a drink while my husband was in the room getting ready. I'm glad I finally had the chance to check it out cuz it was real nooiice (Bernie Mac voice)! All of the tables next to the window were taken but there were plenty of bar seats so I hoisted my short ass up and ordered my usual drink which is a Bulleit Rye Manhattan with a splash of cherry juice. 

The bartender was friendly and he made one of the best Manhattans I've ever had. He even suggested I get it on the rocks because the ice he used was that perfect stiff block of ice cube used for drinks to keep it cold but not dilute it because it doesn't melt very quickly which I appreciated so much. Such a nice touch! Sitting there got me feeling like this is what being in my 30's should feel like. Nice bar, nice view of the city with a nice drink in my hand. I went up for the second time a little later with my husband and cousins but around that time, it was packed! It's an open seating so you better be quick to snatch a table or come early.

This is a great place to come with friends and/or family to start the night of fun or just to chill and have great conversations. Good place to find a reason to bust out that swanky outfit or just keep it casual while enjoying the beautiful view! It's also good to come alone to decompress and someone will strike up a conversation with you or just to simply give you a compliment or ask what you're sippin' on.
author: Candice J.

description:
The seating system for The View is the worse thing I have experienced since watching Kristen Stewart try to act.

Imagine making the decision to trek all the way down to the Marriot and up the elevator to find that there is absolutely no seating system. It is up to you and the grace of God to find a table that is unoccupied. Most parties tend to stay at their tables for an extended period of time. You can literally watch The Lord of the Rings Trilogy twice before you manage to find a seat, that may or may not fit you and your guests. Expect to awkwardly wait next to a table while you wait for them to leave.

The drinks are standard fare and they have a full bar. The food is subpar and seems like an afterthought. It's okay for a few quick bites if you are starving and near death but not worth it otherwise. There are many more rooftop bars that are far better (El Techo, Top of the Mark, Cityscape Lounge, etc).
author: Mike K.

description:
Not bad. Drinks and a view of San Francisco. I wouldn't consider this a late night, big group hang out. Just seemed good only for small groups and for no more than an hour. It's not like they have a DJ playing dance and rave music here.

It's just a get a couple of drinks kind of hangout, maybe get a couple of snacks, look out at the sunset and go out to dinner somewhere else kind of place.

Still, worth the trip up here to see some nice views of the city. And their fruity drinks are pretty good.
author: Mike C.

description: 5 stars for the view - we scored a table at one of the windows!  LEGIT VIEWS.  The food was bad - the Charcuterie was grocery store quality or less - the house made chips were stale.  Wine was good - views AMAZING - skip the food here and enjoy the view.
author: Laura G.

description: This is a really cool spot. If you have visitors from out of town, take them here! Great view of the city. Drinks are rooftop-prices at $14-16/each. Cocktails were good and I love their SF names/theme. The food is also tasty. We had the goat cheese flatbread and it was good. Would totally come back. Even though it was rainy, the view was still stellar.
author: Marie D.

description: My favorite bar in SF. Nothing beats seeing the city from above to the overpriced drinks and good company. It's pricey but it's an experience worth having.
author: Joshua D.

description: Not too much into alocohol but definitely dreamy about the sky scrappers and the beauty of SF city. Have seen it day and night from either sides. The View has got beautiful view...! In love with this place.
author: Namisha G.

description: Love this place. Great drinks, stunning view and great service. Cutthroat seating but I feel like it's all apart of the allure. Definitely recommend to anyone who needs a brief respite from touring the city.
author: Zach T.

description:
I don't really know the metrics on how to run a successful bar / lounge.  What I do know is the place 2/3 times I've visited was a 5 Star place.  However the 3rd time it was an entirely different crowd.  

Pushing and shoving like an 18 and up nightclub in the hood.  This place offers great spirits, has a classy feel most the time but it was an at capacity worry about your safety ghetto spot with a nice view the last time.

I guess show up and be pleasantly surprised or maybe scared?

Charge more, get a dress code?  I don't know but it was missing something last time.
author: Tom B.

description: You need to visit here for a drink and a view of the city. They also serve food so you could get snacks too. It is a must if you are in San Francisco. I recommend getting here right a 4pm do you can get a prime seat. You get a beautiful view and can watch the fog roll in and then a few minutes later see the top of the buildings again.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Is the $16+ price tag on a cocktail more than I'd usually like the pay for a drink? Yes. Is the stunning high rise view of San Francisco that comes along with it worth every penny? Most definitely.
author: Lauren N.

description:
The View resembles the venue in The Dark Knight where Joker crashed Bruce Wayne's party and ended up throwing his shorty off of the balcony. Remember? Bruce somehow changed into his rubber costume (that he had hiding in his oh-so convenient utility closet), beat up a crew of bad guys, and then rescued her? (Ballin'!) I'm sure it's coming back to you, now.

But if you absolutely have no idea what I'm referring to, imagine ascending to the top of the Marriott located in the heart of SoMa, and then turning to your right to lock eyes with a gigantic ass window that spans a two-foot story wall overlooking the city. I would stab a good man, with little (bratty) children, for this view. Would? Maybe. Probably. Did.

More about my window lust, I love how the metal frames holding the panes of glass sprawl out from an epicenter at the base of the floor, similar to a spider's web. Unfortunately, it's Hunger Games-challenging to nab a table next to the window, but if you do be prepared to make some babies. There's something about capturing the Golden Gate Bridge, rolling mountains, and gentle blinking skyscrapers all in one eye f***. Yes, I said eye f***. Like, imagine porn, but only for your eyes. Ok, I'll stop.

To make the views even more imposing, they have plush leather couches, dim naked-time mood lighting, and slap-your-face strong drinks. Oh, what's that? Someone vigorously rubbed your thigh and other body parts accidentally because the mood was absolutely perfect? My bad. MY. BAD. 

Regardless of how inebriated you become, you'll also enjoy their stellar service. Whether it's your new friend you've just made at the bar, or the person serving you drinks at your table, everyone's very professional and fast. 

The View is an annual destination, for me. It most certainly deserves your attention, too.
author: Jonathan T.

description: This place has a beautiful view, and despite how packed it always is, the service is really good. My friend and I came here around 5:00 pm on a Sunday, and it was definitely packed. Luckily for us, about 30 minutes in,  some guests got up from a view by the window. It was very comfortable and familiar. I enjoyed my time there. We only got up to leave at 8:00 pm. I would recommend this place, and will be coming back myself.
author: Nishi S.

description: Great place to get drinks with a view. I came here and we found a place to sit, which is always nice and the drinks are potent. The view is killer and one of my favorites in the city. Nothing quiet like it.
author: Kaylee C.

description: Great cocktails and their house made chips are awesome. It really does have a great view - just gets pretty crowded.
author: Lillian B.

description:
Not to state the obvious, but, I love the view at The View! Everything else is OK. It can get really packed and tricky to get a drink. Last time I was here I scored a table right by the window which made my experience nice and relaxing!

On a separate note I looked into reserving this place out for a wedding event. The minimum price to do this was really expensive! To put it into perspective the minimum price for the entire Rotunda of SF City Hall from ~6pm-midnight is comparable to the minimum spend here to buyout only half of The View from 5-7.I didn't include this into my rating, just wanted to share with anyone planning a big event.
author: Emma B.

description:
It's all been said and seen before! 

Yes, the view is ridiculous, the drinks are a tad pricey, and it's gets crowded very fast, but that like I said, that view, though! No matter what side you choose to sit on in this Mariott Hotel bar, you'll get a birdseye look at the city by the bay. You'll either see the actual Bay or a good chunk of the Haight and Asbury area. 

It's first come, first served when it comes to the window seats, so get here early. At the least get a good spot at the bar so you can side eye the city. Try to get here during happy hour to get a little break in the price. They do serve food here, but I didn't eat any because I was headed dinner shortly after.  

Fantastic views, drinks, and San Franciso. What else could you possible want!
author: Nate M.

description:
Amazing 360 views, great selection of cocktails, and delicious cheese plate. I ordered one I mean three of the gin cocktails. Super refreshing and delicious. Service was on point. 

You pretty much have to scout tables. They are a hot commodity by the window. About $15 per cocktail. Definitely worth the wait!
author: Ariana F.

description: A better place I have never been. Due to it location on the 39th floor, it provides an amazing 360 view of the town! I came there last Monday with my boyfriend and, fortunately, there were some tables by the window waiting on us. We ordered Skyline Punch and Chicken Flatbread, and ate and drunk admiring the view!  Everything was fresh and tasty, I will be back.
author: Anna C.

description:
This is a very beautiful bar and lounge. There is a classy atmosphere which will make you appear better to any dates you bring here. Drinks are absolutely overpriced like any other bar. However, since the View is connected to the hotel: it is very easy to purchase alcohol at the nearby liquor store and consume in your room if you are so interested.

The main problem is that the place will get very busy, very quickly which makes finding a good spot overlooking a view of the city extremely difficult and tedious.
author: Sofyan S.

description: Beautiful place for an early evening drink. We had a couple of martinis and their cheese and charcuterie plate. Wow! They sure don't skimp on the food!!! The view is absolutely gorgeous. If you're in the area, it's definitely a don't miss stop. Wish it opened a little earlier than 4pm. Overall, a great place and I'll be back.
author: Jamie W.

description: Went again. This time a less pleasant experience, in part due to the fact that there were several conferences in the hotel and so lots of people looking for seats from sunset till late at night (and a prime area closed off for a private conference function). Food was good, but not worth fight for a space.
author: J. Christopher E.

description:
Friend:  Let's go somewhere with a nice view
Me: (points to myself) No?
Friend: (rolls eyes) Definitely not
Me: Fine, there's a place close by

I've heard of the View before but never been.  It looks and sounds fancy but when your friend asks for a nice view, you find them the next suitable thing to look at.  Upon walking inside the Marriot, we jumped into at least two different elevators stalling everyone from proceeding to their destination.  To go to the View, search for the High Rise elevators which take you to the 39th floor.  There was a private event closing off one area and all the seats closer to the windows were taken but we were lucky to score seats near the bar.  Our server, Cindy, was very knowledgeable of the menu and patient with us as we drilled her with questions.

Tuna Poke - a tad bland; needed a hint of lemon, would've been nice if it came with crackers as a scooper.  Upon stuffing a mouthful of poke in my mouth, the gentleman next to us asks "How's the food?" "It's good! But of course I have to say that since you're sitting with the Chef!"  hee hee, ha ha
Baked Flatbread - Fresh heirloom tomatoes, prosciutto, burrata, and crispy bread.  I would've preferred a different type of cheese but overall light and healthy
Deviled Eggs - comes with a fancy cheese decoration which tastes like cheez- its, my fav.  Bacon bits was a nice touch 

I didn't actually get to enjoy the view but the food was decent and our server, Cindy, was great.
author: Linda N.

description: I love the panoramic views of this place from the 39th floor! I loathe elevators ever since I got stuck in one but fortunately these ones move quickly and the doors open just as quickly. They have bar seating and couches with beautiful window views. Last I checked I couldn't make reservations so it's first come first serve. I can't say how the food is here because the night I went they stopped serving food early. This would be a good spot for a drink and desert or appetizer. It's a small tapas type of place. I would come back!
author: Courtney Y.

description: This place is a jewel. San Francisco is lucky to have it! I love that even a non-occasion becomes a special memory when it's spent here. Great spot for people watching, viewing the sun set and catching the city lights. Whether it's a second date, an old friends catch-up, post-brunch drink or a business conversation - The View sets the perfect ambience. Only issue is getting a seat. Get here at 3:55pm and try get in the first elevator going up at 4:00pm on the dot. You might JUST get a seat. 9.5/10, would definitely be back again and again.
author: Gia P.

description: Steve at the View helped us tremendously. He had the best drink recommendations, I love his personnel touch on each cocktail! :)
author: Morgan B.

description:
Beautiful view, great drinks!

This hotel bar is around the corner from where I've stayed during work trips. It served as a great stop for a night cap after dinner out in SF. It has a lounge vibe so it's intimate - lots of couches and separate rooms. It's dark and moody so it could be romantic for those on a getaway in SF. For us, it was a cozy place to hang with coworkers and chat. The cocktails are strong and the wine list captures the fan favorites.

You'll pay a few extra dollars per drink for the view, but it's worth it. Snap some downtown night pics and relax with an adult beverage.

I'd say you're good to go with a group of friends and won't have a hard time finding a seat. Each time I went we had 4-6 people and found spots, but it takes a little hunting. Have someone look for seats while the others grab drinks at the bar.

A few fave drinks include their old fashioned (w/ Bulleit) and the SOMA spritzer, which is a rocks glass of prosecco with fresh blueberries and raspberries (and St. Germaine to give it a boost).
author: Breanna B.

description: I've come to this place a handful of times now and each time it's always been very crowded. Seating room is very limited and standing room is a guarantee you'll get bumped into or toes stepped on. The service is nice enough if you can get their attention amongst a million other people. Not a great place for a first date because you'll lose one another in the sea full of people and not be able to hear a single word said. I've only been here on the weekends but perhaps it's less crowded in the weekdays.
author: Noy R.

description: The view of the city lights was amazing. They were open until 1am on the Sunday we went. We sat at the bar for a little until the seating along the windows opened up. This is the perfect place to have a drink, a good conversation and watch the fog roll into the city.
author: Dale D.

description: Impeccable view that goes perfectly well with a sparkling glass of Rosé. Bougie vibe though so beware.
author: Mariah D.

description: Great spot for a date night or with a large group of friends! Awesome view if it's not a cloudy day/night.  The drinks are STRONG, but tasty.  It gets a bit crowded on Fri & Saturday nights, and tables are hard to come across.  The crowd is a bit older, which is nice. Weekday nights FTW!
author: Kay H.

description:
If you are in San Francisco, this is one of those places you should try to stop in for a drink. 
Hand crafted cocktails and locally inspired small plates of food combined with one of the best possible views of San Francisco at the top of the Marriott Marquis.  
The nighttime view is stunning, with the daytime view giving you views across the bay. 
Be sure to walk all the way around, there are twists and turns leading to more room with a view. 
Expect prices to go along with the view, but some things in life are definitely worth it. 
The people watching here is interesting. Bring from the NYC area I thought I'd seen it all, but San Fran continues to surprise.
author: Ed Z.

description: A must see while visiting the city. A gorgeous view and great drinks. This is typically very packed so you have to walk around before finding a table. Wouldn't recommend bringing a large group unless planning accordingly or calling ahead for a possible area.
author: Kelly M.

description:
There are a few places in SF, where you can get a great ambiance, great people and great view and this place is really great to hang out after work with your buddies or with with your SO. 

I have always had the drinks here and specially the Old Fashioned which is the best i have had in SF.

Enjoy a good evening with your friends, your drinks and The View.
author: Urvish -.

description: Definitely worth the name! This is a great place to check out the city when there is no fog... or perhaps to impress upon yourself exactly how much fog there is! Drinks (delicious) and food (ok) pricey as you're paying for the view but service is extremely quick and pleasant. The one thing... my friend and I split a check and a $52.79 bill came back as $27.00 per credit card.... is it the view surcharge? The penalty for splitting a check? Or someone who just can't do math?
author: Kyoko Y.

description:
Good for drinks and to chill. So many chairs, booths, etc so that's nice for a more relaxed environment. 

Drinks are just whatever. Nothing interesting. No copper cups for our Moscow mules :( but def a good spot to hang out.
author: Sarina V.

description: Firstly, amazing service by Mac and Helen. This place is amazing, a must place to go if you are new in Sf or just visiting or if never been here. I got the skyline punch, it was delicious. I am not a bbq flavor fan, so the chicken lollipop for me was just ok. But over all it was an amazing experience. Definitely will come back.
author: Pritika M.

description: Fancy and lovely place to have a cocktail s with your friends.the food in here is nice server in here is cool too
author: Clancy Y.

description: This is the only place i know at the moment in sf that gives an awesome view of San Francisco. The location is convieniently located near union square, so its hard to miss. The only complaint I have about the place is the fact that the drinks are  really expensive. For example, a vodka shot here costs 12 bucks. Overall, it is a really awesome place and I will come back here again.
author: Michael Bryan B.

description:
I've been here twice now and the view never stops amazing me.  The city is definitely a wonderful place to be.  The View is located inside the Marriot, so when you walk in, just ask for the View and they would be more than happy to guide you to the elevators. 

It's perfect if you're looking to take a date, but it's usually pretty packed, so getting a table is difficult.  The drinks are more on the pricier end compared to the mission, but it's the financial district, so you can't be too surprised.  The drinks themselves are pretty average, nothing too spectacular.  

The lounge has two sides, one that faces the East, and other faces the West. Towards the beginning of Summer, if you look towards the the sunset district, you can see the Karl the fog slowly creep in.
author: Wesley L.

description: Pricey food and drinks and unfortunately when its peak hours you can't even get a nice view of the city. At least there is no cover, but come early. Our group of 6 got lucky with booth seating, but otherwise it would have been a pretty bad time for all of us to be standing around for a couple hours.
author: Kelly G.

description:
You cant beat this free view! Unless there's an event going on here that rents the whole place, you are welcome to just walk in and admire the view , take pics etc, without needing to order anything. 

The window seating is hard to get since its such a popular spot, so try to get here early!

Sf looks so beautiful and clean from up top lol.. Far from all the weird smells. 

Food here is mediocre.
Cant comment on drinks.
Service was pretty attentive.
Mediocre bathrooms.
author: Angela C.

description:
The View, man talk about that view.  It was amazing, no matter where you find a seat, the view is tremendous.  We found a seat on the northwest side and the time was 30 minutes to sunset.  You couldn't ask for a more romantic place and time to take a girl and romance the hell out of her.
We both got a couple of their fancy drinks which were expensive but it was the time and place for an upscale drink.  We both loved the drinks and mine tasted great and you could tell that they were not very stingy on the alcohol.
For food we only got one small plate that we shared and it was the cheesy bread with clover butter and honey.  it was very good and it looked like it was more food then the other plates that other customers were trying.  
Overall the experience was amazing.  I would recommend getting there early to secure a nice seat and the only downside I can remember was the seats themselves were not that comfortable but I have a very bad back so it might be different for someone else.
author: Casey P.

description:
The View's reputation is definitely fitting. Absolutely beautiful view of the city to enjoy a fine cocktail from. Yes the cocktails are pricey, but yes they are worth it- old school cocktails with one of the best views of the city you can ask for.

I enjoyed my gimlet and gin martini. Friendly bartenders and service. Hope to come during night to see the city lights going. Not a ton of seating available but also doesn't get super crowded.
author: Kayla U.

description:
Don't...waste...your...Time. 
Opens at 4pm, a HUGE rush on the elevators, and a bum-rush for a table/seat. BBQ chicken flatbread was inedible, although my partner liked it even after finding a big piece of gristle. With the limited hours and sub-par, over-priced food, I doubt I'll be back.  The views aren't worth it.
author: Roger M.

description: This is a beautiful lounge with 360* views of the city!! To reserve a room is a little pricey but we took a chance and showed with no reservation.  Great memories!!
author: Christina R.

description:
Wonderful views of the city. 

This place gets crowded fast and seating is limited, but it's a great place to talk while on a date or when entertaining clients.
author: Eric E.

description:
It's safe to say I'm a fan of The View when almost a year later I'm still day dreaming of cocktails in this swanky lounge, gazing out at the beautiful night lights of San Fran. I can't wait to pay this classy establishment another visit later on this summer when I'm back in town.

I'm not sure what else to add that hasn't already been said by so many other lovely Yelpers (and co-workers!), but here are a few stellar points I can agree on...

+ Beautiful views! Obviously...
+ Delicious cocktails - the SoMa Spritzer with St. Germain, sparkling wine, and fresh fruit was my fave!
+ Lovely seating options - couches, chairs, bar stools, the works.
+ Friendly and fast service!

If your'e in SF, definitely head to the top floor of the Marriott and check out The View... literally. Whether it's the sun or the stars out, the view of SF is an absolute beauty from here. I suggest ordering some bubbly and taking it all in! Cheers!
author: Jacqueline B.

description: The View is a swanky bar/lounge on the 39th floor (pretty sure thats what I remember) of the Marriott Marquis. My friends an I checkout out The View after we got out of a conference in the hotel and we were right in time for the sunset. Such a cool time to be at The View! We were only there for drinks, but we all enjoyed their specialty cocktails! Check them out!
author: Tom F.

description:
Was here for the weekend and decided to stop by after dinner. There is valet parking at the hotel downstairs from the restaurant however there is also street parking if your lucky. 

Came here spontaneously so I didn't have a reservation but they were able to quickly accommodate us . There is an open bar in here all the way around with a 360 view of San Francisco. They also have a variety of alcohol selections ranging from rums, whiskey to cognac. 

The atmosphere was relaxing. It was a Friday night so even though the bar was packed with people, the soft music In The back ground made the night more enjoyable. 

The most amazing thing about this place is the Panoramic view of the city , it was especially beautiful because we came when the sun was setting. Beautiful place and wonderful staff. Will come again !
author: Vivi T.

description: Being at the View made me realize how ugly SF's nonexistent skyline is lollll I really love this bar though. It's super classy but a chill ambience. It's actually a REALLY small space so it's really hard to find space even around opening time on Thursday and Friday. Their drinks are pretty standard... so nothing notable to comment on. It seems like a super cute date spot and just to chill and chat. Thumbs up!
author: Ashley S.

description:
Love it! 
Came here friday 3-31-17 for my anniversary got there a little late (they open at 4) areived at 420ish 
All the seats by the widows were taken of coarse sat on the bar with my husband & got our drinks bartender was super friendly after couple of minutes we spoted a couple leaving & we scored great seat! Super happy defenely coming back! 
Oh & the cheese breas was amazing!!
author: Thania H.

description:
Yes, yes, and yes! 

This place is located in inside the Marriott Hotel in downtown SF. Take the high rise elevator to the 39th floor. I love it! The bar makes really good cocktails, a little bit on the sweeter side for what I ordered, but it's still good.

I believe the bar opens at 5. If you want to catch the sunset, I would go as early as possible and get good seats since it does get very crowded. There's a nice view in almost area you choose, but there's sitting right next to the window that's almost always taken. 

But it's okay there's a lot of other seating available (tables, couches, chairs, a bench, etc.) so be sure to walk around the entire place. When you exit the elevator, you can either go left or right, it makes a giant circle. 

They also serve food/tapas so order a couple of drinks and food to share, and enjoy. :)
author: Karen P.

description: Great view, expensive cocktails but in the case of the $17 negroni, it was among the best I've every had. Love the absinthe wash in the drink
author: Joshua E.

description: What a breathtaking view!! Definitely head there for sunset there's not much food on the menu so just go with the mindset of having some drinks and taking some great pictures!
author: Arianna M.

description: Cool place for a good drink.  Plenty of drink options for normal SF pricing.  The place is much larger than i anticipated and the view.. the view is on point.  No complaints here.
author: Cory S.

description: I really enjoyed my Friday night at the view. The place is not overpriced like my reviewers say it is, food is delicious and drinks are very interesting. Just had se trouble finding a seat because it was crowded. Oh yeah and did I forget to mention that the view is amazing
author: Yéva M.

description: Nice rooftop bar inside the Marriott hotel with a great View, it's always busy, good drinks and very good food, prices are around $13 for cocktails, pretty good menu
author: Musa A.

description: Everything here was great! Definitely recommend going here. The night time view was stunning and the crowd was great. Nice chill spot.
author: Jonae W.

description: The view is incredible~ the drinks are also very good. Was expecting them to be mediocre being they get the business here because of the great view and art deco vibe but to my surprise they were very well done craft cocktails.
author: SHELLEY M.

description:
The view of San Francisco from The View is gorgeous! You must stop by here at least once in your life to experience such breathtaking scenery. Even though it can get crowded, getting a glimpse outside the windows is worth it.

My boyfriend and I came on July 4th weekend and it my goodness the place was packed! The set up is first-come, first-served seating, so it's basically a free-for-all. Luckily we were able to find seating that was facing the windows so we could still enjoy the lovely view. Towards the end, we were able to snag some seats that were along the window and the experience was unbelievable. We were in awe of how beautiful the city is and how high up we were; it gave me chills! 

Drinks are pretty pricy, but I guess part of it is paying for the atmosphere. We had Karl the fog and City Lights, which were $15 each. Drinks were decent, nothing mind blowing though. 

I would come back to The View, but probably on a weekday. Hopefully it'll be less crowded!
author: Amanda T.

description: Over priced, over packed and best during the day/at sunset. Their drinks are mediocre and there is minimal seating. You're almost guaranteed to be standing on a weekend night! The window adjacent the bar seems to be amazing. The DJ on Friday night was also playing some fun throwback jams to the early 2000s. I feel the music choice is a gamble.
author: Rachel S.

description: Before I came to SF, this was on my list of spots to check out. We made the mistake of getting there pretty late. It was packed no tables, or even spots by the bar available.  The view was pretty nice, wish we had a table by the window!!! Although we did not even get a chance to get a drink here, I did enjoy the views, the vibes of this place. Will deff come back next time in SF, and make sure to come early.
author: AJ M.

description: Slightly pricey but worth every penny. Amazing views, get there early for best seating. Good drinks and food, excellent service once we got seated.
author: Dave M.

description: Best place to get a good drink with an astonishing view. Go there at sunset and watch the city light up. It gets really busy right around that time each night, but it's worth it if you can find a good seat.
author: Mark P.

description: Although they were packed, it's grab a seat when one opens up and the servers will attend to you. I arrived on a weekday night and it was super crowded. I was still waiting on my party to show up , whom showed up quite late, about 30min-1hr after I was seated and I was not rushed out of my table that I occupied which surprised me but definitely appreciated. Food is pricey, but really delicious. Would definitely recommend ordering food even though most come for drinks.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Came here on Monday night (May 9th) for the first time as a party of three. I had heard via Yelp and through word of mouth that "the view from The View is amazing" and that the drinks were good, too. We had our cousin in town from Canada, and had been taking her for views of the City while listening to Views by Drake who happens to be from Toronto like my cousin.

Finding the place was easy. It has a very distinct window shape, so we could spot the Marriott from a few blocks away. We were not able to find a window seat initially, so we sat down at a table near the windows. A server was with us within 2 minutes and brought us menus.
