About 4 minutes later, a different server finished cleaning a window table and offered it to us - and we obliged.

We carried over our menus, browsed the options and chatted, and took pictures of the view and with the view. My cousin left to use the restroom and came back. We still had our menus, and no one had come by to check on us and take our order. We began attempting to make eye contact and raising our hand to flag someone down, and thought we had successfully done so - but we were wrong. Were we invisible? I know the sun was setting and the atmosphere was dim, but we were three ladies - one missing a leg - quite hard to miss. After 15 more minutes had passed, we decided not to wait any longer. My sister-in-law's kids were waiting at home for their mommy so they could go to sleep, and she didn't want to drive when it was too late and dark.

No one seemed to notice that we left. On the elevator trip down, we were briefly talking about how ridiculous the service had been - but at least, the views, they were nice. One of the women riding the elevator with us was a staff member and appalled when she overheard us. She offered for us to come right back up, or to come back the following day, and she would personally ensure that we were served. We would've taken her up on the offer, but like I said - it was late, we had babies to get back home to, and we had a full itinerary planned the following day and could not adjust our schedule.

Oh well.

A bit disappointing, and The View has tried to make it up. They apologized on my Instagram when I posted a photo and brief comment about our experience. I'm sure the place gets very busy, as it is a popular tourist spot, but just a tip: they may not have the most attentive waiters.
author: Shar M.

description:
What a gorgeous date night spot overlooking the city! It's absolutely amazing, that's for sure. They don't call it The View for nothing! The only difficult part is that the place is first come, first serve and it gets crazy packed here! Luckily, we snagged a table although it didn't have much of a view, but still nice. We ordered the Sliders ($16) and Yellowfin Tuna Tartare ($19). The sliders were basic mini burgers that came in three. I totally died for the tuna tartare/poke here though! The seasoning on the fish was so tasty and I'd totally get that again.

This is one fancy spot, so of course it is also pricey. It's definitely worth a visit for the killer view and ambiance though.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Get here RIGHT when it opens.

I got there 30 minutes after it opened and it was packed! This was my first time going to The View and one side had a private event happening, so maybe that is why it was packed so soon/quick.

Other than that, the experience is spectacular! The view, of course, is breathtaking and something locals and tourists should see! 

The service from all employees is great! They made sure we got our order in right away, always refilled our water, and talked with us about any questions we had. 

It is a bit pricy. We got 2 beers and it was about $20. Expect to pay about $15-$20 for either appetizers and/or main meals.

There are not many places in downtown SF that have amazing high rise views for the public to go to and this does not disappoint!
author: Michael T.

description:
As the name implies, it is an amazing view of the bay to the east and the rolling urban hills to the west.

One of the best Old Fashioneds' I've had.
author: Nathan P.

description: This place definitely lives up to the name - the view is gorgeous from the 39th floor. Came here last Saturday night with some friends, and we all had a great time. The place was packed, but there wasn't a cover so no complaints here! Don't count on getting a table/seating near the window - they're always occupied. But there's spaces where you can squeeze next to the window for some photos and an unobstructed view of the city. It's worth a visit, no matter if you're from the area or visiting!
author: Richa G.

description:
Blegh. This place made me feel like a tourist in Las Vegas, which I guess is what I should have expected going to a hotel bar called "The View." I ordered a Manhattan, which was, unfortunately, awful and difficult to drink, even for someone who enjoys straight liquor. Also, expect to pay a premium for your cocktail. I just told myself it was a fee for the great view of the city. Except... there are quite a few places you can sit without getting a view of the city at all. I'd say half the bar has okay views, with seating by the really large, picturesque windows only available to a lucky few. The photos made this place look chic and upscale... in person, it felt stuffy and dingy, with carpeted floor and bland hotel decor throughout. The crowd seemed super touristy (again, I should have excepted that, but I was optimistic!).

I had high hopes (no pun intended) but was disappointed with The View. Would not recommend.
author: Fiona F.

description: Really cool environment on a week night.  This place has an awesome view in and out of the room.
author: Robert H.

description:
The place is self seating, but after waiting for one table we were able to get window side seating. They have a large selection of wine and cocktails, but basic draft beer. I had their Highrise Cosmo and their Skyline Punch which are pricey but are flavorful and strong, wish I could say the same for their food. 
Seems like their menu changes seasonally, when I was there I ordered a pork taco I believe, but the pork was sitting on top of this hard dough which wasn't necessary. I ended up eating the pork by itself. Wish they had salt and pepper shakers, i would've added salt. Please know they offer small plates only, no full entrees. We also had the yellow fin tuna poke which was a much better option. Other than that, it's definitely worth visiting for their view of the whole city, and date night atmosphere.
author: Roxana C.

description: Went while my trip in San Fran. Great atmosphere and amazing view but gets super busy during the night. Had to wait constantly for my waitress to take me and my friend's order.
author: David Q.

description: Great view and awesome service - food selection is also nice. definitely recommend this for couples or family with kids
author: Tariq M.

description:
Came here for a company happy hour around 4:30pm. For a Wednesday evening, it wasn't super crowded but toward the end, it was pretty bumping. The wait staff is accommodating, and honestly super fast, considering how large our group was, and how much we ordered. 

I ordered the Pear 39 (maybe 36, I'm no expert) drink and it was pretty tasty, but stronggg. The cheese plate and chips were PRIME. It's pretty pricey (expect ~$16 drinks) but considering it has AMAZING views of the city, it's a spot you have to check out at least once -- especially on those special occasions or if you're visiting the city!
author: Jordan B.

description: Best bar view!  Come up here for sunset-- not easy to get a seat though. Prices are ok, a little high but not terrible.
author: Joe E.

description:
WOW this place is poppin! My friend and I got here 10 minutes after opening on a Saturday afternoon and it was already almost full. The service here isn't the best but what do you expect from a crowded lounge. 

I had a Sunrise Splash mocktail and my friend got the Ginger Elixir. Both were great! The chairs are comfy and the view is amazing. I just wish the venue were larger! Definitely worth checking this place out at least once. You won't regret it!
author: Catherine S.

description: stunning views of the city and cool atmosphere. nice place to meet up with friends or relax by yourself.
author: Joey S.

description: Great place to relax, grab a drink and look at the SF views. They had really good drinks, comfortable seating and a yummy charcuterie plate. I would love to come here during an earlier time to see the view as well.
author: jeannette h.

description: Such a beautiful view! Very crowded but fun. The drinks are delicious. The appetizers were average but I came for the drinks and the Incredible view of SF!
author: Beth E.

description:
The View has been on my Bookmark/Bucketlist since forever. Welp, it's finally time to cross this sucker off with some extra added X's and O's it so deserves.

Located on the 39th floor of The Marriott Hotel in SOMA, The View definitely speaks for itself. The 'view' that you get to experience, from just about any seat in this lounge/bar, is breathtaking and makes you pause a little bit to realize that this is beautiful SF you're staring into while it so innocently stares right back at you at the same time. You don't realize how time suddenly stops, your heart rate steadily slows, and you're taking cleansing breaths from between your lips as you're engulfed by it all. It's exasperating. Real talk. 

It's even better when the weather is in the mid 60's where you can romp around the city in a tank, skirt and booties in February. Cali, you're just so freaking awesome ;]

With such wonderful weather conditions, we were able to catch the clear picturesque views of the bay, Bay Bridge and the overall city landscape and life. We stayed late enough to watch the moon rise over the Bay bridge too. So romantic. 

Once you snap back to reality... And find a spot, they've got a full bar with craft cocktails and craft beers. Bar bites (we had the chicken lollipops and hummus) and other menu options that we didn't get to delve into this time but will definitely next. 

Happy I finally made it in here before I died. However, stepping out of the elevator doors into The View totally makes you feel like you've just died and gone to Heaven anyway. Can't wait to go back to die all over again.
author: Cat V.

description:
The view is absolutely stunning! I love how it has seating all around the circumference so everywhere you sit, you're able to see the view. This place gets pretty packed around the evening, probably when everyone is off work. I wish I've checked out this place earlier! It's such a sight to see, especially during sunset. Most tables near the windows are taken but if you're lucky and snag a table, it's so breathtaking to look out the window and admire what a beautiful city San Francisco is. 

My friends and I shared a bottle of white wine. I don't remember which one. But the servers were nice and kept checking up on us. 

Definitely coming back here.
author: Annie H.

description: Go to The View for THE VIEW- amazing views of the city. Jessica was our waitress and she was awesome, the best. All of the waiters/waitresses seemed very happy to be working here. Great atmosphere. Drinks are expensive but they are so good. Must visit if you are in San Francisco. Get there early for the best seats with the good views.
author: Nessa S.

description:
It's no holds barred in this piece. Between the bridge and tunnel and the out of towers this place can be a hot mess. 

For locals bring your BS filter with you. Especially if you try window seating.  The vultures be thirsty at this spot.  

For out of towners...its casual up here.  Sit opposite side of the sun so you don't melt. 

Drinks are ok. Nothing to scream home about.  Tip well
author: Spanky M.

description:
Came here to start my Saturday night out.

Pros: no cover, lots of seating, and of plenty of access to the beautiful view! Popular but not overwhelmingly packed.

Cons: overpriced drinks ($14 for a small screwdriver) and music is more in the background.

Would recommend for one drink and appetizer or dessert after a dinner out. Great date spot!
author: Roya B.

description: Although we couldn't get a seat right by the view itself, we had a chance to walk around and get a few glimpses. I ordered an Old Fashioned which was good, but it's all about the view of course. Highly recommend grabbing a drink here if you're visiting.
author: Nick D.

description:
Such a cute, cozy and romantic spot to take your date for a drink or have a GNO.  They don't call this spot "The View" for no reason; you definitely get an amazing view from up here.  The only downside is that finding an open spot might be a little difficult but if you wait around for a little, something is bound to open up.  
Price-wise, drinks are pretty standard I think.  We ordered moscow mules and old fashions and they were all $16 each.  They also have small bites you can order but those definitely seemed a bit pricey.  We saw a bunch of people eating chips and dip but for $7... it didn't seem worth it. 

Regardless, I wish LA had a nice place like this.  The Standard and Perch has nothin' on The View!
author: Regina O.

description:
I've seen friends going to The View and didn't have a chance until last Sunday. My friends were visiting from San Diego and were looking for a place to chill (and maybe get some booze and food). I searched on Yelp and immediately recognize the window! We decided to check it out and The View didn't disappoint us!

We were so lucky! We got here around 5:30pm and a friendly old couple let us have their seats and they moved to 2-people seating. Our view was right by the window where we can watch the sunset. The color and the view were phenomenal and breathtaking... It was so amazing and I couldn't even find a word to describe it but felt we were so lucky even it was raining.

We also ordered wine and snacks. For food, we got Smoked Beef Carpaccio, Sliders, Korean BBQ chicken drumsticks and a trio dessert (which I forgot what it was called). Since it was my friend's birthday, she got a birthday on the house! We had such a great time chatting and enjoyed the view... good vibes! It was so romantic and I would love to come back next time. Our server was very friendly and professional.

2016029
author: Leslie C.

description:
At 9pm on Friday had dinner at 5pm shopped my tail off and now its time for a drink and appetizers. 

First of all the views are fantastic! City lights from the 39th floor paints romance in the City. 

I feel like im in a nightclub but everyone is sitting, enjoying conversations and admiring the views.

I, on the other hand am happy with my Asian BBQ Lollipop Wings and 5-spice braised beef short ribs. Ok I like the fact I have upbeat music and can hear our conversations. 

The wings are meaty and have about half dozen on the plate. Juicy enough to lick your lips and suck your fingers dry. Yes a bit of spice and topped with fresh green onions. Thats Asian goodness. 

The short ribs were braised to perfection. So moist and still together but comes apart with every bite. You can have false teeth and enjoy these. They are topped with crispy noodles and cilantro. Watchout for the chili peppers. Chef David Hollands must have an Asian specialty cuz its good!
author: Michelle P.

description:
Great view?  Check. Good drinks?  Check. Good bar snacks and small bites?  Check. 

Do yourself a favor and check it out.
author: Steve K.

description: The view is not just the name, it is everything! Great wine list, plenty of space. A unique & gorgeous place to visit and have cocktails. Every angle you look you can see for miles. Lots of seating options and quick service. Desserts were good too!
author: Rae F.

description:
If I was just going to rate the absolutely breathtaking view of "The View", it would be a unanimous 5-star rating. Hell, I'd go the extra step and give it 10 stars if Yelp allowed it. But I have to be downright honest with each and every one of my reviews. Especially when factoring in the key components; service, quality, and experience.

Located on the 39th floor of the Marriott Marquis Hotel in Downtown San Francisco, this has got to be one of the finest picturesque views you will find in the city. Having been born and raised here most of my life, the only thing equally amazing would be Twin Peaks and Coit Tower. With that said and done, "The View" is an enclosed lounge/appetizer bar that is only open for adults (sorry kids). And they do have limited hours only being open from 4pm-1am.

I came here with my lady and our two friends after doing some shopping at Westfield San Francisco Centre. Fortunately, this place is in heart of everything; shopping, fine dining, Union Square, and plenty of public transportation. Since this review is specifically on "The View" and not the "Marriott Marquis", I won't go into any logistics on the hotel itself. 

One thing to keep in mind is that "The View" gets crowded.. very quickly! We arrived around 4:15pm and almost every table near the window was taken. Luckily there was a small group that left when we were trying to find a decent window seat so we snatched that up very quickly. The service here offers a waiter/waitress service as well as a bar. They carry a wide variety of beer, wine, cocktails, and well drinks. And remember, this is not a full restaurant so if you're hungry, the extent of what they serve here are nuts, cheese platters, salads, and desserts.

Considering this is in San Francisco, expect to pay a very high price for getting this million-dollar view. I ordered a total of 3 bottles of "Guinness" beer and at $8.00/each, they don't come cheap! My lady had 2 glasses of red Merlot wine priced at $14.00/each. And finally, our friends ordered San Francisco's own "Anchor Steam" beer also priced at $8.00. Since we wanted a little something to nibble on, we decided on placing a couple orders of their "Housemade Beer Nuts" priced at $5.00. These were absolutely delicious while packing a caramelized flavor as well as a sweet and spicy kick to it.

Going back to the overall experience of "The View", it is a truly amazing experience all in itself and its something that I would highly recommend. It does get very crowded here so if you do happen to come later, the odds of guaranteed seating are literally slim to none. But if you do get a lucky seat, bring your camera or smartphone and take some awesome shots of the buildings. You will be able to see all the skyscrapers, the Bay Bridge, and even the Golden Gate Bridge. It is definitely worth the experience!
author: Donovan H.

description: What a spectacular place with breathtaking views! We sat at a perfect spot to see the sunset. Wine selections are premium. It gets crowded even on a Sunday night and no reservations here. First come first serve basis. We literally had to stand by a table waiting for a couple to leave. The best view!!!!
author: Kristi N.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the view here is absolutely incredible.  The service, however, is SLOW {beyond slow}.  And, due to the crowds awaiting their "view" table they hover and stare you down as you try to enjoy your food/drink.  I felt rushed, which is a funny thing to feel considering how slow the service was.  

Here's what I would do next time -

1. Be outside their door when they open and grab the first window table/seat you can or
2. You can actually reserve a table {6+ people} fyi
3. Make yourself known to your server and don't let him/her forget and/or ignore you
author: Samantha T.

description:
How does this place not have more reviews?

I am a sucker for a spectacular view and my friend and I dedicated a whole day to hitting up some of the best spots to catch a glimpse of the city from all angles. While this is not a comprehensive list some of our faves include a rooftop brunch at El Techo de Lolinda, the Lyon Steps, Alta Plaza Park in Pac heights, Heron Tower at the De young Museum, and finishing up at the View Lounge in the Marriott. 

When you walk into the lobby take a quick right, grab the elevator, and head straight up to floor 39. You'll have to fight off the other view hungry tourists for a window side table but good things come to those who wait. I mean that window! It's just beautiful. Staff is friendly, our waiter Steve was helpful and gladly took our picture. The drinks are $14-18 and they have some apps/desserts on their menu as well. I got a glass of bubbly because you never need a specific reason to celebrate life. Good views, good friends, and a little bubbly really make for a perfect night.

(You can also consider heading to El Faralito to stuff your face on cheap Mexican food in the Mission afterward like we did...totally worth it.)
author: Miriam M.

description:
If you've already been to the Signature Room in Chicago or Bar Sixty Five in New York, then you won't be too impressed with The View in SF. 

On a side note, it's SO silly that The View charges $300 to reserve a seat by their windows(uh, nope, not gonna happen), don't fall for $300 reservation charge -that's such a scam on their part! 

In comparison, the Signature Room or Bar Sixty Five also takes reservations, but their reservations are FREE, and their city views and facility are astronomically better.

We arrived around 6PM and the The View was already packed with people. We were able to get a spot at the bar and had some drinks.  After about 15 or 20 minutes we got up to walk around the place and we were able to snag a prime spot by the window in the other room.

This place has potential, but is too small and cozy.  Would be a much better experience if they had designed it to be more spacious, especially given the popularity of the whole thing. Too small scale of an experience.
author: Siobhan W.

description: Fabulous view, great ambience and drinks and super service...what more could you ask for?  oh yes, a seat by the windows.  Get there early if you want to snag a window seat!
author: Frank S.

description: Very cool spot. I'm really glad my friend took me up here to grab some drinks. The view is amazing as well as the atmosphere. We only had beer but that was all chill and good. We also go the charcuterie plate which was excellent as well. This is definitely the spot to come chill and catch up with some friends or take a girl on a nice date to see the view of the bay. Cheers!
author: Danny L.

description:
18 years ago we ended our first date with cocktails at The View...last night we returned and the decor reminded us of that first date aka it was still reminiscent of 1999! Amazing view but weird , mismatched dated decor

Weird crowd too - long gone are the days when everyone dressed up. In fact the first person who walked past us seemed to have forgotten half her dress period as she had wore a shirt and jacket - and underwear and suspenders - thought it was a weird city thing but then noticed all the appealed looks she was getting!! So dress code is casual - one or two dressed up, some forgot clothes, others arrived in backpacks and Birkenstocks fresh from sightseeing !!

Amazing view of city and it was pretty quick to secure a seat with a great view!  Bs prepared for random people to join you in order that they too get good seats - or tourists to circle your table to take city pics

Service was okay - fast but we just got drinks and we never asked if we wanted a refill ! Took a while to flag someone down to pay.

Amazing view , good people watching , slow service , weird crowd !!
author: Sam P.

description: The view lounge has an amazing view! The drinks were good the small bites were good. It was extremely packed so you are not guaranteed a seat with a view.
author: Britney D.

description:
I'm a sucker for rooftop bars with breathless city views, which SF doesn't have very much of (who knows why). But The View surpassed my expectations. Everything about the venue was great, in terms of ambiance, interior design aka the window, drinks, and location. The downsides are that cocktails can go up to $16 and can get crazy crowded/busy at the golden hour. I'd suggest beating the crowd before 4:30pm during the weeknights to score a great seat. There are also tables along the left side of the lounge (turn left upon entering) that also have great views of the city! Ordered the Highrise Cosmo and would come back again for another sip of it. Strong, fruity, but not too sweet.

I would give this place 5 stars, but the service was a bit too slow for my preference.
author: Christina L.

description: This place is great for the view. We arrived pretty late so we only enjoyed the lounge for over an hour. It was a bit difficult for us to order our drink at the bar because it was surrounded by people. If you get a seat though it may be easier since there are waitresses walking around to take your order. The view was definitely amazing.
author: Lyset C.

description:
The View is an okay place to take a few pictures, have one very expensive drink, then leave and eat at a real restaurant. 

Pros: the drinks are delicious, the view of the city is kind of nice.
Cons: Expensive, no happy hour ($8 beers, $15-20 cocktails), crowded, all self seating so you have to stalk people while they eat to take their table when finished.
author: Chris B.

description:
TL;DR
-Great view and atmosphere.
-Pretty strong drinks, but a bit on the pricey side.

One of the coolest bars you can go to in SF if you're looking for a view.  Hidden at the top of the Marriott Marquis Hotel, this bar is on the 39th floor and can offer decent city views of SF from all 4 sides.  The lounge itself is fairly large, but it can fill up and get busy.  Seating here is first come first serve so you'll have to press your luck at getting a seat near the window.  

Another thing to note here is that if you get a seat near the window and near the walkways, you'll have a lot of people taking photos while standing right by your table.  This really ruins the intimacy of having a table for your party, especially if you're on a date.  All in all though, this place is a cool lounge without much attitude, and a great bar to just relax.
author: Bryson L.

description:
With a breathtaking view of the city, The View offers a wonderful place to grab drinks with friends/date. It's located downtown so it's a great place to start/include in your night as you explore what SF nightlife has to offer. 

Came here on Friday around 8pm and the place was crowded. We were lucky enough to snag a table right by the window and I am so glad we did. The view of the lit up city below us made the experience feel intimate, even though it was very loud at the lounge. We ordered a cucumber gimlet and the cosmo ($15). My cosmo was slightly weaker than I had expected, but I didn't mind it too much since I was too busy enjoying the company, view, and overall ambiance of The View.

In terms of service, it was good. Our order was taken within 10 minutes of being seated and our waitress checked in on us several times during our time there.
author: Katie C.

description:
The arching window panes make the view overlooking San Francisco even more extraordinary than a regular floor-to-ceiling window. This place makes my favorite time of day, dusk, absolutely stunning. The ambiance is as you would expect from a rooftop bar. The lounge is open seating, so snag yourself your perfect spot. The server is quick to welcome you and perfectly attentive throughout your stay.

Their specialty cocktails are about $15. I subbed the gin in my Van Ness Press for tequila and it was very tasty. Perfect amount of everything and not too sweet which is usually the dealbreaker for me.

Park at 5th & Mission for ~$1-3.50 per hour depending on the time/day. Or you can valet your car at the hotel for the typical downtown valet rates.
author: Shirlene L.

description:
The View was one of the nicest bars that I visited in San Francisco. It sits atop the Marriott hotel and has a wonderful sight-line of the city. There are windows all around the bar, so you can walk the perimeter for different angles of the city. There isn't a dress code but most of the patrons are wearing business casual or business attire. It's a wonderful venue regardless of the occasion.

The beer selection is limited; there are only about half a dozen bottled beers options. The drinks menu certainly focus on cocktails and wines. Our bartender made us a great gimlet. Her service was quick and friendly.
author: Joseph T.

description:
The View: fancy, extravagant, elegant, frilly, lavish, and special. 

Looking for cocktails with fantastic views of the gorgeous city? The View has all that and the ambiance that will surely impress! 

Located at the 39th floor of The Marriott hotel, The View is the perfect place to hang out whether you're chilling with your friends, getting drinks with your coworkers, or on a hot date. Service is top notch, and drinks come out quickly. Their cocktails are $13, which made my wallet cringe, but hey, you're also paying for that view outside the window! Pro tip: get the Manhattan - it's spirit heavy so it's worth your money! ;)

I'd recommend getting there right at 4pm when they open to snag a window seat. It's first come first serve, so once all good seats are taken, you're SOL. I noticed the people who didn't get a window seat watch out for window seats like vultures! Cheers!
author: Christine S.

description: The view is a great place to have a few drinks and relax. However get there early if you want to find somewhere to sit. It's first come first serve, must be 21 years and older. I had a great time there and will definitely come back again. This location is fantastic and the view is spectacular!!!
author: Anonymous A.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped here for drinks while visiting San Francisco. The view is spectacular. The drinks were a little on the pricey side but you are paying for the View and the atmosphere as well. Definitely will come again when I visit San Francisco.
author: Maly C.

description: Loved it. The view was AMAZING. And their signature cocktail was delicious. Definitely more of an upscale relaxing vibe. If you're in town and you want great drinks with a breathtaking view of the entire city? Come here. Seriously.
author: Bianca T.

description:
Perfect place to bring a friend from foreign country. 
Food is delish. Ambiance is over the top. Service is on point. I will definitely come back.
author: Chacha C.

description: Ok so hotel bar. Cliche and lame, right? I never really was into coming here, but my friend convinced me that it would be a good place for my farewell happy hour from work. It can get pretty crowded, admittedly. However, my crew was able to snag a spot in the corner of one the alcoves just past the entrance with an amazing view of the city looking out over YBC and Potrero Hill in the background. Definitely the ritzy ambience I was looking for. Pretty fast service that kept the bottles flowing.
author: Ash T.

description:
My girlfriend booked us at the Marriott Marquis SFO for my birthday weekend.
After seeing "Rent" at the GG Theater, we came back and made our first visit to The View Lounge on the 39th floor.

Wow ... very impressive. Too late for anything from the kitchen, but we had the fries and a delicious dip with our beverages.

Excellent service from Dave. Incredible view. A must-visit. We want to go back again in the future.
author: Dave A.

description:
What a view! It is the perfect place for an evening out with your partner. The cocktails are amazing and the view is breathtaking. Most window seats are hard to get, so I recommend getting here early if you want to enjoy the sunset. 

The place has a loungeish vibe and is quite comfortable. Can't wait tot head back for a drink or two sometime soon.
author: Shriya P.

description:
The View, 5 stars.
The Drinks, 3 stars.
The Food, 3 stars.

If you're a tourist in town-- make this view a visit, or if you're a local-- come for happy hour, as the seating on weekend fills up fast!
author: Taylor O.

description:
It's true. You pay for the view.

Located inside the Marriott hotel, I had no idea that this cool little spot even existed. You walk through their lobby, and into an elevator, press a button to the specified area and voila - spectacular sights of the city from different sides of the building.

As the evening progresses and the sun begins to set, the lighting becomes mood like so that you can really take in what's in front of you. The trick is to arrive early to snag a seat as they don't take reservations and all spots are on a first-come basis. Being a Wednesday night, we had no problem snagging a seat at the bar, but the rest of the tables next to the windows were prime real estate and people were holding on to those with dear life.

The cocktails are more on the pricey side, but they have a great selection to choose from. We ended up trying some of their higher-end tequilas (which I learned you're supposed to sip and not shoot... oops) and found myself enjoying the liquid presented to me. I know little to nothing about tequila, but it was smooth. Have a question, just ask - the bartenders were super knowledgable and friendly.

It's free to go up and gawk, but it can get crowded really quickly.
author: Ryan C.

description:
"No regrets." Those were the thoughts that resonated with me, that evening.
I had stepped in here for the first time, with my friend visiting from Chicago.This area is located at the top of Marriott Hotel. Floor 39. 

Once you step out of the lift, you're greeted with a panoramic view on both sides. Captivating views, full of atmosphere, combined with a beautifully structured interior.
author: James P.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco! This is a MUST go to if your in town. Delicious drinks and food is good, the view is incredible!
author: Mayra I.

description:
This is one of the most incredible bars I have ever been to. You get off the elevator at the top floor of the Marriott and enter a bar with panoramic views of a great city. The atmosphere is lively and I thought my drink, their version of a Moscow mule was tasty. 

Why not 5 stars?  Because the incredible environment of this bar was dampened by a waitress with the worst attitude I've seen in a long time. We sat down with three guests and each ordered a drink. We asked if she could do separate checks and were given our first glare. She didn't even try to hide her distaste. From then on she essentially ignored us and when we would get her attention she would be downright nasty. 

As we were about to leave, two other friends came over to our table as we asked for the check. They were just meeting us before heading out to dinner. She added 20% tip to our drinks because "6 people were seated at our table". 3 of the 6 didn't order a drink and 2 had shown up for under 10 min. Unbelievable. 

It's a shame that this one waitress ruined what would have been a great experience.
author: Greg R.

description: Great place to grab a cocktail and a little bite to eat. Since the bar is open to the public the place becomes very busy quick so if you want a good spot try and go early. Service is great. Friendly staff. Great place to watch the sunset. Make sure you check out both side of the bar!
author: Brandy P.

description: I had this place bookmarked and was happy I had a chance to check it out as we were staying at the Marriott. Be forewarned that drinks are expensive and it does get crowded. There are more seats available on either side of the main bar area. Luckily, we were able to snag some. The best thing about this place is the view of course.
author: Helen H.

description: Beautiful city views, good selection on food/drinks, and plenty of places to sit. Went on a Friday night around 10 and thought we walked into a club. Very loud music and was planning to leave but decided to try the other side which was much more intimate and quiet. Ended up staying a couple of hours. Would go back just for the view.
author: Christina S.

description: What a great find! At the top of the Marriott Marquis, we went to see the sunset and were not disappointed. The drinks are very reasonable, especially compared to other San Francisco hotel lounges and the beer nuts and lollipop wings were also good. Jess was a great server.
author: John D.

description: Lovely view, as the name implies. Usually very, very crowded, unless you get there early. The staff is pretty friendly and ordering is fast. I go here for the ambiance. It may be hard to get pictures without capturing a bunch of other folks with their smartphones up trying to capture themselves in front of the window so it's all about timing! The dessert is pretty good. A bit touristy but definitely one of the better lounges in SF. I recommend!
author: Chris L.

description: Excelent view and service. If you are going make sure you check for the fog since it could ruin your view. The place is classy and you dont need reservation. If you are planning to have dinner they have also small plates and options.
author: Manny M.

description:
We went to The View after dinner to lounge... this place is amazing! The place very nice, clean, comfortable and it fits the name... The views of the city lights is beautiful.  The only downfall is how busy it gets.  We were extremely lucky to get a place to sit, but there were many people who ended up standing or leaving since there was no sitting available. The service is a bit slow, but professional... I think this is to be expected being that there is only one bar and so many people.  My husband and my cousin both had drinks and they both mentioned drinks were good.  The food looked amazing although we did not get to try it.  

Definitely a place to visit again.  Next time I will ensure to try the food and drinks.
author: Jenniffer C.

description:
Ugh The View at The View...is to die for. This is seriously one of the most beautiful views/window areas at a bar I've ever seen. I love the art deco vibe of the window design. This place gets crowded on weekends with a ritzy crowd but it's fun.

It's not cheap but honestly, its less than what I expected walking in. I had a Van Ness Punch and it was pretty weak, which is sad...I like the names of the drinks here. 

A little more liquor in my drink would make that AMAZING view and decor easier to wash down!
author: Ninette C.

description: What a place and what an amazing view! Service and food was good. Usually crazy busy but once you visit you will understand why! Will be visiting again!
author: Jessica G.

description: I went to the view on 4th of July during my stay in Marriot Marquis the have an amazing view of the city but during that day the service wasn't the best our server was distracted we constantly had to call him to order or ask him for anything that we wanted also the food was a little bit salty it was disappointed
author: Astrid V.

description:
You pay for The View. 

You seriously do. My husband and I were in The City and wanted to enjoy some time together. We dropped off our daughter at Grandma's house and I was excited to go to this place. I knew it was just a drink and appetizers place and that is what we were going for. 

We arrived around 5pm and were able to catch a lovely table near the window with an amazing view of San Francisco. It's a typical lounge just with an incredible panoramic view. Our drinks were good and I was surprised that our food was so delicious. We go the Crudo three ways and the Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese. It was incredible! My husband and I devoured it and even thought about ordering more. Our cocktails were good but very light.  We were able to watch the sunset over the rolling hills which made our day. 

We needed to watch that sunset because at $115 for 3 cocktails, 2 local craft beers and two small plates we needed to leave with at least our hearts satisfied. 

Some helpful tips: 

-Parking is $30. That's the norm in San Francisco but hey, it's in a hotel and valet so it's a given. 

-Eat a full meal prior to arriving. 

-Great for nice date.
author: Melissa M.

description: The drinks, delicious. The food, yummy. The view, INCREDIBLE! This is a must see if you're in the Bay Area. You have to get there early if you want a good seat but when you get there you will not want to leave.
author: Rita A.

description: We are use to the nightlife originally being from Las Vegas. We went to Napa for a couple of days and our last night in town we stopped at the View. Nice place great drinks and unique views of the bay. Wish was open later then 1a. At least Friday and Saturday For us 1a is when the party is barley starting.
author: Jess H.

description: The view is beautiful and the service was very good. The pricing, however, is ridiculous, especially for bland food and such limited items. While the poke tuna w/guac was pretty and fresh, there wasn't any flavor, it at least needed some sodium. We couldn't taste any cheese on the so-called "cheesy bread" either. I enjoyed the manhattan drink and they have a decent pour on wine. I'd return for the view.
author: Natasha K.

description: Amazing spot for cocktails. The drinks and music was great! Also, this place has a beautiful view of the city. Nice, intimate spot.
author: Shenna J.

description: On our last night in the hotel, my sister and I decided to explore the view. We got there at around 5 which apparently was good since it's first come first serve and holy cow did it get busy. We ordered two desserts, creme brulee and flourless chocolate cake. Both were superb and savory. The view itself was breathtaking. Wish we could have stayed longer until it was fully dark but it got too busy and loud for our taste. Our waitress Jessica was so sweet and accommodating. I had called earlier in the day and she went out of her way and got me a bag of ice for my knee. She made the experience all the better.
author: Sophia H.

description: The view truly is amazing. We went for drinks and dessert. The layout was great and they had different types of seating. We went later at night and it seemed to be turning into a club/bar atmosphere. I'm sure if you want a quieter atmosphere sunset is probably great. Overall I'd go again.
author: David H.

description: BEAUTIFUL view of the city at sunset. Seating is limited, first come first serve. Best view I've seen of SF.
author: Lasheil J.

description: Such a cool experience.  To be able to enjoy a great drink with an amazing view of the city of San Francisco is something you cannot beat.  They have seating right by the Windows, but those get taken pretty quickly.  Definitely a really unique place to check out whether you live here or are just visiting.
author: Max W.

description:
5 Stars for a view that punches you right in the gut and makes you want to proclaim your undying love for the stranger next to you at the bar. It's that flippin' romantic. 

I ended up at The View (atop the downtown Marriott) on two occasions on my last visit to SF because what's better than a bar with a view of the whole city, no cover charge, and a surprising amount of open seating? NOTHING. That's what.

The moment you walk out of the elevators you'll be struck by the floor to ceiling windows looking out onto the city with views of the water in the distance. Be quick to scout out any available window-side seating, but don't worry if you don't see any right away, since the seating wraps around the building with plenty of options for small or larger groups (up to 8, otherwise you'll have to split up). And groups are great, but this is the type of bar you should really do with a special someone. The lighting is dim, drinks are stiff, and music is soft. You will 100% get laid after this. That's right, if you are walking in with a friend and want to keep it platonic, turn around and take the elevator back down. This ish is romantic a f and you'll end up at third base before you know it. You've been warned.

Moving on, I ordered a gin and tonic (which turned into three gin and tonics) and talked the night away with a good friend. Wait... Didn't you say you shouldn't go with a friend... Anyway, the service was attentive without being annoying and our server didn't bat an eye when we ran over to a window-side table that opened up half way through our drink/talk sesh. 

I was so struck by this place that the next night I told a larger group of friends and we headed back for a nightcap. The crowd was less touristy than I expected (only one fanny pack spotted. And he was at our table), but this time we found a few larger booths and people ordered from the bar. This time I noticed some other areas that don't have a great view, but are super relaxed and better for groups of 5 or more. Once again, a great night was had and this was one of the more memorable bars that night. Mostly because it was early in the night before we'd been to too many bars... But that's neither here nor there.

To recap: it's an uber scenic lounge that's great for a romantic rendezvous, small group outing, or solo emo drink at the bar. The night time views of San Francisco are crazy|sexy|cool and so is the vibe.
author: Andi P.

description: View is really good, we sat next the window, u have to look around and find the best seat :) the food is good as well, love the bubbling wine
author: Ally G.

description: Celebrated my friends birthday here! Great spot for small get together and boy did we luck out on getting a table! View is of course amazing, music was chill and low key and drinks were good but expensive (expected). We had our classic fireball shots but they were $10/shot! Food was not bad either. Overall experience was great and would definitely go back for a low key night out. It does get pretty crowded and saw a few people walking side to side so im sure some folks come to get pretty turnt up at this place! Keep it classy folks! Not Trashy!
author: Imran M.

description: So the view is worth it. Get to the elevators at 3:30 for your choice of seats. Then wait out the evening with cocktails and food. The changing light is spectacular. Not kidding about the timing. We arrived at 4:28 and took the last two seats in the house. We stalked a table to be able to move to the window. You are paying for the view but the drinks are not outrageously priced... $14-$20 for cocktails. Similar for wine. No draft beer, $9 bottles of craft. Did not try the food.
author: Kate C.

description: Spectacular 360 view of the SF skyline and what do ya know - drinks aren't bad either. One of my favorite places in the city.
author: Harsh P.

description: Best lounge in San Francisco! Celebrated my birthday and it was priceless. The view and environment was amazing! Can't wait to go back again!
author: Debbie M.

description: This was so amazing to me. I've always lived in the bay area, but since i've been 21+ still hadn't gone here or heard about it. It's so beautiful and you feel like a part of the skyline lol. It has a very classy vibe and drinks are expensive so if you're not rolling in it like me its best to go here to start your night with a drink and take in the view while you can remember it and you're still acting classy lol. ;) I went when it was already dark but I hope to go back for golden hour some time!
author: Stacey K.

description:
There is no question, this place is amazing.

The views distract you so much you don't even care about what your drinking, eating or its price.

Absolute must for anyone visiting San Francisco and has never been.  

You feel as if your in central Manhattan
author: Joseph L.

description: Phenomenal view. Can't really get a great picture, but that allows you to stand back and just appreciate what's in front of you. Pretty much packed from open to close, however there's lots of table turnover so you can usually find a seat in 10-15 minutes. Food and drink were good, but nothing special in my opinion.
author: Michelle V.

description:
The View got some nice views! 

Sure, they have some mediocre overpriced drinks. However, I don't mind paying that price for the view and the ambiance! 

And now just imagine yourself sipping on a drink while staring into the distance of the beautiful sunset or even the night view. 

If you are planning to come, I would avoid the obvious busy days because it really is a challenge to grab seats near the windows! I also would not recommend coming in with a big group. 

Additionally, if you are coming in with a date, don't order food. I witnessed an awkward first date for this couple at the table next to ours. The food took awhile to come out, and it looked like they couldn't wait to leave the date hahaha. It was painful to witness. So stick to drinks, at least you could chug it and leave.
author: Solongo B.

description:
So, I'm about to add the 1,000th review for The View. Hooray!

This lovely restaurant/bar absolutely lives up to its name. Architecturally, the interior is stunning. This bar is sexy, hip, and full of the best panoramic views of the city. Yes, the seating is limited, but just plan to arrive early with your friends and stake out your territory when something becomes available. Patience, my friends.

My three girlfriends and I sat at the bar, and each of us loved our well made, strong drinks. I love a bartender that knows what they're doing. It was honestly the perfect place for some late night laughs and conversation against the sparkling city lights. While its set inside a hotel, it is absolutely worth the journey (we weren't even staying in the hotel). You won't regret your choice to come and enjoy a wonderful evening in this modern bar- and yes, those photos are not lying. It is as beautiful as it looks. I can't wait to return on future trips to San Francisco.
author: Lauren K.

description: This place gives you an amazing view of the city! If you are from out of town, and you wanna get a beautiful panoramic view of SF, this place is a must. The only thing I didn't like was that it's very small, not enough seating and service was very slow. 4 stars because of the view & price on alcohol wasn't too expensive. Must see!
author: Pablo P.

description: Went there on a Saturday night, extremely packed but oddly got a window seating very quickly. Food was fine, the only reason to really go is for that gorgeous view and yummy drinks.
author: Maryam A.

description: This place is great!  The food is better than it has to be for such great views too.  We always take out of town guests here - a wonderful spot to show visitors! (and even for locals). It is always busy though -and you will have to wait for a table with a view (but you can always get a drink and stand at the bar).
author: Sarah Louise H.

description:
39th floor here we come! The beauty and experiences of some things can never be seen through videos or pictures. Photos just don't do justice all the time. The View is definitely one of those places. Come early or on a weird day (like a Monday/Tuesday NOT the weekend when it will be at its peak) because parking can be difficult and once you've done that, then you have to face the difficult seating because this place gets PACKED. but beautiful views, so totally understandable.

You walk in, seat yourself, and a server comes to hand you menus and takes your order. Everyone here is so nice, from service to guests, the vibe of everyone being so happy to see a beautiful sunset made everything even better. There are two sides to the view. One side faces the sunset, however the other side has a larger window with views of more buildings and skyline. There wasn't seating at either big main windows, but we got to score a window seat at one of the windows to the side which ended up working out because it was quieter and had views of the sunset. Ordered an old fashioned, skyline punch, and framani charcuterie tasting which was salami, ham, and prosciutto with bread. The prices of drinks and small plates are a little pricy, but you're 100% paying for ambience here and these views are worth it.
author: Maleah M.

description: the roof top bar is great but can be crowded the view is really nice drink was stone but pricey nice place to relax
author: RYan H.

description:
How fancy... This is atop the Marriott in downtown San Francisco. "The View" is an understatement. It's gorgeous!!! A group of us were there in the evening so everything was dark. My guess is that an early evening would be when you can really enjoy and appreciate what you see.

It's a very lounge-like atmosphere. Lounge seats throughout. People were mostly enjoying drinks (probably because we were there at 11PM).

Drinks were quite pricey... something that I expected at place like this.

Groups of 6-8 are ideal given the seating options they have. Anything bigger and you're splitting up at different tables or lounge areas.

Go to see something special and bring your camera. It really is a great view.
author: Xerxes N.

description: AmaIng and beautiful place.Tje view is just amazing .I went on Valentine's Day and will recommend to others too.Romantoc and beautiful place
author: Sahaj L.

description:
If Batman lived in San Francisco, this is what I imagine his living room would look like.

Bruce Wayne would look down on his city, smoothly taking sips out of an expertly crafted Manhattan. He would sit in one of the armchairs in front of the huge, iron-paned, half circle of a window.

And if he saw something below him that required kickassery, he's not above flying out of that giant window, all superhero-like. (And what does he care if he has to pay a bajillion dollars to fix the window? Leaping out of the window looks badass, and he's loaded.)

So yeah, The View is like a superhero's urban lair. But luckily, we normies can enjoy it and let our minds drift into comic book fantasies.

Some more specifics:
* The name says it all. The view really is spectacular at The View. From both sides of this bar, you can pretty much see all of San Francisco. Bring a local along with you so that he/she can point out the landmarks. 
* A+ for drinks. I ordered the Bulleit Old Fashioned on both of my visits, and it was smooth, yet flavorful -- definitely not a watered down cocktail. My friends also enjoyed their cocktails.
* And at $14, my Old Fashioned was about as expensive as I found this cocktail to be at other upscale bars in the city. 
* The service was prompt. Even when it was busy, we didn't have to wait long to get a drink from one of the bartenders or waitresses. 
* So much interesting seating. The View has small nooks for just two people on up to longer tables and couches for a group. 

Whether you're staying at the Marriott or not, you should be sure to take in The View.
author: Emily H.

description: If you want a view of Downtown San Francisco, The View is the place to be! No reservations needed, but if you want a spot by the window I suggest you go early. My boyfriend & I were lucky to spot a table open next to the window by keeping an eye out. The service was great, no complaints. Wished they served more options on appetizers because the ones on the menu wasn't that great. Eat before you go! This place is more for drinks & the view.
author: Lo V.

description:
Views: stunning. Everything else: sucks. 

Ok, I admit I am bitter because The View really put a dent in my wedding night back on Saturday, June 18, 2016. 

Flashback: My husband and I made a reservation ahead of time to stay at the San Francisco Marriott Marquis after we returned to the city from our wedding reception in Tiburon. I think we made it into The View around 11 PM. The bar was insanely packed. As it was only the two of us, we could not reserve a table in advance, we were told. Ok, so we will take a chance, maybe we can find a seat somewhere, and at least have a drink to celebrate our wedding day. 

There were zero seats available... Oh wait, except for a curtained-off room with no one in it. I introduced myself to the manager on duty and politely asked if my husband and I could grab a drink and just sit in there for a while, and explained we had just gotten married that day and were staying at the Marquis that night. I even tried to show him some wedding photos on my phone as proof. He brushed me off, and said the room had had a private event in it earlier and hadn't been cleaned up yet (though it looked fine to me, there wasn't any trash or dirty glasses or plates). I pleaded, but he again said he couldn't budge because it was "a safety concern." Seriously. This was the part that upset me the most. It would have been really nice to just sit somewhere quiet and look out over the city lights and share a toast with my husband, even if only for 15 minutes before we went to our room for the night. But nope. 

Ok. We went to the bar. There was nowhere to sit at the bar, of course. Maybe we could stand off to the side and sip our drinks after. The lone bartender was crushed with orders. I waited and tried to get in a drink order for about 10 minutes, but the bartender was making drinks like his life depended on it and seemed to be studiously ignoring me. Not that I blame him as I think he was many drinks behind at the rate he was going at it. Why he had to make all drinks by himself with this crowd, I can only imagine.

Nowhere to sit and no consideration for a very special night by the manager. Can't order a cocktail unless I make a blood sacrifice on the bar. I decided forget it, let's just go to our room, maybe we can order room service? 

Got to our room. The bed is comfortable and the room is clean. But that is pretty standard to expect of a big city hotel, so I'm not going to fawn over a nice comforter and mattress. 

I'm starving at this point and exhausted. It's probably about 11:30 PM. Guess what? There is no room service at this hotel. Instead, they have a binder in the room that lists restaurants who deliver to them. But, oh, they stopped serving earlier. 

I can't believe it. Nowhere to sit at the bar, can't get a drink at the bar, and no food possible in our room. 

I look out the window at the nice view for a while and realize I'm too mad for such a beautiful day and I need to relax. My husband and I are wiped out, so no tmi needed. Instead, we just crash after resolving to get up early, check the hell out, and get brunch somewhere where we can actually get service. 

Our wedding day was one of the best days of my life. The San Francisco Marriott Marquis was an unfortunate end to it, but I made a promise to myself that I will never step foot in it again, and that makes me feel a bit better that I won't ever have to join a herd of young professionals crushed together, trying to get a drink order in so they can feel sophisticated looking out at that stunning view. What also struck me is that about half of the people sitting at the window tables weren't even marveling at the city lights, or their companions, but looking down instead at the glow of their cell phone screens. 

My advice? Enjoy the view if you can get it, and if you go on the weekend, get there early. Really early. Don't expect any special treatment, and bring extra cash for those drinks.
author: Sarah J.

description: The lounge is like Wayne tower. You can see entire city of San Francisco. The View is the really the view.
author: RJ C.

description: Worth stopping in for a drink to take in the awesome view from The View. We got there only a few minutes after 4pm and all the window seats were already taken. We ended up on a couch a few feet away which was the next best thing and still had a really nice view. Drinks were pretty good and the beer nuts were perfect for munching.
author: Therese M.

description:
The View--there is a reason View is capitalized! 

Stopped by for dranks at 12:30am on a Saturday, and it was lively, classy, and dressy. The fact that it was busy made a more memorable experience; looking for a table was an adventure in itself across the various nooks, each with a different View. It definitely reminded me of Boston's Top of the Hub, only more vintage--as expected for SF--with large semicircular windows featuring panes designed like wheel spokes.

(++) Skyline punch, $14 (Captain Morgan white rum, pineapple juice, fresh citrus juice, brandied grenadine): Definitely one of the better punches I've had, with a healthy dose of alcohol added to a refreshing mix of fruit juices.

(++) The View Manhattan, $14 (Bulleit rye, Capano Antica vermouth, bitters): Mm, bold and strong. No better way to enjoy the View.

Funny thing is, my Skyline Punch came in a suave old fashioned glass, while the boo's View Manhattan looked like a girly martini :P

Prices are higher than average as expected and the craft cocktails are good. I just can't help but be amused that $14 is the same price as my huge plate of chile verde I had for dinner at swanky Tropisueno. Oh SF prices... I don't know whether to think that Tropisueno has bargain food or that the View has expensive drinks.

Tip: If you want to take a nice picture of your dranks at night, I suggest finding the room that has a printout of a night shot of the city lights--borderline tacky though it may appear, it makes an excellent backdrop far better than what your camera can capture with the actual View.
author: Edna C.

description:
I have been in SF for shopping for over 15 years but haven't noticed that there's such a beautiful lounge on top of Marriott Hotel. 

My husband discovered this place while I was going to shopping. As he took me up to the 39th floor, I was amazed with the view of SF city from the very top floor of the hotel. 

Love the ambience, the delicious appetizer and the refreshing drink. The price is also reasonable for such a nice place located in SF. 

Definitely coming back to view the sunset.
author: Kara N.

description: Amazing view but it's always packed and the bartenders aren't always the most attentive. That said, it's still worth checking out if you haven't ever been.
author: Mariecar M.

description:
View is legit ... First time in San Fran and I really liked this place. It's blown open on two sides with some real sick views of the city.. Very classy.. I can see work people probably frolicking around in here for happy hour and acting frisky lol ... This place is exactly what I like... An elegant, sexy bar with tasteful decor.. Dimly lit setting the mood and letting the city lights do the rest... A few hotties filled this place! 

I'll prob go back for the happy hour before I leave considering its a rock throw away from where I'm staying.

Bottom line is.... I loved this place, get dressed up and come enjoy a drink in this refined, beautiful bar... Get here early and snag a good spot!
author: Laura G.

description:
The View tops so many lists of must-see places in SF. I can see why, but honestly I think it's a little overhyped. 

It's at the top floor of the Marriott downtown and you don't need a hotel card to get there. The bar is spacious, lots of sofas, seats, chairs, etc. But we had a rather large group, so seating became an issue once it started getting busy. The best part of this bar is definitely the view (lol). The window is huge and overlooks so much of the city. On a clear day, you could probably see the entire city! (exaggeration lol I wouldn't know because it was foggy af when we were there). It's a trendy, upscale, very bougie place to chill and grab drinks with friends.

Aside from that, my major complaints about this place was the overall service. We had a rather large group but we were able to grab a small table and sofa chairs by the center of the large window. The waitresses kept avoiding our table, even though they were making direct contact with us. We were all starving and trying to order food and drinks. One waitress (after we went up to her to try to order), told us that someone would be coming by shortly. 10-15 minutes later (after they had been ignoring us), they told us we needed to order directly from the bar and they wouldn't take our orders because she didn't want to split all the checks. -____- ok lady. could've told us that in the first place instead of making us more HANGRY. So we went to the bar and ordered. The food is overpriced, but what can you expect? It's a bougie SF bar. Lots of drink choices though. I only ordered the cheesy bread from the food menu because I didn't want to awkwardly eat a huge plate in this setting (it's more suitable for finger foods ya know). The cheesy bread was ok. Not cheesy. It seemed like just normal bread. Misleading to say the least. At least it was warm and fluffy?? But $6 for a loaf of bread and some butter is insane. 

I would come back here just because of the view, but definitely not for the food or service.
author: Amy T.

description: Ambience is great, music is great, food is good, prices are okay. Overall, a great experience if you have the budget for it.
author: Ryan O.

description:
This is a bar with serious WOW factor on the top of a hotel in San Francisco. Floor to ceiling windows show off the skyscrapers and general city views in a way I did not see anywhere else during my time in the city.

I went for a non alcoholic beer to drink which was surprisingly good with a cheesy bread snack for us to share. The bread was hot a fresh and kept us going until our food filled evening later on. 

If you want a great date spot or somewhere just to take in the San Fran skyline this has to be the place for you.
author: Daniel G.

description: Super fancy or NFL jersey wearing people is what you will see here. It's almost a 360 degree view of the city here and it's sooo beautiful at night. Drinks are stiff and appetizers are pretty basic. The staff is very helpful for the most part but it is first come first served in regards to trying to grab a seat.
author: Isabel S.

description:
A little crowded on weekends I think but loved the place... 

The view from this place is absolutely amazing and loved the ambiance... It's a nice place to hang out with friends... 

The only part I didn't like was that everyone had to find a table for themselves which was kinda weird... It would have been nicer if the staff was helping out people with that but still not a deal breaker... 

Awesome place for a romantic date or a girls night out with nice soft music in the background... 

There was a parking garage almost accross the streeet which was super cheap and covenient...
author: Rupa S.

description:
My best friend and I stopped by here on our BFF date. Our theme for the day was #views, so it was only fitting we stop by The View lounge to enjoy some drinks. In planning our date, I had originally wanted to go rooftop bar hopping in the City (which you think would be easy), however, not many bars in SF offer rooftop views. 

We had been wanting to come here for some time but we could never figure out a time that worked for the both of us. Walking in, we wanted to make it the best experience possible because of all the time we had waited to check this place out. Unfortunately, I have to knock off one star because our server was a bit rude when I did not like her drink recommendation and sent the drink back. I really hate doing this but the drink was too strong and tasted a lot like rubbing alcohol. When she brought back my new drink order, she quickly plopped it on the table and walked away. Somewhat disappointed because it was a complete 180 from the kind and friendly girl we were first greeted with. As time passed, her attitude changed and I ended up leaving her a nice tip. 
 
The bar itself is small and intimate. The seating fills up fast as everyone tries to get a table next to the window. The drinks are average and a bit pricy but, of course, what you are really paying for is the view. The sweeping cityscape view of SF is worth it too! Definitely a great place to come if you want to impress a special lady friend ;-)

Overall, we had a great experience and would come here again. A must-see if you are visiting the city.   

Pro-tip: If you want the ultimate view of the city- plan to arrive on time! This means taking the elevator all the way up to the 38th floor and once 4pm strikes you'd hop back on and take the elevator to the next floor up. This way, you'll have the best chance of securing a window table.
author: Martha H.

description:
The view is spectacular!

That was the reason why my friend and I came here after work. We got seated right away and since it was pretty dark, the menu lighted up. 

We ordered the mezzie, the kobe beef sliders, and a shrimp dish. For two girls, it was more than enough to satisfy our stomachs. I can't wait to come back at an earlier time to see the sunset or get a table at the opposite side to see the view facing twin peaks!
author: Eva O.

description: One of the best Lounge I have been to in US. Definitely has the vibe & the view will steal your heart.
author: Radhika A.

description: Food and drinks were BOMB i would recomend this place and the waitress Beza was very atentive and took care of us real well, $2.00 raise if i was boss
author: Juan S.

description: Service and security was good here. Food was ok for a hotel but the view was amazing. Drinks were fairly priced as well. Good date place.
author: Ryan B.

description:
We celebrated my boyfriend's birthday. 4 stars because, first, they don't take reservation..We arrived at 8pm and the place was full. No host, no anyone who explain to us the dynamics of the tables or the waiting. 
We waited 25 min at the bar and obviously looking for a good table. The menu is basic, just appetizers. 
Finally we got a NICE table, the food was good. Our server (Earin) was always polite (kind person), I told him about the birthday and my request was a chocolate desert (with a candle)... well, the chocolate cake was spicy (a lot) but good.
Our experience was enjoyable.
author: Viviana C.

description:
I'm spoiled by the fact that I work close by.   It's definitely a great place to look at the city.   And if you haven't been here you should check out the view it's beautiful.  

Go into the Marriott and go into the high tower elevator to go to the top of the hotel.  

You should go to both sides to enjoy the view.   

Have a drink and unwind.
author: Homer S.

description: 4 stars for the price of food, but 5 stars for the view. We decided to come up here for appetizers and drinks before going out to dinner. Our group was not disappointed. It was busy and crowded, but the atmosphere was nice, the views were amazing and nice. You can't ever go wrong with views of the city and the water. We also ordered some meatloaf sliders and the crab dip. The food was pretty good, but a little over priced for what we got. But what can you expect, we're in a nice hotel, with a nice view, and in San Francisco. The crowd was pretty mixed with younger and older people as well. Even if you don't stay at the hotel, this place is worth checking out.
author: Monica K.

description:
This place is what it is. Really cool room at the top of the Marriott, with a beautiful nice big view. I wish it had a more distinct vibe but the view is simply spectacular. My boyfriend and I ordered drinks and you MUST order the cheese plate, it is absolutely delicious. 

We had a nice time but the place lacks an identity or a special pull.
author: Glory F.

description: On February 27, 2017 I brought my girlfriend to The View and us being first timers it was the most breathtaking experience EVER! Last night on January 9, 2018 was our second time together there, but in this case it was night time. The City looks 1000x better at night than in the day with all of the lights lit up. Aside from how fabulous this place is the food is full of flavor we had al pastor tacos. I also ordered a couple of cocktails. One of them was an Old Fashion and the other was Frisco Smash. Both drinks were great, but definitely is an acquired taste. I would get the Frisco smash again its a strong and refreshing cocktail. At last we ordered the creme brûlée for our dessert starting from the nice hard layer of hard caramelized sugar shell on top and the rich custard had the perfect blend when eating it. I definitely recommend this place to anyone delicious appetizers/dessert, upscale environment, amazing and attentive service.
author: Chinito A.

description: Wasn't what i expected. I'm only giving It 3stars because our waitress, Jessica, was really nice and friendly. I drove far away to take my girlfriend to have a great time. We walked in and there was a lot of kids on the ground and running around. I have no problems with kids but I think there should be some rules at this bar. I saw a Mom yelling at her kids to behave. I mean, what do you expect? Out there getting your drinks on and expecting your kids to behave?
author: Trung V.

description:
Seriously? Windows like this exist? Kudos to the architect who designed such a grand space overlooking both sides of the Bay!

Taking the elevator to the top of the 39th floor is incredibly quick -- I had vertigo when I got off. I was immediately drawn to the massive amount of light seeping through these windows. The bar sits center stage and poor tenders having to see such a crappy view every work shift!

After taking an obligatory photo, we sat in a table to the right of the main window, Bay Bridge view. It took about 10 minutes for a server to greet us and take our drink order. It was 2 hours before sunset and all I really wanted was a beer. I requested for a Pliny on tap which is available downstairs at the hotel bar. They said, no problem! However, I waited about 15 minutes for that sucker to arrive. Not sure if that was an issue on the ordering or if it took that long to get up from the lobby. Once it arrived, I was super happy. This place was incredible and bustling. Even though the service was slow, still 5 stars for the view (pun intended) and the chance to order off menu for that Pliny!
author: Jon S.

description:
First of all, the view is amazing. If you live, or are visiting San Francisco, you should come here at least once. We stopped by here for a couple of drinks and appetizers before heading to the party, we were lucky enough to hit just before sunset, so we got to see the view during daylight and under a full moon.

The seating is first come first serve and we were lucky enough to swoop a table just as a couple was leaving. Others in the area were not as lucky, so be ready to be a predator. Service was pretty terrible, we waited so long that we almost went up to order at the bar. The food was middle to lower end. You're not going to get quality to match the price here, because you're just paying for the location.
author: John P.

description:
Dang, that's one good lookin' View! Sure, the drinks are priced for high-rollers (think $15/piece), but when you've got that YOLO state of mind, and want to take cocktail hour up a notch, The View makes total sense. It's stunning. 

The lounge seating along the windows is prime, unless you're afraid of heights. You can see the whole SF skyline from above. There's a Bay-facing and City-facing side of The View, and you can specify which you want when you're being seated. Warning: they don't take reservations so you'll have to arrive right when they open or just try to get lucky later in the night. 

There's a long list of well-crafted, creative cocktails. The wine list isn't very esoteric, it's mostly standard stuff. The bar snacks are quite impressive, and perfect for a small bite after work: spiced nuts, truffled potato chips, hummus, ahi poke. All fabulous. 

Service was great, and made sure all 8 in our group were happy and well-hydrated (with booze) at all times. 

Sidenote: I would NOT want to be up here during an earthquake. Any other day, it's spectacular.
author: Nique F.

description: Get to the elevators before 4pm or you will not get a seat  to see the amazing VIEW lol  Bloody Mary  On Point!
author: Alicia G.

description: Decent view but would be better if it looked north. Also, these folks add the tip to your bill, so watch out.
author: John M.

description:
When we get old and creaky, we tend to lose that sense of child-like wonder that made our world so magical. There are a few places that still sneak up on me, once in a while, that bring that feeling back - and the View is one such place.

I came up here with a group in the early evening, just for drinks, and we were (after the initial trouble of finding the place on foot) shocked at how aptly this place is named. I mean, wow! It really is everything it should be with that name!
It does, understandably, draw a bit of a crowd. So come early, especially if you're with company, and scope out a space. Crowded as it was, we didn't see anyone struggling for a place to sit for too long, and on a Friday night no less.

I had a Golden Gate, which was an amazingly balanced whiskey cocktail, and just the thing to bear the name of the big city's famous bridge (so good I didn't even mind the $15 sticker). I also strongly recommend the Ginger Elixer for non-drinkers and/or ginger lovers - that sucker packs a punch!

But, at the end of the day, come up here - just once - and find yourself a quiet spot to watch the sunset, or look out at the city at night. It's absolutely worth the short elevator ride.
author: Noah H.

description:
I have not been here in ages. As in I was still in my early 20s when I last visited. However, some how we found ourselves here one evening for drinks before catching a 8:45pm showing of Ex Machina at the Metreon a block away. 

Despite some fog, the view was as fantastic as I remembered it. Therefore the competition for window seats is tough so keep your eyes peeled and act immediately if you see someone who you think is on their way out. 

Drinks and food aren't anything to write home about but you already know this place is all about the view hence their name. 

SF isn't like NYC with dime a dozen bars/lounges with city views. This is one of the very few in this city. One might find this place cliche and touristy. Yeah, I'll agree with that but at the same time so what?
author: Esther A.

description: Never fails me I love this place only downfall wish I could get a good seat every time
author: Mo N.

description:
Wouldn't come here for the view. It's really not that fantastic and it gets very packed on Saturday nights -- The drinks are also pricey AF - with tip and tax I ended up paying $18 for a manhattan! The crowd is a bit hoity toity if that's kind of your thing - older businessmen/that kind of crowd.

Much prefer a younger, more authentic SF feel, but of course every major city needs that one place you can take the fam/friends when they come into town.
author: Cindy W.

description:
The View certainly lives up to its lofty name!

This swanky lounge is situated on the top floor of the Marriott Hotel in SOMA. As soon as you get out of the elevator, you'll be confronted with a jaw-dropping, panoramic view of San Francisco. You immediately feel like you're on top of the world.

My co-workers and I were lucky enough to claim a window seat during happy hour. We nibbled on some chips & nuts while sipping on fancy-schmancy cocktails. Keep in mind, the drinks aren't cheap (they're going to run you over $14). Granted, a lot of bars in the city charge that price for cocktails. But then again, those bars don't boast this kind of view.

Our server, Jessica, couldn't have been nicer. She treated our motley crew like royalty. 

I really enjoyed the vibe of this place. Nice mix of tourists and locals - all imbibing in perfect harmony. It's a great spot for people watching for sure. Lots of SOMA techies and finance dudes in suits... and plenty of sexy, dressed up ladies hoping to get their attention. It's fun to watch.

My Bulleit Manhatten was delicious (and potent). The appetizers we all shared (ahi tuna tartar with wasabi sauce, and the hummus with flatbread) were all delectable. But at the end of the day, you want to know what makes this place a true San Francisco treat?
The answer lies in the name, my friends.
author: Kevin B.

description:
OMG, the view. Guess that's why they call this swanky lounge The View. What else would it be?

Spending Friday happy hour at The View is a special treat. I don't care if you're a tourist or have spent your entire life in San Francisco, it's impressive.
