Having recently experienced a makeover, complete with new marble bar and modern, sleek seating, guests feel extra baller having a cocktail or two here. 

Drinks themselves are gorgeous, try the SoMa Spritzer with St. Germain, sparkling wine and fresh fruit. Or go for the Van Ness Press, which comes with gin, raspberries and mint. Very refreshing! 

There's nothing not to like at The View. I could gush on and on about it, or just go back again and bring friends.
author: Abby S.

description:
The View is located inside the Mariott Hotel on the 39th floor. It's beautiful! There's a couple different rooms where you can sit eat drink and enjoy the gorgeous view of San Francisco from up high. Whether you watch the sunset or just want to take a look at the city in the day/night with all the lights; it's all a good view.

I came here as part of a celebration for one of my friends birthday. We took a lot of pictures here, of OURSELVES so sorry no food and drink pics from me attached to this review lol but there's plenty pictures already there anyway. 

The cheese plate was really nice and the food was ok. The drinks were pretty good, and strong, a bit expensive too; but it was pretty much expected and worth it. 

It's very busy so it's a bit noisy, but if you are sitting next to someone you can still hear them. If you eat here make sure you get up and walk around to see the view and take pictures. 

I would recommend you come and experience the view for yourself; I think it's a nice date night place, or for getting together with friends.  I would definitely come back.
author: Lina L.

description: Phenomenal views from wherever you stand. I recommend getting there early to get a window seat (took this advice from someone's review it's true). Decent size lounge. Customer age range from 30 and up. I loved the music they played (Sia, Milky Chance, Santigold, etc.) Great customer service. Barbacoa tacos were ok; a little too sweet. The drink options we wanted they couldn't make (Tennessee Squierrel and Rasberry Lemon Drop Martini). Minus 1 star for that.
author: Linda H.

description:
View is great
Cocktails are great
You are certainly "paying the price" for that view though...the drinks are quite spendy 
Beautiful lounge atmosphere and good amount of seating on either side. Overall everything about this place is great and I highly recommend stopping by.
author: Valerie W.

description:
I wouldn't recommend this place. Like, at all. I had a really terrible experience here. 

First of all, we went to a rooftop lounge for the view. The way that the lounge was set up made it impossible to get a good look unless you were lucky enough to snag one of the coveted chairs near the edge of the window. Other than that you're basically totally out of luck, there's no outdoor viewing area, no window space without chairs blocking it, etc. It was impossible to enjoy the view. As a tourist, I was hoping to get a good photo in, but there wasn't a good place to do that either. 

Additionally, the food and drinks were awful as well. I ordered a mule that came to me in a wine glass and tasted nothing like ginger beer. My friend got a cosmo, and didn't like her drink either. The food was equally as disappointing, and I found most of the items to be poorly described on the menu, misleading us to order things we weren't ultimately satisfied with. 

It's a shame, this place is in a great location with so much potential.
author: Sarina G.

description: Service seems improved but I did note that there is a big difference from the servers. If you stay longer they bring in the ringers (better tenders) and things get better. Still under staffed but the view never stops giving.
author: Rob B.

description:
Nothing super special about the food or the drinks- they aren't heavily specialized in anything, but they provide two things- clearly, a view, and a place to hang out with coworkers after work.

Tips:  

-Do not come here for a date.  Don't be dumb- it's just too noisy.

-If you come in during busy hours and you can't find a table, don't stay in one place.  Order your drink from the bar then go around and search for a table with the black checkbook waiting to be collected.  Perch like a vulture until they leave and boom- the table is yours.  I use this anywhere.

Funny side story when I did this there; I wasn't particularly near the table I was 'perched' at, and when I saw them standing up and leaving, I yelled to them, "ARE YOU GUYS LEAVING? MAY WE TAKE YOUR TABLE?".  By doing so, I was announcing my claim and victory, to the dismay of three other groups who were diving in LOL bitch bye.

-If you don't want to fight for a table then go before 5 PM.

Anywho, despite the decent food and mediocre service, the view makes up for it all.
author: Leighton W.

description:
We discovered this place on Yelp and were really excited to check out the view and selection of cocktails. Upon arriving we learned that there is never a cover charge, they do not take reservations and there is no happy hour. They open at 4pm, and we visited on a weekday around 6pm; the place was busy, but we saw a few open tables and snagged one near the window. 

Most of the cocktails are priced around $15 and the wine ranges from mid teens to low twenties per glass. I tried the "Moscone" Mule (named after the Moscone center, cute!). What an amazing concoction this was! With lots of mint and the most refreshing ginger beer I've ever had, I was very pleased. We also ordered the Mezze from the list of small plates. This was my first time trying green garbanzo bean hummus, and I became an instant fan. It was paired with pickled vegetables and marinated olives along with a deliciously season stack of crispy flatbread. I can't wait to come back to enjoy the amazing view and tasty snacks!
author: McKenna P.

description:
Went to The View to celebrate my Birthday. Don was very sweet and seated us at a great table. 

This lounge has a beautiful setting and city's skyline view was incredible.

We had excellent Food and Service with some amazing  drinks. I highly recommend it and I will be coming back, Don took excellent care of us.

We are looking forward to our next visit.
author: Victoria T.

description:
This place is amazing. Located in the heart of downtown, it's convenient to find. 

-There really is no bad seat here, and thank god they have food. I got the wings with my girlfriend which were delicious and tasted fresh. Very good

-Drinks are pricey, and the alcohol content in the drinks definitely reflects that. After 3 cocktails, I was very happy. 

I hope to come back when I am in the area and am in a celebratory mood. : )
author: Anonymous ?.

description: I've been to the View so many times and never had the chance to make a review. If you are ever visiting SF this is a must. Very chill lounge on the top floor of the Marriott hotel. Great place to hangout or bring a date, they will be truly amazed by the view and the selection of drinks. Every time I bring someone new they instantly fall in love with this place!
author: Matthew L.

description: Only visit this place if you are coming to see the view. The atmosphere is upscale but the lack of a dress code makes it a free for all for wandering tourists trying to snap a pic of the city skyline. Service is nonexistent and bitchy at best. Expensive drinks and overcrowding make it unappealing.
author: David R.

description:
Came here for drinks on the early side (6-9:30pm) on a Saturday night. I've tried to come before on Sunday evening and it was so packed we couldn't stay. So it seems to be hit or miss in terms of your luck with seats. Also, there was a whole other section that was open this time which made a difference. 

The view is stunning, of course. We weren't seated directly near the windows but could still catch a glimpse from our high-top table. The interior of the lounge isn't spectacular but it's clean and really draws your attention to the large windows. 

Large parties beyond 4 people would have trouble finding comfortable seating. 2 or 3 is best. 

The drinks were good. No one in my group raved about theirs but none had complaints either. The service was really great though, which had a big impact. Our group wasn't racking up a huge tab, but our waiter didn't seem to be pushing us out and didn't disregard us either. It was nice that he kept checking on us without making us feel pressured to order more. I'd be happy to come back!
author: Susan G.

description: I love this place just to stop by for a quick drink! Definitely more "upscale". Its very beautiful and can be crowded.
author: Karen S.

description: Guys who work there are stuck up assholes. The bartender is to busy hitting on guys to serve drinks. Stood waiting for a drink for 10 minutes, and I just left.
author: Phil M.

description: Went on a Friday Night.  It was busy.  U find your own spot and seat yourself, which is pretty inconvenient...Felt like going to a food court at an outlet looking for a spot on a Saturday.  This was disappointing as it is a nice spot at a Marriott hotel.  I guess it was just overly busy so I didn't have a good experience.  Both my friend and I were deeply disappointed at the experience.   The view is nice if u can find a spot at or near the windows.  The service was alright although it was greatly understaffed.  I guess I may have came on a bad night as well...Since it was board game night for some people...It didn't feel like a very classy place although the pricing and view was nice (near the windows) with board games and the disorganization I didn't feel like I was at a Marriott with a beautiful view ..Felt more like at a bubble tea shop with board games.  Disappointing.  Being from Toronto if I were to go to a place with prices and environment similar to those of the Marriott this would not happen.
author: Tiffy I.

description: This is an amazing place to hang out during sunset in the city. It's inside the Marriott Hotel so make sure to uber here so easy pick up and drop off. They have good selections of cocktails. Tables are first come first serve so come before 4:30pm to get good seats otherwise, watch for people leaving and get it immediately
author: Sherry C.

description: This is a great place. They are super nice and the owner is great. The hours are really flexible. I am excited to go back again and take all my friends.
author: Raji S.

description:
I had heard countless stories about The View's views, but no told tale can prepare you for just how awe-inspiring, breathtaking, intimidating the panoramic views really are. *I recommend taking a casual stroll around the restaurant's perimeter, so you can see EVERY view it has to offer* 
I was holding my breath when preparing for what I imagined would be astronomical drink and/or app prices, but I was pleasantly surprised--For SF standards, the wine and beer prices were actually quite reasonable. AND, they wine and beer we tried was delicious. 
We had the meatloaf sliders and homemade chips/dip with our drinks, and they were delicious as well.  
Our server was very nice, and even comped our sliders when they didn't arrive on time, but the the missing star is mostly due to an uncomfortable sitting situation and shitty 80's house music ruining the otherwise relaxing atmosphere...
author: Kyle B.

description:
A picture is worth a thousand words, so they say. 

With a place called, The View, I can honestly vouch that the name speaks for itself. 

Some friends and I decided to come to this place since we were in the neighborhood. This bar lounge is located on the 39th floor of the Marriot Marquis Hotel on 4th Street.

Upon entering the building, you already feel that you are in a more upscale place. Doormen dressed in suits greet you warmly as you pass through. Staff members are standing around observing the floor looking to see
if anyone needs assistance. This hotel is quite large so the employee who pointed us in the right direction to the high rise elevators was greatly appreciated.

The lounge opens at 4pm and closes at 1:30am. I was aware that seating can fill up fast so we arrived exactly at 4. Once we stepped into the elevator, we moved quickly and smoothly up to the 39th floor. Most of the
people in the elevator were headed for the same destination. 

As the doors opened, light poured in from all direction and it looked like you would have boarded the Millennium Falcon, itself! With such distinctively designed, rounded windows, and the feeling of being suspended in mid air, it truly gave the impression that you are flying through the city skyline.

I was completely amazed by what my eyes took in. I almost forgot to look for a seat. Once I came back to my senses, I swiftly searched for a seat near one of the enormous windows, but all were basically taken. Mind you, it was only 4:10 pm at this point, and this place was already filling up. 

Luckily, right behind a side wall we were able to find a table that was not too far from a window.

This architectural masterpiece was designed by Anthony J. Lumsden. The high arching windows so beautifully displays the best of what San Francisco has to offer and can leave you breathless. In one direction, you can see the Golden Gate Bridge and in another view you can catch the entire East Bay in all its spectacular glory. The bay bridge is completely visible as well and so is Downtown FIDI and SOMA. 

If you seriously come here to see nothing else but
"THE VIEW," you will leave completely satisfied.

BUT, this place has more to offer than just breathtaking views. The bar has some signature cocktails that are very tasty and even a little bit dangerous. 

I decided to go with the Van Ness Press. This cocktail had everything I liked. It was made with Tanqueray gin (substituted with vodka), raspberries, mint, and citrus. Truly a refreshing drink. Their drinks are mixed very well and smooth to the finish.

We ordered some small plates which included the prawns tostadas and Yellow Fin Tuna "Poke Style." The food wasn't as memorable as the view or cocktails, but our experience was amazing nonetheless. 

I recommend coming a little before 4pm if you want to grab a seat next to a window. They go pretty fast. Self seating too. 

This is a great place to meet friends, to have a relaxing time with coworkers after a long day, or even a great way to start date night.

The atmosphere is lively without being too loud and allows you to enjoy the views with good conversation. 

Service is prompt with your orders and will accommodate your requests. 

The View is definitely one place I'll be back to visit!
author: Ann S.

description: Gorgeous views and delicious cocktails ! A corner table would be a perfect setting for a romantic night. Seating is first come first serve so make sure you get there a little before rush hour to get a good spot.
author: Reema B.

description: The view is amazing (shocker, right?!). The only thing is that you HAVE to get there by 4:30 if you want to have a seat without waiting 20-30 minutes. The cocktails are fine, not amazing. The food is good, especially the cheese platter and the hummus.
author: Adrian C.

description:
It's hard to believe this lounge is located right in the middle of downtown. Normally the hustle and bustle is too crazy and keeps me from wanting to find anywhere to drink around the Powell Street station, but I came here to meet a friend. You can feel the instant relaxation and slow-down of everyone enjoying a good time.

They could not have come up with a more perfect name for this place - The View. If you can snatch seats by the window, you'll want to stay there forever because it's absolutely gorgeous day or night. The View also hosts private events here, so I'll consider that for the future. Although they apparently serve snacks, I just went with a house red. On the pricier side of lounges ($14 for the wine) but totally worth the experience on special occasions.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
The view is breathtaking, the drinks are tasty, but man, are they expensive.
Definitely come here if you've never been--the city looks amazing at night, and it's quite an experience. The fruity cosmo is awesome but pricy, though the standard lower-effort drinks are more manageable. 
I came on a Monday night, which seems to be a good move if you want to avoid crazy crowds. Still pretty busy--and it seemed to get busier around 9 or 10, but you shouldn't have a huge problem finding seats for a group of 4 or 5.
author: Gautam G.

description: This is a great spot if you are cool with heights! Excellent 360 degree views of the city, the ocean and the bay. Get there early because the seats fill up quickly. The menu has a little something for everyone and every budget. My seat was pretty far from any windows but I occasionally walked around the bar just to take in the scenery. My visit was during daytime so the views were great.
author: Tony B.

description:
The view is well known for the view it presents. The drinks were a little on the pricey side as well as their food. 
Me and a friend bought four drinks and two appetizer and the total was $100. No tip yet included. 

How to find a seating here was the problem for us. We came here at 6pm on a Friday night. It seemed impossible to grab a seat but here is a tip on how to snatch a seat. We wanted a seat on the west side of the view to see the sunset. We went around the west side to see if there was any empty table, not seats but table. Once we found a table my friend just stayed at the table while I went around and looked for empty seats to grab them and bring it back to our table. I found two empty seats and brought it back to the table. So we created our space on a nice spot with a nice view of the city. All we had to do was wait for the sunset. 

One thing that really will bug and annoy anyone who comes here for the drinks is that people will walk into your personal space and your table if you are sitting near the window with a nice view. Some will ask you politely while some will just waltz in. I even appeared in some of the selfies of some people because they didn't ask me to move and they just came into our table, stood in front of us in the window and just took the picture. I don't blame them. We really had a nice spot. 

We sat here for a good two hours drinking and having a good chat.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Small list of appetizers and not much on the wine list -- but the view is killer! 
In a place called, "The View" - you don't expect to have amazing food. Right? 

Service was great! 
Thanks, Jessica!
author: Marilyn D.

description: Came in the summer with my sister who was in from Florida. We had drinks, some appetizers before heading out to diner. Was definitely a good place to meet since I was working she just hung out and enjoyed the awesome view. You have to get there right as they open to get good seats because it gets packed. This will be on my list of places to hit up when I have guests from out of town.
author: James M.

description: Love this place! My boyfriend & I came here for his birthday & we were very impressed. We did learn that you need to be at the hotel before 4 as the elevators will not take you to the lounge until 4 on the dot. Once you're waiting for the clock to strike 4 you will find yourself in a small crowd hoping for a spot in the elevator & if the place hits capacity then you're shot out of luck & will need to come back later but thankfully we got seats & were able to enjoy ourselves. The drinks were delicious & the desserts were the perfect size & well executed. The views you get from this place are absolutely stunning, this is truly a place you need to visit when in the city. The service was great, atmosphere is casual, & again the drinks & desserts were delicious. I highly recommend giving The View a try!
author: Stephany L.

description:
Went there last weekend. It was busy, but not totally slammed. I spotted a couple with a great window seat, and the guy got up and spoke to the waitress. I figured they were leaving and walked toward them. I heard the waitress say, 'She'll bring it', then walk away. 

I asked the guy if they were waiting for their check, but no, he was waiting for his order to be delivered. That should have been a clue.  

We found a table with a great view, but it had not been bussed, and there was a server's folio there as well. 

We waited a few minutes, and I decided to bus my own table just to get the dirty glasses and napkins out of the way. 

Waited a little longer, and with no service, went to the bar to get drinks. 

The cost for 2 drinks was $27. I expect to pay more because of the view, but they could at least make a decent drink. The club soda was flat, and it tasted like tap water with a hint of vodka. 

We decided not to have another, and just before we left, a server came by to collect her folio, and didn't even ask if we wanted anything. 

So, they have a great view, but lousy service and value. 

I wrote to management first before blasting on Yelp, but it's been a week with no response, so that kind of explains why the service was bad.
author: Steve H.

description: After seeing all the advertising (some online but mostly at the hotel itself) I really wanted to go up and check out the lovely view. I ended up going up on a Wednesday at about 4:30 PM (it opens at 4 PM). It was pretty empty at that time as the after work crowd did not make it there yet. We (group of about 8-10) were able to snag a corner section. The views are great there, especially in the evening. It definitely does live up to the hype in that aspect. The drinks are very expensive with beer ranging from $8-9 and mixed specialty drinks priced at $14-18 per drink. You can also get food there which is also expensive. We did not eat there. The wait staff took a while to get orders and it was hard to get anyone's attention. Also we noticed that the after work crowd is on the younger end and it tends to get loud. Go for the views and maybe grab one drink, but not much more than that...you'll go broke quickly.
author: Jason P.

description:
The gorgeous View. The view. View

Usually I talk about 3 things when it comes to a place, but this time, it's all about the view! This place has the best view in downtown hands down. 

Tip: come early to grab a seat by the window as it is free seating. I recommend even 4:30pm. That way you will get to see both the sunset and the night view. 

I swear they have filmed a movie here...
author: Jules W.

description: Well the name says it all. The view of San Francisco is breathe taking and worth stopping in just to see that. It is a very laid back atmosphere and a nice places to grab drinks with friends.
author: Angela R.

description:
This is not the Carnelian Room, which has closed many years ago, but I am told the "small plates" are better than the junk that used to be served atop the BofA building. 
.
I had not had a chance to really try much here just some beer nuts and a drink in front of a comfortable seat next to the symbolic Marriott windows that wrap 360 degrees of the top floors.
.
The service was great and they make a pretty good drink too. I will definitely go back for the full experience. I must say it was nice to just kick back and watch the recent storm blow through from this giant window; I bet the sunsets are wonderful!
author: Caesar A.

description:
Located on the 39th floor of Marriott Marquis you can expect a marvellous view of downtown San Francisco, the bay area, or the mountains. It's open seating, so find a seat with a view you like. Waiters will make their rounds and attend to you when you call their attention. 

FOOD (3.0)
We came here for desserts and for the view. The Butterscotch Pudding ($7++ USD) is what our waiter personally recommended, which was delicious enough and presented in a rock glass. The Vanilla Bean Créme Brulee ($7++ USD) wasn't great, but not bad either. The value is in the view, for first timers, tourists, and the hotel's guests it's a must try. 

SERVICE (4.0)
Accommodating and from our experience unobtrusive. Their able to quickly and efficiently handle our requests despite the crowd.

AMBIANCE (5.0)
An Upbeat professional crowd, modern chill music, and a stunning sunset it's a nice place to end the day. The lovely view is well worth the premium.
author: Giovan T.

description: This place had a great atmosphere!! The view of the city was amazing! Make sure to get here early to grab a good spot! A little bit pricey, but worth it! Drinks were good.
author: Bella C.

description: Spectacular views. Whenever I think of roof top restaurant, I think of 'The View'. Their drinks and food is food. You can see Bay Bridge and City lights. It's always crowded but you can find a seat if you hang out for 15-20 mins.
author: Mitali M.

description: Wow, what a view. I am afraid of heights but agreed to meet some friends up here not knowing exactly how high up this place was. I believe it is on the 39th floor? Nice rslow ride up the elevator and when the door opened, the bar was packed and soon found out why. What an amazing view of the city. I am stunning. The famous arch with tables all around the bar on every side so that no one misses the view. We were lucky enough to grab a spot near the main bar and met a local friend. The waitress was sweet, mellow in the chaos and very attentive. We started out burbons and my traditional skinny margarita which was made perfectly. We had to try the ahi tartare stack that came with crispy onions and topped with herbs. It was great, the crispy onion gave it the texture and added flavor the dish needed. We also had an order of prawns. Five arrived on a long rectangle plate with lemons and hers. The layed on a bed of light cocktail sauce. The boys loved them. I enjoyed the ahi stack especially when you get down to where all the avocado is hiding. If you are in the City, please come here and have a drink or a snack, it is so stunning you don't want to miss out, even if you are afraid of heights!! Trust me, I was so happy I made it.
author: Valerie M.

description: Arrived right at 4pm and was able to get a table for 6 right away. It quickly filled up and was completely packed wall to wall by the time we left. Ordered drinks as well as the chips and baked crab spread and both were delicious. I got the moscow mule and it was average, they definitely pour heavy here though! The server was really nice and came back as often as she could. The view is beautiful and I will definitely come back in the future.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Words can't express how happy I was with this place! The views were amazing, the staff was kind and knowledgeable, and the food was delicious! My husband and I found this place on yelp and will definitely return. Make sure you get there early if you want a good seat but even sitting at the bar you'll be happy!
author: Savannah S.

description: This place really does have the most awesome view. You need to get there right at 4 to get a seat. It's a little bit of a mad dash but totally worth it.
author: Kim W.

description:
Popped up here to see what the View was about, but there was a bit too much rain and overcast to see anything. The location is excellent so on a clear night, you should be able to see for miles and miles. Just not tonight.

Lots of meet going on in this market as well. Returning to my hotel room on the 18th floor, I got hit on by two cougars in the elevator. Uh, thanks but no thanks.
author: Bruce K.

description:
Best top floor cafe in SF area. Reminds you with John Hancock 95th floor cafe in Chicago.  The new look after renovation is awesome.

I used to come here when friends are visiting with SF. Always was a great choice. 

Of course, nobody comes here for the food or the drink, it's mainly for the views.
author: Ahmad A.

description: No cover and great view! Drinks were pricey but as I always say you pay for the view! A good spot to check out and it was pretty packed! Still got a seat and met some interesting folks! Would go again and recommend to others who are in the San Fran area and want to see a nice view of the San Fran skyline
author: Warren W.

description: Honestly, 5 stars for the view at The View. This place was so beautiful and it felt good to just sit here, as I have a weakness for beautiful spots with breathtaking views. (it's the Taurus in me, what can I say) Came here a couple weeks ago with a girlfriend for some drinks and we were totally blown away. The place was a little crowded because it was 5 PM on a Friday night, but we found seating nonetheless. We ordered glasses of wine which arrived very quickly and it was a great place to hang out and take in a beautiful view of the city. Can't wait to come back!
author: Rutuja R.

description: Have a drink with your friends and enjoy the view! This place is very crowded and you might not be able to find seats close to the windows to enjoy the view tho!
author: Saharnaz N.

description: A little crowded but good views and well priced drinks
author: Roshan G.

description:
I came here with two friends for drinks and since we came at peak hours we were lucky to even get seats. We saw the window and the view from a distance. Does that count?

As for drinks, it was delicious. Too bad I don't remember which drinks I ordered but I remember how pretty they were. :D

It was one with berries and the other with lime citrus and another one vodka with stuff.

It's super close to the muni/bart so horray public transportation. Otherwise yay Lyft. lol. Happy drinking and eating.
author: Corie L.

description:
For one of our early-on dates, my boyfriend went full romance and took me here. It seems like the type of place that you have to go to at night for the full experience, and a lot of the more negative reviews I'm reading definitely reflect that. But for an evening date, this was a home run. 
Minus 1 star for the seating fiasco that you can expect. We got super lucky and only had to awkwardly loiter by a couple paying their check for a few minutes, but I could easily see spending ~30 minutes waiting. Also, my date's old-fashioned came with crushed ice instead of the traditional giant ice sphere, but mine didn't and his next one didn't either, which was just odd.
author: Delaynie K.

description: We were extremely disappointed in our experience. We heard about it before we  traveled to San Francisco, and very much looked forward to it. The service was really slow. The waitress was not accommodating to say the least. We felt  unwelcome and ignored. I don't think we will go back even when we are staying in the hotel.
author: Juanita M.

description:
Decent place to grab drinks and snacks with a view. The centerpiece of the lounge is a giant window opposite from the bar that offers a panoramic view overlooking the city, making for a pleasant lounging experience.  Drinks are priced on the higher end, but entirely reasonable given the views and upscale atmosphere. The cocktails that I sampled were quite tasty, and the squash hummus plate we ordered was also pretty good, presented nicely with roasted vegetables. 

Service was rather slow, perhaps due to understaffing - it took ages to for someone to come clean up after previous patrons and for our server to come take our order. We noticed that she seemed to be the only server in our area, which was definitely insufficient given how busy the place was. To her credit, she was well-meaning and friendly, and once we did place our orders, our drinks and food came out swiftly.
author: Oliver L.

description: This lounge was amazing! We're about to leave due too so many people but we found seats on the way out. Wasn't the great view seats, but that's okay because the drinks were amazing! As well the staffs were friendly!
author: Guy H.

description:
A lot of the time, hotel bars can be cheesey, tourist traps, but The View somehow escapes this. Granted, the food and drinks are not inexpensive by any means, but at least the presentation is upscale and well done. 

At 5ish on a work day, I found a mostly business crowd taking in the gorgeous views from the 39th floor and sipping wine and cocktails. Seating is first-come, first serve, so you want to get here early if you want to nab a prime window seat.
author: Margs K.

description:
Awesome city-view, lovely atmosphere, friendly staff, & good-limited selection.
Would definitely visit again.
author: Ali A.

description:
Best hotel bar I've been to in a while (similar to the Clift Hotel lounge but more laid back). The views are spectacular and the space is really beautiful especially at sunset. 

Lots of seating but can get crowded around dinner time. Arrive a little early for one of the coveted window seats for privacy and a stunning panoramic view of the city. 

One star off because the food was disappointing. Pork belly came with three measly pieces in a weird soup/broth. Mezze was tasty but portion was small for the price. Eat dinner elsewhere and come for a drink and a snack. I had a lovely Qupe Syrah and my friend had a tasty old fashioned.

Will definitely be back! Nice place to impress a date or bring someone from out of town.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I never knew Batman lived on the 39th floor of the Marriott until I discovered the View.

Every detail right down to the illuminated menus + checks is sleek and sophisticated. Drinks are club prices (around 15 for a cocktail and 8 for beer) but I'd much rather be feasting my eyes on the gorgeous SF skyline than on some twerkin' mamas. For 15 bucks though I wish their Moscone Mule (same as Moscow mule) were served in a copper mug instead of glass.

I've tried a few of their small plates and would suggest that you eat somewhere else. Their smoked pork belly with daikon + miso is pretty good but you only get four pieces for 18 bucks.
Finding a table can get difficult on weekends but you'll snag one in due time if you scope out those closing out. 

It's hard not to feel like a baller sipping on your drink in such a swanky bar. Get a window seat and pat yourself on the back, because everyone deserves nights like this :)
author: Jenny Q.

description:
I love the view! 
Look at it! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2#7EoETHPcv9xG8OKNcuolIg 
How can you not love it?!

A great place to go when I want to have a drink (or maybe multiple in my case) and enjoy a view of the city I live in. Of course, at times, food is needed to counteract the alcohol, so they have a bar menu of small plates and other dishes.

June 2013
*Mac and cheese ($13) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2#NKASto7glS1JFtdOAhWYpA
*Fried rice ($15) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2#-ZrJBvGi5kFHd1pJaII7Eg
*Tuna tartare ($16) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2#Nxdnh_Ju6IQQ9TFH4GACzA

The food is nothing to write home about. It just serves as a snack when people are hungry. But a drink and the view? That's amazing. Great place to take out of towners as well. The View, I know you're temporarily closed now. But when you reopen, I will be back!
author: Elena N.

description:
The View is located on the 39th floor of the Marriott hotel. You just have to walk past the lobby and into the elevators. This place is actually not that known in my opinion. I've met people who have lived in San Francisco for years and have never been here!

This is the place where I try to take my friends who have never been to San Francisco. The breathtaking 360 view is surreal especially at night.

Yes, this place can be packed. However, if you go here during a weekday, it's not as bad as you think. I finally was able to sit down here with my friends and grabbed a drink. I got the Moscone Mule which consisted of vodka and ginger beer. It was pretty strong, but it was good at the same time. For someone who likes sweet drinks, this was made brilliantly.

I definitely recommend coming here and bringing your friends. Be aware that the drinks are pricey but hey, you pay for the view right?
author: Aj C.

description:
Came here after a nice dinner out. What an amazing place. 

You walk in, have two sides of amazing views. It HSS a great modern feel to it. Comfortable couches, chairs, but also a minimalist vibe. Sort of the luck of the draw I imagine if you can get a window spot on a busy night. 

The drinks were well done and the staff was amazingly attentive.

They have a small app/tapas menu but I didn't indulge so I can't comment on that. 

Absolutely worth a stop again.
author: Sean M.

description:
Came here for my birthday on a Thursday night.  Prior to coming here, I read many of the reviews about The View and was very hesitant to come here.  

Found parking across the street in a public garage.  Costed us only $5 by the time we finished.  
Upon entering the lounge, it was very dark and was full at the bar top and all the other lounge tables.  It is quite small I would say. Luckily for me, I stood around for about 10 minutes before a few people got up and I swooped in with my friends right in front of the window.  It was probably around 10:00 pm by this point.  Hands down I would not want to sit anywhere else in this lounge because of the view.  I noticed that people like to camp out for hours on dates, ect.  so I consider you lucky to even try to find a seat in front of the windows.  

Now here is where my friends and I struggled:

Saw a few servers coming around, but only to the same tables.  I wasn't sure if they had been understaffed or not.  We sat for about 20 minutes to see if anyone would take our order, waving around obnoxiously because servers just love that from customers... before my starving friend marched over to the bar to order drinks and apps there. May I mention no one cleaned off our table after we sat down...so that was a little gross.  The bartenders were extremely nice.  Our food was delivered after about 10 minutes which was pretty fast.  Apps were fine, small portions and a little pricey.

So overall, I would have given 5 stars if there were more service at our table.
author: B E.

description: Beautiful view, but really expensive drinks and apps. Recommend if you want to bring someone from out of town for a drink, but don't stay for longer than one drink. Gets really crowded, so you have to get there right when it opens.
author: Rachel K.

description: Drinks are great, service is TERRIBLE.. our waitress was purposely avoiding us.. take our advice and sit at the bar, bartenders are GREAT plus you'll avoid all the tons of pesky gnats flying around annoying the crap out of you sitting by the windows
author: Flora S.

description: I think this place is best to visit during the day or during sunset, the night time views aren't as good as I thought they would be. It gets pretty crowded and not all tables have a nice window view. There are tables that line the windows, but you'll have to wait for those. The drink prices were pretty typical for SF, $15 cocktails and $7-8 beers.
author: Elaine N.

description:
The View is just that - an amazing view. It's honestly one of the finest public vistas in the city, with a beautiful panorama of downtown, the bay and the Bay Bridge. I highly suggest taking in the sites at dusk, just after the sun falls behind the horizon. 

But a good view does not necessarily mean a good overall experience. I discovered this on my last visit while catching up with some old friends. No matter the day of the week, happy hour is EXTREMELY crowded. Unless you know someone or have a reservation, expect to stand around awkwardly, staring down seated guests until they leave and then racing to sit down before someone else does. And depending on where you are seated, you'll get the benefit of being at butt level with the next round of guests hoping to claim your seats. 

The food is decent but comes in super small portions for the price. As one would expect, the cocktails are well-made but also a pretty penny. It's really all about the view, and it is a spectacular one at that.
author: Alex L.

description: I came here with my boyfriend on our anniversary and I honestly fell in love with this place. It's located on the 39th floor of hotel Marriott.  Seats are first come first serve but there was this really nice server who actually went out of his way to seat us next to the window where the amazing city view was. Food and drinks are a bit pricey but worth the money! Skyline punch was a bit strong but I loved it!
author: Tracy N.

description:
Place is amazing, worth the fame for The View!

Drinks could improve for that level.
Vodka and Cranberry-Smirnoff vodka with cranberry where I couldn't really taste the vodka much, was $12! Ok... But at least change the level of alcohol bases you pick.. 

.
author: Pranamee S.

description:
Great place to bring family and friends. If it is their first time here, it will blow their eyeballs out of their head!  The view can not be beat. Go go go. You will put your friends/family and even yourself in "awestruck mode."

Go here!!
author: Daniel S.

description: Thank you Yelp, once again you sent me to a fabulous place. If you ever get a chance yelpers, check this place out.
author: Patrick D.

description: Came here for my birthday.  I had friends in from Los Angeles and New York to celebrate.  After waiting nearly 20 minutes to order our drinks, the waiter returned and spilled them on us.  Although there was no apology, we were fine and understood as the venue was rather crowded and it seemed he was overwhelmed.  On his return he once again spilled the drinks on us, this time directly on my girlfriend.  Although management came over, there was no apology.  We paid our full tab and had to head back to change out of our soaked outfits. The fact that there was no apology provided by the waiter nor his manager, we were pretty upset and just called it a night.
author: Eddie M.

description: excellent views of downtown SF. Large space to accomodate a lot of people.
author: Melinda M.

description: Breathtaking views of the city. Good service. A little crowded for a saturday afternoon but worth it. Try to be there at 4pm sharp, because the window tables are taken fast. Over all a good experience.
author: Harold F.

description: All in all a good spot with a great view. The drinks are good and the dj did his/her thing. Unfortunately, the bar staff is a little pretentious and haughty...
author: Samuel R.

description: Located on the top floor of the Marriott Marquis, this place had amazing views of the city. There are floor to ceiling windows on both sides of the lounge with comfy couches to relax on. It is a great atmosphere to meet with coworkers, or hang out with friends. I would say the food menu is limited, and is mostly just small dishes to snack on. The drink menu is larger than the foods and serves a good variety. The prices are high, but that didn't surprise me. The Cosmopolitan was well made and the desserts ordered were tasty. My favorite would be the trio of cheesecakes, with 3 different flavors. We also tried the cheesy bread, which came out warm with melted cheese and a sweet butter. This isn't somewhere to expect to have dinner and get full, but it is a great atmosphere to hang out and enjoy some snacks and drinks.
author: Khoi N.

description:
The View is beautiful!  It's at the top of the Mariott.  The view of SF is absolutely stunning, especially on a clear night, and the ambiance is very very nice.  The only downside is it is self seating and on a weekend it gets packed, so be quick to snag a seat when you see one available or be comfy enough to share a booth with some others.  With so many people, it takes some time to put your order in...so once you get the chance, be sure to order right away!  They are really nice and do their best to accommodate everyone.  

There are only small bites available, and the food is fine- nothing to rave about.  Seriously though, LBR, if that was really why people came here... this place would be called The Food.
author: Lyn C.

description: Amazing view. My wifey loved the surprise so much. Best place to celebrate some special events. Best to come before sunset time so you can enjoy both day and night view. Loved Skyline punch among cocktails. Waiter was kinda rude, indirectly asking people to leave to accommodate people waiting.
author: Yash D.

description: Great place to enjoy the views of San Francisco but come early if you want a window seat. Good selection of beer and wine and the music fits the ambiance. I prefer sitting on the right side as you enter away from the bar and crowds. Loves the chocolate deserts.
author: Gerald H.

description:
My go-to bar whenever I have guests in town. The name is so fitting. The views are incredible and even better at night.

Very modern, sleek and lively atmosphere...even on a rainy Sunday. The bar is always packed when I go and it's impossible to snag a table. Service is very slow, but the waiters will make their rounds. The cocktails are great. They're on the pricier side, but worth the experience.
author: Helen C.

description: I love The View--a coworker who has exceptional taste (she and I have very similar palates) had raved about this bar so it was only appropriate that my final choice for having a mini birthday hurrah was The View! I believe I had posted pictures around the time of my actual visit, but all of the shared plates were spectacular. The cocktails were very well made and I think I would come here again. All the seats near the big windows get filled quickly so I felt like a hawk trying to scoop out a table. I never expected that such a nice bar existed above the Marriott, but I'm really glad it does. I think the prices were extremely fair for the quality and taste of the food and drinks. The service can be quite slow at times and it seemed like they were understaffed for the volume of people that were there on a Saturday night. But hey, still totally worth the visit.
author: Denise L.

description:
I'd been itching to visit The View after, well, seeing how fantastic the view is! We rolled in at 5 pm on a Saturday night to find a completely full house (I didn't realize people get started drinking that early, my mistake!).

THE GOOD.
+ Simply gorgeous view of the city
+ Solid cocktails (and a fully stocked bar)
+ Extensive menu of bar bites

THE BAD.
- Noise level here is bananas
- Actually getting a table is a feat in itself (prepare to stalk tables for anywhere from 20-40 minutes, if you're lucky)
- Pricey pricey

I didn't really like having to hover and be aggressive in order to get a table, nor was it fun to be loosely surrounded by other people eyeing your table like hawks. You don't really get any intimate or quiet moments, and the room is at a dull roar at all times (with some pretty terrible club music blasting non-stop). Pretty sure you can find a better bar with a decent view without trying this hard!
author: Claire S.

description:
Before I start this review, must confess that I secretly dislike SF. Call it rivalry for a few SoCal resident, not certain if we are envious or just darn competitive. The majority of SoCal residents get along with SF locals but there are a few slim pickings that hold grudges. As to why visiting the SF, thats another story, occasionally I do suck it up and follow the stream.

During our night of escapades, we wondered through the downtown area for a bar to start off the night. Randomly a friend of mine asked a complete stranger for a spot. He mentioned the View at the Marriott, the concept at any bar at a hotel didn't sound astonishing to me. But at this point, any bar would be great. Prior to this we have been walking for hours and no longer had any common sense left in me.

So as we dragged ourselves through downtown even more, we arrived to this lavish hotel. The main lobby was crowded with guests and tourists. Quickly jumped into an elevator that led to the 39th floor. The doors opened up to this huge dinning area. The interior was dimly lit with a bar right in the center. Couches and tables were spread over the area. But one thing that was most impressive was the view. You could see clear down to the east bay with the bridge lit up and sky scrapers blistering lights from the offices.

It was one of the few moments that I was truly impressed. No longer did I despise this great city or held any kind of resentment for visiting SF. The view was picturesque with elaborate glass windows that covered up to the high ceilings. The waitress here was attentive and quite friendly. Drinks were pretty good, they have a long list of items. To end it all after a long day, this was the perfect spot, can only imagine the ambiance during sunsets. Kudos to the designer of this place.
author: Enrique G.

description: Every time we stay in the city we stay at the Marriot. And every time we stay there we go to the view bar every night. It's beautiful and the ambiance  is great. It's pricey cocktails but not crazy for SF. Best view in the city I'd say
author: Steve J.

description:
For the view alone, you *have* to come here.  You might have seen me.  I was the girl with her head pressed up to the window trying to take in every inch of skyline that I could possibly see.  When I was done with one area, I scooted around to the other sections of the lounge and squeezed my way into the glass so that I could do the same.  

Once I was done being pressed up against the window, I turned into the tourist snapping at pictures of the skyline.   Most of them were deleted because they didn't do the place justice. (Hence why I didn't post them up here.)  

Since I don't drink I can't comment on obscenely high prices for alcohol.  As far as I could tell, everything was *free* for me because all I was drinking was water.  Yay me right?!  I did however tip the waiters because they refilled my water for me as soon as I would gulp them down.
author: Lorie N.

description:
Located on the 39th floor of the Marriott Marquis hotel, this bar/lounge offers amazing panoramic views of San Francisco. I came here on a Friday night around 8:30pm and surprisingly, there were a few seats by the windows available. However, that could also be because it was drizzling outside. When we left about an hour later, it was a lot more packed. 

Yes, the cocktails are a little on the pricier side ($14-$16), but they are strong and delicious. I got the skyline punch which was fruity and sweet, and I felt the "effects" afterwards.
author: Joanne K.

description:
Amazing View of the city from 39th floor of the Marriott hotel! The View has two sides, one mainly facing the bay near the bay bridge, and the other side to the city hall, which was closed for private event the day we went.

Getting a table could be challenging, there is room for standing but might not be ideal after a day of work. We had to look around for a few minutes and luckily got a table by the window after a group leaving, but honestly it was a bit stressful.

I got Skyline Punch, tasty with rum and pineapple juice among other fruit juices. Would come back checking out the other side of the View or sunset!
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Like the other reviews said, you're paying for the view via drinks. 

If you've never been here, I'd definitely recommend a trip at least once! The view really is amazing. It looks out to the east side of downtown, and the bay bridge. Cocktails were on the pricey side (14-16ish per drink), but is worth the experience. Seating is by first come first serve basis, so can be a little tricky if it is busy. We were lucky and grabbed at table just as people were leaving. Some people kind of "created their own tables" by grabbing empty chairs people weren't using. Service was ok; the waitress didn't really check on us.

We didn't try any food, but it all looked and smelled delicious. I'm definitely willing to go back for the gorgeous views of the city.
author: Gina P.

description: I have never had poorer service.  Our server and the bartender couldn't have had worse attitudes.   Go for the view.
author: Cameron B.

description: Came here once for (casual) sunday afternoon drinks and it is beauuutiful. It does feel like this place has more window seating than top of the mark does, though that might just be me. Lots of varied cocktail drinks, we also got the charcuterie plate (less cheese but more charcuterie than expected). Waiters are friendly and attentive. Great place for a quiet drink with friends or an intimate night with a date.
author: Michelle L.

description: This lounge has great views of the City along with good cocktails. My husband and I went in a Thursday and it was packed, however we had opportunities to snag great seating while there.
author: Shanee W.

description:
This was a nice spot to show an out-of-towner a skyline view of SF. Very slow to start on the service. The drinks are pricey but you can find something you'll like, and some of the small plates were surprisingly good!

THE WAIT: None at 7:30pm on a Sunday. There were several semi-communal areas open, though none right at the windows. After sitting for 20 minutes or so, we saw a group leave their window seats and after ok-ing it with our sever, we moved that way. 

THE CROWD: Pretty relaxed and quiet. There were a couple girls who'd gotten pretty drunk at the bar, one of whom hiked her skirt up until her underclothing (and basically most of her bottom) was showing; she was being pretty showy, laughing loudly with her friend, and taking some butt selfies. I saw several other customers glancing at her with kind of offended looks. I was surprised she wasn't at least politely asked by the staff to cover up or be a little more decent.

THE SERVICE: As the last time I came, pretty terrible. We sat first in a couch area and saw several servers walk by, ignoring us. It was difficult to even flag someone down. No biggie, it gave us a chance to move to a better table. Once there, we were very clearly looking around for someone to take our order. With much effort, we got a server who wasn't in our section and she was about to take our order.

MUST-HAVES: None of our drinks were outstanding, but to my surprise, a couple of the small plates were. 

COCKTAILS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#T29wSeXdNnX9FoQO7_UR2g
* Skyline Punch (captain morgan white rum, pineapple juice, fresh citrus juice, brandied grenadine. $14) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#ie9ESo7JccS3TtfC2M4f8g
Sweet, fairly well balanced but a little on the strong side. Like a fancy fruit punch. Definitely a tropical vibe.

SMALL PLATES: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#OzkWXngwWV4kem3e6lc_7g
* Smoked Duck Breast Pastrami (chicories, winter citrus, medjool date puree. $12) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#u-EMNdjwCvIvdkZmxHYuGA
While the slices of duck breast were thick and juicy, they were pretty lackluster as they were served cold on the salad and didn't have much of a smoked flavor. This was basically like the Organic Green Salad with a few slabs of meat thrown on top.

* Ahi Tuna "Poke Style" (sesame crackers, seaweed salad. $16) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#e_FIQTby015rU9sFmPoDwQ
Delicious! I'd swear that was smoked and not the Duck Breast above. The sesame crackers had a strong toasted flavor, and was a perfect complement to the tuna. I discovered the seaweed salad only in my last few bites, but that was a great addition too. To be a little picky, the fish did have a little bit of a heavy, slimy texture, but that's just me trying to find a small reason I'm not giving it 5 stars.

* Organic Green Salad (winter citrus, candied pecans, redwood hill feta, black garlic vinaigrette. $8) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg
This is simple and has tried and true ingredients that work well together. I think the vinaigrette could've been a tad thicker, and there could be more orange slices to add that sweet acidity. If you feel like having a salad, this is a good one, but don't go out of your way to order it (especially since it's not super filling). 

* Smoked Beef Carpaccio (dijonnaise, fried capers, chives. $12) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#EJCY4orux02-yO4a7AXX_g
I didn't expect to like this at all, but this was as fantastic as the Ahi Tuna! The meat was very soft, like a very tender prosciutto, and the smoked flavor was intense. It was further enhanced by the capers, dijonnaise, and chives (I don't even like capers normally!). 

* Slow Braised Pork Belly (braised daikon, miso glaze. $18) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=yfSF_CLrbloK-MA7ezLxIg#WYIlitw0x82xPvlvBTMTeg
Two of us shared the four small plates and it still wasn't enough for a full dinner. The only thing left on the menu that looked filling was the Pork Belly. It did its job of filling us up, but it was pretty lackluster. The pork belly pieces were thick and fatty, but being in a broth, they lost any crisp they once had. The broth was boring and just had tiny pieces of daikon floating around. It's just a weird dish because you don't really eat big chunks of pork belly with broth, and when you get through that you're left with this boring broth on its own. Maybe something as simple as a slice of bread would've made that last part more appetizing.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
"Whoa, check out The View!" -- Is what you might say as you exit the elevator on the top floor of the Marriot hotel in SF.

"Whoa, check out The View!" -- Is what you also might say once you've experienced the service, ambiance, cocktails and nibbles on the top floor of the Marriot Hotel in SF

I love a good double entendre as much as the next person but they don't always make the most sense (at least one side doesn't) but thankfully the reason for naming this must see lounge what it is, in fact for the same reason you might think; the beautiful unobstructed VIEW of San Francisco.

In addition to The View's epic vantage, it also has fairly decent snack bites as well and average cocktails - definitely not the best, but not the worst. I went in on an Old Fashioned and was essentially something close to bourbon on the rocks with an orange twist.

This is a one cocktail, take a few pictures and leave sorta place, but definitely a must see on a trip to the City By The Bay!
author: Kris U.

description:
How have I not reviewed my favorite bar in San Francisco? 

This was the first bar I ever came to when I moved here so it set the bar high. I return the favor and bring lots of out of towners/ new residents here to take in our beautiful city. 

This place is usually filled with business travelers & locals avoiding the bar scene so there aren't people stepping on my shoes and falling all over the place. It's an intimate grown up bar where the music is always great, usually deep house/ chill Edm. 

Being so high up and taking in all of San Francisco doesn't hurt either... There's a reason this place is called The View. 

Drink prices are modest for the ambience you get, I advise bottle service so that you get some room to stretch out. Shout out to Veronica, she's the sweetest bar tender there and always makes the best drinks. 

Then if you convince yourself that you want to go out after you're literally a few minutes from all the best night clubs. Hop in a black car and go!
author: Alan M.

description: The view is amazing!  Getting a seat is difficult.  Getting a seat next to the window is even harder.  We got lucky people were leaving as we walked by.  The ambience is perfect for a date or for a group.  Highly recommend for anyone visiting or local.
author: Candice S.

description:
Really nice place me and my boyfriend really liked it. The view of the bay is just amazing 
Worth going to if ever in the Bay Area
author: Marla M.

description: This place had awesome views and pretty yummy drinks. The prices were to be expected for cocktails (about $15) and mine was actually good (I got the skyline punch I think it was called). The only downside was how crowded it was. My bf and I could only stand and couldn't find a seat so had to awkwardly look over people to see the view
author: Lauren K.

description: Classy place that doesn't intimidate. Super casual vibe with breathtaking views of San Francisco Downtown. Cocktails are strong and tasty. The house made chips were delicious. I'd love to come back here earlier in the evening to see the sunset.
author: Rucha B.

description:
I hesitated writing this review, because I feel like it's all been said. What a view! Pricy, yet delicious cocktails! Delicious snacks! Comfy seats! But with a view like this, it's worth saying again. 

This is one place that fires up tourists and locals alike. I have many opinions about beautiful SF, not all glowing, but eff me. When you look at her stretched out from bay to bay through two gorgeous windows, she looks pretty spectacular. 

If you're visiting the bay area or just need to fall back in love with your city, consider having a little cocktail break high in the sky above the SOMA/Union Square area. On a clear day you can see forever (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yxf1IFgPH5s).
author: Evelyn A.

description:
This is where you go when you want to impress out of town guests. The window seats are hard to come by but so worth it. Drinks are ok, nothing special but service is friendly! 
Parking is available at the metro garage nearby.
author: Conny F.

description: Nice views, window seating is difficult grab but standing next pub table you get awesome views Bay Bridge and East Bay.
author: Eric S.

description:
So San Francisco doesn't have many places with a great view... But this place... Simply amazing!
39 floors which opens the view towards every little part of the city, you can get here drinks or just little snacks, appetizers or salads and enjoy the view!
author: Irina P.

description: Come here through the Marriot Hotel.  If you want prime seating (the main attraction of The View) come right when they open so you're not waiting for the tables near the window.  If you come right before sunset it's just beautiful.  They also serve food here, but who comes here for that.  Hahhaa.
author: Darylynn D.

description:
Perfect view. Perfect ambiance. Perfect at night. 
I never really appreciate how much I love the city. How privileged I am to just take an elevator up to the top of my local hotel building and feel like I'm on top of the world. 
These are all the feels that the view gives me. 

Even though the drinks and the bites are overpriced ($15 for a Manhattan. $6 for bread and butter) nothing compares to the nostalgia of high rises and heels. 

Great for a girls night out or a romantic date night. It's very small and intimate so you can actually have a conversation and enjoy each other's company. Parking is easy. Tons of garages around the area or street.
author: Alyssa P.

description:
the name says it all... the view! 

it really is a cool place to check out... when you do come... do expect tables/chairs to be nearly gone, there are no reservations, no cover, so.. you can really just come up and check it out.. soo yes most tables at least all the ones with the view that you want with photos will most likely be gone... if this is what you are looking for.. then be ready to play the table hawk game... along with other hawks...

YES.. the views are amazing... the cocktails are good.. they are a bit on the pricey side.. of course if you live in SF.. you probl. know things are on the pricey side... 

i mean other than that... is def. a cool place to come and check out.. maybe grab a drink... food wise, wasn't all that impressive... they were out of poke the first time I went. I will updated my review, once I have the chance to try other items from the menu.
author: Cesar C.

description: Wonderful cocktails. Great apps selections. Fun atmosphere to relax with friends and enjoy a beautiful view of San Francisco - that is if you're one of the few lucky enough to get there early enough to get a window seat. If you are lucky to get one, sit on the east side of the building. As the other side gets hot with the heat from the sun blaring down on the building as it sets. Other than having to continuously remind our server to bring our second round of drinks and apps today I truly enjoyed my time here with my friends and will return on my next visit to San Francisco!
author: Cindy B.

description: OMG I love this place. I`ve been there ones but ill defiantly will go back. great VIEW and wonderful atmosphere . Nice and creative cocktails, good service. Love it
author: Christina W.

description: very expensive but great view! good spot to take out of town guests. I would eat at Delifinas or The Keystone downstairs.
author: Mike T.

description:
Awesome 360 degree view on San Francisco!! If you go during dinner it could be really romantic. I however went late at night during the bar hour. It was really racked, there's a guy who checks your ID'S right when you get off the elevator. Yes I said elevator because it is at the top of a hotel, pretty sick!
Even with it being so late at night the view is still pretty bangin' with all the lights from the city.
There is a ton of chairs and tables for any size group to go and just chill there, but they get taken pretty quickly so you gotta be on the look out for any open seats around.
There's a wait staff that goes to each table and takes orders as well so you do not have to go up and fight your way up at the bar.
author: Jason D.

description: One of the best city view bars in San Francisco. I recently checked out the Hilton Top Floor bar and the lighting was too harsh and bright and the service really poor in comparison to this place. The View has a great vibe and good service.
author: Alex G.

description: Great place for a first date. The food and drink was good but the view was amazing. Have to get their early to get a good seat through
author: O K.

description: After always wondering about this place, I stepped in for a glass of bubbly and I am not disappointed! They do have a limited selection of sparkling wine, but their Moet Imperial is the best! The view was great, but I stayed at the bar. It was a Thursday night and quite busy and full of life!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description: Great atmosphere with a fantastic view of the city. Located in the Marriott a hotel and a great place to come grab drinks and hang out with friends or with your significant other . The food and drinks were a bit pricy but your pretty much paying for the view, so enjoy :)
author: Jennie Y.

description:
First come first serve.

Waited for over 3 hours for the window seats 
Still didn't get it.

Drink was great. 

Hope I can get a window seat on my next visit.

By the way it was a Monday night and packed!!
author: Mack A.

description: This is probably one of my favorite places I ever been. Nice atmosphere, people and food. A plate of cheese and a good glass of wine with and amazing view is a must. Definitely recommended.
author: Alina C.

description:
AMAZING SPOT.

The view at night is awesome. Such a great date spot.

The only thing I would say is I wish that they had more seating, but I plan on going back next time I'm in town.
author: Mel L.

description:
Lo and behold, you enter the lobby of a decked out hotel called The Marriott. Inside you see glossed out walls of black and gold. Important people are here. People who wear fancy clothes and jackets made of materials that isn't the same as t-shirts or jeans. They probably even shower at least once a day. These are the elite. Walking in with less than $100 in your bank account could ruin you. Luckily, there's always The View.

The Chase

If you're skilled enough you can stare at the ground and rush towards the elevator to stab at the 38th floor button rapidly. As you stare awkwardly at the ascending floor numbers like we all do in elevators, you find relief when the doors open and within the frame of the elevator opening you see what can only be described as the cockpit of the Millennium Falcon. This is The View, the high rise bar and lounge on the top floor of The Marriott. 

Deco

With a large half circle window looking out to the city below this beautiful bar has no bad seat. Individual black chairs and mini sofas are placed strategically towards the windows. Small square tables are found closer to the interior of the lounge. The wall closest to the elevator contains a square black bar top where the bartenders reside. The bar wall is a mirror that allows each drinker to stare back out to the city between the spaces of bottled spirits. It's all very stylized design where simple is clean and open is all seeing.

Bartenders

I wasn't too impressed with the bartenders. Though they did have knowledge of different cocktails you could tell they've grown complacent with the clientele coming through. They had a lackadaisical attitude when it came to service. Even when it wasn't busy they seemed more interested in their own conversations than the customers. Maybe I was expecting more than I should but I find it sad to see such a great place have such uninspired bartenders.

Price

When you come to this place you think it will be very expensive but it isn't any different than the price menu of most of the bars in the city. That's still an average of around $15 per cocktail, $8 per glass of beer, and about $14 per glass of wine so it's still expensive but for the view you get of the city the price is a bargain.

Conclusion

San Francisco has so much to offer when it comes to bars and hotels. Without even trying you're bound to stumble upon a good one. But finding a bar that feels special even within Union Square, especially inside a chain hotel, is even better. The View has one of the most breathtaking outlooks to San Francisco and looks great during the day or at night. Though the service itself might be lacking, once you get yourself a cold drink you can soak up the city from an eagle's point of view and be king/queen for the day.
author: Sammy B.

description:
Awesome place!!

I learned about The View Lounge because I follow Marriott on Instagram. I knew I had to check this special location out. We tried to go one day but then realized it didn't open until 4:00. We came back later in the week (last night of vacation). I'm SO happy we did!  The view is amazing and you can sit in these cozy areas and enjoy the gorgeous views. 

Make sure and arrive right at 4:00 when they open (or even a few minutes before 4:00) because the entire place filled up quickly. We loved the view and it was a memorable way to end our fantastic week in San Fran. The drinks were great. My son devoured the peanut butter crunch cake.  My husband and I enjoyed martinis and ate the Baked Laura and it was delicious!  It was not a cheap place but so worth it because of the fantastic view. 

I rated it 4 stars just because the service was slow. I don't fault the staff because they were all working hard. I think they need more cocktail waitresses.
author: Leslie B.

description: Really great view for a late night drink, but the cocktails themselves were not very good...way too sweet, and the place was absolutely packed, but it was a Saturday night so that's to be expected.  If you want a cool view of the city tho then it's worth checking out.
author: Fiona R.

description: Been wanting to check this place out for ages! We came by super early around 4pm, since we heard that the line up becomes long after. The place filled up very quickly, but luckily we were able to get pretty good seats by the window. There was an amazing view of the city, and the cocktails were on point. We got the skyline punch and rock old fashion.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Amazing place!!! Highly recommend.
Good for travelers, couples, or if you just want to have a drink and to have a good atmosphere.
author: Dima P.

description: This place has an Amazing view. We didn't make a reservation, but got in and got one of the city-view seats after waiting for about 20 minutes and snagging it from the person sitting there. Good drinks with the best view of the city.
author: Hallie E.

description:
Apparently, SF has a quite a number of rooftop bars, and I think if you are looking for an ambient, chill atmosphere with great views of the northern and southern portion of the city, come up to the 39th floor of the Marriott on 4th and Mission. 

They offer wines, cocktails, beers, and other small foods, so this place is most appropriate to knock a few back and enjoy great conversation among friends, or with clients, or even with a date. I ordered their SOMA spritzer ($14), which consisted of an organic mionetto prosecco (Italian sparkling white wine), with blueberries and raspberries. The whole drink went well together, and I enjoyed sipping down on it slowly as our group conversed and had a chill time. We also ordered the yellowfin tuna "poke style" and ceviche, which were both solid "small dishes". 

One star off for the prices...unless you make more-than-decent money, this is not a place to frequent often (unless they offer happy hour, which if they did, I wasn't aware of). In any case, this place is solid. Make sure you aim for a seat next to the window!
author: Viet N.

description:
OMG they weren't kidding the view at The View is amazing and worth every penny. 

If you're near here and have some time to kill to grab a drink, like I did, then you should absolutely do it. First off, the building looks like something from Gotham City and the rooftop is as magnificent as you could imagine. The inside is a hotel so you won't look strange strolling on through and taking the elevator to the top. 

The View has a 360 view of San Francisco from the top. If you're lucky enough you'll be able to get a table right by a window but there isn't a bad seat in the house. When I went it was pretty busy. I imagine it gets crazy all the time from the hotel guests and businesses in the area. 

Drinks are around $15-ish and made nice and strong. Seriously, go here just to get one of the all time best views of San Francisco city.
author: Aaron B.

description: Absolutely love this place. The view of the city is the highlight of this bar. Comfy sofas and single seats assist you in enjoying the view of the city. The food is decent (high prices, but what do expect considering this place offers jaw dropping views). Even tho this place gets pact at night I suggest you enjoy it at night.
author: Marcus M.

description: The atmosphere and ambiance was great. I went there with my friends to get some drinks and have some appetizers. But when I was about to eat the salad I ordered I noticed that the kitchen left on the sticker of the tomato which is completely unacceptable!  This kind of ruined the experience for me.
author: Izzy N.

description:
Yesterday my husband and I went here to pregame before dinner around 630. This view is seriously breathtaking, but good luck finding a seat near the window. We ordered drinks at the bar, 2 High rise Cosmos 15 each. Not bad, but I'm figuring you're paying for the View. The drinks were strong and tasty! We took our drinks to the rear area and socialized with a few tourist.

The crowd was quiet, but I have a strange feeling people of color don't come here too often. We received a lot of unwanted stares, but hey it is what it is. If you're sensitive to that sort of thing, I would avoid hanging here. Jessica was one of the hostess and she was amazing! She really made us feel welcome and offered to take pictures for us! I really appreciate that type of hospitality.

We didn't get a chance to order food because we're running late for our dinner plans, but we'll definitely be back.
author: Shauncy J.

description:
::. San Francisco, California .::

Among those hidden gems in San Fransisco! 

The view is a great sight to see.

Much better during the day for pictures; the night scene can be a bit dim. 

- Easily accessible.
- Highly recommended.
- The bar itself is a bit cramp.
- The dinner tables are not.
- No reservations! First come first served. 

The lounge area is not as large as it seems, you'll have to be on your toes if you're looking to sit (although it's not an impossible feat.) My girlfriend and I were there about fifteen minutes before another couple got up and left. This happens frequently, although some parties do linger longer than others. 

-The cocktails here are about double a typical cocktail price, but the beer is quite reasonable at $7 or so. 

Great place for a drink, maybe a snack and a picture. Then bounce and give others a chance to enjoy! 

P.S. Parking down the street in the parking structure across from Target was very convenient and only cost a few dollars. Also gives you a chance to take a nice stroll.
author: Steven C.

description: This place is incredible. They don't call it the view for nothing people. The view of San Francisco is stunning, especially if you can catch the sunset. It's usually very busy during the sunset, and if you've ever seen it from here you'll know why. Usually I go just to grab a cocktail, usually if you stand around long enough you'll be able to catch someone leaving and steal their table next to the windows. I wouldn't plan on a sit down dinner at this time, just due to the sheer number of people. The drinks are expensive yes, but you pay for the view. Pun intended.
author: christina m.

description:
While I think the television version of The View is awful, this version is pretty spectacular. 

If you're anywhere near the Marriott hotel, go there immediately and hit the top floor. The View really lives up to its name. It's worth a visit to have a drink and enjoy the beautiful scenery. The windows look like something straight out of Gotham City. I looked for Bruce Wayne and Batman, but didn't see either. 

I did my usual dirty (as in filthy dirty) martini and enjoyed the chill vibe with my co-workers. My girl Emily loved her Old Fashioned. Prices are pretty much comparable to the other places around here. Good service from both the bartenders and servers while we were here. (Yes, we were that group. All over the place)

This will be a must visit spot for me every time I am in San Fran for work. Such a fabulous way to enjoy the city.
author: Nikki W.

description: This place is so cool, but getting a seat can be tricky, especially on the weekend.  That said, it is aptly named as the view is incredible.  Drinks are a little pricey but it's a hotel bar with a view so it's pretty expected.  Just enjoy the view and consider the drinks to be a "service fee".
author: Greta R.

description:
Wow, What a View!

The View is located at the top of the Marriott. It is a restaurant/bar. They offer full bar drinks, beer and bar food and more advanced dishes unique in taste. The food ranges from cheese and fruit to tuna tar tar and sliders. 

Is the menu expensive? You bet! The menu and bar items are pricier than most. That being said, there are several TVs and you can watch various games. The bathroom is smaller and I had to wait to pee. So, plan ahead for any bathroom break. 

The View-5 Stars!
Wow, wow and wow! You have a full unobstructed view of at least 75% of the city ranging from Downtown to the Golden Gate side.
