The view is spectacular and makes the cost of the food and drinks and waiting to pee worth it. The view up here is definitely in the top 10 list of amazing views of the city. I bet you can sit up here with just water and they won't mind.

Overall, everything is average except the service was good and the view..Amazing!

Good luck with parking. At the hotel it's expensive. If you are in the area, this is a place to stop by just for the amazing view!

I am a fan.
author: Nick H.

description: Great spot for a private party! Lots of cozy seating options. Fast, friendly service.
author: Kim C.

description:
Located on the 39th floor of the SF Marriott Marquis Hotel. What makes this lounge so great is the beautiful view of the city! However, the whole lounge is indoors which I guess is better since it's usually so cold in SF. It's not exactly my definition of a rooftop bar since it's not an open patio-type rooftop lounge like Perch in LA, but it was still pretty nice. Come here if you're looking for a lounge with a classy vibe, on the quieter side. 

Drinks are on the expensive side since it IS a hotel lounge. I think cocktails were around $14 each. I tried a Moscow Mule which was slightly too tart for me but overall enjoyable. There's tables near the glass windows where you can really see the view, and there's other plush sofas which are comfy but farther from the window. Overall a good amount of seats. 

The only thing I didn't like about this place was the weird lighting. It was abnormally bright in a lot of random sections in the lounge. Made the lounge seem a little tacky or cheesy.
author: Diana I.

description: Man...I hate to be an asshole and I usually give everyone a pretty good review but everything about the experience kind of sucked. After a very long wait our food was delivered before we even got drinks. The manager called our room the morning after to inquire about the note I left on the receipt saying that what I wrote was aggressive. I explained that I'm s server and how simple it would've been for her to apologize busy or not. The only reason I gave two stars is because of the follow up. Great view or not we won't be back.
author: Missy C.

description:
With a name like "The View" the view had better be pretty spectacular. And of course it is quite lovely, as most of the other reviews will reflect. I would like to focus on how much I really enjoyed my cocktail though because the Fog City Collins was fabulous. Made with nolets silver gin, st germaine, and cucumber it was refreshing, flavorful, and a wonderful accent to my time spent in the company of lovely people.

Our group also had the good fortune to sample some snacks including the house made beer nuts, the charcuterie plate, and their "cheese display." Although to be fair, the display wasn't left for long to look at.

It definitely is crowded and they have a no reservations policy so you should go early and/or plan on waiting. But, as everyone notes the view is a 5 star experience!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
This is a great place to pop in for a drink purely to admire the view over San Francisco. The view is pretty breathtaking in the main space, and it's obviously really popular with tourists who want to check it out. 

We were just in for a quick drink - the Karl the Fog cocktail was really nice, and I thought our waitress was really helpful and friendly. We also tried out the cheesy bread which was DELICIOUS - really cheesy, really warm and just lovely. 

Prices are high, but you're paying for the view. I recommend just going for one drink and taking all your photos, then heading somewhere a bit less expensive and that doesn't feel so much like a chain hotel bar.
author: Briony C.

description: Worst service ever. 40 minutes to get a drink and looked like normal rush. The drinks were ok nothing fancy.
author: Sahib S.

description:
This place has the most beautiful view, ever. 

I stayed at the Marriott Marquis Hotel (which is where the View is located) and simply went up just to see the view at The View ;) haha, get it?

I will be back and check your bar + kitchen out soon.
author: Loni L.

description:
Oh, my gosh the View has such a GREAT view!!! Although I can't say much about the food (I came right after the SF Beer Fest and was so full on brew and lunch), I can definitely vouch for the service and the view. 

I believe the View is on the 39th floor of the Marriott. The location is absolutely prime, as you can see as far as the eye can see. I had dinner the night before at the Cliffhouse and the view was terrible, as it was so foggy and you could barely see the ocean. However, the View has a perfect view of the city and the atmosphere is so quaint, I had such a lovely time.

My friend ordered an Anchor Steam on tap and also chips with a scallion dip. The chips weren't salty and the dip made for the perfect match with the chips. The dip was full of flavor and so made up for the lack of salt in the chips. The total came out to $15, which I think is decent for the view you pay for, along with the great service and food. 

Our waitress was very attentive and friendly. Everyone there is relaxed and there to have a good time. I could tell that not only would locals attend but also tourists went as well. The seating varies throughout the place, as there's some booths that go right next to the windows, but also L-shaped booths that are placed in the middle. I'm almost positive that, no matter where you sit, you are bound to get an amazing view of the city. The ceiling is a dome and the windows reach to the far heights of the ceiling, so you are get this amazing view of the sky and the city down below.

Definitely coming back to try more of the food, thank you so much Marriott! :)
author: Hannah C.

description:
The View is located inside the Marriott and you would probably miss it all together if you weren't looking for it. 

Walking down the streets of SF? Look up! There it is. We found this place on Yelp but couldn't find the entrance until we recognized the huge floor to ceiling window from the photos in the sky. The entrance is tricky and you need a key card to enter from any of the side entrances. Instead of walking all the way around we just found a nice southern lady and told her she would have good karma if she let us in, and she did lol! 

Take the elevator up to the 39th (?) floor and enter a dream world. Swanky, sparkly, sexy and just what you need after a long day at work. The atmosphere is dark and seductive and the SF lights draw your eyes in. This picturesque view is something I would recommend to anyone visiting the city. Don't be fooled by the Marriott (no offense Marriott, many that I have been in have not been very nice) 

The drinks are a bit pricey $14-16. I got a organic prosecco, mixed berries, and st. german cocktail and was surprised to see if served in a rocks glass. Hello bucket of prosecco! The flavor was fresh and crisp, and our group loved it so much we went back again the next night. 

Perfect place for a view, a cheese plate, and frankly any cocktail off their list. This place is my jam.

Highly recommend.
author: Cindy G.

description:
One of the most beautiful venues in SF!

Came here for a date night, then took my gf for a night in the city! It's a classy place, but you find families and casually dressed people there as well.

Came here at 6 pm, and all the best seats near the windows were already taken:( drinks are $$$..

I'd suggest the cheese plate for those who don't care much about beer and cocktails!

Come here to see the sunset, you can get a 360 view up top! Omg so beautiful - check it out!
author: Jean K.

description: This place was awesome! I'm from Miami and am use to top tear premium service and that's exactly what I got when I visited The View Lounge
author: Anastacio R.

description:
I've been to this place a few times with coworkers years ago but never thought of coming back.
The view is definitely nice.  I like that it seemed loud but it's not.
The chairs are comfy and it has mixed crowd.

My friend paid for the drinks when I was here so I wasn't sure how the price goes.
author: Learnee L.

description:
Holy Gatsby! Are you sure any 'ol jane like me can meander in here and order a drink? No glitter ballgown or fur shawls required?? 

Yes? In that case, I'll have the Skyline Punch, because it's summer and pineapple print is in. Follow that up with a cabernet, because we all know I love a deep dry wine and it appears that almost half of the red wine list is made up of cabs so, when in Rome (err, San Fran)... 

To be truly honest though, you can serve me a warm, unsweetened cranberry juice and I'll still be a (mostly) happy camper, because it's The View I'm here for and The View is what I'll come back for.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Came here on a Friday night around 11pm. 
As expected the place was full with no seats available. 
As busy as it was, there was no problem getting a drink at the bar, and eventually we found a seat at a small table for two (no view). 
Bartenders and Servers were all nice and attentive.
Finally snagged a window seat as it got later, but as always ended up on a bar stool closer to all the alcohol.
Will definitely hit The View up again, good crowd and good staff combined with THE VIEW is a can't miss.
author: Justin M.

description:
This classy, no reservations bar lounge offers seating at the bar, comfy lounges for groups of 2-6, and drinks that are priced the same as any other bar. The view at night of the downtown core is great, and I can only imagine it'd be better in the day and at twilight, and would suggest that over the night scene. 

I was also super impressed at how nice and accommodating other patrons were as well- knowing that it's a top tourist destination and that we are all there for the view and drinks, everyone was considerate of taking no more time then necessary so everyone could enjoy the view. In other words, you didn't have to fight your way to the view or for a seat! Just a little patience does the trick.

Try the ice wine!
author: Regina D.

description:
Probably the best SF downtown views. 
Great place for evening drinks but not if you want to eat eat! 

I loved my cocktails and they did have nice ambience.
author: Sowmya S.

description: Beautiful view of San Francisco. I lived here for 5 years and I never got to check it out because I hate taking my car to downtown SF and finding parking sucks too. Now that I've graduated and moved back home, I had the urge to check out the city again. I love the view of seeing the city and also the ocean. I've traveled to Chicago and Hawaii, and been to their rooftop bar and this one is just as nice;however, San Francisco lives up to its name of most expensive city, the cheapest item on their menu was chips.... and that was almost like $10 for chips as appetizer. Even Chicago and Hawaii's rooftop bar had cheaper and better appetizer for a more reasonable price; what can I say... SF is expensive and this place lives up to that name for this city. We got one of their cocktail drink and a beer. The cocktail drink was great, not watered down and had perfect amount of alcohol!
author: Mi V.

description: Great view when there's no fog ;-) ! Nice service, great view on the city and the Alcatraz! We had a few drinks, Sunrise Splash is awesome and the goat cheese with tomato with bread
author: Rachida I.

description:
Our first stop during our recent San Francisco trip was The View. Located on the top floor of The Marriott hotel, it was a quick walk around the corner from our room at The Intercontinental. 

We arrived around 6pm on a Friday and were lucky to grab the last open table. A waitress quickly came by to give us menus and take our drink orders. I felt the drink menu was very basic compared to the other cocktail bars we visited. When paying $16 for a drink, I want it to be slightly more complicated than what I can make at home. In this price range I should not see Bulleit and Captain Morgan on the menu. Alas, my Bulleit Old Fashioned was a basic Old Fashioned with bourbon, simple, and bitters. No different than what I make for myself almost nightly. 

Whatever. We came for "the view". See what I did there?

For food, the three of us split the charcuterie plate which was quite good. Then again, I don't think I've ever had a bad charcuterie plate. Kind of hard to mess up cured meat and cheese. Charcuterie plates have become Lunchables for Hipsters.

Without "the view", this would be a 3 star. But the amazing view and sexy ambience make up for the average food and drinks.
author: Adam F.

description:
Based upon the name you can imagine what this place is all about.

No, not a bunch of whiny women complaining about random stuff!

It's a place to catch an amazing view of San Francisco. 

It's basically a one trick pony because nothing else is that special. 

Located at the top of the Marriot Hotel, you can come here for a meal or just drinks. I didn't get food, so I can't speak about it. I would recommend coming here for one drink, that's it. Soak up that view. Admire it and then get out. The prices are high and the drinks are not impressive.

I arrived after a formal event, so we fit right in. The drinks were $14 each and poorly poorly made. My friend ordered an Old Fashioned, which is what I would have gotten. They had an Dark and Stormy on the menu, so I figured I'd try that. My bartender was about to use a low ball glass for my drink. Dude, it's a Dark and Stormy, it belongs in a high ball. Then he starts shoving tons of chipped ice into the glass. These people obviously have no idea what they're doing. The glasses are also oddly shaped. They're oval on the bottom and stick out. Not conducive for a good cocktail.

After taking down a really bad and expensive Dark and Stormy, (Sounds so wrong) we took off.

Once again, it provides an amazing view of downtown and would recommend checking it out at night. Get a drink, maybe you should go with a beer? And then head out.
author: Mitch E.

description: The view was good, the beer was good, and the place was packed. You are literally paying for "the view." So don't get your panties in a wad when it is more expensive than ground level. We were lucky enough to find a table by the window in the first few minutes.
author: Aaron J.

description:
You are paying for the view. Just remember that as you open up the menu and look at the prices... YOU ARE PAYING FOR THE AMAZING VIEW.

Came here with my family right as they opened because you basically sit wherever/whenever there is an open table (they do not accept reservations). Since I was staying in the hotel and familiar with the restaurant, I ran to a table near the window with the Bay Bridge view. We started off with cocktails and beers, appetizers and then ordered a few entrees to share. Honestly, there was nothing memorable or spectacular about the drinks and food that we ordered. However, we relaxed and took our time eating because we were in no hurry to give up our seats (sorry!); we wanted to watch the sunset and see the view at night. Even though I have been here before, you can never get sick of the restaurant's ambience and the breathtaking view.

This place is great for coming with your friends, family or significant other. Be prepared for your wallet to hurt after paying the check, but it will be worth the experience.
author: Carissa J.

description: Named appropriately! Really nice view of San Francisco (SoMa, bay etc). This is a bit of a tourist trap but worth a visit!
author: Anne-Marie R.

description: This is a great place for after work or after dinner drinks. There are amazing  360° views of San Francisco from the 39th floor. We only had drinks and appetizers and they were great. Steve was a great bar tender and all of the servers seem to be very attentive. I am only here for a few days but I will definitely be back
author: Travis C.

description:
You come here for the experience not so much for the drinks or food.  The view is fantastic for San Francisco and I'd liken it to the Park Hyatt hotel bar in Tokyo (á la Lost in Translation bar).  The patrons are very touristy or the bridge and tunnel crowd who get excited to go out in the city on a Saturday night. 

Drinks have always been solid albeit pricey but you're paying extra for the view and ambience.  Had an appetizer of olives and hummus but that's nothing to write about.

I have to say that the service has always been excellent.  We were actually ignored by the bartenders at Dirty Habit across the street due to overflowing number of people there so we decided to head to the View instead for drinks.  Our waiter last night, Hung, was attentive and friendly. Though I noticed he carded a few other patrons but failed to card my girlfriend and I.  Either we look relatively old or we look jaded.  I'll choose the latter explanation :P For living in SF so long, I'm going to say neither of us has that lets get dressed in our fanciest clothes and have full on eager beaver excitement about ordering drinks once we reach the bar look.
author: Bailey N.

description:
When you hear The View you might thing of that terrible daytime TV talk show with Whoopi Goldberg. Trust me, if this were that I would not be rating it so highly. This View is so, so much better. In fact, I'd venture to say that this is one of the better views that SF has to offer. You really can't beat a 39th floor lounge with expansive floor-to-ceiling windows, offering up stunning vistas of SOMA, the bay, and SF to the south-west (on the flip side). It really is tops (see what I did there?)

Anyway, The View is a pretty badass spot to have a few tasty cocktails and watch the world go by outside. The space is chic, the menus light up (fancy!), the drinks are upscale, and the service rocks. I don't think the $$ on the Yelp listing is super accurate, it's more like $$$. But you do get what you pay for here. These folks don't seem to be resting on their laurels when it comes to the fare, which so often can happen when there's such a spectacular setting involved. While I didn't eat much, what I did try was tasty. 

Bravo for taking what could be a cliche and making it pretty awesome.
author: Don B.

description: Best roof bar of San Francisco. If there is no fog the view is amazing from both sides. Saturday nights are more crowded and it is a good spot to meet with new people.
author: Ilker D.

description: Lovely view of the city!  It's a shame there is a big tall building in the way of your view of the sun setting, but still is worth the look cause it's free to see!  Drinks are expensive but no surprise there since you get an amazing view with it.  Go early cause it gets super busy on the weekend and you may end up standing the whole time you are there!
author: Nyla K.

description:
This place was SAWEEET! Perfect view (hence the name), good drinks, and just really relaxed. No complaints!

Best part, IMO, is that this is a lounge (not a restaurant). So, if you're looking to just go somewhere and hang out to take in  beautiful SF, go here. All you have to get is one drink, and you have the key to a great place. Definitely a good place to bring visitors to the city -- you'd get some instant checks on your tour guide skills (and who doesn't want that)!

I went with the basic dirty martini -- no complaints. Service was pretty good (it was a lounge where you drink drinks slowly, pretty hard to mess up). 

Just do it.
author: Derrick S.

description:
Came by here on Saturday night. I had seen the yelp pictures so i knew the view was gonna be nice, but it still hits you like WOW as soon as you get off the elevator. It definitely has a big city New York-y vibe to it, or maybe that's just because most other bars in SF have similar layouts. As many other people have mentioned, places with a setting the great usually lag in other areas. This place definitely did not. Aside from the incredible view, the service was great, the drinks weren't exactly cheap but they did not skimp. None of our drinks felt watered down I had an old fashioned (quite the opposite! they were pretty strong!) and for some reason I wasn't expecting there to be music (idk why) and there was. 

Then, I noticed that they had great views from both sides! I can't believe i hadn't been here before. I would absolutely come back either during the day or during sunset must be awesome. Also great place to impress out of town visitors. Definitely on my list of musts now.
author: Thielson D.

description:
Nice place with impressive view! 
Good drinks some of them can be little overpriced, but overall nice place!
author: Askhat E.

description: Always busy and pricy but you can get a nice view of the city and sit down and relax as long as you want. House made chips are the best
author: Mikaela V.

description:
We attended the International Latino Book Award ceremony at the Marriott Marquis in June. To celebrate after, we took the elevator straight up to The View. It was a Saturday night, packed, but we were able to find nice seating to accommodate our group. 

It's not called The View for nothing. We were lucky to have a clear, beautiful San Fran night and the view of the city was spectacular. I believe it's as good as (if not better) than the view of Chicago from Willis Tower and without the craziness of tourist! The View's ambience of low lighting and low couch seating creates an intimate & casual vibe despite how crowded it is. 

We had the most amazing server, Cindy. I can't rave enough about her. She had great suggestions on what to order and how much to order.  We ordered the Mezze, cheese display, spicy tuna dish, housemade chips and beer nuts. Every dish was a perfect blend of fresh flavors. Let me say, you'll never have a better potato chip than their housemade chips! They are seasoned lightly with truffled salt! The next day I ran out and bought a jar of truffled salt and put it on everything from fish to popcorn. Regular salt is so blasé now! Needless to say, The View's chips have transformed my palate and cooking.  Oh, and their Bloody Mary's are pretty darn good, too.

Cindy surprised me with a chocolate "congratulatory" cake for my book win! I thought that was going above and beyond in customer service. It really made the night memorable. Thank you, Cindy!

I plan on returning in October when I'm in the city for another event. I will try other items from the menu, but I hope to have Cindy again as a server!
author: Julie G.

description:
Love this place have spent many a time entertaining here. It has the best views in the city especially on the clear day and also a great spot to watch the sunset from. No reservations though so sometimes you have to wait for a seat. The drinks are awesome. You must get the potato
Crisps they are out of this world amazing. Great place to bring people who are from out of town.
author: Sian S.

description:
Any mood you want to set, this place will do it. 39th floor, overlooking the best city in the world, what more could you ask for? 

We ended up at one of the window seats out of nothing but good timing. Then again, it was a Tuesday. The drink list was good, and the food selections were more than enough to get you by.

But let's be honest, most people aren't coming here because it's called "The Food" so manage your expectations there. It's all about the pretty lights. If you're anything like me, views are more important than they probably should be. And this one does not disappoint. This restaurant repeatedly makes Top 20 lists of restaurants with best views in the world. I had no idea when I booked this hotel.

But if you're in DTSF and looking for an upscale, sexy place with strong drinks and a good Instagram post, The View is for you.
author: Jay G.

description: Great cocktails and views.  What more could you want?  I ended up with the Valencia, which is a essentially a bitter blood orange margarita without the salt.  It's a lively place that is always packed.
author: Patricia N.

description: Mostly there for the view, drinks are reasonably priced, got a very decent night view of San Francisco, beautiful way to end our trip here
author: Ying G.

description:
Oh man to start was the amazing seating and decorations of the lounge. 
Very comfortable and able to find seating for one very easy, I instantly ordered a martini, and eventually had about four.
Really elegant and affordable, I took some pictures with my camera as well, Fun a must go.
author: Pedro S.

description:
Prior to coming to The View my boyfriend and I were so excited because we were celebrating a special occasion and upon entering the lounge we were blown away by the atmosphere. We were there for what we though would be an unforgettable night during our short vacation. This was up until our experience was ruined by a couple of terrible servers.

 We looked for a table because the lounge was packed. After looking for open table for two we had only stumbled upon a large booth. We felt bad so we asked a server (didn't catch her name) if we were allowed to sit there, being that it was the only open table. Rolling her eyes she replied back with a short and stern "yes" and walked away....okay. Brushing it off we sat down ready for some drinks. After 10 minutes of sitting, Darcie came over and said "anything to drink?" and that's it. No how are yous or hello my name is ____ (Name was taken from receipt). We tried to have conversation with her and even asked about recommendations but all we received back was one short answer. We ordered a couple of drinks and a few small plates which were actually good, but Darcie never once checked on us. 

Towards the end of our visit was the only time we saw her smile as she mentioned that it was the end of her shift and when she asked if she can close us out. As a server myself, I felt inclined to tip but really didn't want to because she literally did the bare minimum. I am only giving three stars because of the atmosphere and Conner who I believe is a busser there. Conner was one of the only people who checked in on us and seemed genuine and made sure we were happy. He really went above and beyond and was sweet. As a Marriott establishment and a tourist attraction I was highly disappointed.
author: Monica T.

description: One of the best views of the city, the drinks here are absolutely fantastic. Get here early it fills up fast. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Chef S.

description: Had our company's Christmas get together here. The valet was quick and inviting. Awesome Christmas decorations in the lobby. The view had Great food and excellent service. The ambiance is also very lively. Would definitely come back.
author: jay n.

description:
Amazing view, for sure. Feels like looking out a window in the Death Star. Not the coolest crowd, as it's limited to whatever conferences is taking over the hotel at any point. And the drinks are pretty pricey, even for San Francisco standards. Seriously folks giving this place 2 dollar signs (Moderate?) must have ordered a Coke and ice.

But if you're in town for the Dunder Mifflin sales conference, can expense it, and are staying at the Marcheese, it's a must do, simply due to the view.
author: Paul D.

description:
Aight, here's the run down.

This place is awesome. The views of the city is great, and I'm a huge fan of the drinks. What I found sort of difficult though was the seating and the service. Seating, I get it - first come first served, and we had to hunt for the first seat available. The first table we sat at, we pretty much swooped in right after another party had left, and even after about 8 minutes, the tables weren't cleaned so we were left with a table of unfinished drinks and the checkbook. We eventually migrated towards another table along the windows, which was much better. Getting the attention of our waiter though was really difficult. Getting the drinks, how long it took to get to us, and what really pissed me off was how many times I had asked for the check. After asking twice, and waiting for a very long 15 minutes, we decided to just leave and they'll close the tab on their own. As soon as we got up and started to look for the exit, the waiter ran up to us and printed us the check. He didn't even apologize to me, which led me to be hesitant to leave any tip at all. 

So if you don't mind mediocre to borderline frustrating service, but love scenic views, then this is a really nice place to go to.
author: Quang H.

description:
An Asian gentleman name Don was not a very polite server. His customer service was not impressive. He was a rude, disrespectful and not genuine. 

I have been coming here for many years and I have never met this gentleman before. I look forward to coming here more in the future, but hope to get a better customer service from him.
author: Emma Yna B.

description: With amazing views as far as the eye can see, an upscale, classy top floor lounge with great food and drinks in an upscale hotel in Downtown San Francisco, how could you go wrong? You're going to pay hefty for that view though, and for that reason, 4 stars.
author: Keagan G.

description:
I love SF and this is a great place to take out of town visitors.  Start here for drinks before heading out to dinner.

I like how there are all these nooks up here to carve out your own space for quiet, cozy conversations.

Prices are more expensive because of the view but less expensive than similar "lounges with views" in Hong Kong or New York City.

SF is best and this place captures the coolness of the town.
author: Ray M.

description:
Sure, it's pretty and the views are great when you can see the city..  However, I think the popularity is making this place too crowded.  I almost feel like The View should limit the amount of people they can take to make the experience better for those who make it up there (even if that makes I cannot go whenever I wish to).

Been here twice now.  Food is pricey, but good for bar food.  First time I made it before people were off work.  Quieter and nice experience.  On the other hand, it was way too crazy when I went again on a Friday night.  Still, good service, nice view, good food.
author: Lindsay H.

description: First time in SF and had to check this place out. The view was absolutely beautiful. We only had drinks and even tho they are on the pricey side we had a great conversation with the one of the bartenders. Her name was Adrianne, she was such a sweetheart. I would definitely return soon.
author: Leeanica G.

description:
I have been here twice now. This place is amazing!  Even with it being busy all of the time I feel that the service is great.  We had the waitress Cindy last weekend and just loved her.  She was kind, attentive, and fun!  
Cocktails are of course more expensive at a place like this, but they do have bottles of wine for under $65 if you want to split a bottle with friends. 
The views are out of this world! Get there early of course. They open at 4p and I am sure there is a line to get in.  Great atmosphere, clean bathrooms too. 
Have only ever gotten their chips and dip for food, but the rest of the food looks good.
author: Natalie F.

description:
Yeah, what a great view but holy damn you have to get there EARLY to get a DECENT spot. Is it worth it? Um, I don't think so. You can explore the whole darn city with the amount of time you need to waste just to find a decent seat. There are so many other places that offer much more than this 15' x 25' room with a crowded bar. The benefit here is the optional room on the side which you can reserve for events. 

Pros:
View
Alcohol
Nice furniture
Elevator ride

Cons:
Wait times
Coming after 5? Forget it.
Not a big bar
Small staff size
Amount of seating available
No one leaves their seat for HOURS
Small room
Too loud
Everything
author: Manpreet S.

description: I absolutely love coming to this bar lounge in the sky! I came here for a friend's company party and another time when I took a friend on a tour de la roof top. I've only been at night when you can see all the lights of the city gleaming like stars. The bartenders have always been nice and the cocktails are delish! If your looking to impress a date with a fun place up high or get a night cap here before you head home for the night, this is the place. Its an extra bonus if you are actually staying at the Marriott.
author: N O.

description: Stunning views of San Francisco. My husband and I went there in our 2nd date and it has made a remarkable memory.
author: Juliette O.

description:
Awesome hotel bar with an awesome view. This place is located on the 39th floor of the Marriott Marquis.

Keep your expectations relative because this is still a hotel bar- expect cocktails to range anywhere from $10+ (Moscone Mule, anyone?) If you're looking for something a little less touristy I'd check out The Local Edition, relatively close by.

The View has beautiful views of San Francisco and has floor to ceiling windows throughout the entire top floor. It's gorgeous both daytime and nighttime and it's breathtaking watching the sunset (the bar is open only after 4 PM. The elevators won't work beforehand).

Came here a few times during my stay at the Marriott for a marketing conference and it might be hard to get a hold of a bartender on a busy night but you'll get your drink eventually.
author: Lalida S.

description: The view is breathtaking. The View is aptly named. It is pricy ($12 for a beer) but they have a great selection. Bar menu is decent for sure. Charcuterie plate was fantastic. Try the shredded Brussels sprouts too. Nom.  Bartenders were very nice. The place was packed, so be prepared.
author: Linda G.

description: The view of the city is absolutely amazing up here. I would have given this place 3 stars, but the view is just remarkable. If you decide to check it out, get here early. We went around 9:00 and it was packed like sardines. The view was worth it, but two drinks was $30, there are limited seats near the windows. Definitely something to check out!
author: Nicole H.

description: Beautiful place to look atthe city of city SF. However, extremely crowded. Drinks were average, but the view made up for it.
author: Julie J.

description:
I've been here before and it was great. 
But this time it was only OK. At best... 
I guess there was a conference of some sort this past weekend nearby and everybody decided to come here but it was quite packed for the size. It didn't help that there were inconsiderate people who stood in front of me blocking my view the whole time. 

Other than that, the negative stars are for the following:
1) broken glass everywhere, which is not their fault, but taking FOREVER to clean it up is: Seriously, if a glass drops and breaks it isn't that hard to hear even at this place with blaring music because some people cheer or some (me) flag waiters down and point towards the broken glass. Why does it take about 3 more tries and 20minutes for broken glass to be cleaned up? If I said "law suit waiting to happen" would cleaning up be faster?

2) service: why are there only 2 people at the bar on a Saturday where there are about 60 people at the small little area? And why are non-bartenders in the area blocking them half the time? Not only is the service slow, the drinks were sloppy and not well made. But I felt bad for the bartender because people were telling him to "hurry the hell up" and whatnot so left him an extra bit of tip.

3) they ran out of food :( only a handful of chips ($5) or caramel popcorn available... not even a cheese plate :( why... should've gone to chipotle and brought some in or something.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Came here for my "27 & Killin'' it" bday celebration! 
 
Rooftop bars are my favorite. Not a rooftop but it's close and the name speaks itself! 

Arrived about 8pm and it was already packed, on a Thursday night too! Let me just say the view was absolutely breathtaking and I'm not exaggerating. Had about 15 people come celebrate with me and everyone in my party enjoyed their stay. 

Drinks were quite expensive but c'mon it's the city so prepare to pay about 14-16 bucks a drink. 

There's 2 sections in the lounge so a pretty good size for small parties! Crowd is mature and professional. 

The decor and ambiance is just stunning. 

The bartenders were attentive and my Old Fashions were made with LOVE! I can tell they take pride in the creations of their beverages. 

Presentation is spot on  

Tip: first come, first serve.. Small groups/tourists/couples like to camp out at the bar and the seats with the views so be patient. I don't blame them though.. That view is gorgeous!! 

I'll be back for sure, even just for the view! 

If you need a recommendation to take your lady out, this is DEFINITELY a winner!
author: Nicole D.

description: I honestly do not go here for the food or alcohol, but just the view and the company. Sadly the 3 other times I have been, I did not get to see the amazing sunset, but the night skyline was pretty awesome. You also meet the most interesting people here. My friend and I got into a conversation with two Aussies, and we laughed until the place closed. Perfect for a date night! However, it can get crowded so your drinks might take a while. There also is a very limited number of seating by the amazing window, so first come first serve.
author: Vivian X.

description: The three stars are for the view. The service here is abysmal. The crowd is made up of snooty tourists wearing who don't care for your personal space, wearing backpacks and dragging around suitcases between tightly arranged seats. I suppose that if you get here early enough to secure a seat by the window, you'd be a happy camper. Otherwise, you'll wait thirty minutes to grab a drink at the bar and then stand around loud, mouth-breathing businessmen looking for some excitement while away from their families and homes.
author: Luis P.

description: I did not experience drinks or food...just THE VIEW which is worth the trip up the elevator. I did take a bit of a tour of the Marriott though since I forgot my ID in our room. The lounge is on the high ride elevators too so I had to go all the way down to the ground level, get on the mid rise elevators to our room and then repeat it to go back up there. It was worth that beautiful view of the city though. It is pretty happening up there during the evening and we ending up meeting another really nice couple from Texas so pop on up and make some new friends.
author: Mikhail H.

description: This is a great destination for people who want a great view of San Francisco. There's lots of delicious cocktails to choose from on the menu. This place fills up real quick. If you want a good seat during the rush times, you definitely need to get there super early. The wait staff is super friendly and helpful! Where this place falls apart for me is the beer selection. They have a short list of bottles....thats it.
author: Daniella B.

description:
I like that this place has no cover and can be accessed through the Marriott.  The views of the city are unbeatable.  Given the pros, the place is quite busy and it took a very long time for us to get a seat and service.

I recommend showing up after dinner, around 9pm and getting a seat towards the back where it's more intimate.  But if you're on the prowl, I'd highly recommend getting a seat at one of the community tables and bring a rose with you.  Pretend you're meeting someone and tell people around you that she didn't show up.
author: John A.

description:
Whenever I go to a big city, I usually make it a point to find a place to get a great view of the city from above. (You can ask me about Houston, Dublin, Munich, and the list goes on.) The View is the place I have found in San Francisco. 

It's located on the 39th floor of the Mariott Marquis, but you do not need to be a hotel guest to access this swanky lounge. You also do not need to pay to go to the lounge. 

If you want a seat, make your way over to any available area. (Of course to be courteous, if you're going to take seat, you should buy something.) Go to the west side to see downtown and the Bay Bridge. Head to the west side to see Sutro Tower and the sun set over the city. 

Service is a bit of a struggle. You'll have to flag someone down to get food (small plates, no entrees) or drinks. The menus light up, the better to see when the sun goes down. 

Their drinks are very well-made. They are a bit pricey, but you're also paying for the view. I got the Soma Spritzer (prosecco, St. Germaine, and berries), and I would get it again.

I've been here twice already, and I'm sure I'll be be back many more times!
author: Victoria C.

description: This is my go to. If you want a beer at sunset come here. Not only that friendly, professional staff and a great menu. Skyscrapers need to utilize their scope more. Very picky about my lounges. The customers are pretty chill here to boot, no overbearing tourists. Another example of Marriott excellence. This company said they treat people like peole in their recent ad and that's true. Always had a good time here. The View for the Win.
author: Mike H.

description: The view was beautiful. The port was delicious and so was the chocolate tarte. However, yes, everything is overpriced. Make sure to get there early. We went on a Sunday at 6:30pm and were able to get a seat.
author: Christina D.

description:
If u want to enjoy the view the city of SF and happy hour., you should come to "The View" This place has good drinks, wine selections, finger food and the waitress also very friendly and helpful 
I order gin n cucumber drink. Taste awesome.. One drink enough to make u little bit tipsy well that mean this place  pretty good with their drink  bravo for the bartender
author: Sarah A.

description: Great place to have a drink and watch the construction of the Sales Force Tower. It can be crowded and the drinks are a bit on the higher price side but reasonable for the location. I will definitely go again and it is on my list of places to take people visiting San Francisco.
author: Ted C.

description: Best 360 views of the city. Great place to hangout and enjoy drinks!
author: Kshitij W.

description: I love the view when you can actually get a space near the windows. A plus on getting in for free for the view. Drinks are a little pricey
author: Jean S.

description: San Francisco....went for my birthday. The view is amazing at night. The server was great, attentive, and full of energy! She made the start of my birthday night very memorable which is much appreciated. The music was good, the ambiance and lighting were awesome. The drinks were a lil pricey, but well made. Would highly recommend to try when in the city.
author: Denise A.

description: I decided to check the spot out on my first trip to San Francisco. I was not disappointed. Besides the great view , the drinks were awesome and I made quite a few new friends. Definitely going back there
author: Flo O.

description:
It's one of my favorite spots in SF. The view is amazing, even tho you can't take a good picture, because lounge not open until 4pm, and after 4 it's getting dark (I was there in November). 
Drink are overpriced, but I believe that's the price you got to pay for the view.
author: Svet G.

description:
Not surprisingly it is all about the view. The drinks and food are good. The service is very good and very accommodating (had the bar mix me a Bobby Burns and offered to fix it or remake if I did not like it, but it was fine). 

Hard to get a table with a great view. Coming early to get a table and staying late to watch the sunset is tough as they open at 4:00 and sunset was 8:30 when we were there. 

Tough to fault a place for being in such a great location with so many people wanting to be there as well. 

We loved it and will be back.
author: P- A.

description:
The View is amazing and provides a rich sight for those that are looking for a cocktail in the city.  It's located on the 39th floor of the Marriott - you could use the hotel parking but I can imagine their parking being relatively pricey.  Safe bet, park somewhere else.  You do have options when it comes to parking, the Metreon is directly across the street and there are a handful of parking lots available for the public that's within walking distance.  

We walked into the lobby and easily found our way towards the elevators that has a sign directing us to the bar.  The elevator ride was fast, so fast that every other floor we had to stop for other passengers ( there was a ISSCC convention in one of their banquets) and I could only imagine it becoming a dizzy ride for those that get motion sickness. But when we arrived we were greeted by the spectacular view of San Francisco.  Upon entering the bar you're faced with a large window displaying Down Town San Francisco and the Bay Bridge. It was amazing and can only stress that one visits during the hours of sunset.  The vibe was classy.  The bar had a dark toned table with comfortable high chairs, while there were a few tables and a handful of chique sofas and couches for people to mingle on.  We found our way to two couch chairs and was quickly greeted by a waitress.  It was obvious that they place was starting to get busy since people were finding themselves moving from one table to a closer table towards the window but throughout our stay, she was prompt and attentive.  

I ordered their skyline punch that was delicious and fruitful.  I wish I had the opportunity to grab another cocktail but I'll have to do so the next time I visit.  What was awesome was at the end of our experience, we were handed our checkbook with a white electronical screen behind it (when the sun sets, it gets real dark).  I thought that was a plus!  

I definitely recommend The View and it would be a perfect place to meet up with a few friends to throw a few back.  It's not a restaurant but does offer a few tapas - although I didn't have the chance to try any.
author: Lea M.

description: It's not all that great.  First of all there are stunning views of the city - from certain areas. If you are in the wrong spot you can see all of...Potrero Hll?  The spots where you can see any landmarks fill up pretty quickly.  The place has a doorman, but he is concerned with ID checks instead of monitoring how many people are crushed inside.  On the weekends the place is a complete zoo, and they keep packing as may people in as possible.  Which leads to the next two problems...the lack of seating and the substandard service.  As the crush of people gets wors and worse, the lack of seating means you all stand in the middle of the walkways and everyone is forced to walk around, or you crowd onto uncomfortable ottomans and pretend you can hear each other.  And I am willing to pay $12 including tax and tip for a bottle of domestic beer, but don't make me have to hunt down a server and beg for it, as she tries to maneuver around the crowds.  I could see coming here for a quiet drink on a tame Tuesday night.  The weekends are a tourist trap and I will stay away.
author: Ken P.

description:
Go early!
4.30 is too late!  All of the tables near the windows were gone. 
Not cheap, but the view is worth going. 
Not much on the menu, but enough to have a snack with you drink. Not a big range of drinks either, but still worth going.
author: J B.

description: Just like what everyone else said, you're paying for the view and the drinks. First come first serve.
author: Klarenz D.

description: Awesome! Beautiful view, great food. Our server Cindy was amazing. Definitely stop by here if it's your first visit to SF
author: Ranisha S.

description: Very good spot to go for a night out. Went with a group of friends. Love the cosy atmosphere and the view. I didn't drink much but my friends said the drink was good. Make sure to bring your date here for a date night. Fabulous.
author: Tri P.

description:
V I E W S.

Really nice views of FiDi/SoMA and the Bay or of the city facing Twin Peaks. Looks great all day and all night. The View definitely didn't disappoint in terms of views. Unless it's foggy. Then don't go here.

Drinks and food are a few bucks more expensive to compensate (or maybe just because it's in a hotel?). Got the housemade chips which were pretty good but probably not worth the price. 

It does get a bit crowded here, so at peak times you'll probably have to be willing to wait or walk around a while or be in a party of 2 (or all of the above) if you want a window seat. And trust me, you want a window seat.
author: Victor S.

description: The View's View was AMAZING, prices were steep, people were friendly. I didn't eat anything, but I did have a cocktail before I had to take off for my flight. Expect to find a fair share of tourists (like me) hanging here since this is in a hotel building. Would love to come back here!
author: Nicole B.

description: Spectacular Windows, get there early to grab a seat as they fill up. Great place to meet up with friends. You could stand at the bar too! It a nice place unwind with  dramatic views of the city!
author: Shelly S.

description:
Hummus really sucks, bad sauce straight from the jar, cooked veg to side the sauce? Pls serve a small salad instead if anything, the crust is fun tho. 
The boiled egg small Dish is very good. 
Orange mock tail drink is good. 
Amazing view I prefer a corner big window with no seat. Romantic at night so dark u only see the great view of the city at a dark corner to male out. 
Waiters are polite and helpful. 
At the end sides of the room they could switch off some window lamps for better nite view. 
BTW the illuminated menu u see in this yelp photo,  they don't use it anymore.
author: Jov T.

description: The view unquestionably deserves 5 stars, as does the ambiance, the drinks (pricey) and the seating.  Perhaps it was an off and/or overcrowded night (we went for pre-dinner drinks on Valentines Day), but we placed an order for appetizers, waited for over 45 minutes and finally had to cancel the order because we needed to walk to dinner.  I was pretty frustrated and wanted to give this place a single star, but the waitress hugged me to apologize (I think her name was Ida...?) and I just couldn't give this place the poor rating I initially intended.  I will try again, because the views and drinks are definitely worth it.
author: Theresa C.

description:
Do you have out-of-town friends or family? Do you want to impress them very easily while also giving them yet another reason to complain about how expensive the city is? The View is for you!

The drinks are surprisingly potent, which will make you feel slightly better about paying almost $20 for one. The Golden Gate is SF-themed and actually good, if the ingredients sound vaguely good to you. You're also able to order well drinks, including your own custom Moscow Mule (cheaper and better). 

Remember that the prices have everything to do with the ability to afford maintaining the beautiful view from the top of a hotel in the most expensive area in America. It's so much more expensive for your out-of-towners to fly back another time to enjoy the view than to just go enjoy The View now.
author: Amanda D.

description: The perfect spot to grab some drinks right next to Union Square. Spent the day shopping at Westfield Mall, and then stopped by around 4:45pm on a Monday evening for drinks. It was pretty crowded when we went - however, it was MLK Day, so might have been a reason for the increased crowd. Definitely wait to get a table near the windows - don't settle for ones farther away! The view so gorgeous, and beautiful especially during sunset. The drinks were nice as well - we tried the Pear 31 and Skyline Punch. The Pear 31 had a nice touch of cinnamon; the Skyline Punch was at first a little strong, but definitely grows on you. All in all, would definitely go back - and would recommend to friends! A great place to enjoy the evening!
author: Puja S.

description: We were looking for a rooftop in San Francisco and The View seemed to have the best reviews so we went there ! First we just wanted to take a drink and finally we were kind of hungry and it wasn't that expensive so we also ate there ! Food is really good but don't look for big quantities ! The waiter was super nice and when you arrive you can seat wherever you want ! We didn't find a spot near the windows but it was still cool and chill ! Also, we went there on a Sunday night so it wasn't crowded , I assume on Saturdays and Fridays it's not the same, but I definitely recommend going there to enjoy the view and have a drink !
author: Myriem I.

description:
Minus one star only because drinks are on the pricey side (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=EDsKd-2_nLKtccXs5nob0w#KAKuWDSHiBuRfxr84eSuIw), but in every other aspect, The View is a five star establishment.

Stunning, sweeping views of The City, delicious cocktails, and attentive service. Lora M and I decided on the tequila based Nuestra Palomas (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-view-san-francisco-2?select=EDsKd-2_nLKtccXs5nob0w#FKyiO4eY2Z0wk9ENSQUmHA) and oowee these drinks are stiff, but tasty! One should do ya for the night. They also have a few flat screens scattered about for all of you sports fiends out there; I know I appreciated it.

All in all, I would definitely come back for another girl's night of juicy gossip.... or with a date ---- If I ever went on any LOL!

Joking aside, it's pretty classy. And a great place to unwind. Hopefully, the next time I stop by, I'll be lucky enough to grab a window seat!
author: Vi T.

description: This place is kind of a must if you're looking for a great lounge in SF. It's touristy because it's in the Marriott but it's awesome. Iconic Downtown SF views. I've been here a few times and recently enjoyed some drinks with my wife here before dinner. It gets 5 stars simply because of the venue. As a bar it's 3.5 or 4. The seating is uncomfortable and if you're not there early then you'll be standing the whole time. Another great place is Top of The Mark. We were staying at the W so this was a short walk across the gardens. I wish they had a larger beer selection.
author: Jordan B.

description: Good views from the lounges and worth a occasional visit. Drinks prices are based off the view, and seating can be hard to lock down.
author: Nathan B.

description:
The View is quite an appropriate name. You come here for the View of SF, which is pretty damn amazing. Its at the top of the Marriot Hotel. If you can come early, you will be able to grab the better seats by the window. 
When I came, there was something wrong with the machine or something and the waitress had to take my credit card when I was ordering food. After waiting for 40 min, there was still no sight of our waitress nor our food nor our drinks. My friend had a hard stop and absolutely had to leave. Luckily we found our waitress and she was nice about it and ripped up the bill and said we would not be charged. This place is pricey by the way.
I would like to come back and give this place another shot.
author: Stephanie Q.

description: Pretty amazing view of the city! Went there on a busy Thursday night there was good music playing in the background.  Wasn't over terribly crowded so we found a table and waited about 10 minutes for someone to come over and take our drink order.  My wife and our friend ordered and the waitress asked for a card to open a tab so I gave her mine. We stayed till closing time they turned the lights on bright and the waitress came and gave me the receipt (not the bill) as she charged our whole evening on my card.  I didn't really mind this but would have liked to have been asked or given the option to split the bill if we wanted. Other than that the place is nice.  I'd definitely come back!
author: Hector L. V.

description: Drinks are horrible. They are either too strong or plain gross. Service follows suite. Depends on who you get as our first waiter was closing down when we got there so he clearly didn't care. The view is nice which is what you are paying for. Wish the Marriott took the time to make it into something. They really do have the makings...
author: Kiran C.

description: Holy crap, this place was crowded on a Saturday night and it was difficult to find seating since it's self seating, so I found the ambiance a little hectic. We eventually crowded into a 2 person stall with a party of 4 and the food and drinks were decent. The novelty of the view kinda makes up for it, but it would be nice if they limited their patronage OR just switched the seating to standing bar tables to allow for an improved experience.
author: Megan H.

description:
Charge to reserve a table = $400.00
Assumption was food bill is deducted/get whatever back left over......

What took place? 2 business people spent $90.00, got $0.00 back.
The $400.00 is min charge/door fee.....
author: Ace F.

description: I like the view at The View. I like feeling like I'm inside the Death Star. Do the walk around. Walk slow. Take in the city lights.
author: Yad L.

description: Beautiful place and breathtaking views! Our bartender was awesome :) I can't wait to go back!
author: Katya N.

description:
If you attend a trade show or conference at moscone center, this is a great place to sip cocktails and beer. The wine list is mediocre. Considering the location only 1.5 hour from Napa Valley, Marriott should have put more efforts to create a wine list worthy of wine spectator rating. There are four red wine choices on the menu. 

If I take a client here or have a drink with this spectacular view, I won't mind ordering  some good wine, preferably by the glass. They only serve some small plates. You can walk across the street for dinner at Annabelle.
author: Ann K.

description: very crowded and did not have space to enjoy the view. there is no dress code and you see people with sneakers and backbags getting in. The place should have a class and be trendy.
author: Aysem O.

description:
Geez.....what to say.  Ok, I've been here twice now (recently).

The first time we stopped by, we were drinking, nibbling, and having a nice time.  Well the waitress took my card and never came back with it.  Of course I also forgot because we were drinking up and partying down.  We were quite upset by the time I realized what had happened because my friends and I all left and travelled a bit downtown and then had to return.  The manager offered me 2 free drinks and an appetizer for the mix up.  That was sweet of him as he didn't have to do anything.

Well, the second time we stopped by, we weren't sure if we were going to stay long other than to show a friend the views from the bar on top.  We ended up staying and advised the waiter of what happened and our little meal and drinks were to be comp'd.  Well, do you know they STILL required a credit card!  I'm thinking to myself "God, this is what started this whole mess and why we're back."  That said, I was taken back.  If the manager is there and saying "yes, we're comping their meal", then why would we need to throw down a credit card?  So there's that.

That aside, the place was clean, the staff was friendly, efficient, and cleaned the tables quickly.  The views are particularly breathtaking BUT, be advised: when the place is full of tourists, the atmosphere and ambiance take a hit.  The reason: so many people do not have any manners or etiquette and they will walk into your seated area, get loud and point fingers in your face while you're sitting "oh look! there's that....and there's that over there!...." I had to pull tables together to create a barrier so cavemen and cavewomen would not enter our private area.  I can't even tell you how many times I had to snap at people and to remind them of where they were.  Oh and at night, it's worse!  In addition to dreadful manners and etiquette, you now have idiots attempting to take pictures AT NIGHT BEHIND GLASS and we're all subject to the flash along with the stupidity: "Oh it didn't come out because of the flash on the glass."

I would avoid at night and avoid the place when super busy and packed.  It's a shame because the food is good, the place is nice, and the staff are friendly.  It's the customers' behavior that drags the experience down.  There are a lot of places in town to capture skyline views, so don't place all your eggs in this basket.
author: Shaun W.

description:
4 stars for the views. Ultimately, this place is for their views of San Francisco. 

Swanky bar for anyone willing to spend some good amount of money. Valet parking for The Marriott is about $20-25 for an hour, which is convenient, but expensive. Parking downtown is expensive and takes an incredulous amount of patience. 

Once you make your way up top, finding a table can also be tedious, but that depends on the day and time you go. Lastly, the price per cocktail is unbelievable. I ordered a couple Moscow Mules - for $15 a pop, I was expecting a copper cup and the fixings. Hell no. They brought that shit back in a bar glass, which is okay, I know I'm not going to die from not drinking a Moscow mule in a copper cup, but it'd be nice. So at this point, I realize you're paying $15 for the ambiance, not the cocktails. Regardless, it's worth it to say "been there, done that." 

I'd come back here to bring guests out of town or for happy hour, but never again for a regular night out in town.
author: Stacy V.

description: beautiful view day or night. the menu and coctails are expensive. seating is very limited here.
author: Raquel K.

description:
If you are traveling and you want an amazing panoramic view of the city while enjoying a stiff gin (or any other cocktail) this is the place for you! 

There seems to always be an event going on at The View, so call ahead to make sure the space is free and open to the public. 

I wasn't impressed by their menu or their drinks, but the panoramic view of the city deserves a 5 star. Unfortunately, our waitress was unimpressed by our orders and the amount of fun we were having. We were neglected and brought our bill promptly after two beverages. If the service was better this place would have more stars!
author: Kendal Ann M.

description: The name says it all. A bit overpriced but great atmosphere for young adults and business experts alike with a seemingly unbeatable view.
author: Jared L.

description:
This is the top floor lounge of the San Francisco Marriott Marquis and upon entering the lounge it's easy to see what the draw of this place is...the view! The lounge offers an excellent view of the FiDi, SOMA and the Bay Bridge and we managed to grab some seats near the windows.

We came here on Saturday night after catching a movie at the Metreon. Last time I was here was a Sunday evening and the vibe was very different. The place was completely packed this time and full of energy. If you're looking for a trendy spot to hang out with friends on a weekend, this is it.

There's a speciality cocktail menu with drinks in the $14 - $16 price range. I tried The View Old Fashioned and Golden Gate while my girlfriend had the Moscone Mule. The drinks were respectable but didn't match the quality available at other craft cocktail bars in the city. You're really paying for the amazing view here.
author: Rodney G.

description:
What can I say about "The View", honestly the name says it all. The sight of seeing the city of San Francisco from 39 floors is breathtaking.  My girlfriend and I decided to come here for a drink after dinner and we were not disappointed. The lounge is self seating and we were lucky enough to get a spot right in front of the window which gave us a nice view of the city as well as the Bay Bridge.

We ordered the Golden Gate (my drink) and the Skyline Punch (her drink).  I'm a huge whiskey fan and the Golden Gate was refreshing and packed with flavor.  I know whiskey can be overpowering to some but this drink is tasty without the strength that the whiskey can sometimes bring.  The ingredients in this drink include (Jameson, St. Germaine Cranberry and Ginger Ale). A really good combination in my opinion.  The creme brûlée was just the icing on the cake. Sweet but not to sweet and creamy. 

I loved everything about "The View" from the drinks, to the desserts all the way to the ambiance.  As the name of the lounge states, visiting this lounge for the view in itself makes your stop worth it. The drinks and food just seal the deal as a must visit spot in San Francisco.
author: Danny G.

description:
I visited before and after the remodel, both experiences were great. The cheese bread is great as well as the poke. Most food options are great for sharing. 

Only complaint I have is the servers don't really know their wine, they're friendly, but not the most knowledgeable in that department.
author: Camille L.

description: I stayed at the Marriott so checking out The View was a no brainer. The prime spots fill up fast but there is a steady turnover. Drinks are a bit pricey, but as others mentioned you are paying for the view. The house made chips and onion dip alone are worth the elevator ride.
author: Megan T.

description:
The View has a ravishing view, hence, the name of this place! 

The iconic View Lounge atop the S.F Mariott is the ideal destination for business and delightful guests where they can enjoy a glass of wine and small high-roller price snacks next to the clear glass windows. 

I would totally come back here to kill time and enjoy the view of San Francisco (you can even see the bridge!) with a date or good friends. 

Try to get seats by the windows!
author: Jan P.

description: Love this place, awesome view and great food and drinks. A little pricey and a little busy but hey, it's a hotel bar!
author: Robyn M.

description: The place is great and food is awesome. 4 stars just because the seating has no order to it. It's a seat yourself place, but too busy to have a good chance of finding a spot with out walking around for 15 minutes. Good place over all
author: Pedro U.

description: A must go. Great drinks, service was excellent and the view is amazing I've gone many times with out of town coworkers and it never disappoints.
author: Michele H.

description: Obviously GREAT VIEW.... No matter where you sit you get a glimpse of the view. Downside is the waitress never really attended us, after she had got our order. We had to keep looking for her for refills or to order more food! But nonetheless great place for a very small party or 4-6 or a date .
author: Cynthia C.

description: The view and drinks everything about this place is simply amazing !! The atmosphere here is very good . A lovely place to hangout with friends .
author: Chaitra V.

description: Fantastic views but to get a table you need to practically get there when they open, or get really lucky which is what we did as we were right by a table when someone left.  It is really crowded due to it's fantastic city views out the gorgeous arched window, and it's wonderful cocktails.  Check it out! (but don't count on those good-sounding desserts when you come late like I did - I think their kitchen closed at 10, sadly, so the yummy thing I had been craving did not happen)
author: Rhonda D.

description: The view is spectacular. The food is pricey but it's also really yummy. Try the goat cheese in tomato sauce. I can't remember the name of it.  It's delicious. It's not for big groups but I did see a small dining area. I think you have to make reservations for that, way in advance although that area doesn't have a view. Try to get there early and claim your spot by the window.  It's amazing and a perfect place to take a tourist.  I love the city and this place just breathtaking.
author: Deepika S.

description: So basically once you get on the 39th floor you seat yourself and try to get the window seat because you are there for the view of the city. Very romantic place and you definitely wanna bring your date here. We had to wait for like good 15 minutes to grab the window seat. Lot of option for drinks and food. It is little expensive but it is worth it 100% for the view of the beautiful city and the experience itself.
author: Bimarsh S.

description:
Came with a party of 6. Drinks are expensive but that's to expected with the location, view, and hotel. 

Great place to chill and hang out with friends if you don't feel like getting super ratchet. ;)
author: Stephen Y.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE The View. 

I've been dying to go here forever and finally made it after they had closed during the holiday's for some renovations. I was definitely not disappointed by the amazing views of the city. Whether is still daytime or night, the views are just spectacular. 

...which is why you are going to pay $15 for a small moscow mule. Totally fine, I get it. I'm not complaining at all, just warning my fellow Yelpers that drinks are going to run you about $15 per drink. .

-1 star for not being able to make reservations at all. With all the conventions going on across the street at Moscone, it's practically impossible to get a window seat in the main area of the bar. It is always packed so be prepared to also be patient and abandon ship for a better seat when there's a chance.
author: Leina K.

description:
Definitely get there when it opens to get a great seat. We got there a little late, so it took us about an hour to get a window seat. Food selection isn't great, but the drinks are delicious and well served.

Perfect for a date night!
author: Gina O.

description: I haven't been able to see the sunset from here yet, but even the foggy night time view is worth it.  There's plenty of cozy, almost private tables and there's plenty of bar seating also.  The cocktails, *drool.  They're not wimpy either so be careful.  I was ready to call it a night after two but this lovely Australian couple we let share our table bought us another round and things are just a bit blurry after that.  The food is decent, but of course expensive.
author: Ems G.

description: The view was pretty cool. Definitely a tourist spot but worth the experience. Windows were beautiful. Service was good even though it was crowded.. I also visited Cityscape which I preferred over The View. There was more seating and a nicer view.
author: Sarah W.

description: On top of the Marriott in union square, bar lounge with the best view of SF. Drinks are a little pricey but totally worth the atmosphere and vibe. Very laid back and casual, with a touch of classy. Snapchat and IG worthy if your a phone whore.
author: C K.

description: Great drinks  & atmosphere & service. My parents even, approved this place. No pretensions here... tourists and local people mixed in.... ( I will catch their beautiful sunset & view !! )
author: Hannah K.

description: Where to start. Many of my friends have told me about this place prior to visiting San Francisco so I made it a point to come here. The lounge opens at 4, but it definitely pays to show up early since it fills up quick. We snagged a seat right by the window and the view was incredible. Drinks and appetizers were definitely in my top 3. The poke was especially great. In my opinion, it's reasonably priced for what you get. I'd have to say it was my favorite part of my trip hands down.
author: Tara C.

description:
First time back here since the lounge was refurbished and as usual it was busy so we grabbed a cocktail at the bar. Once a table opened up, we sat down and wait, and wait, and wait for someone to acknowledge is... And waited... We finished our drinks and left! What a shame, we wanted to order food and since nobody would even make eye contact with us we did have the chance so we ended up going to Denny's!

Bar was packed but the bar tenders were quick and friendly, ordered a couple of martinis that we sipped on as we enjoyed the views! If you are looking for the best views of the city, this is the spot to go to but they are sometimes closed for private functions. It's so sad when that happens but also understandable, just frustrating when you take a ride across town to hang out there with a friend to find it's closed.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great view of downtown! Come early to get a seat!  Service can be a bit slow if you are not sitting at the bar.  But the view of downtown and the bay with a drink in your hand make it worth it.
author: James D.

description: Nothing special except for the view. San Francisco prices but not San Francisco quality. Cocktail menu was average. Can't speak for the wine list. $16 is pretty steep for a basic cocktail. Delarosa next door is better priced, better quality, definitely more imaginative, and has warmer personalities. 3 stars for the view and the drink not being the worst I've had.
author: Nadia S.

description:
Beautiful bar, but really, it just ends there. We find ourselves here often because it's basically a free observatory with lots of comfy and modern seating if you're able to snag one. Also, why does the women's bathroom have like 3 stalls?! Sigh.

My favorite moment -
"Here's your MOSCONE MULE"
*crickets*
"Umm you mean a Moscow Mule?"
*offended waitress*
author: Sally C.

description:
I love this bar! I come here approximately 1x per year, at the end of a conference day for the analytics industry held at the Marriott. 

Some how in between visits I always forget how beautiful the view from The View is, and yet happily reminded when I get up there (39 floors up!). Sweeping city skyline, lit up at night. And the bridge! Oh so beautiful. 

Maybe I should come more often? Or maybe not. After all, it does still feel special every time I go.
author: Krista S.

description:
Bad Thing: It is gonna be little bit hard to find a table, specially on Fri,Sat. Also this place are pretty dark so it's hard to order if you seat on the corner. 


Good Thing: Food and drink are just fine! But most important thing is "View" yup it is good enough to make good memories. And mood is perfect to talking.
author: Laura S.

description: Recently came here for the second time and I was not disappointed once again. This is a great place to go out for drinks with friends or on a date. Although they are usually busy, service was fast and the waiters were attentive and very polite.We ordered a few drinks and some small plates to split between the four of us. That being said, its very easy to run up a big tab here,  In my experience,  people will come early to get seats by the window and stay there for a few hours. So if you come during peak hours you probably wont get a window view but you can try to snag a table if one opens up.
author: Joshua H.

description:
This place is pretty freaking awesome.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because it was CRAZY crowded when I went, and my colleagues and I had a really hard time finding seats, and we were getting bumped a lot by the people traffic.  However, we went there for drinks after a conference at the Moscone, and I think a lot of other people were there for the same reason.  So on a "regular" night, it might be a very different vibe.

The reasons this place rocks?  Well, the View obviously!!  It's got a great view of the city skyline and on a clear day you can see very far.  The ambiance itself is cool - relaxed with lounge seating, and some tables on the side if you're seeking a more intimate occasion, or if you are ordering food.  We weren't there for dinner, so we just sampled the cheese plate, but it was really good!  A lot of places simply throw a wedge or two of store-bought cheese on there (Costco or the like), but here there was a decent selection, along with dried fruits and nuts.  It was a nice tide over to dinnertime.

The wine selection was great, and pretty reasonably priced for the area and for a hotel bar.  My colleagues ordered G&Ts and scotch on the rocks, and were pleased both with the quality of the booze as well as the pours (same goes for the wine - the bartenders were generous!).

I would absolutely go back here next time I'm in the area.  An absolutely great place for a date or for drinks with friends, colleagues, etc.  Check it out for sure!!!
author: Becky M.

description:
Nice relaxing place to watch the sunset. 
Lives up to its name. Get there early to get a seat by a window. If not, there are plenty to seats around so you can still enjoy "the view".
author: Sugar B.

description:
This review is strictly about the bar and the atmosphere at night.
We went here for my friends birthday on a Thursday night. It was crazy busy! She had reserved 2 tables near the window but honestly it was so crowded there was no room to move! People were all over the place-crowding around the table, bumping into us- spilling my friends drink. I understand that this is not the establishments fault, but it was seriously effecting our evening. 
Yes the view is amazing! the drinks are good--overpriced but good. As far as a night out goes--ill probably stick to somewhere with more room.
I would like to go back and try the food during a time when they are not so busy- and to enjoy the view.
author: Erin K.

description: I was disappointed with the "view" of the place, unless you can arrive early and get a great seating spot, you wont even be able to enjoy the actual view from the place. There isnt really any entrees, mostly finger food and appetizers with several cocktails and wines. Its a nice place for a social gathering, but overall if you cant get a good seat then it isnt really as romantic as it could be. So make sure you get there early!
author: Terry W.

description: Great place :-) was with my wife . A wonderful place to have a fantastic night and good time , great views and excellent cocktails
author: Andy S.

description: ! Don exceeds the guest expectations flawlessly ! Cocktails & Apps were great, yet it's the service which  left a lasting impression. Don delivered the best service I've seen in over a decade, which made a short stop  there amazing. So appreciate the attention to detail and level of service!!! Frisco Smash was a refreshing Bourbon cocktail and the gorgonzola, pear & balsamic flatbread was super flavorful & well presented.
author: Tami B.

description:
One of the best restaurants with a view of the downtown. Great selection of cocktails and not so expensive. 
I wish they had more variety of food on the menu though. 
Over all- I love this place but will only come here to grab a drink.
author: Nujhat Nashia R.

description: For the price of admission (it's free folks), this is definitely a WOW view.   The bar prices are typical of a big city ($13 for a mixed drink, most wines are $10+, beers around $9.  There are lots of romantic seating areas - not all of them have great views.   If I were on a date, I would not hesitate to head here after dinner for a nightcap and canoodling (lots of couple seem to do that here).  It is NOT a good bar if you're on a business trip, alone.  The lobby bar is probably better for road-warriors to swap stories and drown their sorrows.
author: Marc M.

description:
Perfectly named as The View is just that.  The best views in the city of the financial district.

 Go for a drink, dessert or a snack and gaze out the enormous windows while you savor your martini.

The wine list is quite good,the specialty cocktail list quite tasty and the bartenders are quick with conversation.

It opens at 4 so get there early for the best seats.

A stunner that is sure to impress if you are a visitor to the city by the bay or if this is where you call home!
author: Carol K.

description: I finally made it here and boy, what a view. It's a gorgeous spot for date night. Everything is overpriced, as I'm sure you would imagine.
