I only stayed for one drink before heading elsewhere. I got their Old Fashioned, which was okay. The bartender was really nice. I'd defeinitely come back.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Awesome VIEW!
Super Service. Great food. Great drinks. 

I am not sure why I had not been here when I lived in SF. Now that I found it, I will make sure to drag my husband from our suburbia living back to the city - specifically to the VIEW.
author: July N.

description: The bar atop the Marriott in SFO has great views of the city. The drinks are reasonably priced for SFO - $15 for a cocktail. The place can get crowded on the weekends, usually a Wednesday or a Thursday would be ideal. The crowd is a mix, locals and hotel guests. Definitely worth getting a drink here if you are visiting SF.
author: Salman M.

description: San Francisco views, night or day are exquisite, especially from a skyscraper. To get those views from here definitely makes for a star-studded experience. I felt like I was on top of the world (a Leonardo DiCaprio moment from the Titanic kind of feeling). Scared of heights? Ummm, you may not want to come up here. I have to admit, I felt a little weak in the knees from being a little too far up. The views were spectacular though, so I forgot about my height fright. Drinks are a tad price, but don't let that deter you from going up there to experience these views. It will definitely help set the mood for whatever you are going there to accomplish. Date night? Why, of course! Go grab a spot in the corner and cuddle with sweetie! Big group? That's an easy one! There was a large booth with a huge table enough to fit about 8 people and even group of lounge chairs enough to accommodate your group. This place is grand and the view exhibits pure grandeur. It's on the top floor of the San Francisco Marriott.
author: Rebecca W.

description: The place is nice and definitely a little upscale, but it's a tourist spots so if your casually dressed don't feel bad either. Drinks are on the higher end but your paying for the View persay more so than the drinks. Good luck finding a seat, it may take a while unless you get hear right when they open. Drinks are strong and staff is friendly. Enjoy!!
author: Ramon C.

description:
Amazing view of the city! It gets really crowded though...I came around 5pm on a Tuesday and there were already so many people there (no more seats, even at the bar).

Drinks are pretty good, I tried two of their specialty cocktails which were both good. Their bartenders are quick so you don't need to wait long until you get your drink.
author: Theresa L.

description: One of my favorite bars in SF because of the beautiful city view. As far as drinks go, they have a standard bar nothing too fancy. Drinks are ok. Good lounge atmosphere.
author: Irma Z.

description:
I was really excited to visit The View after hearing so many great things about it, but it left me a bit cold.

Don't get me wrong, the view over San Francisco is unbelievable and I was completely spellbound by it the whole time I was there. I arrived about 20 minutes after opening and the place was already jam packed. I'd hoped to squeeze myself in to the bar (always my favourite spot) so I could people watch, chat with the bartender, and read, but alas the bar was packed like sardines. Luckily, I found a chair tucked in a corner that I pounced on and enjoyed for a while.

It took quite some time to get service - despite the fact that before I sat down I checked with a server if it was table service or if I needed to order at the bar. When she did arrive I asked about happy hour, but I suppose I was mistaken as apparently they don't have one. I ordered my drink, a tasty cucumber gin mix that I quite enjoyed, and asked for a large glass of water as I was feeling the effects of several nights partying with too little sleep and a cold was creeping up on me! The drink arrived after a few minutes (I get it, they were slammed) but I had to remind the server about my water. 

I do admit I was slower drinking than usual - my book was reeeeally good, and having a cold coming on didn't encourage me to slam my fancy, and pricey, drink. But, for me, that didn't excuse the terse tone of the waitress as she came over and said "do you like your drink? Because you're drinking it really slowly." There was no one waiting for my seat (it was on its own in a corner), and I certainly wasn't informed if there's a maximum time limit in which to finish a drink.

I would come here again with a group as I could see it'd be great for a group hangout, but I can't say it was the best experience for me. 5 stars for the view, 4 for the drink, 2 for service.
author: Ayla C.

description: Great view!!! A bit busy so go a little early. Great place for drinks and tapas. Had the beef carpaccio and plan to visit every time im in town
author: Tigest G.

description: It has two very beautiful views of the city because of its two big rooms. Make sure you get there right when it's open at 4pm as the seats near the windows are limited. Drinks are ok.
author: Mofy M.

description: The drinks were a bit pricey, but what you're really paying for is the absolutely gorgeous view of San Francisco. This is honestly my favorite vantage point of the city. I would definitely recommend stopping by just to take pictures. There was plenty of room to hang out, but definitely expect to wait a few minutes before finding a place to sit if you're coming at night. During the day the place was less packed and we were able to enjoy our Old Fashions while taking in the beauty that is San Francisco.
author: Donel L.

description: Inside the Marriott in the downtown San Francisco Mission neighborhood, on the top floor, lies a swanky bar and restaurant with a spectacular view. The place seems to be always packed and it makes a ton of sense considering their extensive and delicious food and drink menu. The seating can be tricky if you come with a large group, but it's totally worth it. Glass of rose' can cost you about $13 bucks, so come prepared to spend if you plan to be here for a while.
author: Helina G.

description: I finally had a chance to check out this place. I absolutely loved it! I've been looking for a place in the city with a nice view and this place did it's job. You can find this place on the 39th floor of the marriott. When we got there it was on a first come first served basis. Luckily.. We were able to find a great spot right by the window. The customer service was great. We ordered the Kobe Beef Sliders.. Which I found to be very tasty. I would order it again next time. As for the drinks we ordered wine and the Golden Gate Bridge. Both drinks were great. They have a good selection for wine and their cocktails. The only downside to this place is when it gets dark outside, it can get pretty dark inside too. It was a little irritating to my eyes. But besides that, I would definitely come back here.
author: Jadelann J.

description:
Really nice spot if you come around sunset. The colors in the sky are amazing, and you really do have a nice view. However.....this place gets SO crowded, and I think they are understaffed. The waitresses can't seem to handle the volume of people there. Our server was clearly overwhelmed and a little flustered when we ordered. In fact, we even asked for an extra shot in a drink and she said no. No -_- give me the shot on the side then, if we are paying for it, what's the problem?
I'd be back for an earlier time on a week day.
author: McKenna F.

description: Cool place to grab a cocktail and some snacks. The place was hopping on a Thursday night, and the view was great in many areas. The service was very attentive- based on how busy it was, I was expecting it to take some time for our table to be cleared, order taken, and food/drink to arrive. However, it was super fast. I had the skyline punch, which is very sweet and just as described. The hummus was tangy and delicious, and I appreciated the pickled vegetables on the side. A place I'll definitely return to next time I'm in the Bay Area.
author: Leighanna K.

description:
I hate repeating places when I'm out of town because I like to see as much as possible...but I came here twice in a week (and would have made it a third time if I didn't pass out). 

The views are stunning and their cheese plate is the best I've had in at least six months. I've been here during the day (gorgeous view) and at night (sparkle city). I recommend getting here as close to 5:00 (when they open) as possible because by 5:30 it was standing room only...on a Thursday. It is also not 21+ and found it odd for children in soccer uniforms to be roaming around...and found it especially annoying since I had to watch my mouth...which is hard to do when I've been drinking. 

BUT I couldn't ask for a better place to sit and drink and enjoy the atmosphere (and company). Lovely San Francisco bar!
author: Joelle P.

description: Holy moly. That is one heck of a view you got there!! Nothing else really matters when you've got a view like that!
author: JJ G.

description: This place is so nice! I love their Moscone Mule... super refreshing. Ironically, you might not get a seat with a view since it is usually pretty busy. I highly recommend the crème brulee. It was $7 and sharing size and so tasty!!
author: Jane H.

description:
There are some pretty goo views from this place.  Make sure to get there when it opens, all the good seats are taken really quick!  I mean really quick!!!  There are seats in the middle, but nothing compares to the seats next to the window!

We had a few beers and enjoyed the sunset.  Very nice and the staff were super friendly.
author: Rhett Y.

description:
Busy, busy, always busy. But, for good reason. They have the best creme brulee in the city, and one of the best views. Get a seat next to the window, if you can! It's hard to get any seating, at all. 

I had some appetizers and was satisfied, but the kitchen isn't their forte, they obviously specialize in their drinks and ambiance. Been here five times and would make it six if I still lived there! A great place to dine and get drinks.
author: Alexzandra E.

description:
This is on the 39th floor of the Marriott Marquis, so don't fret.  Just locate the elevators.  

I love the view from this place. The Sutro Tower side in the daytime, and the Bay Bridge side at night. Just walk around

Food = Good, for the most part.  They had great sliders (kobe beef with white cheddar) and the antipasti (OMG such good spicy salumi) was awesome. I tried the crispy shrimp but it was too lackluster in flavor. The View Trio was good but it wasn't my favorite.   Last call for food is 10:45, so you're in luck, if you're here 'after' dinner. ;-)

Drinks = yeah, they've got it.  Full bar. Enjoy.  Check out their Mocktails (it's quite delicious, really!!)  I love the ginger elixir. (I'm not always in the mood for alcohol.)

Good service! Yes, they have TVs.  Ask, and they might put on the game you want to see. 

Seating = first come, first serve.  They have two tops, four tops, lounge seating, and bar seating.  

My only complaint about this place: IT GETS BUSY FAST, AND IT'S IMPOSSIBLE TO GET A SEAT WITH A GOOD VIEW.  So try to get here early... they open their doors at 4 p.m., so good luck!! (Or if you're not into the sunset view, then come by later!)
author: Fannie S.

description: We arrived at The View around 4:45pm and it was already PACKED. All the seats with the gorgeous view were taken, of course, so we couldn't sit by the window. The waitress came by to take our order: beef sliders, bruschetta, cheesecake trio, and the pomegranate cosmo. The sliders and cosmo came out super quick! We waited literally less than 5 minutes. The sliders were good but nothing to write home about especially at a ~$17 price tag. The drink was also not bad but $15?? It was so small that I didn't even get buzzed.......and I get buzzed really easily ahhah. Then we waited for like 30+ minutes for the bruschetta, and once we asked about it, it came out really quickly. So I'm pretty sure they just didn't put the order in or something. I don't blame the waitress, she seemed to be the only waitress working the whole area and it was really busy. They really should hire some more people. Anyway, the bruschetta was also alright. Then came our cheesecake trio. The cheesecakes were really small and my favorite was the New York cheesecake. The mango cheesecake was a bit too sour. Overall, the food was not bad but nothing amazing, but the view was really really really nice.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
The drinks are really great as well as the view. 
The only thing that is not suits the restaurant is that you have to find the seat by yourself and no one helps you with that.
author: Shiva H.

description: I always hear my friends talk about this place and seen pictures. Finally I have the time to come to this place and I love it. Thought it would be a lot bigger but it's not disappointing at all. Excellent view of downtown. The bartenders were quick. Very modern and clean. There's not much choice of cocktails but it's a full bar so you can just order anything. You name it, they make it. Perfect if you want to grab drinks with a date. They also serve food too. I would definitely come back to this place and hopefully I can get the center seating/table so that I can get a better view while enjoying my drinks. You should definitely check this place out if you haven't; highly recommended.
author: Cindy W.

description: Nice place in San Fran to get small appetizers and cocktails from. The food was perfectly cooked and came out in a timely manor. We had the crab dip which was perfectly crips on the outside and nice and creamy on the outside. We had the sliders which were meatloaf sliders which were great. And the arugula salad serve with pear, nuts and grapes which I found interesting but balanced each other out. It was kinda busy but we met people and ended up being friendly enough to share the big table. Servers were attentive. Clean bathrooms and Reataurnt in general. Great place to come of your from out of town like me. Highly recommend. I can imagine it during the day
author: Rebekah S.

description: I love this place. I think it's one of San Francisco's best kept secrets. Cheaper drinks than the top of the mark, with equally as stunning views. It's big and the turnover is pretty fast, so if you don't get a seat right away, just be patient and you'll find something soon enough. I also just hosted a private event there. The food is excellent, the staff couldn't have been more wonderful, kind, organized, and helpful (thanks Vanessa on the event side, Porsche from PSVA and Jessica the waitress on staff that night, you're the best!). Love love love.
author: Marla L.

description:
Came here on my first night in San Francisco. Loved the view and the ambiance, however I wasn't a fan that I had to find my own seating. No seating list or reservations, at least not on Saturday night in September. 

Decent drinks, decent service, excellent view!
author: Krittika W.

description:
Pssst! Valentine's Day is right around the corner! 

Hubby decided to surprise me with an overnight stay at the Marriott. We just happen to stumble upon, "The View." As the name implies, boasts some of the best views of this iconic city, with the most notable and popular views being that of the Golden Gate. With floor to ceiling, massive windows, it made my heart skip a beat, looking down to the hustling city down below (I'm afraid of heights). 

We had gone there on a Saturday night and it gets quite crowded in here. Even though we didn't find prime seating at first, we were able to snag a romantic table for two, about a half an hour later, next to one of the big, expansive windows. 

We ordered a Cosmopolitan and Martini, the drinks were pretty average, but pricey. But hey, we were celebrating our anniversary.  Small price to pay to woo your LOVE!
author: Micki M.

description:
Gorgeous view, beautiful architecture. They make a strong Old Fashioned w a large ice cube. Lots of seating. 

Came here on a Friday night for a friend's birthday - lounge-y feel, dark, music playing but not so loud that you can't hear your conversations.
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
The View from this place is great. Pun intended! I can't believe I never visited this place after nearly 7 years in the Bay Area. Drinks are as "pricey" as one can expect in a hotel and in the city, but you pay for the ambiance. 

Such a great place to take visitors!
author: JC C.

description: Came here on New Year's Day evening.  It was the first time my boyfriend and I have been here.  We arrived about 8pm, were we able to get a couple seats at the end of the bar, just as a couple people were leaving.  The bar was pretty busy.  Our bartender quickly greeted us and took our order.  I ordered a cocktail with champagne, vodka and some fresh berries inside.   It was pretty strong, after one drink, I was feeling good!  Next, I ordered a cosmo, mmmm...it was delicious!  We had an awesome time, the view was amazing!!  Definitely would recommend this place and we can't wait to go back!
author: Jennifer S.

description: I love this place!! The view is out of this world! My friend and I went on a Sunday, we loved it so much that we stayed for about 3 hours! Good service, lovely ambiance and the crowd are of a more mature and classy crowd.
author: Ahlam S.

description:
I love the view from up here. Like dear sweet Keane's review, I concur, it feels like I found the key to Emperor's Palpatine office and sneaked in here to have a glass of old fashion. But don't worry, I have yet to be seduced to cross over to the dark side while I'm up here so you should be fine.

The great thing about this lounge is that unlike most other lounges, it's actually quiet enough when you sit by the windows that you can actually hear the words that are coming out of your date's mouth so a proper conversation could be had. This is definitely the sweet spot to take your handsome half on a night out.
author: Taffany H.

description:
I give it three stars only for the view. Other than a quick picture, this place is not worth actually having a drink or food at. 

When we went it was full of escorts and call girls. It was very uncomfortable and we left immediately.
author: Allie Y.

description: Wonderful place with beautiful interior and view. High quality service and qualified friendly staff. Huge selection of delicious dishes. If you like beautiful places I highly recommend visit The View!!
author: Billy G.

description: This place never disappoints- unless you can't find a table, then it's a little disappointing.  My favorite time to come is right before sunset, although on a Friday afternoon it can be packed well before 6pm.  I've also come on weekend nights, and the ambiance is really very pleasant.  The environment is diverse, as most SF bars are, but on average I'd say it's more of a well-dressed, classy crowd.  This is an excellent place to bring the SF visitor.
author: Evelyn T.

description:
Ooooo View, you so fannnn-say!  And to be honest, you really could have gone one of two ways: the way of sequins, affected British accents al la Madonna, pleather, and poorly conceived cheese balls, or the much more palatable way that you choose: come for the views, stay for the cocktails. (And the views.)

Beyond assuring Yelpers that 1. yes, you should get here early 2. no, the view isn't overrated, 3. yes, the beer and wine list leave something to be desired, but 4. no, you won't mind because the cocktails are on point and the service is fantastic, there's not much left to be said. Oh, except that there's a really great view. Has anyone mentioned that yet?
author: Laura N.

description:
If you want to run shoulders with San Francisco's high society coupled with a great view of the City, then this is the place for you!

The bar itself is nothing too fancy. In fact, it's bordering on the small end so expect service to be slow during busy hours. 

The general bar area is also small with limited (and very hard to get) seats, especially the ones with the view (obviously), so expect to either stand or sit on the sides. 

As for the drinks- you have your typical drinks menu with the only exception that the drinks are priced for as high as The View. Be prepared to spend about/over $30 for two drinks - for me, it was for a bottle of bar and a glass of champagne. 

The view really is spectacular here. You should be one not wary of heights though because the moment you step out of that elevator, you realize that you're not on Earth's solid ground anymore. I personally enjoyed it.
author: KJ S.

description:
Horrible service. No one cared to help us find a table and we sat for ten minutes with every waiter passing right by us. We finally had to go to the front to get drinks. Then out waiter never checked up on us. Waited over 15 minutes for a check before we had to track around the lounge to track someone down again. Moscow Mule didn't even come in traditional mug. Very disappointed.

Come for the actual view, but not the service.
author: Jordyn L.

description:
As a San Francisco native, going here during the the summer is THE WORST b/c of the tourists who are hanging around there.

But, def would go again because it has pretty views and a good loungy feel.
author: Yas G.

description: Tourist trap with expensive drinks and food. Nice view, but I would take a peek, snap a few pictures and then leave.
author: Sam R.

description:
Wow!!  This place is amazing, and there is a reason it has such a high rating: the very thing that gives its name!  That VIEW!

I highly recommend to go before sunset.  What a treat it was to catch a seat and see the city in daylight and then by night - a very cool experience.

The drinks are pricey, but rightly so for this venue.  And they are good!  I had a moscow mule, and it was great.  My friends ordered various mixed drinks, and all enjoyed them.  They were well worth it.

Be prepared to watch like a hawk in order to snag seats when they open up.  It can get packed!

No matter who you are, you'll probably fit in here.  It's a real mix of tourists, locals, business people, everything in between.
author: Lauren S.

description:
One of the best places in the entire city! I hate to yelp about it because I want to keep it my hidden gem! 

The cocktails are well made and always on point! Alos the food is to die for. Depending on the time of day the atmosphere can be business casual, romantic or upbeat. 

A great place to start off the night, finish it or just kick back by one of the spectacular windows!
author: Jenn S.

description:
Like most things at this hotel, I was expecting The View to be ridiculously overpriced, but it ended up surprising me in being "acceptable" in terms of pricing. Fine you can charge me over $10 for a cocktail that only sounds OK, if you also give me the option of getting a $6 or $7 bottle of beer. 

It holds true to it's namesake, the view from The View is worth the trip up here, I'm not big on all the SF vantage points, but for a location such as this, the crowd levels here are surprisingly low. Thanks to low cloud covers, we couldn't see much of the skyline which was a bummer. And most (if not all) the tables here are by a window so you won't be stuck with no view regardless of where you sit. You get to seat yourself too which is also an added bonus so you can pick and choose your view or go crazy and shift to a table on the opposite end halfway through your visit. 

I ordered myself a good bitter beer called Prohibition which came in a fun bottle and I would recommend it. We also got their cheese, dried fruit platter with honeycomb and it was delicious! (Picture uploaded).

I would recommend the View, if you want a place with not a whole bunch of people to take in the views of the city with a drink in hand!
author: Dishan W.

description: Beautiful view of the sunset. Limited seating. Great service and delicious food. Worth the wait.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
I recently found The View Lounge on a list titled "19 Bars in America You Should Drink At Before You Die." Having recently moved to the Bay Area, I had some friend's visit for the holiday weekend and I wanted to finally check out this place while they were in town and get it off the so-called bucket list of bars. 

Upon arrival, the location was easy to find and well accessible on the 39th floor. Once exited from the elevators, it was like a standard bar with very little staff and some crowds. Someone was nice enough to inform my boyfriend a new section of the bar had opened up and we were seated next to the window for a wonderful view. We settled in and ordered drinks from the cocktail menu ($12-$18 each which is expected for a place such as this in the city). I absolutely love manhattan's and when mine arrived, it did not taste like a manhattan at all and I second guessed if I had just ordered my whiskey on the rocks. My friend's ordered some drinks as well and they were nothing to really rave about but tastier than mine for sure.

Appetizers were next. Too many appetizers in fact because the amount of food in them was so small. My boyfriend ordered the pork belly and there was probably 4 actual pieces of pork surrounded by a whole bowl of onions and broth. The cheese platter and it's cheese selection were great though. We decided after some drinks and about five appetizers that it was time to ask for the check. 

When the bill arrived, it was $181.39. We threw in $140 cash and the rest was to be charged to my debit card. Our server, Don, returned to inform me he somehow hadn't seen the cash (despite us saying "cash first please") and had charged the entire amount to my card. No worries though, he had rectified it and issued a return and I was only to be charged the accurate $41.39 + subsequent tip. I am specific here because this is where the food and drink experience got worse for me. I leave the restaurant adding $10 tip on my card and a good amount of additional cash. $51.39 signed to be charged. It is now July 7 and 3 days after being at the bar this is how my debit account currently looks:
- $181.39
- $51.39
- $41.39

Yes folks, I was in fact charged three times over 48 hours. The only authorized amount I should have been charged was $51.39. The best part is that the $51.39 and $41.39 were charged on July 6 - two days after I went to the lounge.

I have called today and spoken with the hotel and it's finance department. They can "do something in 6-8 days" if my bank "can not handle it." I was informed to call my bank to dispute the charges because it is easier for them for me to handle their mess than to issue an immediate refund. The best part is they noted they saw the multiple charge errors in their system but it was my duty to get this fixed. How very fun for me! I have spent over an hour today trying to get almost $225 of unauthorized charges off of my account because staff members thought they could just keep charging my card for the same transaction but in alternate amounts!

Let me add, I have worked with high-end restaurants for 8+ years. I know good food, good craft cocktails, and most importantly good service so I am not a person that doesn't understand the efforts here for the dining experience. The restaurant is designed impeccably down to the china and the attention to detail is very good. The service was just beyond inadequate on my visit. If you go here, go only for the view, expect to be amazed very little by anything but it, and bring cash only because they clearly have not been trained on how to properly work a computer. Utterly ridiculous and absolutely shitty customer service after the fact!
author: Holly M.

description: Great place with a great view! They have great cocktails and good finger food to go along with your drinks! The ambience is great! Although getting a good table to enjoy the view might not be easy on weekends!
author: Tanushree C.

description:
This Marriott Marquis is beautiful and the view from The View was even more spectacular.  We came around 7pm on a Saturday night for some drinks before dinner.  Service was very slow here.

When the drinks finally came, they were pretty good.  And their house chips with the dipping sauce was delicious.  Def worth coming here for the view and watching the sunset is beautiful here.
author: Audrey C.

description:
I was very surprised that this place is packed even during the week!

We went around 9 p.m. on a Tuesday for my husband's birthday.
I had reached out to the management about making a reservation but they informed me that it was not possible. The manager was helpful and I appreciated the quick response.

We had white wine, an old fashioned cocktail (small size), the tuna tataki, the shrimp ceviche and the pork belly (my husband's favorite plate there!). The plates are tiny and pretty pricey but they are good and very well presented!

The service was excellent! Very attentive staff. I told a waiter it was my husband's birthday and he treated us with a piece of birthday cake! That was very thoughtful.

I recommend arriving right at 6 to get a good seat, suggested also by the manager. 

We had a hard time finding a seat period at the time we went and it was even harder to get one by a window! Luckily people left and we were able to move twice :-)

Amazing lounge bar, I am looking forward to the next time we go!
author: Leslie S.

description: Skyline Punch and Marquis Old Fashioned with my sunshine :) The view is simply breathtaking! Pictures do not do enough justice! Atmosphere is casual and ambiance is classy and sophisticated. Highly recommended for a date night :)
author: Christine N.

description:
Come for the view, have one of their well made drinks, perhaps a bite to eat.

At the top of the 'juke-box' Marriott, this space has lots to windows with amazing views all over the place, lots of places to sit and relax, very good service, and lovely quaffs.

Usually full of tourists and a few locals. Unique in SF.

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Cool place to go for drinks(being an "out of towner."  On the top of the Marriott Marquis, there were some great views at sun set.
Bar service with apps.  I think this is a more of a drinks and view kind of place than getting something to eat.  
Made a very good Old Fashioned!  Will return!
author: John J.

description: Our favorite place the spend our saterday evening at. Great wine/great service/great view/great food. At "must" if you're in town.
author: Gilles V.

description:
I have been here now about 6 to 7 times and each time had a great time. Been here during the day, at night, on weekends, and on weeknights. The prices are around $12-15 drinks, thank god, or else it would get even more crowded. Sitting my the windows is definitely the way to go. It's fun to hang here with friends or on dates. The service is great too; I've never had a bad experience. 

I think the place is not that popular simply because it's on top of the Marriott as oppose to some nicer hotel name or even something unknown -- but def a jewel.
author: Nolan M.

description:
Food is not bad. View is amazing.

They don't take reservations so you just have to show up, walk around, and hope you catch a group leaving so you can get a table. It could be a long wait to get a table or a short one depending on how lucky you are.
author: Rica Z.

description:
The view was amazing on Super Bowl Weekend. What a great time. Plan on $14-20 a drink. 
Food seems a little skimpy.  plan on eating somewhere else but the drinks and view are great.
author: Aaron S.

description: I went to grab a drink on a Friday late afternoon. It was too hot in the lounge, and the air was not circulating at all. I ordered a $15 drink, and my credit card got charged $73.
author: Chu N.

description: The view here is great, but you pay for it via drinks. Probably one of the best places to go in SF for a rooftop view (it's unfortunately limited here). I recommend coming here around 7, just before the sun sets! (Be careful to make sure Karl the Fog is not blocking your view)
author: Jessica C.

description:
I've been here a few times, most recently on a friday night. The venue has a great view (provided you can sit on the 'good' side of the bar). Their cocktail and bar list are decent; however, the food options are limited. Its a good place to stop by on the way to dinner or a night out. But definitely not a destination in and of itself. 

As an side, the light up menus are a bit obnoxious and blinding when you want to focus on the view. Perhaps they are a metaphor for the entire venue - they sound good in theory, but don't quite live up to expectations.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Took my girlfriend here as a surprise for a romantic evening in the bay area, we get to the hotel and was a little confused on how to find this little bar but eventually was pointed in the right direction. We get up there about a half hour before sunset and snag one of the last tables, unfortunately it was in the back side of the bar, but that's okay we were somewhat secluded and a huge window with one if the most breathtaking views of the city. Everything was amazing that night. Except for the prices and service. For being a public accessible bar needing renovations. Clean, but needed some TLC, the prices for a glass of wine were crazy. It seemed like there were only two servers to the crowded lounge area so service took a while. 
I'd recommend this spot as a date, not a hang out. Might come back just for the view, it is amazing.
author: Ian H.

description:
As the name suggests, come here for spectacular views of the the San Fransisco skyline. Located on the top floor of the Marriott hotel, I wasn't expecting much when my coworkers suggested we pop by for a pre-dinner cocktail. My ears popped as we went up and up and up some more, until we arrived at the very top. We were greeted by gorgeous soaring arched windows that showcased the city. We arrived around sunset, which was lovely, but the sky was so foggy we weren't able to see too far. However, what we did see was beautiful, and if I lived in the city I would come here often just to stare at that view.

The lounge offers sharing plates, and a lovely wine and cocktail menu. I opted for the Soma Spritzer with Prosecco, St Germain and fresh berries. It was totally simple, refreshing and divine. I could have had 5 if it weren't for the $14 price tag.

One thing to note is that seating space always seems quite limited here, and our comfy chairs were snatched up the moment we rose to leave. It would be great for an intimate night out, but probably not the best for a group.

Our server was very sweet and efficient, so A+ for service.

Come here for a romantic dinner or cocktail with your special someone. If you can time in around sunset, extra points for you!
author: Andrea B.

description:
After a great dinner over in Sausalito we decided to skip dessert there and head back to the city for our dessert and a drink at The View at the Marriott Marquis.  

The View is located on the 39th floor of the hotel and offers amazing views of San Francisco from the huge window in the center of the restaurant.  Seating is open and first  come, first serve.  We found a table for two off in one of the side rooms.  The city was still a little foggy but the view cleared up as the night went on.

We ordered our drinks.  Anchor Steam beer for me and glass of Port for her.  We also shared a trio sample of mini-desserts.  It was perfect for us.

It was very busy for a Sunday night and it was a little noisy which made conversation a little challenging, but was a great place to chill out after dinner.

Nice way to cap off an outstanding trip to SF.
author: Daniel M.

description:
What a great way to see the city!

My friend and I saw this on "top bars to view the city" list and decided to try it out. They didn't open until 4pm, but when we arrived at 4:05pm most of the prime window seats were already taken. If you're going to go, get there early!

It's a nice, relaxed atmosphere with casual dress code. It's not a restaurant, so don't expect any big meals. They have your standard beers, wines, liquors, and some good appetizers.

The staff seemed pretty friendly, although I only really interacted with the waitress. I had a craft beer and my friend a martini, which he said was pretty good. So, I can't really complain about the drinks, the atmosphere, or The View.
author: Stephen B.

description: I really enjoyed the view, nice hotel. I just prefer something more low key. Other than that it was great
author: Great R.

description:
Such a great place to go for a drink in the city. Just get there when they open so you can find a seat with a view. And what a view!
This place must be one if the best places to come.
author: Natalie B.

description: When I first walked in I thought the bar was pretty small but there are actually a lot of side rooms with windows, so be sure to go all the way around to scout the best seat. The skyline punch is delicious and we had a very good local cheese plate. It took a while for a waiter to come over to our table but once they did they checked back often.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Great place to have a drink and enjoy SF view. It is usually too crowded over the weekend which makes it hard to find a table and order drinks. But the view from the top definitely worth trying the place at least once.

We rented the place for a private party and management was very helpful in organizing the event. We had great time and may probably rent out the place again in future.
author: Reza F.

description:
Been here many times - for Happy Hour with friends & tech industry parties. Two things that are awesome (besides the view of course):

1st, I was at an industry party a few weeks ago and was amazed by the service level & friendliness by Steve. It was a packed house but he made sure everyone had a drink and if you wandered away from where you ordered, he would always find you. I have never ever had that kind of service at these types of parties. 

2nd is they will always try to accommodate you for HH - it helps to get there on the early side but they are very nice about it and not snooty at all.
author: Karen S.

description:
Can only comment on a few aspects:

View: INSANE. Think roof top Gansevoort in meatpacking NYC at night, incredible view of SF skyline and downtown buildings. Don't know of anything better. 

Ambiance: incredible. Great spot for date night, take clients, power lunch, just for kicks, whatever. No bad reason to stop in here. 

Food: did not eat

Drinks: good enough selection, had some beers and wine, saw some folks order champs. Service was decent enough. 

Place is massive, two sides, with several pockets/areas to each side. But after 5-6pm this place fills up quick so get in early.
author: Tommy K.

description:
Why drink anywhere else when you can swoon over the sights at The View? Oh well the prices...oh and inattentive service....but...ok there are reasons but the view at The View is worth the trouble. 
The cocktail waitresses make up for what they lack in serving skills and common sense in sex appeal and the $15 price tag on the drinks is...well just kind of ridiculous but here's the thing- don't get sucked in by the fancy cocktail list, they're just ok. The Fog City Collins was nice and the Mission Marg. was ok but they're pretty gimmicky. My suggestion: order a Sazerac from Kevin.  Although I liked that he served it in a snifter, I'm pretty sure that's not correct, but I liked that he made the drink with conviction and he knew what he was doing in the mixology ;p. Best one I've had this side of N'awlins.
author: Emma H.

description: Simply blown away! Pretty much as good as it gets! Amazing views of both sides of the bar. Make sure to get there when they open at 4 to grab a window seat! My friends and I got there around 5:45 and it was jam packed. Then having to end up fighting for closer seating. About an hour later we got a window seat. Great place to take a date or have a few drinks with friends. Definitely will be back!
author: Keylo P.

description:
This is a great place to go if you're visiting San Francisco! But the things that make it great for tourists are also the things that make it less appealing to me.

What's good:
It is located on the top floor of the Marriott hotel and has huge windows overlooking the city. The view really is breathtaking, day or night.

What's not so good:
The drinks are way overpriced. Nothing special about them, except that you're looking out a high window while you drink them.
The crowding is awful! The limited window seating fills up quickly, and if you can't sit by the window, there's really no other reason to be here.

Overall, I love taking friends and family here when they visit me. But if it's just a normal night on the town, I prefer something less crowded and more relaxed, like Shotwell's or Oddjob.
author: Dan D.

description:
This is one of my favorite lounges in the city. The name says it all! Even on days where it's foggy, or even rainy (thanks El Niño), there's a beautiful view on either side of the lounge. 

Drinks are typically priced for San Francisco. People are normally welcoming about sitting next to them or taking an empty chair from their group. Nonetheless, try to arrive early for prime seats.
author: Linda O.

description:
I literally want my fiance to propose to me here. 

This is literally one of the most amazing, romantic places I have ever been to.
author: Rivy O.

description:
Bar with realllyyy nice view! Intimate setting, wknds aren't too loud or crowded.

Pretttyyyyyyy! :) Glass wall view, high ceiling. Cute place! Great place to take someone on a date! 

Con is if there isn't any seats, its not one of those bars/lounges you'd want to just stand around with a drink. Its a sit and sip type of place.
author: Diana W.

description:
AMBIANCE: This place is great! I absolutely love the view! Honesty one of the most beautiful views because you get a bit of the city as well as the ocean view.  Such a beautiful  view!! Everyone is Trendy(asSFgets/business professional. I love it during the day as well as at night.

FOOD/DRINKS: They only have small plates. However, they are realllllly good!!! The carpaccio is amazing and so is the cheese platter! Drinks are well poured and taste great. Kinda pricy but your paying for the ambiance.

SERVICE: Okay. But DON was AMAZING!!! Went above and beyond to accommodate us! He helped us find seating...made it work even when e kitchen was closed! Such an amazing waiter!!! Excellent service!!!!!!WOW!! 


OVERALL: This place was amazing. It's a must see place! DO NOT LEAVE SF BEFORE GRABBING A  DRINK/APP HERE!!!
author: Salumeh F.

description: View is great! Service SUCKS!! Tourist magnet & best left to them to enjoy the sights whilst they wait for their drinks...
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Great view of the city from this 39th floor location. Waitstaff was polite, friendly, and quick.
author: Naveen N.

description: I should give a 5 star review as the scenery/views are amazing and there is plenty of seating. Taking one star off for the overly expensive drinks. $17 for a martini is a bit much!
author: Toya H.

description:
I am a native San Franciscan.  Born and raised here so coming to this top floor building to admire the view of the city, would not be something I would ever consider or suggest.  

My friend brought me here to grab drinks in this neighborhood on a Friday night and to enjoy the view, I suppose.  I was not impressed, unfortunately.  There were simply other places that I have been to, that has better perspectives of the glowing city's landscape.

In addition to that, there is an overcrowd on attempting to order drinks - especially at the bar.  It took us awhile to order up drinks and get a table.

I got their Manhattan and it was strong.  It's a good drink that will last and suffice.  

Ultimately, there could be more staffing and better servicing around ordering up drinks.  You would think that this place would have adequate staffing with its decor and ambiance.  

Nope.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Come for the view not for the drinks. They could use more skilled bartenders for the prices they are charging. So what can i say typical hotel bar with a great view.
author: Susan S.

description:
There is pretty much one reason to go to this bar, and it's in the name. That said, it's a pretty awesome reason. Sure, it's a little expensive, can get a little crowded, etc, but it is also a great place to just sit and overlook the city after a busy day of sightseeing. Kick back and relax and enjoy what you've seen. Plus, it's only a little south of Union Square which makes it really convenient.

If you have guests in town, this is a great place to take them. Otherwise, just make an excuse to go yourself every once in a while.
author: Brent W.

description:
Wow! Although I had poor luck with the weather and things never do actually go according to plan when it comes to planning in general.. this spot is perfect for late night drinks with plenty of suave and loads of fun. 

-------------------------------------

[Atmosphere/ Decor]

Think of yourself as 007 AKA James Freaken Bond, you're thirsty but you don't feel like going to a regular dive bar or lounge... you need a spot that can refresh your "liver" and perfectly express your classy touch. Well, the View where it is.. With a nice intimate atmosphere and a stunning view of the SF city lights (granted it isn't foggy). What more can I say... along with the great atmosphere, the seating isn't that bad as well..nice comfy seats all around and some darn it good dark lighting for you mysterious people.

[Food/ Drinks]

Pricing is a little expensive but you don't have to worry about that right Mr. Bond?

For dessert, I recommend getting the (pick your three mini dessert) choice. My Favorite is the Espresso Creme Brulee! TRY IT..YOU KNOW YOU WANNA!

As for the Drinks, a popular choice there and my favorite is their Skyline Punch. It's a nice touch of Pineapple, citrus, and also packs a punch of Rum for you classy people.

[Service]

Awesome service with great recommendations if you're unsure of what to order, though that's the fun of a new place right?!

--------------------------------------

What more is there to say... when you're in the mood to play secret agent with a thirst for danger, The View is where you outta be!
author: Daniel N.

description:
I came here on a Saturday night with 7 others. Surprisingly, the place wasn't packed and there was open seating! We easily grabbed a couch and ordered just two drinks. They were slightly expensive compared to typical-lounge prices, but I was just happy they didn't ask for bottle service in order to be sitting at that couch. That, by itself, made this place worthwhile.

The view of downtown was a bit underwhelming. Well, the windows were enormous and beautiful, but the San Francisco skyline just isn't a particularly pretty view. If this lounge were teleported to the middle of the strip in Las Vegas, it would easily be one of the most spectacular views there.
author: Nathan Y.

description: The views are gorgeous!!! Absolutely love it during the day and night
author: Viki L.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here twice in one day - once in the afternoon and again later that night. The view through the windows is amazing!!! And they have really good cocktails. I had the Skyline Punch and it was delicious!
It is a bit pricey, but we really didn't expect anything different, given the location and how beautiful the view and bar itself were. The only real complaint I have is it was rather difficult finding somewhere to sit, as there were a lot of people there on the Saturday we went. But I was find simply standing in a corner where I could admire the beautiful view!
author: Katherine P.

description:
Gorgeous view in the main area. Dishes were lacking in flavour (had the sliders and chicken wings), so would not recommend coming for the food. Food and drinks were well priced (considering the view and service) and the ambience was brilliant. Self seating, so be sure to try and scope out a spot near the windows. Great tourist spot for a quick drink before heading out for the night. 

Would also recommend for a romantic night out.

Would definitely check it out again next time I'm in SF.
author: Umair K.

description:
Worth coming up here at least once.

The window at the center has probably one of the best views in San Francisco (sans Transamerica building which is only accessible if you have an office or meeting there I believe).
author: Barry T.

description: Worth checking out for the view but that's it. If you're unable to get a table near a window then forget it. Service is mediocre at best and drink prices are steep. Mules not served in copper mugs which is already a red flag in my book. Our server would disappear for LONG periods of time. When we were ready to cash out he was nowhere to be found. After walking around and unable to locate him, I figured i'd just cash out at the bar. I waited for a good 5 minutes just to have someone look at me and then waited more after they did. I gave the bartender my last name and he brought over my receipt and card only to find out it wasn't even my credit card or tab. The name was nowhere close to mine!  That's concerning especially if you're the other customer. He asked if I had a server and I told him yes but hes been hiatus for about 30 minutes. I was told that he couldn't cash me out because the bar and are servers were "two separate entities." Give me a break...server finally showed up with the right check and card and we left.
author: Josue R.

description:
Great place w an amazing view of course...a bit loud for my taste but overall a great experience. Had a few cocktails w my girlfriends there, service was friendly and polite
Drinks were good, pricey as expected but pretty decent. Would I be back? I think so, for the wonderful view
author: Patricia H.

description: Great views of the city and friendly staff. Standard drinks and nice little selection of appetizers. FYI, if you're looking for a table next to the windows come early.
author: Jimmy W.

description: Great view of the city, if you're lucky enough to get a seat by one of the windows. Drinks were good but pricey at $15 a pop, however that's expected at a place like this. It's on top of a hotel so the crowd is mixed, locals and tourist groups.
author: Cara S.

description: Very nice cocktails with a great view, but of course they come with a price... worth in money AND time ;)
author: Alex F.

description:
Great view BUT they close at 1:00 am.
Drinks are reasonably priced.
author: Claudine V.

description: I have been trying to go here for awhile, for some reason it was closed for renovations for quite some time this year.  I tried again this week and yayyy it reopened.  Just a hint though- if you get there before opening the elevator button will not work.  I got there right an opening because I wanted one of those great seats next to the window and I'm so happy I did.  The view is amazing and totally worth the overprices drinks and mediocre wine and beer list.  I was so happy to come up here and see the beautiful views.  There is quite a bit of space for seating but not all of them allow you to enjoy the view.  The cocktails we had were tasty and it was a lot of fun.
author: Kate F.

description:
The View Lounge is such a nice place to go to. It is a bit pricey so can not do this every weekend but definitely a place to treat your date or a special friend. I went here on Saturday afternoon to see the view of SF from 39th floor! The huge arched windows are totally gorgeous and the view through it is amazing. Just be careful where you sit, there are 4 sections, each section offering a different view. There are different kinds of seats available too, normal dining table to high chairs, and sofas.

The cocktail and wine list is impressive, they even have a good New Zealand white on the list too! I had the Moscow Mule, made with vodka and ginger beer, it was a superb refreshing blend for a warm summer afternoon. 

The staff are super friendly and courteous, willing to offer a helping hand with suggestions if you ask. There was only one woman who came with her kid, thankfully the kid was behaving himself. This is in a touristy hub, so expect people requesting their picture to be taken.

The men's restroom only has one urinal and one stall, there is a sofa out in the aisle for waiting though. The bathroom were clean but it was a little disorderly towards the later part of the night. It didn't stink, so that gets a thumbs up from me.

I live in the East Bay, can see myself being a regular here for special date nights or treating a friend for birthdays or other events!
author: Sunny E.

description: Great place to go out with friends. Enjoyed excellent service, a clean area to hang and met some really cool people while there. Definitely a must when visiting or out in the city!
author: Tiandra B.

description:
Came in around 9pm on a Thursday night. It's open seating and all the seats next to the windows were taken. I'm pretty sure the place is almost always busy because of the view and location but there was some event going on so the place was packedddd! 
Luckily there was a party leaving so we were able to snatch a seat in the corner with a view. 
We ordered a few drinks and bites. We got the tuna tartare, pork belly lettuce wraps and vanilla bean creme brûlée. They were alllll yummy and better than I expected. 
I loved the atmosphere. The lounge is dimly lit and has a very warm feel. It can be loud unless you find a seat in the corner, so it can be good for a big crowd or even a date night. It was a diverse crowd where there were young couples being all cute and lovey dovey in the corner but also a group of elders celebrating a birthday with balloons, birthday hats and popping bottles lol. 
The service was amazing. Despite being busy, every time we ordered a new round of drinks they came quick. 
Only downfall is it can get packed and finding a decent seat to enjoy the view(which I'm sure is the main goal of everyone coming here) and not standing around can be difficult. But overall I can't wait to be back!
author: Joanne L.

description:
This is a nice spot to finish your evening (or to watch the sun set).  It's not my favorite place to go in the city, but it's still enjoyable because of the really awesome views.

It can be difficult to find a place to sit on weekends, and the place is really funnily configured so there are hidden nooks you might not even expect to find a table....but keep looking and eventually you'll be able to set up camp.

Service can sometimes be a little snooty.  Or maybe not snooty but aloof?  I guess that's to be expected when the clientele is mostly passers-through and tourists....people they'll likely never see again.

The wine list is alright (I expect better from a lounge so close to Napa, come on guys) and the cocktail list is a lot of fun.  Snacks are good as well, and there's a fair variety to choose from.  

Bathroom is kinda janky but it's a heavily-trafficked hotel bar so that's par for the course.

Consider this 3.5 stars.
author: Heather K.

description: Definitely delivers an amazing view of the downtown area. Can get a bit crowded due to the small space, but worth checking out.
author: Andy S.

description:
My bf and me came here because it was named one of the nicest bars in the country. I just want to clarify that there is a difference between nice and best. This place was nice but I didn't enjoy myself at all.
-It was crowded and filled with tourists.
-we circled the place a couple times before we got a seat. And it's first come first serve on seats or...if you are lucky to find a seat and take it before someone else sees you take it. The strategy is to hover over people that may be leaving soon and swoop in while they are getting up.
- their food options sucked They sucked so bad that I ordered the house potato chips. And I never eat potato chips. I also ordered pizza when I got home because I was still hungry 
-my bf got an $18 pork belly and It came with 4pathetic pieces of pork belly in a soup of turnip stuff
- everything was so expensive. Unnecessarily expensive
-this place is loud, but it could also have be
 normal loud. I was just having such a shitty time that I was annoyed by everything
-on the bright side the view is nice and if you come just for drinks, on a full stomach, and get a seat if should be really nice. But still expensive.
author: Julianna I.

description: Such an amazing view and the drinks were pretty good. They tasted good and they were strong which is always nice. It was pretty pricey but what do you expect when you go to a nice place in the city. Pretty crowded and difficult to find a seat but I also went Saturday night during a busy hour.
author: Janelle S.

description:
Ok, maybe there is someplace better & I haven't found it.  We spent two evenings here because the weather was phenomenally clear with crazy beautiful colors for sunset.  We completely lucked out and got tables by the windows on the West side both nights.  

It's nice that the tables behind us were higher so not being at the window still gives you a great view.  Both sides have great views!  I'd love to eat breakfast on the East side, but I don't think they do that.  They do serve appetizer fare & the Blood Orange Cocktail is delicious!  The servers were always friendly and welcoming.  

If you are at one of the window tables just resolve that you will always have people coming up behind you or squeezing in between tables to take photos if it's a nice day.  It totally had a chill vibe and everyone was quiet and calmed.  It was very romantic & relaxing (if you didn't look at the carpet) and I would highly recommend it during any weather or any time.
author: Melanie E.

description: Chill atmosphere with the music being not too loud. A good place to talk. The drinks were so so. I only recommend coming here for the view.
author: Michelle S.

description: Wonderful view (go figure!) of the city day and night. Can get crowded but overall very casual and friendly atmosphere. Dress code is semi-casual to upscale, but there is no snobbery in sight. Fair/average drink prices.
author: Veronica A.

description: This is a quiet chill environment to go eat and drink with a beautiful view. Most dress casual.
author: Jackson P.

description: Came here on the Wednesday before thanksgiving around 530. The place wasn't empty or full and my gf and I were able to find seating next to the window looking over downtown - the two views are downtown or back towards the west. The pictures that people have uploaded here don't do it justice, this place is great: ambience, view, lighting, decor. The drink prices were what I would expect for a nice place like this and I repeat that the view is worth it. Def the best place I've been to in sf for drinks before dinner and a night out in nearby union sq or soma.
author: Caleb R.

description:
Came here on a whim after spending the afternoon walking around downtown San Francisco. We actually arrived at the hotel around 3:50 and waited until it opened at 4:00 to get in. Trust me this was a great idea as around 15 minutes after it opened, tons of people showed up to get seats.

Why was it so busy you ask? Let me tell you. This view is INCREDIBLE. You can see both the East Bay as well as the north depending on where you sit. And there isn't a bad seat in the house, except maybe at the bar because then you're not taking advantage of the view (and I don't know why that wouldn't be your first priority any way). My boyfriend and I ended up picking the table that was in the center of the view, just as you walk in. But there are lounge couches, hight tops and other seats galore to sit at all around the restaurant (which was quite large). 

There's a very sophisticated, sleek vibe to the place. Everything is very modern in terms of the decor and furnishings. 

The prices I think are reasonable for a rooftop place, but a little expensive if you're expecting just casual restaurant prices. However, the drinks are delicious. I had a Skyline Punch, which was fruity and strong. We also ordered the cheese plate, which was a great accompaniment to our drinks.

There is no way I won't be coming back. I'd love to just sit, have a drink, and enjoy the view as I do some work.
author: Saroya W.

description: The top of the Marriott. This place will be PACKED. You have to be a sniper and harass people as soon as they look like they might leave to be able to secure a spot and when you do, you will have people hovering over your back as you look out over downtown. Drinks are typical inflated hotel prices, but were made strong.
author: Andrew Q.

description: Great view.  OK drinks.  Super touristy and packed.  Hard to find a seat and if you do, there's a million people hovering waiting for you to leave.
author: Kim K.

description:
Very beautiful views of the city, great cocktails.

My date and I loved the new shrimp tostado small plate, which is new on the menu and we highly recommend! 

The wait staff were unbelievably hospitable. It was a very pleasant experience. Thank you!
author: Meaghan H.

description: This place is so gorgeous! Great place to come for a date or just to sit and look out the window with your drink in your hand! WOW! I really liked the atmosphere here.
author: Marevie T.

description: Cool place but gets super crowded and all the good seats get taken. Found a nice guy to let us sit with him. Loved my drinks and my waitress type person helped me to chose a new drink I haven't tried based on my preferences. When I tried it, it was a bit strong for me so they doctored it up for me. Perfect :) bit price adds up.
author: Candice K.

description:
This maybe the only place that has somewhat of a "rooftop" view of San Fran. I literally went into the Marriot, went to the top floor, and walked around on top. Both sides of the floor have city views, if you're looking just for the view you might find it hard to get close since there are many seats and couches that are occupied by guests. 

My guess would be to come here during the morning/day time to avoid the late night rush. Its really not something that spectacular. The Samovar Tea Lounge in SF has a better view and you're actually outside.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
This place no doubt has an amazing view + bomb Korean wings, but this review is solely based on my experience Saturday night 8pm with Yordi. We already felt an unwelcoming bad vibe and sensed Yordi staring us down, along with a forced smile. Tried to order one beer, she said(and I quote) "Based on my judgement, I can't serve you because you've had too much to drink" This is by the most outrageous shit I've ever heard. After coming out of work you would think a glass of beer would be acceptable. I kindly asked what makes you say that because we did not have one sip of alcohol." She turns to my friend and said has the nerve to say "you look drunk."  Well yeah, what do you expect? after sitting 20 minutes admiring the god damn beaming sun, that tends to happen LOL. Mind you, we are all adults, 23 to be exact. We weren't loud, or causing any scene. We spoke to the "manager", and she of course sided with Yordi. She felt as though we were going to be a liability of hurting ourselves. Quite absurd, you know what is a liability?! if one of those damn purple, bootlegged acrylics of hers were to fall into someone's food. Didn't bother arguing any further, just asked for the check. Paid for the wings, and based on MY judgement, I left no tip. Not to mention, as we left, there was a group of drunken loud guys on the other side, with about 6-7 drinks. 

So before you order any drinks, make sure you don't gaze too long in the view because you might end up burnt or "drunk looking" Maybe it was the fact we looked the youngest out the crowd. Who knows, never coming back.
author: Julie L.

description:
Tremendous views. Awesome floor to ceiling windows. Very attentive yet not intrusive wait staff. Friendly. No pressure to drink or leave. Drink prices reasonable for the venue. Very friendly customers that were welcoming and happy to chat. 
Definitely worth a repeat visit. 
Was there on a Monday so cannot comment on weekend crowding. 
Definitely worth another visit.
author: Jonathan T.

description: This place has a wonderful vibe. Beautiful view, nice service, and a fun clientele. All was good, except when my credit card bill came out and it showed that my server went out of her way to tip herself on top of what I tipped. That's just pathetic.
author: Ali S.

description: The View was amazing but I just wish the place was bigger. Drinks are very pricey which is expected at a hotel. Wish I would have came during the day to see the view. Very crowded on a Saturday night and limited seating.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Damn, that view is completely amazing...sadly the interior lighting is horrendous. I fear this place will never become a classic as clogged as it is with kids and tourists - yes, sadly teens and Tweens kept loudly wandering through this bar. 'Is this legal?' I wondered to myself while trying to cover myself with my scarf so that I felt less exposed in my cocktail dress. Seriously, the lighting over all seats but those by the windows is as bright as that of a microscope...and you are the subject of magnified examination!

The drinks are priced for the tourist trade, rather than the locals among us, so I stayed for only one glass of wine.

Sadly, thumbs down.
author: Jessica B.

description: Great location which is on the 39th floor of Marriot hotel. Self served seat, just find a spot where you can sit and the waitress/waiters will come and serve you. Good for a friday night chill.
author: Tran M.

description: Awesome views, not easy to get a seat, we had to hunt down ours. Drink prices were reasonable.
author: Kris B.

description: Super crowded, food was ok. The windows glasses reflect so much inside lights that makes it hard to view the city at night.
author: San B.

description: Fabulous view of the city of San Francisco. Pricey but very good selection of wines by the glass. Great service and above average food.
author: Tommy Y.

description:
5-stars for the VIEW!! An absolutely gorgeous 360-view of San Francisco. 4-stars for the actual drinks.

We came here after dinner nearby, and while the place was still packed on a Thursday evening, we were still able to find a seating near the windows! This place has the BEST night views of San Francisco--definitely gives off that sexy and intimate vibe.

I was really impressed that while the place was absolutely packed that night, the waitresses we incredibly attentive and efficient! They have a small selection of wines, beers, cocktails, and non-alcoholic drinks. If you're feeling a bit hungry, they have a few items available for you to munch on. 

The View definitely embodies that intimate and romantic night feeling. Fun place to come for drinks after a date or just to have a few drinks after work with some coworkers!
author: Rachel C.

description:
In a word: breathtaking. Came here early one evening to enjoy a few glasses of wine with a date before dinner and we came here upon his recommendation. I had never been here before but gazing at the 39th floor from the bottom of the Marriott, the opportunity to gaze out at the San Franciscan skyline sipping some wine was too tempting to pass up. 

The view from The View lives up to its name, it amazing and the perfect place to socialize while feeling on top of the world. The wine that garnished this mile high experience definitely made my night though--sipping a beautifully sweet glass of Boneshaker (Lodi) Zinfandel wine as the world went on its way down below.

Definitely come here early though, I recommend around opening time till about 5pm if you want to be sure you can nab a booth or table right against the window. So come with lots of time to spare and you can enjoy the changing hues of the sky from turquoise to a rosy gold to an inky blue pierced by the lights of the city. So romantic!

On a quick aside, I cannot speak to the food as I just went to enjoy the wine, but they do indeed have a small menu of some appetizers and entrees which did look rather tasty!
author: Nicole W.

description:
This place reminds me of the rooftop bars in New York. It has a great view of the city, everyone is dressed up nicely, and the lounge is very classy.

It's self-seating, so go ahead and find a spot next to the huge window! You'll be able to look at the beautiful city lights while sipping on some drinks with great company. Their menus are lit up too! I love everything about this place...even their service is outstanding.

Their drinks were a bit too overwhelming for me though...it was a huge kick of liquor every time I took a sip. But I loved the view, the people, the ambiance. I would definitely come back and bring any visitors with me so that they can see this gorgeous panoramic view of SF.
author: Kelly T.

description: Beautiful twinkly city lights from huge glass windows makes this a romantic place for a nightcap before heading back to your hotel. Yes the drink prices are a little pricey but it's worth it for the San Francisco view at night.
author: Bonnie C.

description: This place did not disappoint! Amazing view of the city--- like epic! (Think Perch in LA). Super diverse crowd, great opportunity to mingle. Only downfall is the watered down drinks.
author: Cen'Cere C.

description: Place is a must visit for date night or when friends/family come into town!.. service is pretty "meh" but once you get over that it's one of my favorite spots here.. also be ready to fight for a seat, this place is almost always busy whenever I seem to go and for good reason. Great music usually too!
author: David R.

description:
I could give 5 stars for the view / location itself, and I did.  It's right near Union Square  Downtown and reminds me of living in San Diego.  I miss rooftop bars / lounges on the top of tall buildings with great views, and this is exactly what the View has to offer.

It's a good place to stop by for date night around sunset.  It might get difficult to find a window table around that time, but we just sat down with some random tourist couple and talked to them until they left (and stole their seats hehe).  Looking around, I'm pretty sure we were the only people there that actually lived in SF.

To satiate the waitress, we ordered a Heineken... it's definitely an expensive place.  I would't stay here to continue drinking, but like I said, it's a nice place to stop by in the evening for 30 min.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The name really does say it all, this view though! I could sit here all night and never tire of the view. Drink menu not extremely impressive but who cares??
author: Christine E.

description: I went for the view and its spectacular. Honestly the drinks are overpriced (especially the beers) but the ambiance is great and it's great to visit especially if you're new to the city.
author: Helen F.

description:
What an amazing view! The lounge was reasonably sized and we arrived around 11pm and managed to find a spot with a table and two lounge chairs looking out toward the window. The atmosphere seemed relaxed, hip/classy and fun. 

Our server was nice and the drinks were pretty stiff and a good size for the whopping $14-$15 per beverage. We had the type of marinara sauce with feta  and cheese bread appetizer which was delicious!! (Note they don't serve dinner here, just apps)

I gave it a 4 as later in the night it got busier and it took us a while to get our check, but we would come back! Street parking was easy to find nearby (we arrived on a Sunday). 

View was top notch of the city, bay bridge, water, etc. Simply beautiful.
author: Olivia B.

description: Awesome view and great drinks!! The hotel bar is around the corner and it has seating all around so every were you sit you see breathtaking city lights view. The service was very good and the appetizers were delicious. We enjoyed every minute of our evening!!
author: Abby C.

description: Amazing views! No, but seriously. We got there about an hour after it opened and it was pretty packed. Good thing is you get to pick your own table. The tables wrap all the way around so you get a great view no matter where you sit. The drinks aren't cheap (mixed drinks about $15) but it's to be expected in San Francisco and even more so at a place with these views. It's a great place to stop by for a drink or two. I was in a hurry and only had time for one drink before a night tour and the server was so nice and quick to bring the check after I mentioned it. It's worth the stop.
author: Adrianna R.

description:
The view makes it all! It catches up for the terrible service and the pricey (and not exceptionnal) cheese plate. 

Also, how in the hell a hotel of your standing can serve such a plain (and super cold) creme brulee?? 

Good cocktails but don't get food
author: Margaux M.

description: The food is not that great and the drinks are so so. But the atmosphere and the staff is really good. The view of the city through the windows is spectacular. So it's actually worth the money you spend on the food and drinks. It's a nice lounge where you can hear people that you're with and have a conversation without it being too loud.
author: K E.

description:
The views are amazing from here. The drinks are a bit pricey and there's no happy hour special. I ended up getting a $7 non-alcoholic drink. It was tasty but a little bit on the higher side for me.

If you want to see a lovely view though, you definitely want to stop here. You can get some pretty awesome photos.

It's pretty quiet if you get here around 4pm when it opens so if you're looking for a convenient place to catch up with friends this would be it. Not sure if I'd go here all the time though.
author: Amy J.

description:
My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time here! Headed up to SF not decided on where to go and came across this place.  Hadn't even heard of it before.  Walked in and it seemed to be pretty crowded (I think it was a Thurs night?) but we got a little table just next to the window right away!  It's ALL about the view, really.  The place is very quaint and cozy - dark/dim lighting... very romantic, however the tables are close to one another, so you might overhear your neighbors convo.  There's a bar section in the middle and a bunch of little tables around the windows (best views) with waiter service.  The waiter was quick and efficient.  He allowed us to move over a table mid way through to have a better view.  We just came for drinks and apps - boyfriend got some lollipop meat of some sort and loved it and we shared the red pepper hummus - tastes like all hummus ;) no fancy drinks, just a couple glasses of wine.  Can't give a great food review as we didn't get much. 

Again, we just popped in and got lucky - I'm not sure if they take reservations or how great this place is for larger party accommodations, but my experience was a good one and hopefully will be able to return soon.
author: Jess L.

description:
Great place to take out-of-town friends and family! 

As many others said, the view is stunning on a clear day around sunset! The View is the perfect place to end your day and catch up with some friends.  The drinks are surprisingly strong, but for $15 a drink, one would hope so. We didn't try any of the food, but did op in for the chocolate tasting platter. For $9 it included chocolate pots de crème, chocolate cake, and a cookie shooter. Definitely a cute concept but pricey considering how small the portions are. Overall amazing experience and we would definitely come back!
author: Tori V.

description:
I can see why my friends called it the Death Star bar with the elegant arced windows overlooking San Francisco.  What an incredible view.  I went the same night as some convention there so it was slightly packed, but service was decent, if not a tad bit slower.  

The drinks were great and strong.  Noise level was low enough to have a decent conversation.  The design of the place is very cool and sophisticated and the drink prices are slightly high.  I didn't have any of the food.

I'd take my wife here on a date if we're back in SF together.
author: Timothy H.

description:
Situation: I found out over dinner that one of my best female friends had never been here before. How could this be, I wondered? This is one of the best date spots in town and has an amazing view. Apparently, her dates need to man up! 

We went on a Monday night around 10pm and it was pretty packed.  There are views from both sides, but it was a pretty cold and foggy night, so we couldn't see much anyway.  There were no seats on the "better" side facing SOMA, so we opted for a quiet table on the other side.  We got the dessert trio, which was perfect to share, nibble on, and generally just satisfy our sweet tooth (ok, ok, *my* sweet tooth). The desserts were fine, nothing to write home about, and a bit pricey but not unreasonably so. 

On other occasions I've had their drinks and felt the same way about them. I'll usually just settle for a glass of wine because I know what I'm getting. You're here for the ambiance and the view anyway. 

On this occasion, the service was excellent and our waiter was very attentive. On other occasions, I have had pretty poor service. I think it's safe to say that they're more attentive on the less popular side.
author: Janet Z.

description: The view here is spectacular!!! View of the whole city at night is so pretty  it's a little crowed but not to crazy and the prices are not so bad.
author: Steph S.

description: I have been there 2 times and the quality goes up and down. First visit was great. I had a divine steak and potatoes. Second visit was horrible. I got the same thing as my first visit and the steak was like rubber and instead of potatoes, they served spinach. My third visit was ok. I got the burger there and ended up being ok. Pretty inside. Service wasn't the greatest.
author: Brianna K.

description:
A complete waste of time. We came to have an excellent time and all we got was a lack of service and a menu that listed about 7 items. Not a place I would recommend. Go for the view, snap some pictures and leave. Seating is first come first serve so we ended up essentially fighting for an open table while we waited for a group to leave.  As we finally got our seat we waited for a very long time and still no one came to even clean the table let alone take our order. We ended up leaving after about 15 minutes with out anyone noticing. 

Very disappointing.
author: Z C.

description:
For SF, this is a nice little break from the divey bars and EDM clubs that the city is all about. It's not like any of the NYC or LA rooftops, but this is SF, so The View is as close to it as you'll get.

As it's located inside the Marriott, the crowd is mostly tourists and out-of-towners. I think this place has potential -- maybe with a different crowd, though. Maybe they can turn up the volume of their speakers? Maybe they can hire sexier looking staff? (They very much look like hotel employees.) Maybe they can update their menu with some interesting cockails? (I mean, it's SF!)
