I was also surprised at how not spacious it was -- I actually thought the venue would be a lot larger and more open, too. Food did not look appetizing at all, so we didn't even consider it. Drinks were just 'meh' and overpriced, as you'd expect. Service wasn't too bad, though, despite it being packed.

Entrance to get inside was also a bit difficult to find. I wish they would just let everyone in from the side entrance (close to Tropisueno).

Based on this experience, I can see why locals don't really come here. I would probably opt to go to the Press Club instead (which is what we did right after our first drink).
author: Diana K.

description: Showed up for some casual drinks in the early evening and this spot proved perfect.
author: Shalini B.

description: I loved this place! Giving 5 stars for the view and venue not the food. We got there when sun was setting and it was beautiful. Definitely must go!
author: Alta B.

description:
My boyfriend and I had the unexpected delight of stumbling upon this place after dinner at Mourad (which is fantastic!)...]Focus...ugh, ok let me start over. We came here on a night when there was a Twitch convention and the attendees took over The View. This made it really fun We talked to some of them and they were pretty amusing. 

As for the bar itself, the angle of the view is unique and beautiful. The cocktail menu was pretty typical (there was a cosmo on the menu). If you're used to very original SF cocktails it's not for you. I can't speak of the food but man, that view and a drink..not a bad way to spend an hour or two.
author: Larissa M.

description:
Awesome view. Medium everything else. 

A solid option downtown before / during sunset. I took clients out here and we found a little table by the window and had a nice chat.
author: John N.

description: Great late night spot to be on the top of the Marriott Marquis having cocktails and catching an awesome view of the city. Small plates of salad, hummus or cheese tray to add to a glass of wine or martini. Cozy for the couple or bring your friends!
author: Jeanine O.

description:
I was really excited to come here because I had looked through people's pictures on Yelp and the view from the windows looked beautiful. And when I got here, I was definitely not disappointed. There are huge, nicely designed windows that provide an amazing view of the city and they face different directions so you can see different parts of SF. We got there around 8PM on a Monday so there were still several seats along the windows that weren't taken. It was already dark outside by then so we could see all the city lights. The seats are all soft and leathery sofas and were so comfortable. Needless to say, the place is quite classy with dim lighting and all, and most of the people there were significantly older than us.

The drinks and service were pretty good, but still can't compare to the location and ambience of the place. I ordered the fruity punch cocktail and it was strong but quite sweet. The drinks are very expensive but you're also paying for the view, which is worth it. Our server was pretty attentive and didn't forget about us, even though we kind of in a corner. I'd definitely like to come here again sometime.
author: Kailin H.

description: a grand experience -- you get a touch of vertigo even, some tables are right up against the windows, brilliant overall--
author: Penny F.

description:
Great lounge....It is probably one of the best views of downtown San Francisco day and night. It is located on 39th floor of Marriott. 

We arrived around 10 pm on Saturday night and we were lucky to grab a table by the window to enjoy the City lights twinkling. Grabbed couple of cocktails as well as few appetizer item and we were good to go :-) 

Only draw back was the service.....I had to literally get up and walk to the bar to get someone's attention but once I got his attention he was very attentive to us.
author: Nikki S.

description: They don't call it the View for nothing! The view is absolutely amazing!!! Especially during the holiday season, you can see amazing views of the bay no matter what window you are looking from, absolutely beautiful! I was in awe of how gorgeous the view was. Ambiance has a casual but romantic vibe. Perfect place to go to after dinner to grab some drinks and gaze out at the stars and the city lights.
author: Marisa J.

description: First time at this lounge, a little small but with spectacular view. We went there on a Saturday night, the place is packed (of course)
author: Teresa C.

description:
Amazing view but very loud and overpriced.
Service is not very well, but the view is worth it!!!
author: Michal K.

description: What a romantic spot in the heart of downtown S.f! It goes without saying the view was breath taking. The atmosphere seemed hip and the menu was as to be expected. Could easily be enjoyed by tourists and locals alike.
author: Erica T.

description: Great ambiance. We ordered the cheese platter and bruschetta, both were fresh and definitely worth trying. Of course the city views are really nice too!
author: Munazzar T.

description: Service was okay. But 5 out 5 for the ambiance. Beautiful place to take your gal on a date!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Good places to be as a first restaurant in SF...  Good service also the manager really helpful if you need help putting together a proposal!  I know my review is good but just as a suggestions get better on service like make sure if we still need other drink or something else?! 
But I love the view also really social place
author: Rafael H.

description:
Tourist spot.

We pretty much showed up and enjoyed the free view of the city.  No fee to get inside.

It's hard to get a table by the window but there are lots of tables around.
author: Mike T.

description: Not very cheap. Not that anything is in San Fran but this isn't a $ dollar sign. It's a great atmosphere though and service is good.
author: Bobbi E.

description:
This lounge as some of the best views of SF! If you get there in the afternoon (it opens at 4 pm) it's not as crowded and you can really walk all around and take in the views or take pictures. When you come later at night (10 pm and on) it gets really crowded and very hard to find a table. Kinda need to squeeze your way in and awkwardly hover until someone leaves.

I came here with the bf and we got 2 drinks (a little pricey, but still on par with normal SF drink prices). We finished them fairly quickly but our server never came back to give us a bill. After waiting for 45 mins, we decided to get up and find him instead only to have him rush towards us and condescendingly tell us that we shouldn't be running out on our bill...It was busy and maybe he didn't want to rush us but we could've been spared the speech. Service aside, the drinks were delish and the views were amazing.
author: Lina H.

description:
The view and atmosphere is great. Would recommend for everyone that wants a great view of the city. Drinks are strong. Service is so so. Some people get attention and others don't when it is busy. They need to hire more waiting service. You see plenty of people with empty drinks or even tables. Took about ten minuets to get water.

When you order, order a lot to last. Or make sure to really grab the servers attention.
author: Ian P.

description:
Not only is the View elegant on the inside , the architectural design of the hotel in which the View is located is also very unique. 

Drinks are a slightly pricey the times I've gone. So this time, we ended up buying ice cream at Cako on the way to the View and had the best ice-cream eating experience ever.

Another nuance to appreciate about the View is the elevator that takes you up to the View, because this elevator skips 17 floors and brings you to the 39 floors in the blink of an eye without any jolts when it accelerated and decelerates.
author: Shelley C.

description: Expensive but one of the best views in SF
author: Clinton C.

description: The drinks here are pretty pricey but then again you're in the Marriott. I got the Skyline Punch and it was ridiculous sweet. My friends got the Cosmo and a Midori Sour and they both complained about it being too sweet. The atmosphere is classy yet dark. A lot of older men from the financial district come here. The bar, booths, and tables were all packed on the Friday night I was there.
author: Ally T.

description: The View is a great place for after dinner drinks.   The atmosphere is modern, chic and trendy.  The lovely seating lined along the huge windows offers great views of the city and on a clear night, they can be quite beautiful.  A cozy venue for drinks and conversation over music.
author: Lan N.

description: Very nice lounge, with an amazing view of course. The drinks were good. Can get busy and makes it hard to find good seats. Will definitely return.  The servers are rude, as if they're annoyed at serving you.
author: Liz L.

description: This place is amazing. Nothing else to say. Great Vibe, amazing views.....great service. ASK FOR MAC. Hes the man. Saved our seats for us for about 20 minutes while we took a smoke break. This is for sure my new hangout spot.
author: Jason D.

description: Amazing view amazing drinks! Lots of cute rich business men oh my! Get the soma drink if you want a little sugar buzz. This place is classy and fun! I recommend dressing fancy after 6PM! Come early for a seat next to the window.
author: Michelle G.

description: Absolutely stunning views, drinks are pricey but that is expected with such a beautiful ambience and view. Only four stars because I was charged twice not only for my drinks but also my coffee in their lobby cafe. Something must be wrong with their system to be charged twice in two different transactions. It was time consuming having to dispute the charge. But if it weren't for that I would give 5 stars!!
author: Jane K.

description:
Slow service, no reservations, difficult seating... But it's so worth the view!!

The cheese plate was delicious, the Malbec was great..

I wish I would have arrive around 7pm so I could see the sunset view.
author: Christina B.

description: Gotta love this place packed with awesomeness. the ambiance is  amazing and the staff was very friendly. we went her every night.  it was great visiting this place.
author: Carla P.

description: Nice views. But crowded. And you will see public making out. It is a very popular dating bar
author: Alex L.

description:
Absolutely gorgeous view of the city!!

Friends from SoCal were in town so one of the stops we went to was The View for a couple of drinks. It's located on the 39th floor of the Marriott hotel in downtown. For a group of four we were able to find a table easily on a Saturday evening. The server was polite, pretty standard service by providing the drink/small foods menu and explaining their specials. The attire I'd say was a mix of semi-dressy to casual, considering this place is frequented by tourists and those who are preparing for a night out in the city.

I had a dirty martini for about $14. Not bad at all. One of my friends had their cosmo special that was way too sweet. I wouldn't recommend that one.

Overall: 4. Nice place to enjoy the view, sip on a drink, and catch up with good company.
author: Loriel L.

description: Wonderful view of the city but the drinks are quite pricey. It's all worth it though and I really enjoy my night here.
author: Linda N.

description:
Came to The View lounge atop the Marriott on 4th Street for a Happy Hour before dinner recently.  I've always enjoyed coming to top floor bars and restaurants in pretty much any downtown high-rise.  There's something about being "above it all" and "having the world at your feet" that kind of boosts the ego!  There's also always something out there to enjoy and talk about that just seems to help stimulate the conversation, and the moment.

On this particular early evening, we had an awesome view as the fog rolled in from the west (of course), while the sun was still shining brightly over the Bay, AT&T Park, the Bay Bridge, etc.  Check out the photo I've uploaded.

Service was attentive . . .  we scored a table next to the window . . . and . . . the drinks were well prepared.  The View is a great place to take in a drink during a quick HH.  It does have a hotel lounge type atmosphere rather than a "real" bar . . . but I'd say this is a solid 4-star spot.  I'll be back!
author: Joel E.

description: I was very excited to come here on a Friday night to see the spectacular view of the SF everyone talks about and it did not disappoint! It was absolutely gorgeous and had a very intimate vibe giving me goose bumps the minute I soaked in the views of the city I adore. I was expecting there to be a cover fee but luckily there wasn't. This is a popular place so it can get pretty packed especially for sunsets and nighttime. It is self-seating and to have the best experience, I recommended to be patient if it is busy and look out for seats that will open up next to the windows, it is worth it! Drinks are ok but nothing special. I was too distracted by the breathtaking view and the great company I had with me to really care about the quality of drinks. The drinks can be better but other than that I very much enjoyed my night here. Great location for a date night or girls night out! The View will be on my list next time I am in the city.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Well A. The name speaks for itself - the view from the top is gorgeous! It was a misty Thursday night and a bit chilly near the windows, but such a relaxing and enjoyable time.

We had a great server who recommended the Russian River Pinot Noir, and it was delicious! Her excitement about the wine convinced me to order it, and I was not disappointed.

Great date night place, or a good break from your work trip if you're staying at The Marriot
author: Mitzy B.

description:
Where do you go after you been wined and dined; well you go somewhere that takes the focus off everything but your date.  If your date happens to be hideous to look at (not mine, mind you) then you have THE VIEW, a breathtaking panoramic view of downtown SF located on the top floor of this dowdy hotel. 

Grab a little table in the corner nook and whisper your enjoyment of the evening over a glass of wine (don't bother with the drinks, they're horrendous).  Get to know each other while marveling at the spectacular view and relishing in the fact that you're in a beautiful city such as SF.

The View reminds me of Top of the Hub back home in Boston.  Overrated but definitely appreciated.
author: Lo-an L.

description:
My coworkers literally dragged me in here. I wanted to eat food. And I didn't really want to eat crappy hotel food.

Observations:
1. There actually was a lot of seating on a Friday night around 9pm. 
2. Lots of tourists.
3. The bartender asked me if I wanted fries with my sliders and I said yes. She didn't mention the fries were an additional 6 dollars. Not a huge financial dent, but annoying nonetheless. 
4. The kobe beef sliders and heirloom tomato salad were not bad. Not amazing, but totally fine. 
5. Total on my receipt was around 42 dollars. The total charged to my cc was around 44. That is annoying. I had a feeling this would happen. 
6. I ordered salad, but no one thought to bring silverware, so I used a toothpick to eat my salad. 

All in all, it was fun to continue hanging with my friends, but there are so many cheaper and more reliable places to eat around here.
author: Julia D.

description: It's always super noisy and very crowded. The drinks are good and the views are fine. I don't feel like that I can truly appreciate the views when I am surrounded by so many people.
author: Jie C.

description: Loveeeee Loveeee Loveeeee...one of my Fav Fabulous place to chillaxe and have a tasty cocktail n people watch but of course the best bar with the best VIEW of SF ....highly recommended....always..
author: Lokelani M.

description:
Went for Sat night drinks!
Busy busy busy... my bf and I were very lucky that we found seats right away, but I can see that that might not be the case if we come next time. Drinks were about $14 and desserts were around $10-15. We got the sampler and it was pretty good. The view is amazing ONLY IF you find seats near the window. If not- it's just crowded and nothing special.
author: Sora B.

description:
My coworkers were staying at the Marriott Marquis so I joined them for a quick pre-dinner drink. The views are phenomenal, almost an entire 360 degree view of the city. It was a clear day as well. 

I ended up getting a non-alcoholic "mocktail" called the Ginger Elixir. The ginger was so fresh and also had mint leaves in it with lime juice. Very good! It was very quiet as it was about 5pm on a Monday. But our server was very attentive. We had other dinner plans but appetizers were available along with a full dinner menu. I will be sure to come back to try the food on my next trip up to SF.
author: Anthony B.

description: Great views, pretty loud, but what do you expect for a bar. Drinks are pricy but such a great experience! Love the drinks I had the fog drink and it was delicious! Service is quick and friendly!
author: Korina K.

description: great views of the city on either side of the building. Having a window table really makes this experience, so get here early, its a free for all once you're up there. mixed, well dressed crowd with a lively vibe. standard drinks and half decent finger foods.
author: Phillip R.

description: Best view of the city bar none.  The service was mediocre and the drinks were like the 39th floor. (Sky-high)  Great get away if you are not in a rush and have money (gold bullion) to burn.  Intimate place for a nightcap.
author: Dale G.

description:
Nice place for a drink and view. But one staff  member can ruin a night. A private event was being held there occupying half the bar. We were seated and overheard an externally rude staff member tell a couple to move. They were in front of the  "Private Event" sign and she just hassled them. No one was there and she had a terrible attitude. 

I hope this rude little control freak is fired by the time I visit again.  She is the type of "person" Larry David would create in Curb Your Enthusiasm.
author: Alex C.

description:
Nice view, good drinks!
But this place is for COUPLE.
(You should remember that!)
author: Siwoo P.

description: The View is exactly what it is. Amazing view of the city at night. As for the seating, good luck! Hard to find seating the servers are running their butts off and I ordered a drink with kettle vodka. The bartender poured me a well type vodka and when I sent it back the bar manager had a look on his face like he has a stick in his a**. He said to the server "what's wrong with it?" The server said it does not taste right and the bar manger rolled his eyes as if the customer "me" was lying. I felt like saying look here little boy! The drink is not correct, please know the difference or retrain your staff. The replacement drink was correct. I felt as if the bar tender felt it was some type a malicious act to obtain another drink. It was clearly not drank because it tasted like sh**. Not sure I will return there because of the bar manager and no coordination with helping customers find seats.
author: Nathan P.

description:
We visited here on a Friday night just for drinks.   This was an amazing and new way to see San Francisco.   The bar is upscale and feels very classy.   The views are incredible.  
Recommend coming here at night, staying for a drink and continuing on with our evening.   It's a nice place to stay for a bit but wouldn't be the main attraction of your evening.  Also the place fills up quickly and may be hard to find a table or seat.
author: Michael D.

description:
The $15 manhattan was surprisingly good - just the right amount of sweetness and a very sizable libation. What irked me was the $5.50 charge for what was the tiniest espresso in recent memory. The server was friendly and the view was nice but damn, I still can't get over charging that much for a nespresso pod. 

If you're staying at the Marriott Marquis, The View is a nice place to come up and work. Grab a small table by a window and enjoy. Just stop in the lounge first if you want some caffeine.
author: Bryan R.

description:
Amazing five star view at The View for sure.

We were very lucky to snatch a prime seat in the packed room, so they could have served water and it would have been a great experience.

Service was a little slow, and it's pricey as you'd expect, but they have a decent selection of booze. They also have a food menu, but our server said it "comes from downstairs" as he talked us out of ordering.

But that view is crazy. Go check it out.
author: Evan F.

description: The view is what makes this place a gem, but the first come first serve eating is awful and the wait for a drink is even worse. I recommend if you plan on coming here, get there early and with plenty of patience.
author: Roxanne L.

description: So close to Bart and what an amazing view!!!!  Great for a quick after work drink and bite while you gaze at the sunset's glowing spectacle.
author: Dlanor T.

description: A wonderful place to visit with a gorgeous view of the surrounding city. Lovely, romantic, and relaxing place itself, with an attentive staff and some pretty well-made drinks. Got the skyline punch which had just the right amount of alcohol plus sweetness from the juice. Would love to make a return visit next time I'm in town.
author: George P.

description: What a great way to end the day in the city.  It really is all about the view! Limited number of seats along the glass wall but well worth the wait. We had been walking all day throughout SF and needed a place to unwind after dinner. Drinks were priced average to the city - $7-8 for beers and about $15 for cocktails. I sampled several of the local brews and my girlfriend had the skyline punch - delicious blend of rum and juices. Strong enough that she only needed two for a happy evening. We also had the spicy seafood appetizer - well seasoned shrimp and crab claw. Wait staff was exceptionally attentive without being intrusive. Definitely warrants a return next time I'm here.
author: Kevin D.

description: Horrible horrible service.  The wait staff completely ignores you when you sit down and blows you off when to try to flag them down for drinks. The view is great but they are utter snobs.
author: Jeff G.

description: Best view in San Francisco, and purposely built looking into the gracious city. Solid drinks, a great date spot.
author: anthony r.

description:
I'm a fan of this place for late night drinks! You get a very nice view, has a classy environment, and if you get here early (before 10pm), there will be places to sit!

The drinks weren't bad. I got a margarita, but I really liked the skyline punch a friend ordered. It was pretty refreshing. Ultimately, people come here for the view, so try to grab a decent spot!

A couple things to note though - definitely get there much earlier if you have dinner plans. You don't want to still be eating while hoards of loud crowds come here for drinks. Dinner/date would be nice here in a quieter ambiance, which I'm sure is the case between 7-9pm.
author: Larry F.

description: Breath taking view! With a few drinks it is a must for anyone who has ever been to SF. A bit pricey, but you are paying for a spectacular view so it's worth it.
author: Rosie G.

description:
Keep your receipt & make sure you aren't stolen from!!! 

I went here on a Friday night to drink some wine while I looked out on the city. The internet was sketchy so I couldn't use the tablet I had hoped to be able to do a few things on but I was majorly disappointed that I was over charged when I checked my account the next day. 

I left a $10 tip for the waitress on a $30 charge. She decided to turn it into a $20 tip since I used my card and didn't keep my copy of the receipt. However, I will still be complaining because that is an extremely fraudulent charge! 

I liked the place & the view (I would also not suggest going here hungry), it was an enjoyably ambiance. However, I will never appreciate being fraudulently charged.
author: Rachel M.

description:
This is my all - time FAVORITE spot in the city.  Since I was a little girl I've gone with my parents to the view lounge on the 39th floor after a long day spend shopping on black Friday.  Its tradition for us, and has now become a must for whenever my friends or bf and I go to SF for the day.  

This is the most beautiful place -  its all glass on two sides and provides absolutely stunning views of the Bay Bridge on one side, and dt. SF on the other.  Its very intimate and romantic, adorned with comfortable seating lit mostly by candlelight .  The bar is nice and they have a decent selection of appetizers and drinks.  Occasionally theres also live music.

Definitely not good for kids, but I was an only child and very quiet/well behaved. I sucked down my Shirley Temples and gazed at the view in silence :)

Even if you don't come for drinks or food, come for the view - its worth it, and your date is gonna love it
author: Rebecca S.

description:
This is a fabulous spot to take your tourists. Love the view of the cityscape from both sides of the bar. If you've never been, you have to go at least once because it's got a great mix of locals and tourists--

It's on the 39th floor of the Marriot, and make sure you take the proper elevator to get to the higher floors (there are two sets). 

The sexy bartender with the bald head, annd long goatee will hook you up with some heavy drinks-- so if that's what ya want, sit at the bar, when he's there. 

Oh-- and try the Pomegranate Tequilla straight-- it's like a mixed drink all in one, no need to add anything else.
author: Cassandra E.

description: Sitting on the 39th floor on a big couch with a strong Manhattan in hand looking at the city lights ... can it get any better than that? Sounds like heaven to me. The drinks are pricier here, the manhattan was $15, but since its a hotel and a view point site, I would say its not too bad. The service was great, and just a very nice classy bar to grab a drink. And best of all, it's 1 block from my dental school, so I will soon be a regular.
author: Nikita K.

description: Did I go to the same place that everyone wrote a 5 star? View, yes... nice, but not enough for me to want to hang out there more than 20 minutes. That's probably how long we ended up staying. We should have listened to the guy that we met on the way up, he actually said, it was lame upstairs and that's why he was leaving. We were playing tourists and wanted a stunning view of SF, little did we know we were going to be acousted by a drunk, young Asian dude who thought he was pretty funny hanging over me to tell me my girlfriend looked like she needed a SEX ON THE BEACH drink. Do they even make those anymore???? LOL! I'm sure during the day for brunch would be a great, but a night out in SF didn't need to feel like I was at a frat party.  We left.....
author: Alice K.

description: Upon visiting San Francisco this past summer my sister, cousins, and I stumbled upon this place and it had the same feel as top of the hub in our native Boston. It was propped right up on the 39th floor, nothing like Boston's 54th floor restaurant but good enough lol. This place gets packed and they don't do reservations, it's a first come first serve type of deal and although there is plenty of seating, they were not satisfying enough for our viewing pleasure. But my cousins eventually settled for some seats in the the next room. My other cousin and I were determined to get better seats. We noticed that a group of older businessmen had the best seats in the house. As my cousin and I stood near the bar eyeing the scene like sad puppy dogs hoping someone would leave soon so we could get better seats, the waitress approached us. She basically told us that the businessmen were calling us over to sit with them so we approached the table anxiously not knowing what we were walking into, when we approached them, one of the guys said to me, "we are done here and we just wanted to save the best seats in the house for the most beautiful ladies in the house, enjoy your evening" and they left gracefully. We were so elated and lucky lol. I ordered appetizers and drinks and gazed at the view before me. I had the crispy salt and pepper shrimp and the view trio, I enjoyed both plates but I loved the crispy salt and pepper shrimp, it was so good! I also had the skyline punch, it was a little too strong for my liking since I'm more of a wine girl but anyone who is a lush would appreciate how strong they make their drinks. All in all pleasant and memorable, I'll be visiting again the next time I'm in California.
author: Charlene E.

description: I love a great night on the town, and The View totally rocks it!  Went with a couple friends, and it was truly a great night. Amazing view, great vibe and good music. Best Cosmo I've had in a long time. We also had some apps which were surprisingly tasty.  The service was only so-so, and very slow, which is why I giving it four stars instead of five.  But The View is totally worth a visit!
author: Carolyn G.

description: Swanky, contemporary and chillin atmosphere. Great warm attentive service and price was reasonable and view of the city was spectacular. Tried the mezze, beet salad and caramel popcorn ponocotta dessert, really tasty and good presentation. Drinks was just right, yummy sparkling champagne and moscato. Hip lounge music and going on a Sunday and Monday isn't too crowded so plenty of seats available to choose. Would definitely return to chill with a significant other or with friends in town.
author: Lilian L.

description:
My Favorite New Happy Hour Spot!!
Small menu, but fun atmosphere, not too loud. Great first date place.
Awesome Views!
Men, You'll woo her if you just bring her to the 39th floor!
author: Cassondra B.

description:
you have to come... if you are staying at the hotel at least... cus it gets the view of downtown and it's romantic after the sun goes down... they open at 4pm... you can go up early and take a look of downtown during the day time, and still till it goes dark... 

drinks are expensive but pretty strong, food was okay, they all shared the same kitchen with the cafe downstairs.
author: Bonnie Y.

description:
Everyone is raving about the views over SF and they are all right! Amazing views over the city and I prefer the city side so you see the rolling hills, over the harbour side.

We came right before sunset (around 5 in November) and managed to get a table straight away. It's a classy place but gets a bit run down by all the tourists visiting. No need to wait to be seated, you just snatch a table as soon as you see one.
author: Lotta Y.

description: The view was awesome! Drinks were a little pricey. The place was really packed and they didn't have enough people taking drink orders so it took too long.
author: Abd Al Alim T.

description: This is probably the perfect spot to hang out with friends and meet new people. If you dig sunsets, well, try this place! It's usually packed as it is a tourist trap but it's definitely worth it. I love the vibe when the sun's down and the place is illuminated by dim lights. This place is not recommended for dinner. They only have small bites and smaller than usual portions. They have a good wine selection though and it's just such a nice place to relax and unwind in with awesome people.
author: Leah Anne B.

description: Looking for a great place for date night? Start off by venturing to the top of the Marriott, which includes a gorgeous view, and an attentive staff. The view of San Francisco is spetacular and the food is mediocre but my kind of deal to start the night.
author: Kathy V.

description:
A great place to take out of towners that you want to impress.   Also, a great place to get someone else to buy your drinks, since they have a great view, and, well, they clearly know it, and charge for it.  

It's worth it though, as you'll be hobnobbing with SFs VIHGs and VICAs* and taking in the bay or sunset views (go for the sunset side...trust me) as well as folks in the know like yourself (you're so happy you read my review, aren't you)   This is one of the only hotel bars I actually go to semi-regularly in my hometown, and one of the few I'd take an out of towner to.

* Very Important Hotel Guests and Conference Attendees.  This is a species that merits an entirely different review...
author: Travis B.

description:
A group of about 20 of us met up here as the starting point of a surprise gathering for a mutual friend's birthday. The View is a lot bigger than I imagined it being (we were worried that our large group wouldn't be able to fit/hide appropriately from plain sight).

What a view, though. Even as a girl born and raised in the Bay Area, the view of San Francisco all lit up at night is still breathtaking (even if gimmicky). Prices were a tad on the higher end ($7.50 for a bottle of Anchor Steam), but what else do you expect on a Friday night in what amounts to be a little bit of a tourist trap located on top of a hotel next to the Yerba Buena Gardens?

Still, the staff were super friendly and didn't complain about our large group taking up almost an entire corner of their seating area and (most surprisingly) didn't complain about some of the rowdier members of our group. They just smiled, took our orders, and brought us water when we asked. I was impressed by how stoic and unfazed they were.

The place has a classy-feeling vibe, but has no problem with people just relaxing in their jeans, hanging out and having a good time either. Needless to say, I'd love to stop by again and grab a table next to the giant glass windows/wall, look out over the view and grab a bite to eat and a glass of wine.
author: Anna W.

description: Man oh man! I found this place on yelp and decided to stop by for some drinks. You have a full view of the city. They have yummy drinks and very nice servers. It's a great place to come to with a big group of friends. Absolutely loved it here... It was the highlight of my trip to San Fran.
author: Linet O.

description: Late night at 11pm is full of wannabe hipsters, messy tables and limited staff. View is amazing through the huge window but you feel like your at a frat party.
author: Emma A.

description: Expensive, but that's expected for the view. I would recommend to intimate to medium-sized groups that are interested in getting cocktails and appetizers before a night out in SF!
author: Audrey Z.

description:
This is the place to go if you are looking for a stunning view of San Francisco with an upscale happy hour atmosphere. The views are breathtaking and the tables near the huge windows put you right in the picture. I was here with my brother (he's from out of town) and my girlfriend, we enjoyed watching the setting sun and the rush of traffic crawling towards the Bay Bridge while sipping our adult beverages. 

Great place to take out-of-towners because you can see so much of the city from up there. Cocktails on the pricey side, reflecting the view and the upscale atmosphere, but the quality and flavor of the cocktails is outstanding.
author: Skye P.

description: I stopped by here on a trip. The drinks were great and the view was of course spectacular! I loved the atmosphere and vibe here!
author: Vicky M.

description: Only reason they're not getting 5 stars is because of their bar bites; not a great selection. But I must say, the chips and scallion dip is delicious. And the view is to die for. I can't imagine another bar in the city having a view like this.
author: Monique W.

description: Great place, a little packed on Friday night. We had skyline punch and a van Ness something, both excellent. The skyline is more like a high caliber rum runner, and the van Ness seems to be mojito inspired. Prices are around 14-15 bucks per cocktail, and beers around 7. The view is excellent. Snacks are about 8-15 per small plate. Love that you can lounge and sit wherever without the VIP nonsense. Parking while expensive, beats hunting for parking in the area ....just drive up to the valet at the Marriott lobby entrance. Parking for two hours is about $32. Only bad part is that while many people are dressed presentable for the classy bar this is, others are dressed sloppy casual. Jeans have had their 10 year run as business casual, someone put a nail on that coffin.  Bar is on the 39th floor of the hotel. Enjoy!!!
author: Marcos A.

description: Wonderful views of San Fran.  There menu is a little limited but you come here for the view of the city.
author: Vijay B.

description:
The View is a gorgeous high-rise bar and lounge in the Marriott, with stunning city views. I love sitting near the huge floor-to-ceiling iron wrought Gothamesque windows, or in one of the little inlets along one wall. This venue has a classy lounge atmosphere with dim lighting, comfy seats and couchs, and little candles on the tables. I feel this place would go great with formal cocktail attire, but I've never been made to feel horribly out of place when I show up in jeans and sneakers- just as long as I'm clean and presentable.

Staff has been friendly. Prices are a bit high but in-line with the venue. All the cocktails I've had here have been very good- definitely the kind of bar that specializes in classic cocktails and martinis- and I get such a kick from the menu page of expensive artisan bottled waters. Who decided one time, as a laugh, to live large like a rich jerkbag and order a $19 bottle of aged glacier water? THIS GIRL! (Spoiler alert: it tasted like water. Ha!)
author: Summer M.

description: Solid four stars.  Great tasting classic American appetizers.  Really recommend the tuna tartar as well as the cured meats plate.  Hefty pours, but this could be dependent of the bartender for the day.  Great service, although atmosphere may come off a bit pompous and certainly a tourist trap.
author: David C.

description: The view itself is amazing. The moment I was on the top floor I had to say WOW! Great view, super romantic. But its kinda pricey. Real pricey. Its a place to go once in a while for a special occasion.
author: Heidi L.

description:
On the 39th floor of the Marriott hotel it has views of all San Francisco.  
It opens at 4 pm and shortly after will be packed. You have to be aggressive for a window seat. 
Drinks are very good and range from 13-15$. Apps were good but we had to request more bread and crackers for the cheese and hummus plates.
Great for tourists,  or a special night out.
author: Candace E.

description: Best 'view' of town, apps were great and service is good. Very cool place with an awesome atmosphere.
author: Brent F.

description: Best spot for drinks! But not just any night of the week... a great place for a date or special occasion. Had two fabulous drinks here and the heirloom tomato salad was fabulous!!! Also best creme brulee ever. If you're looking to make a lasting impression on your date then bring them here. Its classy, romantic and very memorable!
author: Rebecca R.

description:
They don't call it "The View" for nothing! The view here is amazing, especially at night when the city's lights can truly be appreciated. 

Seating is first come first serve so it can get challenging trying to find a seat depending on where you want to sit. They don't take reservations unless it's for business purposes. You might find yourself standing or walking around waiting for space to open up. I arrived with my party at 7 p.m. & seats were available near the bar & the corners (usually for 2 people) but we really wanted seats with a view so we waited a whooping 50 mins for a space to open up. The smaller the party, the easier seats open up.   

Prices are reasonable for the ambience + view. Service is slow & it takes waiters a while to get your check at the end but then again it's quite busy at night. Prices are about $7/8 for beer, and $12- $22 for wine. The appetizers/desserts range anywhere from $7-$19. They don't serve dinner, so be prepared for small plates. Food is okay, though not totally worth it's price. Worth the view!
author: Ana V.

description: Amazing view from the 39th floor on beautiful San Francisco, go there and have a drink with a fabulous view in town !
author: Julien F.

description:
This is a fantastic place to go if your girlfriends are in town for the evening, or if you want to have a romantic, classy night overlooking the city lights of SF with your special someone. This is even a perfect place to unwind after a business meeting or to celebrate a colleague achieving partner in a firm. 

I've been here several times with my mom and sister (part of a fabulous girl's weekend) and with other friends. The bar is located in the center surrounded by a glass dome of windows creating a magnificent 360 degree view of the city. My relatives from Germany were visiting the states and we wanted to have some drinks at this glamourous spot, but President Obama was in town and staying at the Hotel Marriot, so it was closed for the evening-- which was a huge disappointment(!) I have yet to come across such a classy environment with such delicious martinis. The lemon drop was perfect-- a  sugared rim with real lemon and smooth vodka. The Cosmopolitan was a bit strong, but then again that really depends on the bartender and if you're looking smashing and classy;) 

A few tips: Get there a little before the sun sets-- this allows you to take in the breathtaking views and helps you to avoid snatching a place to sit, because it does get crowded. Also, the appetizers are basic and not too terribly impressive. If I were you, eat somewhere else in SF or snack beforehand to avoid paying for mediocre o'devours.
author: Fawn H.

description:
Wow! Came here on Halloween night and it wasn't too crowded. Got seated (self-seating) immediately and placed a few orders. The desserts were alright, and the drinks pricey, but still tasty. Regardless, no complaints whatsoever because the view was extraordinary, especially at night. Wow. I wish I could live here. 

Also the menus LIGHT UP when you flip them open. I was fascinated by that haha.
author: Chris C.

description:
So glad I found out about this place! It is located on the 39th floor of Marriott. Really great ambiance and a lot of different drinks to choose from. Drinks are ranging somewhere between $8 for beer to $15 for cocktails. Yes, kind of pricey but you're also paying for the great view of the city! The only reason why I'm knocking a star off is because I wish there were more window seats. 

Tip: make sure to arrive promptly at 4pm right when they open because window seats do get filled up quickly.
author: Karen C.

description: Came here with my girls for girls night out on a Saturday.  Got lucky and was able to get a seat right by the window.  Gorgeous view!  Great wine & food.  Great place for a date as well.  Only 4/5 stars because it does get over-run with tourists and unfortunately we had a annoying group of Japanese tourists a few tables down snapping pictures with flash (in a dark room) every 10 seconds and stopping the waiters every other minute asking them to take pictures.
author: jenny k.

description:
Oh my, go up 39 floors---yes 39 and wait for your ears to pop with the altitude change... and you come to the top level.  There's no waiting area once you get up there so if you're waiting for company wait in the lobby!!!  Not exactly a 360 degree view, but, quite spectacular with the floor to ceiling windows and decorative patterns.  A bit annoying when a "date" takes a table meant for 4 or 6... just because it's by the window.  I mean, when you walk in looking for tables, and they have a huge table, and they're awkwardly seated on the end of the table (so close to the window) and they just look at you... well it's fine there's other seating.  They don't take reservations, but really it's not that hard to find/wait for seating.  

Drinks: the blood orange martini was sweet actually, and sugar on the rim but not on the entire rim.... I like martini's because they're stronger and not filled with ice and really you can't go wrong with it unless it's terrible vodka or something... the salt and pepper prawns (or shrimp?  what's the difference?) was pretty good for a non-asian "restaurant", and we got this other plate of fried stuff--with green beans (yes green beans), onions, calamari, other stuff... and there was this really strong lemon dipping sauce that tasted like they deep fried a lemon.  Really.  It was so-lemony.  

Chocolate cake was, well rich but not sooo fresh you want to die.  You'd probably expect them to serve a bit of ice cream on the side but instead there was whipped cream.  And a neatly trimmed strawberry, no greens, and sliced in half.  And, the mint.  If the cake is too dry eat the icing... with the chocolate flakes... don't we all love cake.

I would say, this isn't the best date "date" spot, because the dates I saw here looked really awkward... come on.  If you want to be impressive... well, the girls just looked more nervous than impressed and the guys looked... well.  Everyone's just trying to relax, you know.  It's a lounge.
author: Christina G.

description: (Cue James Bond music*) da da tha, da da da da....that was essentially what I heard when stepping into The View. Talk about Schnazzy! The view certainly lives up to its reputation providing spectacular, unbeatable views while providing a classy ambience. If you don't feel like you come from old money before coming there, you will once you get there. I deducted stars however for slow service (kind of disorganized) and a little too pricey, but can't complain too much since you can't beat that view! Check it out next time your in SF!
author: Ayesha K.

description:
Very nice place to go. One of the best rooftop bars I've ever been.
Good music. Best view of San Francisco, I believe so.
A very good choice, specially if you are at the hotel Marriott Marquis
author: Juliano G.

description:
This is the first bar that I've been to when I first came to SF, I fell in love. Ever since, I've been coming here often. With or without company. It's name, speaks for itself. Astounding almost 360 breathtaking view of the city. Or is it? 

Drinks and foods are not cheap, they can be overwhelming too just like your view. I'll help you get over that. Think of that relaxing feeling the moment that drink touches your mouth until it travels down your throat while the pupils of your eyes dilate in response to what excites them. Still remember what pisses you off that day? Drink more, gaze more. lol 

To date, they still don't have Maker's 46. *____*
author: Lora M.

description: Friend took me here and I loved it! Great skyline views are my fav, the higher the better. I really was there only for the view, I only had a Stella while I was there so I can't comment on the drinks or food. It was a Friday night and pretty packed, we transitioned from the bar to a table in the center, and then to a table right next to the huge window (definitely kept our eyes out for an opening). All the buildings and the Bay Bridge in the distance looked incredible, I can definitely see the appeal. Dark, romantic spot, would be great for a date.
author: Pamela S.

description:
This will be short and and straight to the point.

VIEW OF THE CITY: Underwhelming. The View's layout doesn't optimize your cityscape experience. Reason being is because their interior lighting is setup so terribly that it bounces off the windows causing light reflections and glares. Another mistake they made was how they constructed their windows. They have thick beams running throughout the window that actually block your view. 

DRINKS: Overpriced. I got a Moscow Mule for $14. Niki got Skyline Punch for the same price. I'm all about paying more for a good drink but these were terrible - little alcohol and the flavors were whatevs. 

DESSERT: Well, Niki was having "girl issues" (TMI) so she was craving chocolate. We ordered the Assorted Mini Dessert with your choice of three. She picked the German Chocolate Cupcake, The Espresso Creme Brulee and the Butterscotch Pudding, Caramel and Sea Salt. All of this for $10. To be honest, I'm not a dessert guy but these were actually pretty good, especially the Butterscotch Pudding. The sweet pudding and caramel with the sea salt really took me by surprise.

SERVICE: Stellar. Amazing. Top-notch. 

I'm sure the view would be much better around sunset so I'll give this place another shot some other time. Our cocktail waitress was SO awesome. It says a lot about a place that provides excellent service. In some situations, great service can overshadow average food/drinks, and The View is ON POINT in this category.
author: Bruce C.

description:
My 18 year old baby faced nephew came home from a dinner with 2 adults in this restaurant, and he was drunk !
Why would the staff serve multiple alcoholic drinks to an under age diner. I am appalled.
author: Catherine J.

description: View is just amazing! I ordered a Mocktail-Sunrise Splash it was really good! I am a sucker for mocktails. Their housemade chips and dip was really good as well. I just love to sit there with my friends and just talk while admiring Sf's beautiful skyline. I would advise going around 4-4:30pm to get a seat. I will be here often!
author: Preeti R.

description:
Ok, seriously this is the best place to have dinner in the city!!  By far.  Was in the bay this past weekend and had dinner here with a friend.  I could not believe that I missed so many opportunities to come here when I lived in SF.  Oh well, better late than never.

The views were breathtaking.  Seriously, wow.  The big glass window was amazing and just stunning in person.  It was like a dream...  maybe.

We didn't have reservations so we pretty much waited until a table was free.  We probably waited about 20MIN.!?  It didn't seem long though.  Maybe because I was busy admiring the view.  Anyway, we sat right by the window!! :)

There wasn't very many things on the menu.. not really big meals but appetizers, drinks, and dessert which was cool.  We ordered the ahi (of course!!) and the salt and pepper shrimp (which were good) and drinks.  We got our drinks pretty fast but we were wondering why our food was taking forever so we asked our waiter and he was like... "Omg, I forgot to put it in.. I'll do that now and I'll pay for it"  Hmm.. I was more happy than mad considering we pretty much got our food for free.  So thank you, waiter.  That's excellent customer service for ya!!  Even though that happened, I will be back for sure the next time I'm in town.
author: Criselle O.

description:
Sometimes I guess you can't trust a yelp app to find the right place. This was listed as romantic, classy? Hmm apparently NOT on a Wednesday night. I thought perhaps it would be quieter midweek evening but some rowdy business conference people were there to get drunk and talk loud. It was not a intimate place- even in the darker corners with window views, sounds echo loudly and if that wasn't enough, you could barely hear your own train of thought through the cloudy of club music blaring in the background (probably why the drunk people had to shout their conversation- to overcome the music.) 
The view- well, it's not Portrero Hill, you can see the starting edge of the bay bridge on the far side, you can see the MOMA, the W and the brightly lit Yerba Buena from an aerial view. But it's not a stunning sunset and skyline of the city.
You want a typical hotel bar, close and convenient to your hotel room, club music with no dance floor, typical uncreative cocktail menu, lack of interesting bar bites... then this the place for you! 
The wait staff was nice, the drinks ok (in a place like this, I skip the mixed cocktails and get my bourbon neat, can't really mess that up), the prices included the charge for the view, the itself was only alright, but the ambiance- cut out the club music. 
PS. The woman's bathroom looked deconstructed- exposed plywood covering an opening where possibly the where the old paper towel dispenser was. That's classy.
author: Naomi K.

description:
One of the best views in SF. I definitely recommend this place for out of town visitors and friends. It could possibly be a decent location for a date, too, as long as your date doesn't mind having to constantly walk around searching for an open table for a good 30 minutes on busy nights.

Go here if you're mainly here for the amazing view, though. Food and drinks are good, but nothing spectacular.

Since you can't get reservations here, you're going to have to either go up to a group and kindly ask if you can have the table after them (Don't make them feel rushed, though) or you and your guests are going to end up standing around lurking at different tables and trying to swoop on whichever ones become vacant.

Also, this place isn't as big as how it looks in some of the photos people have posted. So don't expect it to be very spacious, it'll be crowded depending on what time and day you go. Friday and Saturday nights are the busiest. 

Overall it's definitely a worthwhile place to check out.
author: Oliver D.

description: This is a wonderful little spot near the financial district/SoMa. The views from this place truly are amazing and I think that is one of its best qualities. The night I came, it was quite busy and a little noisy but on par for what I expected on a weekend. Service was average. Definitely check this place out if you want to relax and enjoy the scenery.
author: Charlene C.

description:
Seeing the view here is definitely worth it!   It was hard to find seating, but we managed it (around 9pm on a Sunday night).  

The drinks were pretty good and the staff were very nice (we chatted to our waiter for a bit).  There are sofas by the walls and smaller round bar tables near the windows (they'll seat maybe 4 at a push), and there are larger tables in the middle of the room.  It was a big space and there was quite a bit of seating, although the seating is spaced out so you don't end up hearing other people's conversations.

The view is amazing - you can see so much of the city.  We went at night when the city was lit up.

Extras:  Our phones ran out of battery, and we were able to charge them (there were outlets near the sofas).
author: Louise H.

description: Very nice! Visited this bar twice. And I like service. Great location, amazing view, nice people, good kitchen, I like this place!
author: Karina P.

description:
Drinks were uninspiring and extremely pricey. You pay for the view and the ambiance and it's totally worth it!

39 floors up and you encounter the most gorgeous, romantic view of San Francisco and the Bay Bridge. I would describe the view as romantic even if you are there with friends and not a romantic partner. Come at night. The city lights add so much to the magical feeling.

There are two sides of the lounge and you'll notice that everyone is clustered around the bay bridge side. Don't worry if its packed on that side people are always coming and going and if you're vigilant you can swoop in on a good spot. Honestly, when you are up at the view there is no bad spot. It's all pretty breathtaking.
author: Oulie T.

description: not much to say here guys. the view is amazing (get it!? cuz it's the name of the venue too!)
author: George M.

description:
It closes at 1 but refused to serve drinks at 12 onwards. FYI 

While its legal for them we went there based on advertised time compared to local establishments and were disappointed.
author: Somik B.

description: Great way to start a long evening. Grab a drink and take in "the view". I was pleasantly surprised on the vibe and energy at a Marriott hotel...
author: Chris G.

description:
LOVED this experience. The food is pretty weak but not terrible
What a view!

Ambience:
They did block off half of the lounge for a private party so seating was limited but we got lucky with a intimate table right next to the window.
+The views are the most amazing from any rooftop place I've been to in the city (better than Top of the Mark)

Food:
+ Ginger Elixer- a virgin Moscow Mule; a little too watered down
+ Dessert Sampler- we got 2 creme brulees and the butterscotch pudding. the creme brulee was completely liquid and there was no custardy feel for it
+ Mac 'n cheese- pretty standard but $14 a pop, it ain't cheap

Service:
very friendly staff who helped us get a table by the window quickly. it is first come, first serve though

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: I love it here and the reviews about it, is on point. "39th floor with high arching windows overlooking beautiful SF in a chill & fun environment with good food & drinks." Certainly a must when in SF.
author: Jules T.

description:
I'm terrified of heights. And then proceeded to get a table that may or may not have been on the furthest edge of the area. 
Even then, the view was amazing. Where we sat, you can see the Bay Bridge and all of the condos that are lit, in addition to the bustling streets below.

The menus light up. That's all pretty cool, granted that the room itself is dimly lit.
author: Sean H.

description:
The View is the top floor lounge at the SF Marriott. I had no expectations on the way up the elevator and was pleasantly surprised with the view (Oh, I get it) through the enormous windows that I can only describe as "architecturally enhanced". I took a pic, but it was nighttime, and it didn't work out (just imagine blurry lights in the distance).

As for the bar itself, it could have been better; No beer on tap (boo), and my caipirinha tasted exactly like a margarita. But our party had a good time, especially when we found great seating on the back (western) side, which is slightly hidden and also more private, with a viewing window just as large as the main bar side. Service was slow, and I ended up going to the bar a few times to get drinks for our group. I guess they don't have to try as hard, considering the lofty location. Still, I'd come back, now that I know the ropes.
author: Dan B.

description: It was a chill spot. We went after 8 so it was hard to find a table. One finally opened up so we sat down to take in the view. Only select window seats have good views of the city and ours wasn't one. The waiter came by in rapid succession asking us if we needed another drink. I was only halfway through my first drink and ordered another because this guy was so buggy within the first 10 minutes. The lighting could be a little lower to reduce the glare on the windows but if you get a good seat and good waiter it could be a nice evening. I parked in the garage across the street for ~$2/hr.
author: Sold B.

description: Love this place. The view is great but would recommend to get there a bit earlier to get a spot to sit by the windows.
author: Ranee W.

description:
Come here for the great view, leave for somewhere else for food or drinks considering the $$, but hey, you can't complain since the atmosphere and service is top notch.

Recommended: for the view
author: Bobby L.

description:
As you can probably tell, my husband and I enjoy wining and dining at the top of tall buildings.  If a place has a top-floor restaurant or bar, we'll probably go there just to check out the view.  For some reason, it's one of those things we just love to do no matter where we visit.

Of course, we had to visit The View because the Yelp reviews promised excellent views of San Francisco (and this was the hotel where Alex Trebek was injured while chasing a burglar... hilarious).  The restaurant/bar is easy enough to access - just cross the lobby of the hotel and go to the 39th floor.  

This place seems like it could get pretty crowded, especially on weekends, but Sunday night was just right.  One side of the bar had waiter service and the other did not so keep that in mind on slower nights.  We found a cozy table for two right by the window (other side of the bar) and we ordered our drinks from the bar.  

The drinks are pricey (and so is the food) but you're paying for the view.  My husband absolutely LOVED the Manhattan that he ordered and my cocktail was pretty delish.  Cocktails run $12-$15 each so be prepared.  Beer is $7-$8 depending on what you order, so don't plan on drinking too much.  

The views of the city are excellent.  Since SF isn't a very tall city, 39 stories up is plenty high to see everything.  If you sit on the bar side, you'll get a great view of the Bay Bridge; other side and you'll look out onto City Hall and Coit Tower.  Go here for a drink just for the view.  SF looks good out of these windows day or night.
author: Jenna S.

description: I have to say this place is awesome. Great views, great drinks and fabulous service. Jessica waited on us and she was fantastic. I had a glass of the Riesling and a small portion of the creme brûlée. It came it a cute little dessert cup with a chocolate dipped cookie. I must say delicious. I didn't order any food because we ate dinner already. The drinks are pricey, but it was worth it to me. Oh yea, the parking is a bit much. We paid $20 for an hour. The valet did mention a parking deck across the street for about $4-$5 an hour.
author: Kamara W.

description: I loved this place! The view IS truly amazing and the people there (staff and clientele) all seemed so fun, friendly and enjoyable. Total strangers felt like good friends. Loved the vibe and their selection was all really top shelf and the service was great. Loved the appetizers and attention to presentation.
author: Amanda J.

description: Great view, hence the name, but a bit busy on a Friday night with only open seating, so you have to be kind of aggressive to get a seat. Also somewhat loud. With that said the drinks are top quality and even with the crowd our service has been very quick and efficient. The drink menu could be a bit larger. Overall a nice place to entertain friends while in the city.
author: Warren S.

description: It was kind of dreary last night and the view was still spectacular. I highly recommend this spot, especially if you are new to the city or just enjoy a beautiful view. The drinks were also great, I really enjoyed the old fashioned. For food you can't go wrong with the crab and prawn cocktail and the cheese plate.
author: Naomi T.

description:
Go for the view.

This place totally reminds me of the revolving lounge, Bona Vista in LA, but not quite there in coolness. However, for a nice chill lounge in SF to chat in with a view that doesn't involve freezing your butt off, this hotel lounge is the place to go.

The lounge doesn't get packed but seating can be difficult to find since the place is rather small & intimate. Also, I didn't even know they served food but do expect slightly higher prices for the drinks they make. I recall the Ginger Pear was pretty good if you're a fan of vodka & are tired of the usual drinks. Good beers are only $1 more than domestics.
author: Steven C.

description: This place is the best spot to have a great view of the city and enjoy a good cocktail!  It doesn't open until 5:00 so you have to hang out until then but get there early to get a good seat.
author: Ryan G.

description: Go when the weather is nice.  I went on a foggy weeknight and the view was obstructed for most of the time.  Overall, it was a very good experience.  The service was quick and polite.  I didn't feel any pressure to hurry up, despite the crowd.  The Kobe Beef Sliders which were pretty good.
author: Joel L.

description:
Awesome lounge, spectacular views, good service. 

I stayed at the Marriott for a conference. I noticed a poster in the elevator advertising the lounge on the top floor. Naturally, I was curious so I decided to head up. I was amazed at how beautiful the view was from the restaurant. You can see most of downtown San Francisco and you can see views of the water. 

While there, I had the Kung Pao chicken wings and the Prawns. The Kung Pao wings were the star of the show lol. The wings were very flavorful and had just the right amount of heat. The prawns were good and well flavored as well. 

If I'm ever in San Francisco I would definitely return to this lounge.
author: Sheri B.

description: Really good classic cocktails, very strong. Delicious beer nuts. Not all seats are right next to a huge window though, you probably have to come right when it opens for those seats.
author: S. A. K.

description:
One of the coolest spots for a drink I have ever been to! First of all the view alone is breathtaking. The bar has a great drink list and chill atmosphere. 

I have been here twice and the service, drinks and view were spectacular both times! Great place to meet up with friends, have a romantic drink with a date or just relax and get an incredible view of the city.

It's a little pricey, but definitely worth it!
author: Darcy R.

description: Nice spot for out of towners.  Cocktails are about 15.  The selling point is obviously the view.   The venue itself is bit outdated.
author: Sharmeela S.

description:
ATMOSPHERE:
How have I not written a review of this place yet? Came here few times. Love love love the atmosphere and, well, quite literally the view!
author: Angela L.

description: This review is long over due. The view lounge at the Marriott Marquis has the best view of the SF skyline! Food is small plate and meant to be shared. Such a great spot to hang out and chill.
author: Monica S.

description:
Food? Not here unless you are starving and have no other options. Why the 4 star? Because of the Name and the actual View! Ambiance at its finest in San Francisco. Romantic place to start an evening or end it right in the same building...........but different floor and room.....LOL!

Cocktails and Conversations.......for a chill evening. Come here when it is raining as well!
author: ARIeL P.

description:
PRICEY = YES! (but not so much compared to some other not so good spots Ive been)

FOOD = Fantastic (at least based on what I had and I've only once been to a 4 M-Star restaurant. Compared to those, not so much. But compared to many others. Good

LOCATION = Amazing, great right in the center close to everything. 

PARKING = Don't park at the hotel = Expensive. Park in the Garage by the Matreon/Target (1 Min walk) 

VIEW = LMAO ... of course AMAZING... that's why it's called "THE VIEW" lounge. 


I primarily go here for the amazing view that it has. Have brought many of my friends and dates ;) here and it's just a nice vibe. 

TIPS: They accept NO reservation. Go early (between 6pm-8pm winter time) so basically right before sunset. Since many don't care for it. But at least you get the good seat and when sunsets and it's all romantic you are in the prime seat. If you show up all classy and late and want a good seat... GOOD LUCK. To me it would suck to get a crap location with such amazing view, but pay the same price as everyone else for the food. 

Drinks are expensive. Food is worth it. Get their meat dish., absolutely tasty. 


Overall, for the cheapest bottle of wine, and three drinks ($16 each) two appetizer and two course meal. It came out to $150 including tip. Not bad for an amazing date ;)

No parking validation, so don't get your hopes up. 

Also, been there in the day time, didn't like it as much. Still nice though.
author: Sina J.

description:
If you're trying to get laid in San Francisco, you could do worse than taking your significant other to The View.  Appropriately named, this bar/lounge is at the top of the Marriott Marquis and is literally floor to ceiling windows with a 360 degree view of the city.  It's suuuper dimly lit, has nice comfy chairs, and a very intimate vibe.  The only thing spoiling it are the people and children running all over the place taking in the views (which, I admit, when we first got up there, was us).

They have a small food menu, mostly little appetizery things, and a full bar with some signature drinks.  The food we had (a trio of dips - hummus, tapenade, and baba ganoush) was really tasty, and we further ruined the classy vibe here by basically licking the things clean (I dropped the bowl on the table, oops) and wearing t-shirts and jeans.

Really, the only thing that keeps this from being a must-visit is the price.  It's expensive.  Flat out expensive.  Not a little pricy.  Not a tid bit much.  Ex.pen.sive.  Think of a fair price for a drink and double it, and you're probably about right on the prices here.

That said, as time goes on, I remember less of the sticker shock and more of the peaceful, amazing views that we sat and looked out on while sipping our drinks.
author: Adam J.

description: Really right now with this view!!!!! Best view of San Francisco.... The music is great, the vibe is terrific, and the drinks are on point! A must do if traveling to San Francisco!! 6 stars!!!!!!! Outstanding !!!!
author: Shelly M.

description: Indeed came here for the view. Anything place high is good in my book. Drink is pricey but you are here for the view. Seating is first come first serve.
author: Amanda D.

description: If yelp let me give half star, I will do it. This bar is not professional at all. We even got here very early but they did not gave us any table. They was giving tables for people who gave them more tip even though they were late. So make sure if you want to have a table in the weekend, bring more "Tip".
author: Tran Hoang H.

description: I came with a friend during this past summer while I was visiting SF.  The views can't be beaten.  Amazing to go during sunset. The drinks were pricey, but that's to be expected at a hotel bar.  The crowd was touristy, which is why I knocked down the rating.  Took a few laps to find seating area.  The location is downtown SF/FiDi, which was OK.  After I've seen the view, don't think I need to go back.
author: Ashley G.

description: Absolutely breath taking views of the bay and of the city of SF. Ive never had any food here but they make a great paloma thats for sure. A great place to take people who have never been to SF or just a great place to take anyone who enjoys a birds eye view of the city with great service.
author: Zino M.

description: This place has a great view!! Have been here multiple times after dinner for drinks :) I really wish that they had a dessert menu for later at night!!
author: Karishma B.

description: This is a nice spot to get a drink in the evening's. It gets really packed as people come for happy hour. The drinks are a little pricey but this is the place where you are really paying for the view.
author: Evelyn Q.

description: This place is pretty hidden inside a hotel. You can park near the lobby and tell the valet that you're going upstairs to "The View" and they'll park your car near the lobby for you. But sometimes it gets really pack so you might have to park somewhere else and walk back. They don't take reservations so you would have to wait for the next table to leave. The view here is beautiful! A perfect place for a date night. There's two side of the view one where you can see the bridge and city lights at night and the other side is an overview of the city. This place is not really a dinner type of restaurant where you can get full off of their food. It's mainly for wine, cocktails with cheese and crackers or appetizers. It can get alil loud here at times but in general it's worth it if you never been here before. The pricing here is pretty average but can be a bit pricey depending on what you get.
author: Jenny H.

description: Awesome bar with a great view! Had a nice drink and cocktail selection although I still think I prefer the Top of the Mark' drinks. This place got super crowded on a Friday right when it opened at 4 and there were no seats available when we left.
author: Kiki H.

description: Despite being unable to even get a drink, it was that busy last time, I'm a huge fan of this place because of the unparalleled view. The windows do look as if they're from Wayne Enterprises, and the windows provide an easily accessible panoramic view of the city. We went to Top of the Mark and the Starlight Lounge that same evening, and while they have good views, they're just not as awesome as the view from the bat-cave windows... Also, on the Top of the Mark you're confined to the view from your particular table. Next time we go, we'll make sure it's not on a Saturday when there're so many events going on in the city.
author: Bronson S.

description: Aptly named, the view of the city is spectacular. You'd have to come here early to get the best seats though. It gets packed by 8 on Saturday. The menu is as expected for hotel bar food. The drink is okay. They have Canadian iced wine which is my favorite!
author: Olivia C.

description:
I went to The View for a VIP dinner earlier this week. It was awesome! They reserved the left side of the bar for the event but it looks like on a normal business day the entire space would be open without a fee to get inside. 

The dinner/ appetizer setup was really pretty and the food that I tried was delicious. I really liked that they labeled all the food options too. I tired the Vietnamese spring rolls, chicken skewers, crab cakes and a blueberry lemon dessert. The spring rolls were kind of dry and the skewers were just okay. They skewered were covered with peanut sauce and I'm not a huge fan of that. Not impressed. The crab cakes were awesome and so was the blueberry lemon dessert though! It was quite tart. 

The view from The View was spectacular! The clouds were rolling in and the sun was just on it's way down. I would have stayed all night had the place not gotten so crowded because of the event.
author: Julia A.

description:
Love the view! So worth coming out to.  Be careful though. The seats by the windows tend to get taken pretty quick (like in less than 20 mins from opening).  Drinks are pretty and potent. Worth the price tag. 

Haven't eaten here - cannot comment on that. But did I mention the view is BEAUTIFUL? Cuz it so is.
author: Minnie S.

description: This place is just around the corner from our house yet I had never been here before my wife and I checked it out on our date night before seeing a movie at the Century Theater.  Half of the room was closed because they were having a private event but the views were amazing...if you could get a table close to the window.  We ended up moving our way closer and closer when people left so we had a good table by the time we left.  I got a Moscow mule and thought it was just ok but the food (the view trio, tuna tartare and kobe beef sliders) was pretty decent.  The burger lacked a little punch.  This isn't a cheap place though so just know you'll be paying for the view.
author: Blake B.

description: Located in the heart of the city and in a trendy hotel is already a plus . What we came in for is more on the spectacular night watching atop the 39th floor of this glass encased lounge. We came here not for the warriors and clippers game ( flat screen tubes telecasting the event on both sides of the room) but I finish off  night of breathtaking wine and dine night with our best friends. Their dessert samples /3 of 5 choices on the menu was the perfect ending topped with coffee and the night sparkle view on top of the most beautiful city . A definitely romantic mood place and a plus for out of town visitors. Our wait guy was very tentative and friendly .  This place does not take reservations so come early or late it all just depends on available seatings.
author: Ateh M.

description: The drinks were amazing and the view was on point after running a marathon! The staff were helpful and gave us the drinks in no time at all. Overall we got there early and got good seats. I will come back next year after the marathon again!
author: Myia M.

description:
I was gonna give them a 4-stars review for the very cool location and nice decoration and well-built cocktails.
But then I checked my bank account and saw that they charged me $25 instead of $21. I wasn't drunk so Im very sure I left my tip in cash, which means the amount charged on the card should only be the amount on the bill.
Just a warning guys
author: Alan T.

description: Want to see the the breath taking view of SF come here and see it for yourself self !! It beautiful and there drinks are very tasty !!! Worth the $15 drinks
author: Brenda L.

description:
Beautiful view. good to have business meetings

Foods and service are nothing special..
author: Patricia H.

description:
I love it up here for the view, especially since the Carnelian Room is gone over in the BofA tower.

So why am I leaving a one star review?  Because my friend's purse was stolen here and I'm hoping you'll read this, be more prudent, and it won't happen to you.

It's fairly dimly lit so it's probably a pretty good place to prowl since it can get crowded and you feel pretty secure 39 floors up in a Marriott.

I'm not being racist, but these two black kids were acting incredibly suspicious.  They were sitting to the left of us, constantly eyeing us.  A little while later, they moved to the right of us, sitting much closer.  They continued to suspiciously look over and one pulled his hoodie over his hat.

We were the only ones there and the two kids left.  About 15 minutes later, we realized that the purse was gone.

We spoke with security to check camera footage and my friend called to cancel her cards, and they had already tried to use the cards a few blocks away.

SF is the second most intelligent city in North America, but I guess every city has its share of miscreants and idiots.

If it were up to me, I would've gone Liam Neeson on them.

On the upside, I appreciate the way the security supervisor handled the situation.

Maybe I'll be back, maybe I won't.  Maybe I'll be armed, maybe I won't.  Maybe I'll be clothed, maybe I won't.  Maybe I'll become a racist, maybe I wont.
author: Lawrence H.

description:
Had it been three weeks ago, I would of given "The View" a full five stars. I had an amazing experience here three years ago on a date.

It's come full-circle, and I'm no longer as impressed with this lounge as the first time. The service was super slow, it took more than 10 minutes just to be told it was open seating. Once my friend met up with me 5 minutes later, he literally cleaned the table for us because they don't have a bus boy. The waitress was really overworked and there was a couple nearby that stormed out because no one ever came around to take their order.

The place is mainly an older/professional crowd (est. early 30's+) mixed with some young people here and there (early 20's-late 20's). 

The view of the city depends on where you're sitting in the lounge so if you want a specific view then be aware to sit accordingly. There is an area of the lounge with fireplaces. People are dressed business casual to cocktail attire to typical San Francisco casual (bummy look). Mainly business casual though.

I liked that people are generally chill, there's couples on dates, I recommend this place if on a date! At night it can be pretty romantic since its darker, candles, and the lights of city are really nice. 

Food is okay, had the chocolate cupcakes and Cabernet, it wasn't amazing but mainly typical lounge food.
author: Rose E.

description: The View would have been awesome if the fog hadn't rolled in and taken away the view.  Anyhow, great place for a cocktail and chat.
author: Brenda D.
