description: The views, even on a foggy day, are breathtaking. Drinks are delicious and service superb. There are plenty of seating areas on both sides and both offer amazing views and a great setting to unwind.
author: Viv H.

description: This place is awesome! There are amazing views of the city and the Bay Bridge. The drinks were great also! The View is a great first date spot. :)
author: Ashley N.

description:
This place gets even 1-star solely for the view. 

The food is disgusting.

My group ordered tuna tartare, sliders and fish tacos. 

All of these dishes were priced very high so we thought the quality would also be high. It was MICROWAVED frozen food. And if it wasn't, that was the worst chef that's ever made me anything. 

The tartare tasted like dog c*m. How do I know what dog c*m tastes like? Who knows. 

The fish tacos tasted like they were bought from Taco Bell and then put into a crappiertaco shell. 

Also, this place gets REALLY hot because the glass windows are in direct line of sight of the SUN. Yet, they don't turn on the A/C. 

Again, this place doesn't even deserve one star if it wasn't for the view.
author: Jesse J.

description: Awesome view of SF, fancy and classy. It's hard to get a window seat but ambiance is always nice and intimate!
author: Kylissa M.

description:
Nice spot for drinks and live music (which they don't have as often now) - simply because of the view. The food / appetizers are not good - just your average cafeteria stuff. 

This place used to be much better, but now it's just another San Francisco cost cutting tourist attraction. 

Couldn't believe when these guys actually threw in some ketchup and sauce packets (like you would when ordering McDonald's to go) along with their appetizers. Really? You just going to throw in some plastic packets and expect me to squeeze them out onto my food? There aren't any half way decent ramekins or even paper sauce dishes for the price? 

I asked our server about it, but he just mumbled sorry, seemed indifferent, and didn't offer anything to make our experience better.

They probably get enough foot traffic from out of towners to be profitable. They don't really care about quality or customer service.
author: Andrey L.

description: This place is great! Great views of the bay! And outstanding service! Very welcoming staff!
author: Fleur M.

description:
Now I know why it's called what it's called. Sweet rollerblading Jesus, the view's spectacular; even on a dark, dreary, rainy evening at 7:00pm! Every table in the place has a grand view of the windows overlooking the city. 

Though I warn you: if you're here at night, it's pretty dark in here. Like, I-can-hardly-see-this-damned-menu-let's-use-our-phones-as-a-flashlight kinda dark. 

EATS
+The View trio: hummus (smokey, not at all good; we barely touched it), babaghanoush (a bit bitter, but a bit more palatable than the hummus), tomato olive relish (I held back from licking the bowl clean) served with triangles of pita bread.
+Local artisan cheese plate: a ramekin of honey, marcona almonds, dried apricot and figs, crackers, and a selection of cheeses that were never clarified (I believe only one was goat cheese [a blue cheese], and the rest were hard, cow cheeses).
+Antipasti platter: a mound of (what seemed like) a salami-prosciutto combination (again, never clarified), burrata (super-creamy mozzarella), peppadew peppers (the sweet vinegary ones), pitted olives in a pool of its oil, and crackers.

DRANKS
+Tasty dirty martinis
+Beers are bottled, not on draught

An excellent place to bring a date and share an appetizer; a lover and split a bottle of bubbly; or a cheating spouse to throw a martini in their face.

Yeah, it's that kinda place.
author: Adena B.

description: Don't go for the food, go for the view (obviously ;) and sunset.  A drink and dessert?
author: Christine T.

description:
Best view in SF. 
Good dirty martini. 
Worst Mac and cheese in the USA.
author: David L.

description:
So they have high quality drinks there for around $15 which is great for a once in a while experience. Sliders weren't that great but I was impressed at the truffle fries. 
Get there before everyone gets off work to get the view you want. I like the higher tables you feel like you're really in SF!
author: Allen Y.

description:
One of the spot I love in SF. 
You can seat yourself. By doing that, they give you chance to find with other customers in getting a best spot. Depend on where you sit, you can view Bay Bridge on one side of the building, and on the other side you can see Twin Peaks. 
The champ-gain is good. We got some desert: Cream Bullee, Mashmallow dip in chocolate and an ice-cream...3 dessert for $10. And an appetizer with shrimp....It was a really nice spot.
author: Diem H.

description: Horrible service no one cared about the table need more bar host and  I cut my self in the window. Omg no body didn't care 25 minutes later no alcohol or banded...WTF drinks 30 minutes later we arrived at 9pm now 9:52pm still no drinks or banded
author: Denish G.

description:
The view from The View is fantastic, day or night, possibly the best in the city. This is a great place to take out of town guests.

The drinks are good but there is really nothing special about them and they are overpriced, but you are paying for where you are having drinks more than the drink itself. Desserts are pretty good as well.

The main issue is that service, while friendly, is extremely slow. It took quite a while to place an order and a long time to get the drinks, then a long time again to get the attention of the waitress to order more drinks. Luckily you can just sit and look outside at the city and the bay as you wait.
author: Frank J.

description: Great view, but open seating...the side facing the Bay Bridge and Financial District is much nicer than the other.
author: David W.

description:
One of my favorite places in the city.

As everyone already mentioned, it's perfect for a date. I took my boyfriend here after a lovely dinner at Amber's and a movie. It was definitely the cherry to the top of a perfect date night. 

But aside from date nights, this is an amazing place to escape to. I like to go here when I don't want to be seen. Sometimes you just need to get away, you know? The view is so serene and I love enjoying my alone time overlooking the concrete jungle. If I still worked downtown I'd probably be here almost every night.
author: Kayla I.

description:
This place was chosen as the meet-up location for our friends on a Saturday night. I did not do the choosing. The drinks are pricey. The cheapest drinks are bottles of beer for $7.

However, you don't come here for the drinks, you come for the view. The view is nice and there are plenty of nooks and crannies to sit in. We had a large party, so we actually didn't have the best view. The staff was friendly and helpful. They put together many tables for us and were attentive, but not pushy when we weren't ordering round after round. We stayed for awhile, waiting for everyone to arrive as it was National Hangover Day. We had a nice time. 

This place is quiet and relaxing. This is a nice place to catch up with an old friend or take a date for a romantic night out.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
This is the type of place where you bust out your smart phone and start taking pics to upload on instagram/facebook/twitter to show everyone and their mother how gorgeous a birds eye view of SF can be.

Located close to the Powell bart, this lounge is easily accessible. Best time would be right before sunset (so you can claim a spot by the windows). On one side you get a view of SoMa and the buildings, with a peek at the Bay Bridge. On the other side, you get a view of Bernal Heights with a peek of the Golden Gate Bridge behind some buildings off in the distance. Oh and you can see city hall too! 

THE FOOD: 
Tacos- delicious! I liked that the taco shell was crunch but not overly fried- soft crunchy. Great as an appetizer.

Mac & Cheese- I don't usually like mac & cheese but this dish was well done. The cheese is creamy and mild- so those who don't like cheese can enjoy it too.

Fried rice- pretty good!

DRINKS:
Oh my goodness, the drinks are STRONG STRONG STRONG. Make sure you eat before you drink!
author: Emily C.

description:
A tourist must-do!
Watch the sunset with a drink 
And someone special
author: ReviewHaiku F.

description: Stopped by in the evening with a few friends for a drink. The view of the city at night is simply spectacular.
author: Will D.

description:
I often call this place "the sky bar" and you'll see why... 
You get an absolute breath-taking 360 view of the whole city at night, words can not express how gorgeous and upscale this place really is. I normally recommend this place to tourists and always take my friends and family! It's a bit pricey for a drink $12-13 for a glass of wine when I go but whatever, just enjoy the view " )
author: Mari B.

description: This place gets 3 stars because of the view! However, this place is overly crowded and way too hyped up. I would just come up the elevator, snap a picture, and get out. It's pretty much a tourist a trap, in my opinion. It's just filled with a lot of obnoxious people and rude out of towners. The drinks are pretty strong but very expensive. The food was ok. The charcuterie board was expensive and there were only 3 slices of 3 types of meat, a few raisins, some dried apricots, and some weird olive & fig spread. I also got the cheese board as well to which had local cheeses which I was also not too impressed on the selection. The service was great though but I feel very bad for the employees who work there because I'm sure they were busting their butts off for out of towners who are really bad at tipping.
author: Gary I.

description: Best bar ever!!!!great drinks great atmosphere,great food.the music is not too loud.everything is perfect.i recomand the moscone mule - great drink
author: Zohar I.

description: We just went into this horrible horrible place waited in the que for nearly 30 mins and didnt get served. while i was in que i saw one lady return her cocktail which she said taisted aweful. So yeah we decided to go elsewhere.. sorry i read the reviews and wanted to go to this plc but the service was "zero". Too busy and the music was crap.
author: Natasha M.

description:
If you're a sucker for a good view like I am, you'll love the scenery from the top floor of the Marriott in SOMA. I suppose you can make that assessment pretty easily just with the name alone, but it bears repeating. 

It's certainly not the most affordable place to enjoy a drink, but the treat that awaits your eyeballs is well worth the extra Washingtons.
author: Ruggy J.

description: I love views like the View has. I enjoyed a drink with a friend and the atmosphere was great. I didn't feel uncomfortable and it's a place I would love to go back. They are pricy there but sometimes you just need to treat yourself. I went around 4 and it filled up pretty fast.
author: Caitlin M.

description: The View is definitely a more upscale, posh bar than not, but if that's what you're looking for it's going to be hard to beat this place.  It's difficult to get a great seat at times (it gets rather busy), but the view is spectacular.  At the 39th floor of the Mariott, views don't get much better than this.  The drinks are really great as well, although you're gonna pay a pretty penny for that Old Fashioned.  They offer some food choices as well that looked enticing, but I didn't try any of it.  Bottom line is that if you're looking for a really great place to ingest alcohol, kill some time and enjoy a great view, look no further - you've arrived.
author: Zach S.

description: Good crispy shrimp.  Food a little above average, but the view of the city is what this place is all about.  Good service to boot!
author: Todd K.

description:
Absolutely stunning view of SF. If you're looking for a romantic place to impress your date look no further. This is by far the best lounge to go to for an intimate evening with that special someone. The entire place is very dim, each table being mostly lit by the candles and the city itself. 

I took my date here at night around 9pm and we found a table with a decent view, the best ones have a beautiful birdseye view of the bridge. The drinks and food are expensive, but for this ambiance you have no right to complain. I stuck with my usual hennessy and coke, and got the sliders as well. The food was delicious, and the service was just right, our waitress came at the perfect moments when we needed her. This is the kind of place you want to relax, talk, and soak in. It was a great experience. 

Parking may be hard to find, but if your fancy enough they have valet parking which I recommend you take advantage of.

No words can really explain how breathtaking it is watching the city dance at night, but "the view" paints a pretty darn good picture.
author: K C.

description: One of the most breathtaking views of San Francisco. Plus the service is great (even in rush hour!) and there's always a good crowd at the bar.
author: P A.

description:
Absolutely phenomenal place for drinks when in town. 

Excellent drink menu, some delicious food choices (I had the antipasti plate) and very friendly servers.

I watched the sunset over the bridge and cannot recommended this bar enough.
author: Stirling G.

description: Every view from this floor is great. The drinks are def pricey but the whole experience is worth it. I would absolutely come back.
author: Neek W.

description:
Great view for an afternoon drink. One of the best spots for sunset.
The view is best at night or dusk.
Yummy appetizers!
author: Kimia R.

description:
I've been here twice so far both on a Friday night. There's always people sitting by the windows so you may need to circle around to find a seat with the view. I was lucky enough to get a seat by the window each time.

This is a really romantic place to bring a date for a drink. It's dark by the windows and you have a candle on your table for light. The waiter comes by often to see if you want any drinks so no need to wait at the bar.

I've only had Scotch each time I've been here, so it can be pretty pricey. They give a decent amount of whiskey in the glass though. There's a lot of fancy Scotches here that I haven't had before.

Overall, this is a pricey place just for drinks but the fancy whiskey and romantic setting and great view makes this place pretty awesome.

Pros:
- Great view of the City
- Romantic, dark setting
- Good whiskey selection
- Friendly waiters

Cons:
- Pricey
author: Paul U.

description: I'm new to SF.  So, when I first contemplated exploring nightlife, I got to admit, I was a little intimidated, and a lot clueless.  Fortunately, I was staying at the MARROTT MARQUIS, and my answer to a great night out was right in the hotel!  It's called THE VIEW, at Marriott Marquis! When I walked in, and actually saw the floor-to-ceiling view all the way to the Golden Gate bridge from that high up, I was glad I took that elevator ride.  You will be too!  Oh, DJ was spinning 80's dance. I'm a huge fan!  Felt right at home!  If you're ever at the Marquis, don't leave until you've seen THE VIEW!
author: Tim J.

description: This is one of the best view of the city. This hotel with it's central location and business travelers, gets inundated quite a bit. In fact the Oracle Open World conference happened to be going on while we were here. Lots of power meetings and tech geek drinking. You could tell people were shmoozing and had been let off their normal leashes. Luckliy scored a top but the window. Had a couple of drinks, looked at the skylin into Oakland then went about our way
author: Kim N.

description: Go here for the view. The food was pretty good, the drinks also good if both overpriced, but the view... well worth every penny!
author: Greg F.

description: Although The View is a tourist spot located in the Marriott Marquis, we came by anyway for drinks and to see the San Francisco skyline. Our server was not particularly friendly and gave a bit of an attitude when I told him I'd be okay with just water. It was a pretty full house around 9:30 pm, and it only got busier as the evening progressed. Luckily, we were able to grab a spot by the window after a few minutes. At night, the view is just okay -- the window panes seem to be tinted, so we couldn't get a completely clear view of the city. I'm sure it's a lot prettier during the day, so I'd like to come back to see it then.
author: Ivy W.

description:
On the 39th floor of the Marriott, The View offers a stunning view of the city of San Francisco.  After you exit the elevators, on both the left and right hallways will lead you to a large open area with large windows that shows you the view of city.  It's more visually stunning at night with all the tall buildings and bright lights.

As for the bar, well that's a different story.  The prices are higher than the norm and the drinks aren't of the quality of high end bars like Gitane or Rickhouse.  What you probably will buy here are whiskey neat and shots of vodka.  Alternative is to buy a glass of wine but I'm not a wine expert so I can't comment on their selection.
author: Ronald L.

description: Came up because I'm staying here.  The view, is of course great.  The service, well it leaves a lot to desire. Servers lack attention, and have a RBF (look it up).  Go for a great photo, but don't expect an atmosphere.
author: Bryan C.

description:
This place had all the right stuff that I was looking for in an SF lounge at night on a random Tuesday night - smooth tunes emanating from surround sound speakers, low romantic lighting, smaller space that is not crowded, a huge ass window with a decent view of the city that lives up to its name.

Space is limited so you may wanna make reservations of busier nights. Good luck getting seated next to the huge ass window. Our small group was able to only because I asked the hostess really nicely if she could hook it up so you may wanna do the same if you're stuck on one of the side lounge areas.

The drinks are over $15 dollars here so be ready to pony up for your lady friend(s).
author: Sam P.

description:
The second I got out of the elevator I was shocked .
As a tourist in San Francisco this place is a must! 
The view is just amazing . Before I was seated I walked around and every spot give you a a different view of SF.
Warmly warmly recommended .
The drinks and snacks are not cheap but worth every dime , the service is good ( although they are very busy ).
Don't miss it out if your already here.
author: David H.

description: Awesome!!! Relaxing environment with a breathtaking view! The drinks were deelish, but the appetizer menu is rather limited. I deducted a star because it took us nearly 20 minutes of walking n circles to find a seat. The bar opens @ 4, my husband & I arrived close 2 530. Once seated all was good. If we had had a large group or even one other person with us seating wud have been nearly impossible. For that reason, not sure that I'll b back. But it's definitely worth going 2 say you've been there!
author: Me M.

description:
As a local, I've checked out pretty much all of the spots with nice views in SF...or so I thought. I mistakenly overlooked the Marriott. The View Lounge is remarkable! Occupying the full 39th floor of the Marriott, it is spacious and offers sweeping Bay views from all sides of the building!

It's a great spot for locals to hang out if you're looking for something different from the norm. Also, definitely a more diverse crowd with people from all over the world.
author: Mansi A.

description: Very cool place. The view is spectacular from anyplace in the restaurant. It's very popular and hence quite difficult to find a seat. You may need to hang around a bit and wait for someone to leave as it's all "seat yourself." Don't go here if you want a full dinner - has a limited menu with just some small bites. Food wasn't anything amazing but the drinks were great. Parking was easy as there was a valet parking garage right across the street. Would recommend but wouldn't be one of my top 5 places to go in SF.
author: Nicole S.

description:
This is a must for any locals or tourists. I have a conference every year at the Moscone Center and I always come up here afterwards with clients and business associates for the enticing view of SF. Be sure to get there before sundown to grab a table or lounge seating as it gets crowded. Not sure how it is on the weekends but I'm usually here on weekdays so the demographic can vary from low 30 to 50 year old yuppies.

Last time I came my manager was pleased with his Mojito. They had muddled in a fresh sprig of mint and wasn't watered down or too carbonated like most. The following night I took a friend that had just moved there from VA and enjoyed an apple martini, couple glasses of scotch and  a whisky. A little pricey but it's normal for a SF lounge. Both of them enjoyed the drinks and were pleased with the service.
author: James V.

description:
I got a stiffy here.  Yes, a nice stiff drink.
Bombay Sapphire gin martini.  Olives please, because I need to have dinner.

Night cap here was the best as it was shared with two people I absolutely adore, my husband and my bestie. We had the perfect view of the city.  SF, you are one gorgeous dame!
author: Elle A.

description: Love the view! Priceless. My girlfriend and I had a great night drinking wine and chatting. Great set up for casual drinks after work.
author: Rose G.

description:
An fantastic view of San Francisco. This place is perfect for anyone who is new to the city and enjoy having good drinks. The waitress was very friendly, cute, and attentive to my group. 

I recommend this as a place for anybody that is new to the area.
author: John D.

description: I really had good time here, the view is amazing. The drinks and desserts are great. But the most important part of my joy, was because the company I had and the amazing date I had here;)
author: Waleed B.

description: Amazing view over whole San Francisco! Friendly straff who suggested us to change side to see the upcoming sunset. The window tables get occupied pretty fast, but usually people just stay for a drink (pre dinner time). Get seats next to a window table and you are first at it when they leave :)
author: Marie L.

description: The best view of the city from the inside! This place needs to offer more food though...
author: Tom S.

description: Tourist trap of sales guys but the best view. Packed with special events so depends on crowd
author: Z H.

description: The Name describe this location perfect. The View have the perfect view. One star minus is for the bad and unfriendly service and no reservation option.
author: Andreas M.

description:
This city has some particularly gorgeous views, and the View has one of the best, but I only seem to end up here with tourist friends, so that should tell you enough. The crowd is way older, the service is nice but slow, and the drinks are overpriced. 

When your Mom is in town, she'll love it. Otherwise, unless it's your friend's first time in San Francisco, you can do better. Try the Starlight Room at the Sir Francis Drake.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I wish they were open during the day, as the view of the city is just as stunning by sunlight as it is by star/moonlight. 

That said, GO. If nothing else, go up, admire the view, take it all in, then leave. But the bar's cool, and I suspect when WWDC isn't in town, it's not so lame. Getting a drink at any bar during WWDC is near impossible without a signal flare.

There's lots of little nooks and cranny's to steal away and get out from the hustle and bustle of the main area. There's a few waitresses working the room, but don't come too hungry or too thirsty, you might expire before your first bite or sip.
author: john W.

description: Great place for a date night! Save your pennies because drinks are pricey but "the view" is worth it. Get there early to snag a table
author: Jenni M.

description: Amazing view the chocolate tasting was good but oh my god that salted butterscotch pudding!!!! Could eat that for days!!!! Oh the skylines were amazing and the drink of the same name was great too!!!! David and the team were remarkable at serving us out of towners and the view was great! Seats along window are first come first serve!
author: Jasmine L.

description: This place was awesome. We ordered drinks at the bar, waited like 10 minutes when a seat opened up on the side. After about 20 minutes we got a seat right by the window, which was crazy. I would definitely recommend everyone to check this place out. The music was really good and at a perfect volume, not quiet but not too loud.
author: Andrew A.

description: My father and I enjoyed a few local craft beers at the View and it is definitely a must visit for anyone in the Bay Area. The panorama is spectacular and the service was very professional and quick. We were lucky to find a table because it can get rather crowded. The music was a little loud and upbeat, but overall it was a great experience and I highly recommend the View if you have a chance to visit.
author: Nate F.

description: Lovely view, reasonably priced specialty drinks (though the drinks were not very unique...the atmosphere definitely made up for it). When we went on a Friday night it was very crowded. However we still found seating.
author: Linna G.

description:
On my last day at the Marriott, I decided to head up to the 40th floor, which doesn't work until after 4pm.  It's a first come first serve, so don't dilly dally around if you want to look out at your favorite OOOOOOh and AAAAAAh spot (nope, this view does not rotate).  I don't drink so I can't speak on the margaritas, although I did get the grilled chicken and a cranberry juice, both were "okay", but let's face it, you're likely not hear for the food.  THis is the type of view that makes you just smile.  I looked out over the bay and must've taken the same picture 40 times before my meal came.  

Servers were fine and on the ball about getting you what you needed and if you're sitting alone, as I was, people may come up and look at your little slice of view real estate if you're in a good spot, commenting on said view.

If you're a tourist, you gotta go.  If you're local and your date has never been, you gotta go.  Food was forgetful, but I wont forget that view
author: Jamarcus T.

description:
We stumbled upon this little gem thanks to yelp for blackberry.  Great view (you know, minus the fog) and great drinks.  The place was busy so the service was slow, but our waitress was spot on with her pomegranate martini recommendation.  A great place for a night cap or taking your tourists.

The View reminds me of an older, more mature sibling of Chicago's "The Roof" at the Wit hotel.
author: Kirsten A.

description: The View is breathtaking if you're lucky enough to position yourself in front of the huge window.  We were relegated to a small side window but it was still beautiful.  Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about drinks and the sidecar we ordered was fairly reasonably priced ($13) for a place with such an amazing ambiance.
author: Yi Z.

description: Very beautiful view! Really packed had to stand drinks were average over all a good experience !
author: Jackie R.

description: Nice place, great view (if it's not foggy). We arrived at 7pm and were lucky to find a window table and ordered some sparkling wine. Lots of people just goes up to take a picture of the view
author: Mattias N.

description:
Whenever I'm downtown and can't decide where to go, I somehow always end up at the View. Its a lovely place, great ambiance, and of course a beautiful city view. However, I'll be honest, service is sub par here. Although they're courteous, servers are really slow. The food is OK, but not worth what they charge. Drinks tend to be either too strong, or too watery. I have yet to get a good mixed drink here.

But somehow I keep coming back....all because of the view
author: Lea F.

description: It's been over a year since i visited The View. I used to go quite often, esp during nights when there's live band. Such a lively joint and it's romantic. The view is spectacular...named perfectly! Prices of drinks are, of course higher, afterall it is a hotel in downtown SF. What do you expect! Come and enjoy the atmosphere and the awesome romantic feel.
author: Vee V.

description: Surprise! This place has a really great view of the city, as the name suggests. However, not all of the seats in the lounge get to share in that view, which is a bummer if you go there hoping to watch the sunset or something. So if you go on a Friday night without reservations (if they even take reservations), you'll probably be squeezed somewhere else in the lounge, away from the view. And if Karl the Fog is in town, no such view really exists. The lounge is fine. It's dimly lit, a little noisy, but a typical after work spot. We got appetizers and drinks: a bruschetta (really tasty), Moscow mule, and an old fashion. The drinks are standard, nothing too special. But they are pricy. Overall, likely because this is in a hotel, it didn't feel like authentic San Fran, which is what I love about San Fran. It was an okay spot, nothing special. But I'd much rather have spent my time at one of the other many cool bars and lounges this beautiful city has to offer.
author: Chariese S.

description:
My wife and I went here since we were staying at the Marriott and kept seeing all the advertisments about it.  We went right around 6-6:30 and it was packed.  We didn't realize that while you can get an abbreviated menu of food items there, some of which are large like burgers, a lot of the tables are small lounge tables really only meant to hold 2-3 people's drinks.  The food comes from downstairs so that coupled with the fact that there are only a few servers for a crowded lounge adds up to somewhat slow, unattentive, service.  

I would rate the food but since it comes from the main restaurant downstairs it's unfair to include here.  The drinks were somewhat pricey and for it to be during the normal happy hour timeframe, there really were not any happy hour specials, at least none that our server mentioned.  

All in all I think this place is more hyped than it should be.
author: Michael L.

description: This place serves all purposes. Drinks are really good; we had the old fashioned, the spritzer and a skinny mojito and they were all tasty. We also had the slider, which were delivered pretty quickly and tasted great! The views are breathtaking and the prices are reasonable! Came twice during my stay in san francisco and would definitely come back!
author: C G.

description:
Nice view, fancy place, expensive but good food and drinks. Try to get a table facing the bay since that area has the best view. 

I was there when it was almost dark but I bet the view is even better just before sunset.
author: Nikhil D.

description:
Came here on a beautiful day/evening.

Didn't plan on it but came here with good company. We decided to have 1 drink just to enjoy the view and ended up staying here for 4 hours. It was awesome. Atmosphere was very sophisticated and elegant. 

Our party of 2 ended to be a party of 10. Met a lot of people all over the country..  It was nice to have a conversation with other professional adults rather then being hit on with a lame pick-up line!
author: Jay B.

description:
You go here for the view. As the name belies. The drinks are not amazing. There are tons of great cocktail places in the city if that's what you're after. 

You come here to be way up high in the sky, looking out over the bay. It's almost a little scary when you're right up against the glass. Kind of exhilerating.

If you have friends from out of town, and they've already been to top of the mark, come here. It's less pretentious, the service is faster, and you're really close to MoMa (if you want to round out your touristy activities).  If you want a really cool cocktail afterwards, you can always head over to Local Edition. Or grab some interesting wine at Press Club.
author: Shanee B.

description:
If Emperor Palpatine had decided to cut Alderaan some slack and reposition the Death Star over San Francisco for some fancy cocktails and olives, he would get the view you see here. The initial reaction is surprise: the views from both ends of this rooftop cocktail bar are phenomenal, made even more dramatic by the stellar design of the windows. 

It really looks like sitting at a tyrannical purple villain's regal window seat. The only downside is you'll have to pay a price for it. 

Power doesn't come cheap.
author: Keane L.

description:
"Well we're movin on up,
To the east side.
To a deluxe lounge in the sky."

That's what I kept singing in the elevator as we continued to climb up 39 floors to reach The View. 

This was the perfect way to unwind after a long and stressful day. To my surprise we'd arrived in perfect time to take advantage of their Happy Hour special: 1/2 off Skyy martini's!! If the view wasn't doing it for me already the $7 martini's definitely did. The service was a little slow but I couldn't imagine trying to run around that place in circles serving 20+ people at one time. We ordered an array of appetizers ranging from the cheese plater to the antipasto plater to their so called glorified chicken pizza on flat bread. Their food was a perfect addition to the giant shots we ordered. These weren't your typical sized shots, they were more like gulps...but hey, you don't see me complaining!! 

When you come to The View, you're paying a premium for that view. Which made it a little easier to swallow the $250 bar tab for 5 people for 2 hours.
author: Kristy M.

description:
The View... was meh. 

First - the lounge is at the top of the Marriott... so hotel bars are only "so-so" good.  It's hotel food, what do you expect?  

Second - the location is downtown, but the view, looks straight ahead at the skyline instead of the view from the top - let's say of a hill or mountain top. 

Third - happy hour ends at 6pm. Really?

Overall, great destination for tourists or if you're trying to impress someone on a date.  Not so great for locals or professionals looking for a new happy hour place.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Grab a table facing northwest if you can. I came here for a quick drink to catch the views from this lounge atop the Marriott, and it was so hard to get service from where I was sitting. It seemed all the action was on the other side of the room, presumably because that's the side facing the Golden Gate Bridge.

In any case, the views are pretty great all the way around and it's an impressive spot for a one-time thrill.
author: Thy N.

description: Gorgeous views of the San Francisco skyline to delight your special someone.  Happy hour seems a bit more causal then compared to the dinner, so suit up at the lights shine throughout the city.  Also friendly service from the staff impeccably helpful and patient.
author: Ben D.

description:
AWFUL SERVICE. I never leave bad reviews on Yelp, but this takes the cake. This is the second time I've been to the view and although I had horrible service the first time, the view of SF made up for it. 

10 minutes to clear our table of the other patrons drinks that were there
10 minutes until we waited long enough and flagged down the server
10 minutes until we got just, two simple martinis delivered to our table

The best part of this is she asked us to MOVE. Mind you, this is an OPEN SEATING bar. She said that people had reservations at our table which seemed highly unlikely. So she makes us get up and move to another table with no comped drinks, no nothing. If a manager asks a table to move, don't you think they would try and accommodate you a little better??

On top of all that, and being late to our movie due to the slowest service ever, I checked my bank acct. today and my friend and I were both charged double what we paid!!!

NEVER GOING BACK HERE.
author: Jenna M.

description:
Is there a Doctor in the house? Well if you happened to be at The View Bar on Saturday night there most certainly were! 

Thanks to some medical convention in town I felt completely safe and did not hold back downing a few cocktails. I figured if my heart were to stop that one of the many medical professionals would be at my side within seconds to save my life. The only bummer was I did not spot any plastic surgeons, which is what my face really needs. 

This bar sits on the 39th floor of the Marriott. And as it name suggests, the views are amazing and worth the trip up the elevator. The bartenders here know their stuff and can pretty much whip any drink you can think up. The prices are also very reasonable considering it's location. 

There is also a small bar menu which include some pretty tasty treats. I have personally sampled the burger on occasion and it's one of the most underrated in the entire city.
author: V B.

description: Fabulous lounge with breathtaking views of the city. I was there with some friends for drinks. Service was exceptional. Noise level was comfortable. We had seats overlooking the city and could see the fog roll as we were above the clouds.
author: Taylor M.

description:
Looking for an awesome place to have a drink  in San Francisco that has a great view of the city and the bridges?  Then you must stop by the View on top of the San Francisco Marquis Marriott.  This place is a nice spot to sit and sip on your favorite cocktail while admiring the view of the city.  If you come at night, you can watch the Bay Bridge light show that occurs nightly for the next two years.  

Drinks can be a little pricey like $14 and up, but I guess it is because you are paying for the view.  Also, it get's pretty busy here at night (believe it or not).  I have been coming here for the last couple of years when I come up to the city  and I always thought it was a place where older people came to have drinks, but to my surprise lots of younger people, such as myself come here too. :D  

Service can be spotty at times as they can be understaffed when it is completely busy.  But like I said, if you want an awesome view of the city, this is definitely the place to be!  :)
author: Amy C.

description: I have to give this place 5 stars. Service is fast and friendly even when the place is packed at night and of course, the view of San Francisco is phenomenal. Helps that I had REALLY good-looking company. :-)
author: Rosalind G.

description: Great date spot! Nice little drink during happy hour, then dinner or movie after. Took my girlfriend here on our first date and she never looked back. :)
author: Dom P.

description:
Gorgeous bar, the place is very aptly named because the views really are just stunning.

We arrived around 11 on a Friday and the place was packed. We still managed to snag a couch and couple chairs, and browsed the drink menu while waiting for our server. She stopped by to tell us she would be right with us, which I always appreciate: I know you're busy, but the fact that you took the time to acknowledge us makes me feel better. :)

This is where the warm fuzzy ended. She came back and took our orders: 5 fancy $10+ signature cocktails and a bottle of champagne. We waited about 10 minutes or so, until she came back to retake our order.... Somehow she lost it in between there and the bar? I don't know what happened. Anyway, off she goes again, and we wait another 10 minutes. An older gent stopped by to ask if we were ready to order shortly after... Not sure if he was a manager trying to help his incompetent wait staff or what...

Drinks finally arrive and they were not worth the wait. I generally do not like ice in my drinks because I hate the way it tastes when they start melting and watering it down.... And that's exactly what this was. The drinks had obviously been made a while ago and had been sitting at the bar waiting for the waitress to get them (which leads me to believe she put the order in the first time and that's when they were made).

Expected more from what appeared to be an upscale spot, but they really need to hire more waitstaff. Our server was so frantic and flustered; her hair was falling out of her bun and she just looked disheveled. I want my waitress to look put together and confident and she didn't convey that at all.

Also they were playing top 40 music in the background but it was SO quiet we could barely hear it. They need to find a happy medium, as I read another review that said it was too loud.

Icing on the cake was when we left. We tried to find a cab, but there were none to be found so we went inside to ask Marriott staff to call one for us. They told us there was no point because it was Friday night and we'd be better off just waiting outside. Well that's your opinion, now do your job and serve your customer. :/

Side note, apparently all cabs in SF are flipping Priuses so we couldn't fit our party of 5 and had to take 2 cabs. What a ripoff.
author: Jamie L.

description: GO HERE. The name says it all - the views are jaw dropping. I had a Syrah which was surprisingly good, I can't speak for the cocktails, they looked a bit unremarkable honestly but it's not about that. Prices are as expected $12-$15 for drinks. Service was okay, again unremarkable, but I wasn't really paying attention I was busy gawking out the window as you will be. Not impossibly crowded on a Thursday night 10 pm, able to get a table for 3 without any trouble.
author: Amanda W.

description: Great view but the appetizers were overpriced and the delivery took more time then iut should have.
author: Mohammed D.

description:
We just had drinks and dessert both were good but the view was amazing.
side note: its pretty pricy and I would recommend getting there a bit earlier if you want to get a seat right by a window.
author: Alana P.

description: Great place for drinks. Very crowded and hard to get a good seat by the window.  We were Lucky enough to find a window table and had a very Romantic evening.  Great place for a group or friends to hang out.
author: Ali F.

description:
Rude waiter ( Chris ) that freaked out when he figured out I wasn't interested in drinking but there to eat?   STRIKE ONE

Waiting over 1 hour for mussels and a couple pieces of bread on a slow night? STRIKE TWO

Waking up the next morning and seeing in my bank statement that I WAS CHARGED TWICE?  STRIKE THREE

It was beautiful saturday evening and a couple of friends and I wanted to have drinks and a bite to eat before heading home for the night and decided to check out "The View". We were impressed by the view and we sat down to catch up and enjoy the evening. I should have known to walk out when the waiter came to greet us, he was grinding his teeth and obviously on some sort of drug... but the view right?! Plus I was in such a good mood I decided to let go and enjoy the company of my friends.

Chris ( names have not been changed for the purposes of this review) took our drink orders and only two friends ordered drinks but we all ordered food, the waiter rolled his eyes and read back our order and ended it with " 3 waters and only one drink" then he looked like that  post nasal drip finally got to him and he put  on a grade A stank face... we laughed and ignored it and  continued catching up.

45 minutes later... we get his attention and politely ask him why  there such a wait for our food. He explains it's because it was because the kitchen was on the first floor. Then we asked him where our water was 45 minutes after ordering and he looked unconcerned and didn't apologize. He promised  us water and walked away.

1 hour after ordering and becoming frustrated with the fact we had too much class to walk out on our order, it came and we were surprised with a new server from the kitchen and he was fantastic. He was awake, polite, and more importantly obviously not on drugs. It was now when we finally got our water.

My Mussels were delicious and the consensus was the food was delish but not enough to make up for Chris, by far the worst waiter in my dining hitstory.

Another employee came over ( and for their protection I won't give names)  came and they were also super polite and courteous and when we asked them why they couldn't be our server all along,  and then proceeded give the employee a play by play of the evening. They confided to us that the Chris our waiter was screwed up in the head and then told us NOT TO TIP.... YES IT WAS SO BAD AN EMPLOYEE TOLD US NOT TO TIP

So we didn't, but I would be lying if I said that idea didn't cross our minds first. So Marriot do yourself a favor and FIRE that scum bag...
author: T Y.

description:
If you want to impress someone then come here!

Please note that I have not eaten here and only come for happy hour. The name of this place sure fits it well. The view is amazing, you can see down market towards the water and the Financial and the rest of the city from the other end of the bar. The place has some pricey drinks so come with an open wallet even if it is happy hour. The drinks do tend to get a bit on the sugary side but a good old fashion will fix that. The staff isn't always the friendliest but that view takes care of any problems you may have. The waitresses do sometimes forget your drinks but it's understandable as it is a huge place. 

The crowd is mainly tourist since it is in the Marriott but you do on occasion get the group of workers. There is a special elevator that goes straight to the 34th floor where the bar is. There is plenty of seating so you can bring a group with you. 

All in all come for the view. Ehh ehh get it!??
author: Javier G.

description:
The view is beautiful! There's limited window seating, or seating in general is limited. The waiters aren't keen on cleaning up tables or they assume those customers will come back.

The male bartender was friendly that night. The drinks are pricey but fairly large.

The waiter who stands on the outside next to the cash register was not friendly. We purchased two drinks and the dessert platter, easily $40+, and I felt like having a cherry with my drink. My boyfriend asked the waiter and he said no. So sad.

I won't be coming back anytime soon, and not because I didn't get my cherry, but it's a been there done that sort of thing + the waiter didn't help us feel all that welcomed.
author: Christina V.

description:
How much would you be willing to pay for a pretty terrific view of downtown San Francisco in a bar that bears a striking similarity to the Death Star cockpit? If you said, "Oh about $14 a drink" then this is your spot!

Seriously though, it's a great place to start a night off with some friends from out of town. A word of warning though, some luck and patience will be required to get one of the coveted center window spots, but it's totally worth it. Since you're already dropping big bills for cocktails, skip that route and share a bottle of Mumm Cuvee and a cheese plate as you take in the grand views and imagine how cool it would be to Force Lightning your enemies.
author: Madhu P.

description:
6/11/11
So glad we came based on Yelpers reviews! We were hoping to find something different and unique and we definitely liked this location with awesome views of the City! 

Tried the Blood Orange Sidecar martini...at $14 a pop...and a French connection $14ish...but you get your money's worth with the skyline view u get...

Liked how it was a seat yourself and they came to ask for your order...
author: Belle N.

description: The terrible wine and beer selection (come on, Marriott!) is quickly overlooked when you get to the top of the View Lounge. Get there when it opens at 4pm if you want your pick of the seats... Although there are no bad seats. Bar menu was unappealing so we did not eat. Take some pictures and have a drink before going to a nice dinner somewhere else.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Great place to chill.

I checked into the hotel and was exhausted after a full day of driving down the 101. I noticed the kitchen was open to this place until 11pm, and i wanted to check out what the fuss was all about.

I walked in the place around 930 and there were hardly any seats not taken. There were already people comfortable and looking like leaving soon wasnt an option for the seats near the window. So i found myself a seat at the bar. Still a nice view and right in the center for good people watching.

The decor was like any city lounge. Low/ dim lighting, back ground top hits, comfortable seats and decent drinks. Since this place was on the top floor of a lavish Marriott the prices were alittle high, but besides that the service was good and the bartenders were always around.

I ordered the mac and cheese and the angus burger. The burger was juicy and well cooked, but i could have done without the mac and cheese. The bitter cheese crumbs on top of the dish would have been alot better left in the kitchen.

Overall this place is pretty cool. You dont need to even leave the hotel to have a good time and you have a great view. Guys i recommend taking that special someone here, she might get the wrong idea when you get into the elevator to go up, but who knows maybe she'll have the right idea on the way down :o)
author: Nicholas C.

description: The view is just that, a view. It took at least 15 minutes to be waited on. All I want is my Lemon Drop and Long Island. Overpriced drinks and less-than-happy staff. $26.00 for two mediocre drinks. I don't care about paying for a drink, but please make it decent at least.
author: Marina T.

description: a lil pricey but well worth it. i ordered the golden gate if was really good and Beef Carpaccio it was okay.. a lil bland. The 36 of the view it was breath taking,great service nice place to bring a date, I'll definitely will be coming back!
author: Lucy S.

description:
Oh, The View! 

Seriously, the view of the city from the lounge is absolutely beautiful! I could literally sit up there for hours. It's a great place to order some drinks and have a conversation as you watch the sun set. Although it was a bit crowded on a Friday evening, my friends and I were able to snag a couple of seats near the giant windows that overlook Civic Center. If you go around dinner time there are children and families, but as it gets later an older, calmer crowd comes in, creating a perfect, relaxed atmosphere for some good ol' conversation. The waiter was very accommodating and gave us plenty of time to go through the menu. 

If you have a sweet tooth like me, I would recommend the creme brulee - absolutely delicious! I knocked off one star because I ordered a white russian that was way too strong and pretty much undrinkable (it was like one huge shot of vodka mixed with milk). Granted, I'm also a lightweight when it comes to alcohol.

Great views, great ambience. I'll be back!
author: Jenny A.

description:
I had to give the place an extra star just for the amazing view.  Came here right before sunset and saw downtown from up top at night...beautiful! 

I ordered one of their special cocktails...a little too sweet/girly for me.  When I asked for something stronger, the server suggested the Old Fashioned.  It was stronger than the previous cocktail but it was still much sweeter than other Old Fashioneds I've tried.  We also ordered the Trio app, flatbread served with hummus, babaghanoush, and a tomato olive relish sauce.  My personal favorite was the babaghanoush.

Good place to bring work people you have to impress during the day or a date you want to impress during the night ;)
author: Jane N.

description: Can't beat a bar with a world class view!  Even if the prices of the drinks are about double the normal... it's just something that you have to do.  Sunset colors always enhance the already great view.
author: Jeffrey P.

description: As the name suggests, there is a spectacular view of the city. If you're lucky enough to snag a table by the window you'll get to enjoy a magnificent bird's eye perspective of the San Franciscan metropolis. It's generally pretty quiet, so if you're looking to have a private conversation you won't be drowned out by the loud drunken banter of your fellow bar patrons. Drinks are decent but pricey - you're mostly paying for the view.
author: Emily D.

description:
Was here last night, possibly one of the nicest lounges I have been in.

It it called "The View" for a reason, when I got there all the good seats near the window were taken, go figure. Right when my date saw a couple walk away from a table he took that table really fast, funny was because the waitress who helped me told me "Yeah, that's how you do it here."

We went late at night, and by then the sky is already dark but the buildings still looked beautiful, looking through the windows just gives you a 39th story floor view of the city. The place is definitely a place you would take a date, very intimate. The place is lighted by candle, the only lights were at the bar and at the elevator.

I ordered the Pom - View (Pomegranate Martini) & the Vanilla Creme Brulee. The creme brulee was amazing! It was sweet and creamy. The martini in my opinion was too strong, I didn`t really taste the pomegranate because it was just bitter, I felt tipsy too... unless I`m just a light-weight...

Overall I really like this place! I really would love to come again, next time I wanna try the food :)
author: Johanah I.

description:
The place to go if you want to impress visitors from out of town. For every time I went, I was able to find a decent spot by a window, which is nice since the major attaction is of course the view. Esp. on sundown!

Drinks and service are decent but pricey. Reachable by the elevator of the Marriot hotel
author: Stephen V.

description:
Like the name suggests, The View as an awesome view!

Now... the servers feel old school. There not overly friendly, yet not overly rude. Mediocre I guess I'd say. 

Here is something that I DONT get, why don't places like this have blue cheese stuffed olives? It seems classy enough to carry that. NOTE: TO STAFF OR MANAGEMENT, US DIRTY MARTINI CUSTOMERS LOVE OUR BLUE CHEESE STUFFED OLIVES. PLEASE CARRY THEM I WILL SPEND MORE MONEY THERE.
author: Jess O.

description:
The view is awesome!  
We had drinks and shared a piece of chocolate cake that was super yummy.  
Service was fast and friendly
author: Jenn B.

description:
One of the best nights I've had in SF thanks to The View. 

AMAZING Views of the city (in my opinion, better than Top of the Mark)
Dimly lit setting.
Cute nooks with tables snugged in between. 

I will definitely be coming back here!
author: Anjali M.

description:
What a clever name for a place with an amazing view!  How did they come up with it?  I wonder.

I've been here a few times over the years and the view definitely does not disappoint.  Those huge 2 (3?) story windows are just stunning.  You feel almost as if you're flying.  The full moon rising over the skyscrapers just added to the beauty last night.  

My auntie got there early (I think she was there exactly at 4 when they opened) & snagged the perfect table for 3 looking east towards the Bay Bridge & Oakland hills.  Apparently she received excellent service from 4-5pm.  When I got there just after 5, I ordered my drink & waited.  Chatted, waited, chatted, gazed at the view, chatted...wait a second, where's my drink??  I lost track of time but I must have waited 20 minutes for my dirty martini.  My auntie had to go up & inquire about its whereabouts.  Raina S had finished her caipirinha & auntie's cosmo was running low.  I did finally receive my martini which was excellent I must say.  Large, strong, & a deal for $7 (HH price).  We stuck to one drink & headed to another HH where we could stretch our $$ a bit. 

The drinks were great, the service was slow, view is incredible, HH menu is weak.  3 martinis are half price & that's it.

3 stars cuz I probably won't be back unless it's for my 1 fancy drink of the night.
author: Erin S.

description:
Fantastic place to sit with a glass of wine (or several) and ponder about your life while looking out to the most beautiful city in the world..
Come during the weeknights when the vibe is intimate and cozy...
Definitely doesn't get overcrowded and overhyped like Top of the Mark..
author: Mimi T.

description: The view is absolutely stunning although the place needs some interior design remodeling.
author: Maria C.

description: Fantastic view of San Fran! I highly recommend going there for happy hour! I think the restrooms could cleaner, but overall a great place to have a drink and appetizer!!
author: Sylvia C.

description:
The View is priceless!

Went here to celebrate some cocktails for a birthday celebration with a few people. Since it's pretty popular your going to have to scout for seating when you arrive which can suck depending on the time you come. It took us about 15 min of walking around to find seating (even the bar is filled)! 

Although it closes at 1AM beware the kitchen closes at 11PM

DRINKS:
Orogeny Pinot Noir l Russian River  5/5 (my fave)
Moscone Mule 4/5
Van Ness Press 3/5 (nothing special)
Soma Spritzer 4.5/5 (crowd favorite)
Chocolate Birthday Shots 5/5 (not on the menu, but the bartender makes it so good)

FOOD:
Mezze 4/5 the hummus is tasty, definitely fresh but not as thick as usual hummus
Cheese Display 4/5 comes with sheep, cow, and goat cheese w/ some dried fruit

I'll be back to see the sunset and avoid the afternoon work crowd. The service is not as great and seems like it's a little understaffed but you're really coming for the view!
author: Caroline N.

description:
The view is usually packed so its good to get there early.. Its one of the two hotels in san fran to have a view of the whole city and the view is spectacular, but if you arent sitting by the window its blah
Without the view its just dark with terrible music and drinks so unless you show up early to get a seat, don't bother.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I was in San Francisco for work.  On the night I arrived, my friend and I (traveling together) decided to stop here for dinner and drinks.  We were staying at the Hilton Union Square, and The View was a very quick cab ride from our hotel (of course... everything is "close" in SF, so maybe that's useless info).  We arrived on a Wednesday night, but it was rather late (and we were famished).  The ambiance was fantastic; dark, not too quiet (a nice hum of conversation, but nothing on the disruptive side).  Of course, the view out the window was incredible.  May have been the alcohol highlighting the bit of vertigo, but it almost felt like we were OVER the city.  An absolutely unobstructed view, where you can see the MOMA, and other SF area landmarks.  

The menu was pretty extensive as far as appetizers go, and my friend and I ordered the Tuna Tartare.  It was perfect... and I will definitely go back for drinks and appetizers...

...but not for dinner...

Don't misunderstand-- dinner was excellent, but the menu (entrees), was limited to only a few items... like FIVE.  I had the filet, which was outstanding, and cooked exactly how I ordered it (it's the little things).  After two martinis and my entree, my total bill was upwards of $80.  

I guess its my fault for going to a lounge for DINNER.
author: Ava M.

description:
Nice view but claustraphobic. The drinks are pricey as well. $12 - $14 drinks. 

You must have to be there early to get prime seating that overlooks the view. Maybe i'm a grumpy old man. It was stuffy and I wished I wore less. You can just go there to lounge and chill around w/ a group of friends. It's defintely an intimate affair. 

I'd go again if I wanted to brag about SF :) You get that twins peak feeling w/o your hair all up in a mess.
author: Jenna L.

description:
I went to The View on Thursday, July 5th. What was nice that the hotel: the San Francisco Marriott Marquis, was only a few blocks from my hotel, the Westin on Third and Market Street. 
It was early in the evening, so it really wasn't crowded, so I was able to get a seat near the window and see a nice view of the city. 
Dinner was ok: I had the BBQ pulled chicken sliders with coleslaw. Didn't taste a whole lot of BBQ flavor, but the meal was satisfactory. 
I do recommend this place for a date or someone from out of town who wanted to see a beautiful view of San Francisco. For me personally, I would come back to see the view, but would get dinner elsewhere.
author: Andrea T.

description: The name says it all- come for the view! The service was slow and the crowd was so-so, but thats what I expected being a hotel bar. Cocktails were tasty though and if you get there early enough (by 6) you may be able to get a window seat. Be aware that many people will be leaning over you to take pictures though.
author: BriLo L.

description: Great view. Great food. We went around 1045pm just in time for appetizer and drinks. The burger sliders were phenomenal. Also ordered the short ribs that were also good. The drinks were good enough lol. The menus lite up which were really cool. Would definitely go back.
author: Michelle B.

description:
view says it all. Don't go if you're remotely afraid of heights. It's very hard to acclimate (without alcohol). 

The staff was friendly, attentive, and helped recommend yummy cocktails. The view was amazing from all angles. Love!
author: Chayne J.

description: Service is pretty rough. I was ignored by about 6 different servers and the bar tender. Finally had to stop someone and ask them to come to our table. CRAZY overpriced drinks. We had 5 drinks total (bottom shelf cocktails) and the total was $73. The view is great, night or day. I guess worth it, but don't offer to buy a round for anyone.
author: T J.

description:
This is such a great place to take you away from the hustle and bustle of San Francisco. 

I came here for happy hour, and it was just perfect timing since it wasn't too crowded and the sun was just about to set. 

The Kobe Beef sliders were amaaaaazing, and their mojitos were just right. And to top it off, their chocolate cake was definitely worth the one-hour cycling class the next day!

The view just gets even better when the sun sets. The Bay Bridge is lit up and all you see are twinkling lights. Ahhh so romantic =)
author: Mary S.

description:
Still standard drinks.

Service in the evenings on the weekend is subpar, especially when it gets very busy.

As a tip, the food on the menu is brought up from the downstairs restaurant, so if you're really, really hungry and don't want drinks THAT badly, go there first.

The bacon burger is really freakin' good if you're hungry.
author: Paulina D.

description:
This is my favorite place in the City to go on a date night with my boyfriend. :) No matter where we're going beforehand, or afterwards, I always hope we end up here at some point!

Other places SAY they have views, and they do, but this place... It has THE view. My jaw almost dropped the first time my boyfriend brought me here and I looked out of the huge, elegant, floor-to-ceiling window and saw the twinkling lights of the Bay Bridge practically right underneath us. 

The drinks are always cute and classy (a little on the pricey side, sure, but whatever). The crowd is always pleasant enough. Overall, it's just a super enchanting, wonderful little bar at the top of a very tall, enchanting, wonderful hotel. I love it! Makes me smile just thiking about it. :)
author: Shari B.

description: I came here to catch up with a friend and of course, look at the view. This place is on the 39th floor of the Marriott hotel and the view is beautiful. We came here around sundown so the sunset was gorgeous along the bridge and skyline. Drinks here are expensive! I was surprised, but then again, you're paying for the view. I had the Fog City Collins, a refreshing combination of cucumber, st. germaine, 209 gin and citrus juice but still $14? I'd come here again though because the view is really beautiful and it's a nice place to take someone you enjoy spending time with. We were super lucky to get a table and witnessed several people standing around waiting. No reservations.
author: Nicole A.

description:
One of my favorite places to take out-of-town guests. On a clear evening, the views are truly impressive. The dim lighting and small candle lit tables give a cozy-but-elegant feel. 

Don't look too, too closely though, or the carpet and the number of of tourists and people wearing conference badges will remind you that you are, indeed, in a Marriott. The last time I visited was the weekend of the Santa convention, and there were a number of patrons with that beard "white as snow" and "bowl full of jelly" belly, which was sort of fun.

On the practical side, its a convenient meeting place for people who don't know their way around well yet, easy to get to from BART, and in a building that's impossible to miss. The drinks and food are standard and good quality, and suit all tastes. No one comes here and can't find anything they want.

Its an ideal first stop for an evening out in the city, a perfect place to catch your breath and gather the troops.
author: Lindsay M.

description: AMAZING VIEWS!! You can see San Fran from a 39th floor. However, I would recommend to come a little before sun set to make sure you get a great seat
author: Harriett H.

description: Amazing view! Although it's kinda hard to get a seat but we got lucky. I went with a party of 4. Drinks are pricey like expected because they know they can ask for the price for the view that they have. I did like my drink although I can't remember what it was called. I had a good time with good friends. Good place for visitors.
author: Kay D.

description: The view is amazing. The drinks are expensive. Very swanky atmosphere. Service was good. Have I mentioned the view? Pretty amazing.
author: Ashley B.

description: Went there Saturday 2/15 . Walked in at exactly 4:05. We were able to get one of the best tables with views of the Golden Gate Bridge and golden gate park. We got the beef short ribs and the cheese platter. I did enjoy the views the most, and the food was nothing special, although my date did like the cheese. Great time; would Definitely come back next time I am in the city.
author: Arian S.

description:
So..this isn't the place to "party it up" but my friends and I were staying at the hotel and wanted a drink and take some photos of the view...and we happened to be in wigs and all in white as the theme for our friend's bachelorette party...can we say awkward stares?

LOL...it's ok all for the bride right?  But really this place was very intimate and beautiful when you can see the view.  It's pretty nice and lots of people were there on dates, etc.  Definitely will come again on a day I'm not in a wig or with 10 other girls..LOL
author: Kim D.

description: Very classy bar on the 39th floor of the Marriott on Mission st. Despite the upscale appearance, prices aren't really that outrageous. A bottle of local beer cost me $8 and my friends' specialty cocktails were $15. Absurd prices of course but relative to the fact that we're in a nice hotel in SF's financial district I expected much worse. I'll need to keep this place in mind next time I'm on a date.
author: Byron C.

description:
I happened to stay at this Marriott over the weekend, I have stayed there before but never went to the top level. I love the views and if there are clouds in the sky the sunset is really cool! 
Yes this is a hotel bar and drinks are going to be on the high side.   It is such a great way to see the city. It isnt crowded or loud. it is an awesome place for a drink with a view. The food menu is pretty slim and pricey too, so I would eat elsewhere.
The lounge opens at 4 p.m. daily.
author: Grace L.

description: This review is simply for the fact that we couldn't get a table!!! I was so excited to come here and I was so upset that we left after about 45 minutes of waiting for something to open up. One star for breaking my heart lol They should definitely do reserved seating like a regular restaurant. I wouldn't mind waiting an hour or more if I was guaranteed a table EVENTUALLY.
author: Blanca V. S.

description:
The perfect place to take newbies in town! Gorgeous view of downtown SF AND the Bay Bridge. The drinks are decent, but it's the view that is a winner. In a skyscrapers starved city (yes, yes, I know, EARTHQUAKE) The View is the perfect place for eyeballing the few tall, gorgeous buildings that do dominate the skyline. Come here for some glamour, and a whole lot of view. 

Also, Bart-able. Total win!
author: Ishita G.

description: Can't go wrong bringing a date here for drinks..  The drinks we had a Paloma and Old Fashion were done right. A little pricey for the drinks, but you pay for the awesome views.  The crowd was a bunch of Texan fans the night I was there.  Very noisy group drinking bucket of beer.  Brought the place down to a sports bar with a view.
author: James W.

description:
Atmosphere is great !!! I suggest getting there early due to sitting area which are first come first!!! We stopped by on sat night during our vacation 
We set by the bar which was decent with the best view of the city but our food came out slow . Thats the reason why im giving 4 stars ! But other then that its a fantastic place with the best city view !!! Must go if you are first timer in town !! :)
author: Dong K.

description: Touristy or not, I love getting drinks here. We got there early around 7pm, so there was no wait for a table. The drinks are strong and the view is amazing. Excellent service too. We got a great table facing the big window. I love the atmosphere, it's mellow and classy.
author: Jane R.

description:
This place would be great for an intimate date, or small gathering of close friends.

Beautiful views and very cozy.

Perfect for sipping drinks.

Very small menu. (Not much food here.) What I ordered, I loved. (Gourmet cheeseburger and fries.) 

I went with 2 friends who were staying at the Marriot and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The waitress was very great as well. :)
author: Ashley P.

description: Loved the ambience! Went on a Sunday night and the crowd was decent.. Got a table near the big arch window overlooking the bay bridge. Food was agreeably good, less portions but was good enough. Drinks were great! Whiskey on the rocks was super smooth and the cocktails were great!
author: Balaji R.

description: Have been twice and both times I enjoyed myself. However, finding a table can be tricky and pictures are a bit misleading because the view is not a large 360 bar, like Top of the Mark.  You get views from specific windows and there are sorta 3 separate rooms. Everyone I've taken there has liked it, but they have been tourists. For locals, this isn't the best bar in town.
author: Amy L.

description: As the name suggests, this bar lounge has a great view of the city and bay bridge. The drinks are tasty but on the pricier side - but I think that's expected since what you're really paying for is the ambience and the view, which is pretty awesome.
author: Syddie P.

description: Great view for sunset and a 15 dollar cocktail. It's self seating upstairs which is cool bc if you go early you can snag a seat right at the window.
author: Evan D.

description:
Whoa... this place sure has a pretty badass view of the city.. no one can dispute this lounge's name .. no, not even chuck norris, rajnikanth, jon skeet or that most-interesting-man-in-the-world guy!!!
They also didn't seem to have any reservations system, which is awesome if you are looking for a nice classy quiet-ish place to hang out and chat with friends without having planned the thing in advance!
Drinks are kinda expensive (or maybe we ordered wayy too many of them.. i don't remember :S)
author: Aditya M.

description: This place is awesome because of its location and view. It is on the top of a tall hotel, and you get an amazing view, and of course pay a premium. I went there with some underage friends one time and the staff was nice enough to give us a few moments to enjoy the view before leaving.
author: Spencer G.

description: Nice view of SF business district.   The drinks and food was good.  Good place to drop by for evening drink and pupus with your date.  It gets pretty crowded and you need some luck to  find a good window view table.   The view wasn't that great, though.  Service was ok.  We didn't feel  rushed to clear the table but had to wait a bit to get our check.
author: Xiao L.

description: Cocktails are average. Service is excellent. Cheese plate is great. View is AMAZING. You will not be disappointed!
author: Food L.

description: After some research, we decided to come to the View for some after dinner drinks.  Right away, we loved the huge open design of the windows that let you savor the night skyline from the 39th floor of the Marriott Marquis.  The View is very low key and is a great spot to relax with a drink and gaze out the window.  I highly recommend it.
author: Scott P.

description:
Awesome Views!

Sure the drinks may be a tad priceier than you expect,.
Suck it up Cheapsate!
Imagine you had to pay for the elevator ride to get up here.
Then you'd be like, Oh, okay!

Staff was friendly and on it.
author: MaJ C.

description: This is an awesome place to get a late night quiet drink. The views are amazing! It tends to get crowded and takes some time to find a place to sit but worth it. Drinks are reasonably priced and decent.
author: K R.

description: I loved everything about it.  I took my out of town friend and she loved it too.  The drinks are delicious I had the Collins my friend had the Moscow mule.  Can't talk much about the food except for the olives and cheese platter. I don't know what they put in those olives, but the are addicting.  The server was amazing and so was the view.  I will definitely be going back!
author: Teresa B.

description: Excellent spot if you can get a seat by the window. They call it the view for a reason, on a clear night, the sights are breathtaking for such a beautiful city. The drinks are a little on the pricey side but you're paying for the ambiance
author: Ross I.

description:
took my gf here on our very first date. did a lot of making out in this seat in the corner that had good view. the drinks are a little more exp than other bars but its the view and the time u get to spend enjoying the view with yer sig other that makes it worth comming here. 

if you wanna impress a girl and shes never been here youre def gonna get some action if you play your cards right
author: Mark T.

description:
The saving grace of this hotel bar/lounge is its namesake.  If you want a great view of downtown, definitely check out The View.  The huge, floor-to-very-high-ceiling windows afford you a whole lot of SF skyline.  

The service is extremely slow, although friendly enough.  I was with a group of six, and it took nearly half an hour to get our drinks (only two drinks were mixed drinks; everything else was beer or champagne).  Our single shared appetizer took another 20 or so minutes.  It was really quite strange, because the bar was perhaps 1/3 full, and there were literally more than a dozen Marriott employees milling around, seemingly doing nothing.  

If you want a great view, check this place out.  If you want a great view and decent service, check out the Top of the Mark or Harry Denton's Starlight Room.
author: Sarah S.

description: What a beautiful treat. Not only was the High Rise Cosmo amazing and strong. the view here is simply breath taking. I loved everything about this place and will have to come back for dinner soon.
author: Jess C.

description: A great view if you're feeling fancy! Grab a drink and take in the beautiful colors of sunset or the glittering lights at dark. Really special place but be prepared for premium prices. Definitely worth it for a drink or two.
author: Kelly M.

description: No seats, staff not helpful in finding seats, and the atmosphere was icky.  Couples on couches making out, teens obviously under 21 with their parents having snacks, it was just a weird vibe.  The music was super loud, preventing conversation.  Just not impressed, so we left.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I always take people here when visiting SF!  The view is astounding, day or night.  However, it's usually pretty crowded up there and drinks are pricey.  They do have a delicious creme brulee though (and dessert menu in general)!  They also have a nice selection of mixed drinks.  Try to hit it up earlier in the day after some shopping to avoid crowds.  On a Friday or Saturday night tables with decent views are hard to come by.  But, this place tops the list for after dinner drinks and dessert!
author: Sheryce S.

description: 3 stars because of the breathtaking view, personally wouldn't come here to have dinner or grab a bite to eat. Food is very pricey and not tasty.
author: Glenda G.

description: I came here with my friend for a drink before dinner on a Sunday night, not knowing how packed it would be. We were barely able to find a seat! The view is visible around the entire floor so you'll be able to see something beautiful anywhere. We ordered a few glasses of wine (which were okay) and a cheese plate. It took about 25 minutes for the plate to come, but I understand they were busy. Overall, it's a decent place to grab a few drinks, and if you can grab a table by the window (especially on the right side of the room), take it quickly to see the best city in the world from up high :).
author: Sheeva G.

description: Was great. But upon returning the old Bartender "Buzzard" now works elsewhere. The place sucks aside from the view. Will be going somewhere else when back in town for business. Too bad they can't keep good help. Anyone know where he went?
author: D. H.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place sooner. I thought I did? Turns out I didn't. Damn. I'm overwhelmed with shame for not having done so.

In short: this place has the most awesome view. The drinks are good and not too expensive. Even though the hotel is kind of classy you can walk in here sporting a touristy look hauling shopping bags.
author: Yoni D.

description: Really love to take people that have come to San Francisco for the first time to this view deck in the sky. It's located on the 39th floor of the Marriot at 4th & Mission streets.  They serve great drinks with a have a limited food menu (tapa style). Perfect place to watch the sun go down or just enjoy a moment of breathlessness in the San Francisco sky.
author: Kevin R.

description: The best view on the Bay Area, amazing! I had a drink here and it was really good. Try to go early so you can find a spot close to the big windows.
author: Patricia D.

description: This is, hands down, the best view in the city. I guess they didn't name the lounge The View for nothing. The drinks here a pricy, but you get what you paid for. It's intimate and one can actually have a conversation here. A date night must!!
author: Alice W.

description: It's the Marriott. They cater to tourists and visitors.  Why someone would come here expecting cheap drinks is beyond me.  Especially with the exquisite views.  Good service, decent selection.  Crowd is, not exactly diverse. ;) Find a favorite drink, open a tab, enjoy the view, and let the night take you away!
