Fellas, If your date comes back from the restroom saying a lady kissed her and told her she looked hot, don't be surprised. Oh, and avoid the draft from outside on the backside of the bar. ;)
author: Ethan R.

description: Came here with co-workers for a happy hour and it's name stands up to what it has.  A great view.  Service was OK and of course the drinks are over-priced.  But we had a great time anyway and it's worth it every now and again just for the view.  Get there early though because it does get packed.
author: Amanda K.

description: Great place. The view is amazing!  I came here on a Wednesday afternoon after work around 430pm. The employees were so friendly. They offered to help us find a window seat and later encouraged us to go walk around the lounge and take pictures of the sunset.  Darcie was my server and she was amazing! I ordered a Lemon Drop which was $13 and worth the price.  I recommend this place to everyone and will definitely be back soon.
author: Bria T.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the view from the top of the bar, it overlooks all of San Francisco. I'd check this bar out whether your a tourist or a local looking for a chill environment, a great view and reasonably priced drinks.
author: Anisha A.

description: What can i say, the name says it all. The view to a sunset from the 39th floor is amazing. It was over crowded, but expected. Although there was a convention that night, might have something to do with it. This place is amazing, servers hospitality was nice and attentive. Got a great vibe from it, would do again. Very impressed. I'm only giving it a 4 because i did not get a chance to taste the food. When i do, i ill change the rating.
author: Lex L.

description:
The View isn't cheap or fast or particularly trendy, but it does boast an incomparable 360-degree view of San Francisco and the Bay. It's worth having a drink up here just to enjoy the view. 

Sticker shock isn't uncommon, but this IS a downtown urban bar, and the prices aren't out of line. A pleasant surprise is that for your money, you get generous and top-notch cocktails or glasses of wine. The budget conscious should take advantage of the half-price Sobieski martinis during happy hour, 4-6pm... $7 instead of $14 and a good-sized drink.

The Marriott has started sourcing their chicken, beef, cheese, and even pasta from local producers, and much of the food at The View falls into this locavore category. They're proud of supporting local farms, and it's one of many ways the company shows its green efforts.
author: MH A.

description:
Come for the view, stay for the... super overpriced drinks, cheesy decor, and bad service? Every now and then, sure!

Though it's a total tourist trap, The View is a still must-visit for locals. Tons of window-side tables 39 stories in the air make it perfect for a romantic date night, a boozy business meeting, or post-shopping martinis with Mom. Being able to watch the fog roll in, the sun set, or the city lights sparkle at this angle is definitely worth doing at least once. Alas, this bar could be so much better.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Great for cocktails for amazing views of the city! Try the cheese app...
author: Wally C.

description:
Awesome place for an after work drink.

Jessica is the best, find her section.

Only problem is that your likely to be drinking with whatever convention is in town, which can be highly annoying.  Actually, it usually is highly annoying.   One can only deal with so many textile vendors or gynecologists at one time.
author: Todd F.

description:
The view is definitely gorgeous with its bright lights and architecture. 

My boyfriend and I ventured here last night. I tried to call in advance, but was told seating is first come, no reservations taken. 

The venue itself is not too small, a fairly decent intimate size. The ambiance consisted of dim lighting and constant chatter. There is various seating styles, from low seating directly next to the larger than life windows, bar style high seating slightly removed from the windows (perfect for those that go with people afraid of heights...as was my experience), and sofa like seating that was removed from the window view but allowed for a more comfortable, relaxed seating. 

We arrived around 9:30ish and the place was already semi packed. People are willing to push to get "their" seats, which was our case but definitely not necessary. When you arrive from the elevators, go to your right (for the main entrance) and the views are definitely better; however, seating was scarce and didn't allow "the view" experience. So we walked around to the other side and found bar table seating. It is extremely intimate and allows for conversation with privacy. 

There is really only one waiter for the entire venue, so if he approaches have what you want ready to order. The bar table allows for minimum items, so if you're planning to eat and drink with a group you may want to consider seating with bigger table space. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the ginger pear and blood orange drinks, the ginger pear was the best of the two...both good flavor and I did not feel like it was watered down. Small plates were ordered, we tried the prawn & BBQ pork fried rice (tasty, but hard to share), salt & peppered prawns (a definite must to try...my favorite), and calamari (which had great flavor). 
Each item is priced at $15, but is enough to be shared with another person and I left full by the end of the evening. 

This is definitely a place I would select to unwind and just hang out. Dress attire is not specific and the ages of guests ranged from legal to grandparent so the environment is definitely appropriate for all. The service was fairly fast once you ordered, the food hot and maintained a high quality, and our waiter was chill and accommodating.
author: Angela M.

description:
4-stars for the view alone! If you can snag a table by the window, you won't regret it! I love how some of their rooms have HUGE mirrors. 

My group of about 10 came by to hang-out and the waitresses were very friendly, even though not all of us ordered a drink. Their tequila gimlet was spot on, and their Blood Orange drink was good too. Too bad their kitchen closes at around 11 or 12.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The view here is amazing, especially with the sunset, our severs were very friendly and nice.
author: Sandra F.

description:
Date: Valentine's Day at past 8PM 

Occasion: After dinner drinks with Boyfriend

Ambiance:  Bar on the 39th Floor of the Marriott 4th Street. Spectacular bird's eye VIEW of the San Francisco skyline at night. Glittering City lights.

Decor:  Contemporary and classy. Tables for 2 and groups;  comfy lounge chairs by the floor to ceiling glass windows overlooking the whole of San Francisco at night.

Music: Jazz, house and R&B

Service:  Our server was very attentive although the place was packed.  She did not forget my order of trail mix which came generously in a big glass.  We were removed from the main place (by the bar) but she came to check on us like clockwork.

Our drinks:  1 Bailey Coffee for me
                       2 Pima View for BF

At one point, I was happily inebriated and mesmerized by the City lights and City sights.  We were lucky to have grabbed a table for two by the window.  The night was very clear considering it was raining all day.  I could clearly see the ice skaters at Yerba Buena and the cars on the Bay Bridge.  BF and I stayed at the View for over an hour just chillin'.  And the View was one of the best places in SF to do just that.

Total:  $40.00 for 3 drinks not including tip.
author: Leah E.

description: The service is great and so is the view ... it is pricey however, but I guess that should be expected.  If you're ever in the area I suggest to stop by this place.  The view itself will make it all worth it -- morning or evening.
author: Pia V.

description:
I would have previously given this place 4.5 stars because the ambiance is great. Very dimly lit, jazz playing, and a spectacular view framed by the magnificent architecture of the crazy windows which makes you feel like you're really somewhere special, maybe a really fancy supervillain's hq. I've taken many people here and have spoken up for it's merits when others complained about the prices, that sometimes it's hard to find a seat, or the service being sub-par. 

This time, however (I'm here as I write this), I was totally turned off and even insulted as I was asked for a room number before even making my order, to which I responded that I'd be paying in the bar, and then I was hassled before my food even arrived, being told that I needed to provide a credit card or room number. When I questioned this, having been to many fancy and expensive hotel and other bars/restaurants for the occasional splurge over the years without ever being asked to provide a payment method in advance--really, never--I was told "yeah, we get written up if we don't. I'm skeptical of this "policy" excuse, since it's so odd and also because she awkwardly dropped it when I told her I was paying with cash. Before you make this guess: I'm not exactly dressed like a street kid trying to rob a meal--not that it should matter much--but I'm dressed fairly nicely in a brand new sweater, decent pants, very nice boots, and a peacoat..
author: Kelzorg B.

description:
Phenomenal spot to bring guests who haven't ventured around San Francisco much, it's in the name. You get an amazing 270 degree view of San Fransisco, as well as the start of South Bay.

If you don't mind higher priced drinks then this is your place. The ideal scene would be to have a few pre-dinner drinks at The View and then hit a nearby restaurant (to be fair, I've never eaten here, they might have amazing food).

This is a solid go-to for bringing friends visiting to start off the night.
author: Jason M.

description:
Brought here by an adventure prone friend. The view really is great, give or take some glare. Food and drink is pretty standard for hotel lounge. Had a good but not great or big salami plate.

The view was incredible though. Make sure to walk around the whole place, lots of different angles.
author: Michael F.

description: You come here for the view, period. And this place gets 5 stars for that. An awesome view of the bay! We just ordered one drink each because they are pricey here. Good luck trying to find a table!
author: Vol T.

description: The view is amazing, go to the bar side.   The service was fantastic.   If you can find a seat in Steve's area, win win.   He took great care of us.
author: Tony M.

description: This is my favorite to come to alone. It has such a nice vibe and AMAZING VIEW. It is t called the view for nothing. Appetizers are ok.... But I come for the drinks and to relax! Service can get a little backed up but only because lots of people and tourist come a visit this place. Servers and bartenders are attentive. I highly recommend this place!!!
author: Michelle S.

description:
The view is awesome, prices are typical of a hotel bar/San Francisco posh bar ($12 for a basic gin & soda water drink), not much space so grab where you can! Then again....it is a hotel bar so it's usually not crowded but we decided to descend upon The View on Halloween. 

30 people in my group and we easily took over 1/2 the space. Add in all the other guests & party-goers & it got crowded fast! But it was fun. Good DJ, the bartenders (2) did an OK job of keeping up w/ the demand for drinks. I never waited too long for the bathroom which was amazing! No cover (ever) which is a plus.
author: Marissa H.

description:
Once you go up to the top floor of the hotel, you can either chill at the area that doesn't get service or go to the other side where you can order small plates and drinks (the menu has more drinks than food). The views from both sides are amazing, but the lounge where people eat has a better view in my opinion (faces SFMOMA and Bay Bridge). 

My friend and I came in around 9pm and sat ourselves down at a table right next to the window. We ordered the Filet Mignon and Frito Misto (calamari, green beans, lemon, fennel, red onion, and chipotle aioli). I also ordered an alcoholic eggnog drink that our waiter recommended. It took a longg time for our food to come out. My drink came out first, and it was okay... I had the same drink a week ago at a friend's place, and his eggnog drink tasted better. My friend tried a little, and she thought it tasted like cough syrup haha. The Frito Misto finally came out, and because this place is SO DARK INSIDE, I couldn't tell what I was eating most of the time. Everything was lightly deep fried but in different shapes. It was so hard to see sometimes that I even accidentally ate a slice of lemon. The Filet Mignon came out as soon as we finished the Frito Misto. It comes with mac&cheese which was pretty good. I would have enjoyed it more if it was more cheesy. The plate also came with super long and thin broccoli which were pretty good too. The steak was okay, but it didn't have that much flavor so I got sick of it pretty fast. 

I would probably come back here for the view and drinks, but I'm not sure about the food. I would have given this place three stars because the food is overpriced and average, but because of the pretty view, I'll give this place 4 stars.

Quick tip: You can only make a reservation if you're coming with a party of 10+.
author: Annie S.

description:
I was here for an event so I can't say anything about their drinks, prices, or food.  

However the view was spectacular.  I do think the decor could do with an upgrade (from what I saw) but still a great place for a drink.  Sunset was beautiful. (and I'm sure evening night view is just as stunning)
author: Sujan H.

description: Great place to go for people watching... Excellent small apps... Outstanding beef short ribs ... Better than most.. Especially coming from a lounge/ bar!!.. Gotta go for that "VIEW "...
author: Jim L.

description:
This bar is one of my absolute favorites in the city. It's an unbelievably romantic setting and has a fantastic view. The wine selection is great. 

Prepare to have your breath taken away when you look out over the city. Come at night and sit back at a cozy table with a glass or bottle of wine, and enjoy the city view and your company.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Amazing view! 
Great place to meet people for a drink or two, and enjoy the view. 

Drinks are on the high side, but are well made and worth it. If you don't like $14 martinis, then go for happy hour for 1/2 price martinis. 

I asked the bartender for recommendations, and I got a dirty 509 gin martini- loved it!
author: Matthew B.

description: I visited The View with a friend of mine, based on another friend's recommendation.  I thought the views were absolutely spectacular (I was there at night), and what I really appreciated was that we could walk around and did not have to stay at the table we started at.  Each side of The View has a different part of the city to look at, and the large windows make it easy to see far across the entire Bay Area.  I would highly recommend as a date spot.
author: J L.

description: Beautiful views of the city even at night. Wine was pretty good but stuck with vodka tonics with lime. Can't mess that one up. Didn't try any food but this place is more about the views and ambiance.  So go ready to sit back, sip, & enjoy the amazing views.
author: Simone W.

description: If you want a great drink or a quick bite to eat with an amazing skyline view of SF go here. They have a great happy hour for a hotel in the city and very fair prices. Go during sunset and sit on the west side of the so you can reap the benefits of this location. I've got some really amazing pictures from up here. This is definitely a great bar to take your out of town guests to.
author: Michael B.

description: Beautiful view. Come on a clear weekday and you'll be happy. Foggy or weekend. No bueno.
author: Khalid N.

description:
This Marriot hotel lounge lives up to its name....

If I lived in the Bay, I'd def. be hanging here with my man and friends.   It can be romantical or not.  That's how versatile this place is.  The name says exactly what it's all about:  The 360 View of downtown San Francisco. 

I'm not one for heights because I feel like I"m going to pee my pants when I'm up too high, especially seeing that we are on the 39th floor.  But this place is worth it.  We came at night, so if the view is pretty with the lights, I'm sure it's even better in the daytime.  

This place was bigger than I expected.   It's a good size actually with enough tables and chairs by the window and away from it.  Decor is nice.   It wasn't fancy shmancy but it wasn't your hole in the wall bar either.  You could get away wearing a formal dress or jeans and a nice top.  Our waiter was attentive and didn't leave us hanging.  We all ordered drinks, don't remember the names.  But for a beer and two foo foo drinks I paid 15 bucks which I guess is about right for SF.

I recommend if you are in town and looking for a nice spot to end your night.
author: Bernadette M.

description:
The View Lounge is an absolutely wonderful place to go in San Francisco.  It's open after 4 pm every day (the elevator going up to the 39th floor does not work before then).  The best part of the place is definitely the view.  There are plenty of tables around the entire floor, each offering a different view of the city.  I recommend going soon after the lounge opens, because the tables next to the windows fill up quickly.  Bring your camera because you'll want to take pictures, especially around sunset.

The drinks are a bit expensive ($14 for a martini).  The key is to go there during their happy hour (4-6 pm), when four different martini's are $7.  I've enjoyed every martini I've tried there so far.

As for food, their antipasto platter is quite good if you want an appetizer to share.  It's $14 for 2 people, which is pricey, but you're basically paying for the view.  I normally just come here for the happy hour and eat dinner elsewhere.

As for the service, it's a bit hit or miss depending on how busy the bar is.  I've experienced both excellent and terrible service here.  I find  that if you are sitting by a window you get better service than if you're sitting at a table in the center.

Overall, I give this place 5 stars for the view, but minus 1 star for hit or miss service and the price.
author: Martina M.

description: Good view of the city. Friendly and quick staff. Sometimes hard to get attention at the bar but its workable. The seats are hard to get when late. Very nice place to go at night on a clear day. Sometimes you can see the stadium in the distance lit up when there is a game going on. Definitely rec swinging by for a cocktail for visitors.
author: Omar S.

description:
5 stars for the amazing view.
4 stars for the great service- it took the waiter a while to get to us but we weeeere kinda hidden in the corner. 
4 stars for the food- boyfriend's fillet mignon was a tiny bit overcooked.

But overall, such a great night!

Do yourself a favor and go here!
author: Irina Z.

description:
The view from this place is stunning.  

Yes, it's pricey.  But I've got to say that it's the best "view-y" place in the city; I have no issues paying those elevated prices.

This is a great spot on any given night.  It's not one of those old stuffy type places like Carnelian or Starlight.  And it also doesn't have that "touristy" type of feel.  

The ambiance is jazzy, romantic, and all-round cool.  To top it all off, the food is actually better than average.

I say, go for the view, stay for a drink (or two or three!).
author: Angella S.

description: What a great place to view the city of San Francisco!  This place is on the 39th floor of Marriott, and they have nice drinks and an amazing view!   don't expect to eat a full meal here though as they only offer appetizers.
author: Tiffany H.

description: overpriced drinks... but the view of the city... absolutely amazing. what a way to reel in those tourists.
author: Ann T.

description:
Checked this place out for Happy Hour, but I never received any type of deal on my drink so I'm wondering if there was a Happy Hour menu or something. In any case, my server never mentioned anything to me.

Ordered the steak quesadilla ($15) and ginger pear ($13). The quesadilla was great and came with sides of sour cream, guacamole and salsa. It was cut into 4 slices and had the perfect amount of cheese and steak. The ginger pear was okay...high price for a non-Happy Hour drink.

Service was slow but then again the place was crowded. Was busy chatting it up with friends on a sofa so didn't really get a chance to check out the view.
author: Janel Y.

description:
This place is on the top of the Marriott, and has an incredible view of the city. There's a huge window that gives you a crazy view of downtown SF. 

The food was okay, a little pricey though. And the drinks were nothing special. The benefit here is by far the view. I'd recommend it for drinks after dinner to save yourself some money. Plus there are far too many fantastic restaurants in SF to get so-so food. 

The service is not that great, it took a really long time to split and pay our bill. So make sure you don't have to get out very quickly.
author: Cassandra F.

description:
This is a great place for a date or to bring someone new to the city, or best of all, a date with a foreigner.

The moment you walk in you're surrounded by the beautiful city lights of San Francisco (make sure to come on a day when the fog isn't too thick) which lessens the surprise of opening the menu to find the drinks very overpriced. They're delicious, I'd recommend the mango mojito, but definitely don't go here for value. Go for the experience, splurge on one drink and enjoy a birds eye view of the city's elegance.
author: Nicole S.

description:
I actually really enjoyed my time at The View. The view itself is actually very cool, and my boyfriend and I were able to see the Bay Bridge and the Giants Stadium. Also, it's nice to look out and see all the twinkling lights from all the buildings around, and little cars going down the street.
The drinks/food were also great. I had a non-alcoholic "Sunrise Spritz" which was very good (orange juice, lime juice, grenadine, and sierra mist). The flavor was there, and it was actually a good sized drink, which I appreciated. We got the "View Trio" which is many slices of pita bread along with 3 dipping sauces (tomato relish, baba ganoush, and hummus). The first two were GREAT, with the hummus being a sad 2nd runner up. But, I appreciated the actual quality of flavor in the dips and how the pita bread was warm and soft.
Also, to mention, the staff at The View are extremely friendly and accommodating. They know some people just want to come and look, rather than order food, and they don't seem to mind. The food/drinks are good, so I'd recommend it, but even if you just want to check it out, go here as well.
author: Azinda M.

description:
I've been here several times this past June, July and August with the boyfriend while staying at the Marriott and then again just to finish off a fun evening in the fall when not staying there (but it sure is better being able to simply take a quick elevator to a room rather than having to sober up to go home).  I have yet to take visitors here, but certainly will because of the great views on a clear night.  

B-52's werean exxxcellent creamy dessert with layers of Amaretto, Bailey's Irish cream and Kahlua - then lit on fire, blown out and quickly sucked down with a straw while warm. Yum! 

The first mojitos we ordered came with something other than rum (yuck and they should have said something when we order them since they are typically made with rum). They did take them back and replace them with slightly better rum versions. Still, it may be best to stick to their basic limited list of cocktails rather than ask for anything off the list. It's really about the view here anyway. 

At the 1am closing time, they put all the lights on BRIGHT to encourage your departure ... it's effective but unfortunate.  I quick word to let guests know that it is closing time would be more respectful.
author: Heather M.

description: Really enjoyed this place. The only thing is it gets packed fast! We went on a Saturday night and being that it opens at 4:00 I wanted to get there as close to opening as possible as I knew it would be busy. We arrived a 4:07 to find every table already taken because they had closed off the second half of the lounge for a private event. After waiting around for a bit we finally were able to grab a table and enjoyed the rest of our evening looking out over the city. I took off one star due to the craziness of the kitchen/bar. The couple next to us waited between 1 1/2 - 2 Hours just to get some small burger sliders. Our food came out pretty much on time but we waited about 45 minutes for our drinks (20 of which our food was already out in front of us). However, the waitress and manager took good care of us and were extremely apologetic. Really enjoyed this place but would be hesitant to go back unless I was with an extremely small group (preferably only 1 other person) as it is insanely packed with little seating.
author: Haley A.

description:
incredible view of san fran! 

cool drinks!

what more can you ask for?
author: Esco J.

description:
If you're like me, you probably stay away from the tourist and business-traveler-hubbub of the SOMA/Yerba Buena hotels.  Who thinks of going into a hotel to have a drink when there are so many other great watering holes nearby?

But then, you'd miss out on the awesome views that The View Lounge has to offer.  It may not seem like a big deal to see the night lights from 39 stories up, especially to those of us who already either live or work in a high-rise, but trust me, it's pretty cool.

Drinks and food are expensive and mediocre, but this isn't really the type of place where you'd expect good food, because the view is really the selling point of this lounge.  Classy place, but be prepared to shell out some major bucks if you're planning on having a meal or snack here along with a few drinks.

Obviously not a CCG-approved place, but the views are worth a trip up the elevators, even if you don't plan on having anything.
author: Tori S.

description: This is a terific place to meet for pre-dinner social time. Specialty drinks galore...speakeasy style...and the service was terrific! (Thanks Jessica) Prices are expectedly high and parking is insane...we parked across the street and saved more than $30. Otherwise go o. Ip and check out the city from the 39th floor.
author: Alex R.

description:
I call this lounge the death star bar.  Seriously the scene at the end of Return of the Jedi when the epic light saber battle goes down with Jedi Skywalker and Emperor Palpatine sits in his lazy boy cackling.  
Tis comfortable, great views, and a good wine and appetizer list.  I love this place.
author: D B.

description: what an awesome view!
author: Sheryl M.

description: Went to The View in the Marriott hotel when some friends were visiting. Drinks aren't cheap, but they have an amazing view of the city. A great place to grab some drinks and chat. It's a great place to catch up and enjoy the view.
author: Richard P.

description:
Wow... the view was amazing. I really like the SF Marriott and all that it has the offer. The View Lounge was beautiful. The view from the 39th floor was breathtaking; although it wasn't much of a difference from our private view when we stayed on the 37th floor. We sat on the bay view side during our visit and munched on tapas and drank ourselves silly. Music was good, ambiance was great and the watching the setting sun cast a golden glow on the skyscrapers and watching the lights twinkle was beautiful. 

Drinks were definitely pricey considering in the liquid to ice ratio. Service was very spotty and could be significantly improved. Mojitos were fantastic; I didn't enjoy the margaritas as much. To me, as far as tequila is concerned, I'm the one holding the lime between my lips and having someone else lick the salt off of me. That's as close as I like to be to tequila....
author: Vicky L.

description: Really great view of the City, the Bay and surrounding area.... but only when the fog has lifted can you also see the Golden Gate Bridge.  Drinks are good, food is decent but a little pricey.  It's worth it to find a table by a window.
author: Evelyn B.

description: Still a gorgeous spot and a great place to take guests, but sadly they have done away with their Happy Hour. With drinks averaging at $14, I'm afraid I won't be frequenting  The View as much as I would like. But I will still include it in my list of go-to spots for out-of-town folks. It is just that special.
author: Katie S.

description:
This is the bar and lounge at the top of the San Francisco Marriott. In many ways, it's pretty typical of a hotel bar in any nice hotel in any major city, however, as its same suggests, its view is simply amazing. From its lofty perch, you can see all around the Bay Area and because the Marriott is just south of Market Street, you have a sweeping view of the downtown heart of the city. As Jay B. also noted, you'll meet professionals and business-types here, understandbly, and not too many locals. What is great about this bar, aside from the view, is it's not too loud and it can be romantic or business-like predicated on what attitude and what company you bring to it. I brought a friend of a friend whom I'd been fixed up with for dinner (more business than pleasure, networking or whatever) here and she loved it: she was visiting from Wales and it provided her with a rather unique introduction to the city. Kari S. was right about the Manhattans, by the way, and most any typical, standard, drink they'll do a yeoman's job on here.

If I ever had a television show about my crazy life as a student in SF, anyone who had a short meditation on the events of the episode would, at the end of the episode, wind up here having a drink. It's like that: it can sum up a lot about SF.
author: Mike W.

description: Awesome staff.  The place is a little loud..... Well, very loud; however, worth dealing with it.  "Steve " was great and made us feel welcomed.  Perfect poured drinks and interacted with the customers.
author: Richard N.

description: This is a definite must while visiting San Francisco. The view is great but hard to find a seat. Even if you're not planning to sit for a drink or two, it's easy access with a few spots to stand and check out the view.
author: TheWordisOut V.

description:
The View is a nice idea. It is NOT a nice idea on a Saturday night at happy hour. My mom, aunt, and I walked in circles around this place for 30-40 minutes before we found 2 people leaving. We huddled around a tiny 2-person table while scanning the room, waiting for someone else to leave. In my opinion, they should seat people since they serve food. Yes, it is a bar-type setting, but with this many people looking for a place to sit, something must be done. The whole time, I felt like I was being watched by people who were lurking... waiting... for my seat. 

The martini's are half price during happy hour. So, I can see why it's so packed. They were $7 and they were nice and strong. I even branched out and tried two of their fancy martinis and they were still strong. The bartender was very nice but we were not asked once if we would have liked to order food by a waitress.

The view is spectacular. When you look out any of the windows, you truly feel as though you are IN San Francisco. Our table had a view of union square and we were able to see people ice skating in the square, as well as some mood-killing occupiers. The view at night is breathtaking. If you can't get a table, at least take a look!
author: Hilary C.

description: You're literally paying for a great view with crappy service and really overpriced drinks. That said, the view is great and saves this place from the ignominy of a 1 star review. I'd bring friends from out of town here maybe but not somewhere I'd want to go on my own.
author: Misha T.

description: Everything you would expect from a hotel bar: a nice view, oversized chairs, lots of businessmen and women, and a bartender (and waitress) without a clue.
author: Laurence W.

description:
I went here for the first time this Sat for a friend's birthday and it was so beautiful. I was pleasantly surprised. 

The music was loud (not so much that you couldn't hear someone in your group talking but enough so that you don't hear other people's conversations). The atmosphere and the lights of the city as you look out the window are just so amazing. The glass half dome window is something that should be straight out of a movie. 

We sat down at this table that faced the huge window, and ordered a round of drinks and just chatted until we became hoarse. I like doing chill things and this was sheer perfection. The people working there never bothered us to get another round and we never felt rushed to leave even when the place started to get crowded.
author: Jessica C.

description: Amazing view!! Great to take someone even if there's no seating. This place gets packed early so get there sooner than later. Service seemed attentive but understaffed and not nearly enough people for the customers on a weekend. Definitely go on a date or just for a calming beautiful scene to enjoy for yourself with an after work drink.
author: Anne N.

description:
Such a nice place to have a drink in a quiet atmosphere with a gorgeous view. 
You'd better come here with a company, otherwise, it may get pretty lonely. With so many energetic clubs and bars in the area, this place won't entertain you as much. 
Try the W hotel's lounge instead. No city view, but a lot of good looking people :)
author: S ..

description: The two star are solely for the view. The table service staff needs better management or replacement. Two of us waited for 15 minutes for a couple to finish up at the first table walking into the main bar area on the right up against the window.  Well worth the wait for the view.  Then after having 2 different servers, the Asian girl and Asian guy, walk by us 4-5 times each and gently flagging them down, which did not get their attention, for 10-15 minutes, we finally went up to one of them to ask for some drinks.  Should have just gone straight to the bar.  The guy tells us "he can't serve us because the have assigned section" but will get our person.  I'm thinking "awesome, time for some cocktails". 10 minutes more of server walk by's, not a single glance over to us and we were done.  One of the best tables in the house that I'm sure we would have been at for an hour or two and can't get a single person to give us the time of day.   Waste of time.
author: Mike S.

description: One on my favorite spots in the city with a cool view. Whenever I have visitors, I always bring them over because of the view. Lots of tourist but you can't be surprised as this place is in the heart of SF. Good for a date night.
author: Natalia N.

description: Was looking for a bar to go to after work and found this one. Went here on a winter night so it was more of a foggy view. the burgers was great and the beer was freezing cold which was awesome. Not the best bar to go out and just drink or meet people though. I mean, it's a good bar to do it but it's more of like a group hang out place or a place to propose a marriage. The price is pricey but it's justified by the ambience and service.
author: John L.

description: What can I say about the View?  This lounge is located downtown right near the Powell St. BART stations and has THE BEST views I have seen from a bar in SF.  The lounge/bar occupies the entire floor so you can walk around to get nearly 360 degree views.  They have a full bar with a selection of wine and beer.  Prices are a little high but you aren't just paying for the drink - you're paying for the ambiance and THE VIEW.  Definitely a great place to take out of town visitors!
author: Liz H.

description:
If you're staying at the Marriott, you'd be a food not to at least gander up and check it out. 

The drinks are good but pricey. An expanded food menu would be great. 

Great view plus good drinks equals four stars on Yelp.
author: Mark M.

description:
This is one of those places to take your out of town guests.  

View = 5 Stars
Cocktails = 3 Stars - adequate but overpriced
Food = 2 Stars - overpriced and mediocre
Atmosphere = 4 Stars - elegant and comfortable
Service = 2 Stars - indifferent, slow and frequently absent

Overall A-ok.  We take all SF virgins and out of town guests here.  The view alone is worth it.
author: Russell D.

description: Great view! The drinks are decent and the menu has decent noshes for appetizers. The room feels a little dated, but then you look out the window and see all of San Francisco.
author: Bev W.

description: Yes it's expensive, but the service was excellent and so were the drinks and food. So I felt it was worth it and of course the view is incredible. The server was also excellent she even helped find a seat that was open.
author: Daniel S.

description: Great view. SLOW service. It took us 10min to get he drink menu and 30min to get our shrimp cocktail. I expect better from a Marriott branded hotel.
author: Joe W.

description: I called at 9:39 and spoke with the hotel staff to ask what time the view was open until and was told the view closed at 1:30am tonight and I confirmed twice! I arrived at 12:52 and the bar tender says they are closed, spoke with the MOD and he did nothing as well, no drinks served. The MOD Says he has no power to keep the view open if the bartender is done. This is unacceptable service. There are other hotels with a nice view at the top like the intercontinental or the Equinox  I'll be going there from now on.
author: J N.

description: The View was okay. The view of SOMA and Castro is not that great. The view of downtown buildings is okay. The menu was expensive and not that interesting. I got a 20$ kobe beef hamburger. The drink list is long and interesting, so if you like drinks, go for it. I was just not really charmed by The View even though I went dressed up
author: Denise C.

description:
Come for the view, not for the watered down and overpriced drinks! 

Guys this place is an awesome place to bring a date, its a strong closer!

Impress her with your upscale taste, and knowledge of the excellent views, great ambiance. There are plenty of Nook and corners to try and steal your first kiss ;)

The staff is kind and friendly, I just have a problem paying $18 bucks for a weak watered downed long island ice tea, that doesn't get my buzz on.
author: Aaron R.

description: I love this place, great spot for a meeting or date.
author: Luke B.

description: The View rests on the 39th floor of the Marriot and has an awesome view. Even for people who live in the city to visitors that view day or night is something anyone can appreciate. To really enjoy this place you have to get a table near the window. They have light snacks, I've only gotten the cheese plate. Drinks are pricey, but service is good and seats are comfortable.
author: Sandhya R.

description: ducked in here for happy hour and decided to take advantage of their half off maritinis from 4-6pm.  sky vodka seems the poison for these bad boys but at 14$ its not only overpriced for sky vodka but the taste was mediocre at best.  Half off made me swallow this a little better.  I was a little hungry and say the blue crab cake appetizer...two small deep fried critters served with a lackluster coleslaw at 14$---seems like a magic number for this place since most of the drink menu seem to hover around this range.  Come up here if you want to see a great view, other than that, i would give it a 4/5 judochops for the view of sf but only 2 for the food and pricey drinks.
author: Dustin G.

description: The view up here is amazing. The drinks are good but they aren't anything special. However, the prices for these drinks are quite high. A cocktail will run about $15. I understand that part of what you're paying for is the view. However, due to the high prices and the fact that it's very crowded, I can't rate it higher than a three.
author: Meghan M.

description:
Four stars for the view only.

This place is one of the best place to bring a date for a fabulous night view of the city in the center of downtown. But the drinks here are so-so... watered down (like many mentioned) and overpriced.

As for the staffs and service... I have mixed experiences. The first time, it was wonderful, they were nice and friendly. This other time, there was this waiter that was quite rude and impatient... so yeah, there you have it.

Just to be clear once again... the 4 stars are for the night view ONLY.
author: Gordon L.

description:
This bar is very romantic! We sat in our own little VIP section on the left side from when you walk out of the elevators. The view of the city is just breathtaking! 

*Pricy but worth it, especially if you've got a room there for the night like we had!
author: Jessica B.

description:
This is my favorite lounge in SF(mostly for the view of the city)!!!!  I really think this is a great place to take friends, a date, or out of town visitors.  However, I found the drinks to be heavily overpriced simply because this place has a nice view of downtown.

As nice as this place is, its definitely difficult to find a decent place to sit at night.  Why?  Because its soooo freakin' packed!!!  Everyone goes there for the view and wants to sit next to the window to view the city lights.  When at this lounge you have to sit next to a window because if you're not sitting next to the window you'll probably be sitting in some dark corner without a view of anything, other than the wall.

If you really want to impress someone then this is the place to be!!!!
author: Glenn P.

description: Stopped in for 2 drinks to take in the view- enjoyed a Stella and a glass of wine. Great wine selection, though a little disheartened that the beer was all bottles and no draft. Definitely worth going for the view!
author: Briana C.

description: I loved this place. It wasn't too expensive, just the right amount of classy at the right price. I plan to spend a lot more cocktail hours up here. There are two great views: one if the sun setting over the city, the other of the bay bridge lights. Highly recommended!!!
author: Chris H.

description:
The View.
It's all about the view.

My date brought me here after dinner and I loved it. You can literally sit for hours looking over the city. There are so many amazing views and it's absolutely beautiful.
I felt sassy and couldn't help but have a few really great martinis..very Carrie Bradshaw-esque. 
I'll be back.
author: Denise S.

description: Gorgeous views on a clear day! Great spot for drinks with a date. Lots of seating. It can get crowded and loud but you can still manage to find a quiet spot to have some QT with a special someone. So grab a drink and just enjoy the view! ;)
author: Linda N.

description: Great little spot to get a drink and see a killer view. Great for night time relaxing.
author: Zeel J.

description:
AMAZING view of the city, good music, delicious drinks, but absolutely TERRIBLE service. Terrible. There were 3 bartenders and they clearly could not care less about the customers. After finally getting the attention of one bartender and ordering my drink he left for a good ten minutes. When he came back he didn't apologize or even make my drink when he got back, I had to order again. I noticed that all the bartenders had their backs to the customers most of the time (not super professional) and moved at a super slow pace. When I went back to get another drink, I watched them walk around and pour drinks for other people and walk past me like I was invisible. I finally got his attention and was told "we're kind of closing up here" even though I had just seen him pour drinks for other customers. Not so cool.
I will admit that the drinks are delicious and the view is amazing, but I may not go back after that experience.
author: Cristina D.

description:
If you want to see a "view" of the bay area, come here. I got a little queesy heading up in the elevator, it shoots up kinda quick. Though the view is to die for literally scary and at deadly heights! LOL

You can actually see the east bay, and some bridges from the view. It is something you need to experience besides looking at pictures.

The food was pretty good quality, though I only had appetizers, and a few glasses of wine. They have great service, and the aumbience can get very intimate because there are tables that aren't in the main area.

Take a look at the pictures, they speak for themselves. This location makes you very proud of living in the bay area.

Love it!
author: Lei L.

description: Five stars for the view! Amazing! Get a seat by the windows, of course. High end cocktail lounge and a price point to match.
author: Kasha G.

description:
Like a really hot chick, the View doesn't have to work for patronage and it shows. 

With its spectacular vantage point, towering above the haphazard city streets and strings of mesmerizing lights, it's easy to overlook the abysmal service, the drink list consisting of a cringe-inducing array of skittle-colored vodka and rum drinks with astronomical price tags, and $14 freezer-burned crab cakes. Not surprising for a hotel bar, but it's just so painful because with the right care and talent, the experience could be magical. 

Stick to the wine, cheese plate and pay in cash to avoid having to wait for the slow-as-molasses servers, and drown in the magnificent views.
author: Ligaya T.

description: This is one of my favorite places in San Francisco, nay, in the whole wide world!  Floor to ceiling windows offer breath-taking views of the City of Lights.  Stiff but yummy cocktails, dimly lit lounge, and cozy tables offer the perfect make-out spot on a foggy evening. Delicious offerings on the menu means you can come here as early as 7 and not have to drag yourself away until 1:00AM.  A must-see for tourists with sophisticated tastes.
author: Ifeoma W.

description:
The View.. is well amazing because of the view. I love bungee jumping and zip lining but being this high up and sitting next to the window made me freakout alittle lol being up so high. I think it was the 39th floor or something.

I have to note that I did not like the red headed waitress. She was pushy and demanding. The only time she checked back was to get more orders so she could get more tip. She didn't care how we enjoyed our drink or anything of that sort. Drinks were expensive and on the watered side down too. 

3 stars is for the view.. as far as the atmosphere.. it's another typical hotel bar.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Nice view, and decent happy hour...  You can relax and have a few appetizers and drinks while gazing at the fabulous view of the bay.  Didn't know they had a 360 Degree view, as you can also travel to the backside of the bar, and find additional seating.  Good place if you enjoy Skyy vodka martinis, since they feature that as part of their happy hour choices.
author: Lawrence L.

description: We had the best seat in the house, right in front of the big beautiful window looking over the city. I would give this place 5 stars, but the lighting was a bit too dark (couldn't see my friends' beautiful faces) and the service was a bit slow. Drinks, pricey but guess thats what you expect for a swanky place like this.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Forget  the drinks because you're mainly here for "The View," hence the name.  If you ever wanted a free, quick tour of San Francisco, just mosey your way towards the Marriott's View Lounge.  Soothing ambiance over low-keyed rhythmic beats surrounded by cougars lounging on plush couches where silver foxes are standing by to get snagged.

Besides that, you can find a very mixed crowd anywhere from their early 20s up to their retirement 60s both either sporting the latest fashion trend or decorating themselves like polyester is back.

Come here with a special someone and you'll definitely get lucky afterwards.  All your troubles will go away as you gaze out the many windows rotating 360 degrees overlooking the handsomely lit city. Talk about anything and everything, the timing will always be right. Propose or get divorced.  Find your 2nd wife or husband here.  Just take a break with a Kit Kat bar, sit back with a drink, and drift away. The View simply holds it's name.
author: Mikey S.

description: This spot was really surprising as I hadn't known about it before but I was really happy with the choice. The view is amazing (but the drinks are pricey) -- I would definitely recommend just checking it out for that alone especially since it leans toward the quiet side.
author: Shauna S.

description:
You're paying for the view, but there are other options in the city with equally thrilling views AND better food and service. It's a 5-star view, 0-star bar. Ok, my drink was decent, so a 1-star bar. It's a short stroll from the Powell MUNI station. Still only 1-star.

I've been here three times, and service has always been... meh. But after my most recent visit, I would rate service as "poor." The server completely forgot us on a *very* slow Tuesday afternoon. I had to get up from my table and go find her. Twice. And both times, she was idly chatting away with one of her colleagues. Take your out-of-towners and SF Newbies here on a clear day, order 1 drink directly at the bar, grab yourself a table, and savor the view. Go around sunset, and watch the fog roll in and the sunlight bounce off buildings. Do not order food (not terrible, but not very good, and very overpriced). 

Or, better yet, go to Top of the Mark or the top-floor restaurant at The Hilton.
author: Miss M.

description: The name fits the location. The views here are incomparable, absolutely breathtaking. The lattice work on the windows is reminiscent of the Empire State Building. The service leaves a lot to be desired. After 15 minutes of waiting, we still couldn't get the waitress to stop for us so we ordered at the bar. The drinks were not very good at all. The decor inside is pretty standard for a generic hotel in the 90's. This place has so much potential, but even with all of the negatives, I will definitely be back and I will be bringing others. The view was really worth it and if you can manage to snag one of the tables, its a great place to linger with friends. One great thing about the View is that the tables are first come, first serve so unlike the Starlight Room, it is possible to walk in on a Saturday night and sit by the windows.
author: Kari G.

description: Great view and it really is.  Fun atomosphere - food is so so drinks are good - but great view - that says it all.
author: Chris C.

description:
Five stars for the views! :)

This is definitely a great date place.  It's located on the 39th floor of the Marriot.  Every table is strategically by windows overlooking the city of San Francisco.  So breathtakingly beautiful! 

Yes, cocktails and food are over priced. I ordered a lemon drop martini, which was nothing special, and a chocolate cake. It was a good portion, very rich and we enjoyed it.  But at $12? It's too much. 

The place is okay but you come here for the views and nothing else.
author: Pam S.

description:
I would never choose to go to a location like this... but it is quite a nice bar

As the name suggests it has some amazing views of the city and the bay bridge, so worth a visit to check that out but a regular hang out; probably not for me.

I like that most reviews make it a 'date spot' and I am sure it would make a great date spot, just make sure you have deep pockets if its your treat
author: Chris M.

description:
I love The View.  It's now one of my favorite rooftop lounges in the City.

As a local, you really ought to have a few rooftop lounges to pull out when the situation arises.  Down to earth on a 3 story restaurant/bar/lounge in the mission, fancy schmancy with live music in nob hill, etc.

The View is unexpectedly awesome.  Located in SOMA on top of a fairly tall building, the 360 degree views really could not get better.  You might find another place with similar views, but probably not better.

Beautiful decor, dim lighting to accentuate the spectacular views.  The service is laidback, but friendly.  The food is above average but not mindblowingly.  I believe I ordered a Kobe burger.

The music is no't live, but doesn't detract from the great ambiance at all.  Everything is a bit pricey, but the view is worth it every once in a while.

Best of all, it doesn't seem to have been discovered by many tourists (other than those living in the hotel downstairs).  It gets busy along the windows (as one would expect) and they usually won't take reservations for the window seating, but you can grab a drink at the bar while you wait (and you can order food and have it delivered to wherever you end up finding a spot).

Come here if you haven't.  Seriously.
author: Timothy Y.

description: Reasonably priced drinks that are nothing special. But take a date here to wow them with the view! It's pretty aptly named afterall...
author: Claire G.

description:
It's called "The View" for a reason!

Really, what's not to love about sitting inside what appears to be a giant juke-box overlooking the most spectacular sights our fair San Francisco has to offer?

When my family visits from the East, it's never a compete trip without zooming to the top of the Marriott for a cosmo with a million dollar view. The drinks & snacks are very pricey, but as I said - they come with a million dollar view! This isn't somewhere I come unless I'm toting around tourists, but every time I venture here - it reinforces why I love this city so much.

Their cocktails are well mixed, and the service is good. The view is always dazzling.
author: Maureen B.

description: One of the best views of the City!  The drinks were good but nothing special.  Come here on a date after dinner for desserts and a drink!  The place is pretty big with two big glass half domes so there's a good chance that you can get a seat with a nice view!
author: Keisuke N.

description:
I came for a private event, so I'm in no place to judge normal food and drink service.  

But, ZOMG, the view!!  The entire city is splayed out before you, you can see into the hills on the peninsula, or glimpse the Golden Gate bridge whenever the fog decides to give you a peek.  You can see Alcatraz sitting in the Bay and watch the city light up as the sun sets.  The floor-to-ceiling fan windows are gorgeous!
author: Cathy Y.

description:
The name says it all. 

And that's the best part of this place. 

Drinks are overpriced and mediocre. 

Clientele is mostly touristy. 

But, damn, that view is fantastic!
author: Matthew R.

description:
This place called The View for a reason because it is located on the 39th floor of the Marriott hotel. It's food is not as good as you would expect but what more can you ask from a restaurant located that high up. They ran out of jalapeño chips when I was there but I had it before. They were great.
The food is expensive for what it's worth though. Three small desserts will cost $10 and the said jalapeño chips were $5 for a small plate of kettle chips with some jalapeño ranch sauce. Their drinks are good, both alcoholic and non alcoholic. They have "mocktails" which are non alcoholic cocktails and those were good and worth the money. I believe it was $4 but it might be $7. 
Aside from the food, the view makes up for it. Imagine you're in a helicopter hovering at one spot high up above the street looking down at the city with its straight roads running right under you. From that height, you are able to see the mountains and houses of South San Francisco as well as the Embarcadero, and the Port of Oakland, not to mention the Bay Bridge. You can also see the roofs of many buildings in the city. Because this place opens at 4:00pm, if you stay long enough you will even be able to witness the fog rolling into the city from the behind the mountains. The view is exhilarating hence its name "The View." Come here for the view and the experience, not for the food.
The staff are nice though, they're awesome.
author: Ryan C.

description:
The view here is well worth the trip! 39th floor view of the city.  Great laid back environment that is dimly lit during the night.
Drinks were good but definitely overpriced.. $5 for a small glass of ginger ale or around $12 for their specialty drinks.
author: Melissa W.

description:
Not the American talk show, co-hosted by a panel of women. No, no!

A lounge high up in the Marriott Hotel on the 39th floor with an excellent VIEW of the city. Yes, yes!

Food is served here but we came for drinks. Martinis, Elixirs, Cocktails can range from $13-$15. Beer can be at $5 minimum, depending on what you order. Prices may be a bit ugly but who's thinking expenses when the lights and sights of the awesome cityscape put you at ease?

Came here once on a date and another time to show a buddy a place to bring a potential date. Service was very attentive. But I think it's just easier to purchase drinks at the bar and to find a cool spot to chill. I would prefer the side with the view facing the Bay Bridge. The view seems better cuz it overlooks more buildings (nicer ones!) and you can look off towards the bay. It can get too crowded at times, with some of the good seats taken. But if you wait long enough, some will open up. Just be patient. 

Overall, I'm a fan of the place. Twas a good find, indeed. Coming back for sure!
author: Will S.

description:
I am so looking forward to spending time over holidays!...

Yummm so delicious I can go back once a month,...
author: Vienna V.

description:
this place is appropriately named because you don't come here for cheap drinks. 

nice lounge for the fancy hotel folks. probably the kind of place edward took vivian to make her feel out of place. but then she comes back later to show the staff how wrong they were at first.
author: Son V.

description: well... sorry to break it to you over priced drinks, stuffy environment, and a foggy view only granted this place 2 stars.  If you are in the area and want the quick touristy experience take a chance have a drink but don't stay too long, honestly not worth it.
author: Erica B.

description: They mean it -- amazing view!! Good drink menu, a bit pricey but a great place to take someone for the "SF" experience. Absolutely gorgeous!
author: Alexandra B.

description: 39 stories up, great view of the city and the bay - excellent place to get a drink before dinner or bring visitors, they will be impressed. I love the view and the atmosphere is far fancier than anywhere I usually go and I love the couches. However, the drinks are so so expensive ($10-15 minimum) and the small plates even moreso (nothing less than $14 on the menu) so if that's out of your price range (like it is mine) than just go for one drink to get the experience.
author: Luthien N.

description: Came here with a couple of my friends after a day of shopping around Union Square. It's a perfect way to end the day while the sun is setting. The view is absolutely beautiful!! Being a somewhat broke college student, I wouldn't recommend this place for someone who's trying to find cheap drinks because this place isn't cheap. But the ambiance and the view is definitely worth it if you're in the city with out of towners who want to see the city from a different perspective. I ordered the Ginger Pear (Grey Goose Pear Vodka, Pineapple Juice, and Ginger Ale) and it was delicious!
author: Kevin Joseph A.

description:
I went up to the 39th Floor to check out The View one evening after dinner - the place is pretty cool. Dimly lit, candles, and a blue-ish glow permeate the place - with music softly playing in the background.

There were lots of out of the way nooks here and there - I think this would be a fab place to take a date for a romantic evening. Made me think about how much I miss my ex girlfriend while I was looking around...

There were a lot of folks up here drinking. I sat at the bar and opted for my favorite Martini drink - Vodka martini - shaken, extra cold, dirty, with an extra olive - made with Ketel 1. The drink was strong and delicious.

The bill for one Martini? $13 FRICKIN Dollars! Wow.

And yes, the view of San Francisco at night is pretty cool.
author: Neal E.

description:
Great place to chill out with a group of friends, or even with a date since the view is spectacular!...(Given if it's a clear night).  We came on a somewhat busy Friday night, so it took awhile for the waitress to give us the drink menu and to take our orders.  In addition to cocktails, they have a few snack selections...the combo pita-hummus-cheese-meat platter is a good choice.  I was looking forward to my Mango Mojito, but it turned out to be a BIG disappointment because the blended mango puree overpowered the mintiness of the drink.  The drinks were on the pricey side, but then again, you kinda expect that for the VIEW you get. Otherwise, I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a nice lounge spot. 

(There is also a parking garage nearby if you can't find street parking, which is almost never in the downtown area.)
author: Lisa C.

description: A date brought me here about 6 months ago and one of my gf's did, too, back in the day. Not much has changed, nor does it need to. The name says it ALL and the cocktails are verrrry yummy. So of you are a tourist or a local, The View is a must see.
author: Nise R.

description:
Eh, it's a hotel bar.  Drinks and food are fine, but overpriced.  I know it's a hotel bar, but they should still offer a glass of wine for under $12 - especially when you're in the backyard of wine country.  

The view would certainly be nice - it was pretty overcast when I was there, but that's certainly not the bar's fault.

The service was a little iffy - our server was kind of a dingbat, but she didn't deserve the berating she got from the guy at the table next to us.
author: Megan K.

description: The view is unbelievable, the fish tacos are awesome, the wines are pretty good and on Friday nights they have a DJ. The night I went the DJ played 90s hits. I was seriously having a moment with myself. A really good time, chill atmosphere but still with an upscale vibe.
author: Mahta P.

description:
Should be called the BATCAVE. Dark, electric, night view of the city is transforming. 

My favorite spot for a night cap in San Francisco.  Well worth the expense. A visual memory you won't soon forget. 

The hotel is also top drawer - we've stayed for both work and on a few special weekends.
author: melanie s.

description: I wasn't aware of this hidden gem until I attended a prei-con here. I found their prices to be pretty reasonable and the view is unbeatable. I would go here at sunset. It's a great choice for a pre-dinner spot.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: A little hidden gem in downtown SF. I worked across the street from the Marriott for 7 years and never knew about this place. Thanks Melissa for introducing me to The View! Great views of the city, nice stiff drinks and a good variety of small snacks to munch on.
author: Adelina W.

description:
All the years living in the city I have always wanted to come here but never really had the chance. So one night, at about 11pm after the Wicked performance ended, everyone was feeling hungry. We jumped in a taxi and I told the driver to take us here. I knew my party would love the view here!

The view is absolutely stunning! Place was packed, very dark, I walked around to see the different view, and we finally found a table in a corner facing the Bay Bridge. Much to our disappointment, the kitchen was closed, we did order drinks but the waitress hurried us to pay. We enjoyed the view, and left twenty minutes later feeling extremely hungry.

The view  is worth a stop at this place, and probably the only reason to come here. But I personally would come here before it gets dark and stay until the nights comes on, and I would bring my SLR to take plenty of pictures. While waiting, I would enjoy a few drinks and have some food (hopefully the food aren't as bad as some people said here).

I will be back!
author: Sharon P.

description: I used to come here often with my husband for enjoying the 360 SF view. The spot reminded me somewhat the piano bar at Akasaka Prince Hotel in Tokyo, which is no longer exists.
author: A J.

description: My bf and I made a quick pit stop before hitting up our late night dinner res elsewhere. We got there around 9p and there were no seats to be found. It wasn't packed, but it was bustling. We ended up walking around, taking in the lovely views, wishing we could hang out a bit longer. Overall this lounge has a classy yet no-fuss vibe, which I love. The dimly lit interior (to better enjoy the cityscape at night) makes for a perfect date night location. Would love to come back again the next time I'm in town.
author: Sammie O.

description:
After a night of partying and consuming way way to much alcohol, we decided to take it easy the next night....we found ourselves lounging at "The View" and I must say the view....AMAZING!!! It was very relaxing, just what we needed. The appetizers were alright, the drinks were strong and the atmosphere was sophisticated and relaxing. Had a great time here just taking in the surroundings and enjoying the evening...I would love to come back on my next visit to SF


SF....i hardly knew thee.... =( *tear tear* hahaha
author: cassina Q.

description: The view is amazing!!! it really holds to the name...my guests during the birthday celebration that i threw recently were having fun. The valet personnel were very accomodating. But, the service was so slow...they don't even go to your table right away to check if you have ordered or what. The burger meat that we ordered were too dry. One of my guests commented to her that the burger meat was dry and the server name Krystal told him, "you ordered well done right?" "So, that's well done". What an attitude!!! Service needs to be changed in here.
author: Lindy P.

description:
As you might have guessed, it isn't called the view for no reason.  The view is great.  The fog had already rolled in so the view was spectacular, but definitely want to go back to watch the fog roll in.  
The drinks were great and the food, we ordered the cheese plate, was amazing.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Awesome views! The drinks are pretty good.  SUPER romantic place to impress a date!  

We had a really good time chilling here! 

I didn't get to try the food but the drink menu is fairly extensive and the lounge area is super cool!
author: Joanne L.

description: Yes, the view is amazing! The drinks are strong and the service is great. The food is pretty terrible and the prices are sky high. Still, this is a must for both tourists and locals alike.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Great place to take a date, best view I found in the city i didn't have any food but the lighting, mood and nice cocktails made the night service was out standing
author: Nick D.

description:
I completely apologize to anyone I may have offended on my first visit, but in my defense:
1. The view was spectacular
2. The drinks were strong
3. The appetizers were yummy but still no match for the drinks 
4. It was nice and dimly lit
5. The lap I was in was very warm and cuddly
author: Loli L.

description:
I love Sky Bars! The Jennifer loves Sky Bars!  This is a great place to go and truly enjoy the city!  There is something energetic about being in a big city!  It is the people, it is the vibe, it is the lights, the coats, the crime, the shady people walking around, the European tourist, ok.... maybe not the last three items.  However, truly something cool about being in a city that we love.  

The View Bar is exactly that.  After dinner, walking in a giant cool city down the street and into another venue and enjoying that moment is an experience within itself.  Being from So.Cal, we don't get those feelings too often.  The first night we got there after 10, on a Friday.  The place was packed!  The crowd was mix, early hipster wanting to get a vodka redbull, couples (like us) enjoying the vibes, businessmen and conventioners losing their ties to shop talk,  and everyone in between all vying for the coveted seats and tables.  We found a table right next to the bar, completely crowded.  The server was real nice.  I had to turn on my "Get Fresh" charm!  The Jennifer was tasked with spotting any open tables by the window!  She found one (Good Job) , using my charm, the server brought our drinks over to the high-table that was leaving and  wa-la!  We were in view heaven.  We ended up drinking martinis and cosmos the night away, not wanting to leave and take in every second of the city.  

We actually came back to The View the next day at sunset for happy hour.  We got there early and found our table again!  We watched the sun go down and the city lights come on over cosmos and scotch (single malt) on the rocks...guess who had the scotch?  The Jennifer or I?  It was much more relax atmosphere.  

I miss this place already!  The View is something that will be in our hearts and memories, and also on our list to visit every time we are in SF.
author: Doug C.

description:
The moon hits your eye, like a big pizza pie!

The view was great, of course seating is an issue, but that aside the view is great. The floor opens up when the bar opens up.. I guess that would be 4pm I think. 

The bartender was cool and made up my drink a tad stiff.. meaning 'just right.' One side of the view is of the water and the water front. The other side is a more cityscape minded view but equally beautiful. I was able to see city hall area (the flame throwers from Lovefest was a nice touch), japantown area, and more. I guess i kind of do miss the city... but surely it's more of a nostalgic feeling if anything else. 

The staff was delightful and the food was better yet. I believe we got a number of apps just because we were heading back out to the clubs. Think we ordered a quesadilla, crab cake, shrimp cocktail, and seafood flatbread something or another. I liked the quesadilla and the shrimp a lot. The crab cake was alright and I never did get around to the flat bread. 
;D
author: John-Michael C.

description: Great view of San Francisco, but not worth it I had not been here in 5 years. First thing I was told I would be charged $21.99 for the first hour to valet my car then the drinks were $15.00 each. To expensive for what you get.
author: Michael B.

description: Comfortable cocktail table seating.  Great views.  Busy with tourists and hotel visitors.  A lot of people coming and going so good for people watching if that's your thing.  This is the kind of place that's good to stop by for a drink or two then move on.
author: John R.

description:
No doubt about it, the 360 degree view is pretty spectacular.  You can't deny the location is exceptional.

However, there isn't much else the place has going for it.  Our waiter didn't say hello until a good 20 minutes after we sat down (self-seating when we were there on a Saturday night), even though he was attending to some neighboring tables.  He finally came to clear away the used glasses from the previous group, and seemed on a mission to utter as few words as possible to us.  I guess I'd be angry too if I had to wear a lame uniform all day long.  My friend wanted a recommendation on a very sweet and fruity drink - the lemondrop she got didn't fit that bill and was poorly crafted.  My mango mojito was lackluster and weak.  He delivered us the bill after a while without even asking if we wanted to order more drinks...not exactly what I'd describe as hospitable.

Didn't get any food, but I glanced at their appetizer menu.  Shrimp cocktail was something like $15-20 and from the looks of neighboring tables that ordered it, not worth it.

So, you're paying a premium for the view, but if you're looking for good cocktails or good food, try elsewhere.  Maybe I've been spoiled by the amaaaazing mixed drinks crafted at certain SF bars (e.g. Bourbon & Branch), but 10-15 bucks for what tastes worse than something I threw together at home isn't acceptable.  Might considering bringing an out of towner here for a quick beer if we happened to be in the area, but nothing I would go out of the way for again.
author: Yushan K.

description:
Beautiful View!!!! 

Drinks taste good but are overpiced. I have not tried the food or deserts  but I will sometime in the future.

It is a perfect place to take a date.
author: Beth M.

description:
Food: bleh. Overpriced cardboard.

Drinks: typical, tasty, but overpriced.

Ambience: Nice, a bit retro, but warm and relaxed. 

View: One of the best in the city. Clearly the reason for the pricey drinks: subsidizing free entry to such a great location.
author: Jason L.

description:
I don't know where to start,but let me say that this is a wonderful view. If you are expecting something over the top like Paris..well move on. It is nice and I feel that you can sit and relax. Depending on the crowd it can be peaceful,relaxing and etc. I have never been to "The View",before but let me tell you there are I believe 2 side's(I think) and where I was at was quite nice,view very precious and relaxing. It can be a romantic place for some or it can be a place to think or perhaps just kick back and have a drink after work. 

I found the place to be quite nice and very relaxing.I think if you are looking for a view,drinks,conversations and a laid back time try this place out. Just pick the perfect spot in "The View".

 Decent drink menu ,reasonable prices..however the lightening is quite low.So some might think as it more of a romantic place,but I don't and I think what is important is what you take it is.

A time to relax,unwind and take in the view.
author: Dani D.

description:
It's a good view, but that's it. The dishes were overpriced, so were the drinks. If you get a chance, and you are in the area, take a quick detour and head u to the 39th floor.

I went in  sunday, if you are on a date and want privacy, this is a good place for that.
author: Eric A.

description:
As a celebration, I took my friend here to toast his new job right in the heart of San Francisco! He couldn't help but smile after I mentioned the word...viewtop floor at the Marriott Hotel and have a few drinks?

One word: Amazing! You won't regret spending a minute here with a few gals or pals for a cocktail or two. On the otherhand, if you need a night to relax after a long day of work...best place to take in the bright lit city of SF, right?

Every corner you turn inside the somewhat lit lounge, you'll notice the great window views of city life and some jazzy feel music playing softly in the background.

My friend wasn't impressed with the place, because he's been here before. At least he was very happy celebrating with a few good friends. I must say, a bottle of wine and a few martinis got me feeling a tad bit giggly. Prices on the menu were slightly inexpensive and not many selections to choose off their food menu. I would come back here from time to time just to enjoy the view. I would enjoy it a lot more if I had a romantic evening here with a special someone, but I doubt that would happen anytime soon. Instead,  I figured that my BFF deserved to come out here after landing his dream job! Lucky him, he got what he wanted and as well as spending a great evening with his close knit of friends.
author: Fraulein C.

description:
I'd say the view is spectacular. 

If you move to the south side of the bar, you have an unobstructed view down the Bay for miles. It's a good place to unwind, or, as someone I know did, hold a book signing party. High above the street where the book began, at the same intersection but in a different world. Basically, we took over the room on the south side of the bar for several hours. As the sun set, the colors in the sky and around the City were almost as entertaining as the author, who graced us with a reading of his work. 

The bartender was pleasant, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. I paid for the view, though. It's a hotel bar, and prices were as expected. A rum and Coke cost me $10 + tip.
author: David D.

description:
Though this first bit will probably sound like a broken record, I am going to say it anyway as it is the ONLY reason I gave this place any credit...that being that the view of the city is absolutely amazing.  The windows are floor to celing and give you a nearly 360 view of SF.

Now, how is this place totally not worth it?  Let me count the ways...

The service is horrible.  I've been to plenty of bars where I thought the bartender was a bit of a dick, but this is a hotel bar...packed with tourists, I was presumptuous in thinking I would receive some level of hospitality.  The staff was cold with a pompous attitude which was confusing to me because it's just the Marriott.

Along with rude staff I will add nearly incompetent staff as our server could never remember what we ordered (group of 5), was always blaming the bartender for STILL not having the drinks ready (20 min passed) and had to redo our bill 3 times because she couldn't get it right.  Something you should know about this place is that even if you spend $12 for a glass of wine they put a $50 "hold fee" until they process all of their charges later...then the $38 is taken away and the $12 that you actually spent remains.  I know this sounds absolutely nuts...and it is...but they act like it is the most normal thing in the world and ALL hotel bars do it (not so).

That's it for the rant.  Except one last thing...the bar is furnished with the same standard styleless pieces that fill the rest of the hotel.  Seats that are as worn as those found on the BART.

Don't go here.  Choose from one of the hundreds of other fantastic bars located just blocks away.
author: Ashley G.

description: I was pleasantly suprised by the View.  the views were amazing and go all away around the building.  But our server Steve, was top notch.  We had signature cocktails, yes they were all around $15.00 (but you are paying for the view). Also had housemade chips, with dipping sauce and marinated olives.  It was the perfect start to our evening.  Can't  wait to come back.  Room is getting a bit dated, could use a renovation.
author: tonya m.

description: Came here with my sister once for drinks. It was nice. The drinks were good, and the view was amazing.
author: Elaine T.

description: Very classy place ideal for a date, but not really the spot if you want get drunk with your buddies. The atmosphere is nice but not the place to socialize with meet strangers. The food on the other hand is great and the way they plate their food and drinks definitely adds to the experience.
author: Michael R.

description: Beautiful view.  Certainly worth taking a trip up here if you're looking for a place to enjoy the views of the city and overpriced drinks.
author: Marcus M.

description:
We decided to head to The View after having dinner at home at around 9:00PM on a Thursday. I don't know how packed this place normally is since I am not from here but to our surprise we were able to grab a table in no time.
