Our table was tucked away in a corner and right next to the glass... we were able to see the beautiful night lights at all time. 

The lounge was fairly full so the service was not the fastest but it was definitively friendly. The drinks were good and plenty. I drank red wine, and my husband had his usual Jack and Coke. The couple with us has Gin and Tonic and Margaritas. All were pleased with their drinks, especially my husband since we both know how difficult it can sometimes be to find great mixed drinks in Boston. 

Overall a great night. I would love to go back to The Lounge the next time I am in San Fran!
author: Melina C.

description: My boyfriend and I arrived here around 7 or 8 PM I believe (couldve been later) and as soon as we walked in we scoped out a table, everything was full until the waiter says someone is checking out so we waited near the seats until they were done. The service was okay the waiter made statements about the night but left right before you could reply. We enjoyed our drinks and our delicious food. I was very irritated when this 35+ white lady approached our table explaining it was "her man's 40th and we had really good seats" this lady sat there and continued to ask questions of how long we were going to be there. My boyfriend did not want to be bothered by her so I simply said when the check comes I'll let you know. She then continued to ask will it be about an hour. She finally left and hovered near by. The view was perfect right by the corner of the window. Did I add how delicious our food was the chicken, eggplant,  shrimp and desert sample were amazing I had to contain myself from not ordering another order of chicken(the portions are WAY too small for the price). As we left we did say happy birthday to the birthday boy but he act as if he had no clue what we were talking about.  Luckily we had an amazing dinner to not allow such ignorance to mess up our night.
author: Shonece B.

description:
After a long day at work with little sleep the night before the only thing that could temp me to schlep my way into the city for sunset cocktails was my sexy girlfriend waiting for me when I got home with the suggestion to go to the "View". 

Although the drinks were not cheap and the food was just good enough to be decent......... The view and ambiance paired with the company made this place a quick addition to my top 10 must go to San Fran spots for pre dinner drinks.

My girlfriend wants me to add that the floor to ceiling windows are spectacular. Very romantic. First come first serve for seating.
author: Eugenio G.

description:
I've been to many a high rise view in the City. This 5 star is for the view, the ease and the excellent special event allowed on the 39th floor. We were lucky enough to attend a special release by Charbay Premium Spirits... dinner and whiskey barrel tasting. I am learning to appreciate whiskey. It certainly is not my first cocktail of thought...yet, the chefs and Marko of Charbay paired the most exquisite 5 course menu and libations for the evening. I think my attitude is strictly one of gratitude as I begin to see the mystery in Whiskey. 

Great view...unbelievable view from the View! I can't wait to go back and try the regular fare. The chefs could not have 'nailed' the whiskey pairings any better. Duck tortellini soup in a delicate consume with one Japanese quail egg poaching in the soup... where does one find that normally and since when would you think to order it with a French Oak barrel aged, double hopped premium beer whiskey? 

Hats off... great job!
author: Kaethe S.

description: Went here for drinks last summer and, as the name implies, the view is fantastic.  I was impressed with the service as they helped set up a table for my party and quick with our drinks.  I can't speak too much for the signature cocktails here, but the Tanqueray 10 martini I had was well-executed.
author: Eric F.

description:
This place isn't cheap and the waitresses are slightly snooty, but "The View" is glorious.  

My Mom was visiting from Chicago and we went to "The View" on a Saturday night.  She loved it so much, we went back a few days later for happy hour and got our martinis for half the usual price ($7 vs. $14).  The environment is high-toned and beautiful (perfect for out-of-towners), but I'd say the majority of the mid-evening crowd wore nothing fancier than sneakers and a hoodie.  As a consequence, this is the perfect spot for a drink after a long day of sight-seeing, a nice location where your guests can still feel special without having to look special.  

Thumbs way up!
author: Sarita T.

description:
I gave a Suprise 50th B-Day Party at The View Lounge and it was FANTASTIC.

This was my very first time ever planning an event besides a kids birthday party.

I booked out the entire View Lounge for this event.   

The guests LOVED the food.  The Manager was WONDERFUL {Sandra Manhart}!
She helped me throughout out my entire process.   (i.e. planning, picking menu, etc.)    I would meet with her in the evening after my work hours.  But, becuase we were discussing having an event in one o her venues, they feed you on the house.

This may be common practice, but I was impressed.

I Love This Place and Would Definitely Hold Another Event There 
(no matter what the cost)

Thank You So Much Sandra Manhart  {YOU'RE AWESOME}
author: FedUp W.

description:
Yeah, it's overpriced.  Duh.  It's a hotel bar.

Yeah, I said duh.  Wanna fight about it?

Annnyway, I had a lovely time here last night beginning my "girls night out."  The cocktails are pricy, but my manhattan had easily five ounces of woodford reserve, so I wasn't arguing.  However, if I'm paying $14 for a cocktail, I'd really like a good brandied cherry in my manhattan, not a maraschino thankyouverymuch.  

The cheese plate was lovely, and came with a sizeable chunk of honeycomb, so I was quite happy.  Creme brulee was light and airy, and still nice and cold despite a clearly just-torched top.  

Well done, The View.  You're so much better than that show with four bitchy women.  Congrats.
author: Caitlin M.

description: There are two Marriott's in the city so make sure you have the right address. The view lounge is dimly lit though not too dark where you can't see the person sitting across from you. Their menus are lit with a white light behind the paper. There are two large windows across the room from each other but you should arrive early to get a seat near the window because you seat yourself. I had the creme brulee which was served with two small chocolate covered biscotti. This creme brulee was one of the best I've ever had and I absolutely love creme brulees. The sugar was perfectly hard and very golden brown on top. The flan was soft and melted in your mouth and the taste was perfect. Alcholic rinks are pretty expensive here and I wasn't in the mood to drink so I got tea which was a bad idea. They gave me a cup of water and five packets of tea to choose from. Not what I expected from a nice establishment.
author: Karyn G.

description:
Have you forgotten why you like the city? A quick ride up to the view makes for an interesting evening!  This has to be one of the best 'views' of the city that you can get with a bar setting.  I was amazed by how much seating was available...The bar twists around the whole building and is pretty much guaranteed to have at least one empty table! 

The drinks are pretty amazingly expensive...but theres no cover...and you're looking at one of the best views you'll see in the city! In my opinion, the drink prices are justified.  Use this place as the intro to a night of fun!  Maybe follow up on a date here...after dinner, go out for drinks?  Maybe enjoy the evening sunset with your crew before a fun night on the town.  The possibilities with this place are endless...it just takes a short ride up the Marriot's elevator...also, its so close to Union Square!   This place is a must see!  Even if you just look ;D
author: Ryan L.

description:
I'd come here again for an upscale, relaxed evening. 
Sink into a comfy chair, sip on that mojito and take in the night view of San Francisco.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I admit--that View is the jam.

Besides that, I walked out of this place muttering how I planned to Yelp the shit outta them...so here goes.

Waiter spilled on my pants. Irish Car bomb had shot glasses that didn't fit right in the pint glass. They overcharged on the bill. 

You're lucky the window seat was so good "THE VIEW"!!
author: bm b.

description:
I still don't get why they call this place "The View" but the drinks were fairly stiff (good thing), there's cheap parking next to the Metreon, the prices weren't bad at all for a hotel bar, and the view was very impressive.

Wait a minute...
author: Patrick C.

description: The view was amazing. I was very excited to try some of the drinks and the food.The Ahi was so delightful! My friends and I also tryed the pulled pork sliders which was a first for me. i usually avoid sliders of any sort because  when the meat is in such a small portion it is  always dry. But the sky bar had it Nailed! They were delicious and i could eat them everyday they were  so good!!!! The ambiance was nice but a little dark in the resturant. Like hard too see my friends across from me dark. Also the last thing i tryed on the menu was the mac and cheese i would pass on that next time.
author: Kristyn M.

description:
My experiences here have been mixed, but I think it's a nice bar to keep in mind when you're downtown and hankering for some liquor in a nice environment.  They advertise that they make their own syrups, but they are either making them out of corn syrup or substituting that same cheap bottled shit when they run out or on certain nights of the week.  I've gotten both awesome and terrible drinks here, and no luck ever having a terrible drink fixed.  The wait staff is also very hit or miss.  At times they can be great and professional, at other they are really aggressive to get you to a table instead of having you order at the bar only to be obviously annoyed when you only order coffee!  "Yeah, I thought I could have carried it over the table myself too!" 

Yet the view is unbeatable!  It offers both a perspective granting view of San Francisco facing south and the "tourist view" facing north (which is a great display of Yerba Buena Gardens, the MOMA, Embarcadero Center, and the Bay Bridge).  

The drinks are stand prices.  And the appetizers are tasty.  For 14 bucks, the cheese plate is good for two or three.  It has yummy but not super great cheeses (3) with some basic fruit, nuts, and honey comb.  

It's a great place to take dates during the day--when you don't need to impress but want something impressive--or to relax for a bit if you're shopping.  And you should definitely take out of town guests.  But if what you're after is a consistently good cocktail in the middle of the day or HH, try 83 Proof on First, or B in the YB gardens themselves.
author: Luke M.

description:
OMG you guyz, so at THE VIEW, I totally felt as glamorized as Star Jones (except pre-stomach stapling and prior to that whole marrying a gay man thing) (AND she fooled absolutely NO ONE except maybe her pastor, and even then I have my doubts).

I mean, seriously, I was momentarily befuddled and for a second thought I was rockin' the bedazzled horse blanket and a cascading waterfall of luxurious weave and my Payless plastic pumps for the after party! I, for realz, kept expecting to turn to my left and see Joy Behar being all snide and forced-funny in all her wannabe-Bette glory up on my face. But it turned out to just be one of my dear high school friends (Although they're more the Bette from "Beaches" rather than the Bette from "Hocus Pocus" or any of her other cinematic classics).

The drinks at THE VIEW are "high end" in price - about $12-$20 for a little bitty cocktail drink in those totally-not-ergonomic martini glasses, which is why I can't give this place high stars, AND I was sad they ran out of tiramisu when I was there BUT it's all good because that would have cost an extra $10! Shoot, at that price, I could march my Star Jones-esque cankles over and buy me a new pair of plastic pumps from Chez Paylezz, nkay????

USEFUL TIP: We got there around 9, the place was half-full, and subsequently, we got a great table with a fantastic view of the gigantistic fan-shaped window with a beautiful view of the bay (and I'm not one for views, srsly) and the best part? We were there for 3 hours, and only got one round of drinks, and the staff did not bother us ONCE. Not even when it got super crowded by 10-11ish. Thanks The View, you're in my prayers tonight forrealthoughhey!!
author: Joshua L.

description:
Not much to say about this place. The drinks were average, and the service was good, but really you come here for the "The View"

We went over when it was raining, but the view was still amazing. We spent most of our time checking out this odd shaped white structure on the top of one of the skyscrapers. We asked the waitress what it was and she told us that its an apartment... pretty impressive

Anyways, if you want to get the "metro" feeling and take a few drinks then go to this place. The atmosphere is chill, but the view makes it worth while
author: ariel r.

description: This place is awesome..on the top floor of the Marriott hotel...I think we got in around 9:30-10pm ish or so, and it was a cozy little bar with a great view of the city.  It was stil l pretty early, there were plenty of seats available...the only drawback, I'd say is that there was only one bartender at the time, so service was a little slow, but he was friendly and accommodating. Loved the view.  Would definitely come back. Great place to sit and have a conversation over a drink or two.
author: Patty O.

description: I enjoyed hanging out here. Very chill, you come in, find your own table and the wait staff take your order. There are drinks, appetizers and dessert. Everything is over priced for what it is, but I think you are also paying for the view. Definitely a better alternative than Mark Hopkins, where they never have any food that's on the menu. I don't know why, but I've been to the top of the mark many times and they just didn't have anything. That being said, I was a bit disappointed with the Caipirinha my friend got. I went to Brazil last year, so I had a lot of Caipirinha while I was there. The Caipirinha is made with taquila at the view, which is just wrong! It's supposed to be made with Cachaça. The bar didn't charge us for that drink, so that was nice. The service can be a bit slow at times, but you know...it's a bar to hang out and enjoy the view.
author: Cicie W.

description: Amazing views! I had a fun time and the desert trio was delicious!! It's not a full restaurant but I would stop by for a quick drink and snack next time I am in SF!
author: Jasmine S.

description: Great views & great staff. Drink menu is not very creative, food was okay (but pricey). Bring your out-of-towners.
author: Jordan P.

description: Great views of the city.  Nice place to meet friends ahead of dinner.
author: Dylan S.

description:
View was spectacular! Drinks were.. average.

Absolutely amazing to end a night lounging around looking over SF brdige, the water and all the tall builings. You walk into the lounger, one side had everything a tourist would want to see, the other side a million stars on the ground highlighting houses and small businesses. Waiter.. shabby.. drinks.. I'm not going to complain. Nice way to end the night touring in SF
author: Jannie C.

description:
Three stars for the view alone, and probably the only reason you should really ever go here. It's a classic tourist trap, with drink prices to match. But I'm actually ok with that. In fact I like Level III in the other Marriott in town.

What really bugs me about this bar is the unusually horrendous service that transpires here. Take last week, when a colleague and I stopped in for a bottle of wine. We waited patiently for a cocktail waitress to surface but once that didn't happen, ordered a cab from the bar. That took another 5 minutes, and the bartender seemed to be stand-offish once he took the order. Given his slow pace of making cocktails, you'd think we were doing him a favor, and it's not like a $48 bottle was a small tab, either. Unscrew the cork, serve. 

Anyway, once we brought the bottle and two glasses to our table, things seemed to be pick up, but that was really due to Mother Nature. You really want to get here around sunset to fully take in the surrounding view of the cityscape, as dusk begins to settle. Whether you're visiting or live in San Francisco, the Millennium Falcon-like vantage is admittedly hard to beat. 

But then we fiNished the bottle. We tried to flag down a waitress again. No such luck. Went to the bar, had to wait another 5 minutes (at a bar which was really not that busy anymore), only to be given another gruff 'tude from the bartender. Excuse us for trying to pay the bill. With service like that, keep me posted on how "the view" is from the unemployment line.
author: Nish N.

description: Ok, everyone needs to come here when visiting the city for the first time. Though it was dark out for me, it was an incredible intake of the city's landscape. Worth the trip up to the 35th? floor of the Marriott to at least take a peak. The server was exceptionally friendly and helpful, too. Quite the chatter. As Kari S. said (my cousin who took me), it is a hidden little gem! The perfect place to be to soak it all in from up above.
author: Elisë K.

description: This place was incredible! The views of downtown SF; breathtaking. We came at night so the lights of the city sparkled. I think I need to come at sunset! Great drinks and the service was awesome. I can't wait for friends to come in from out of town so I can take them here.
author: Shannon H.

description: HIDDEN LITTLE JEWEL!  I plan to bring all of my out of town guests here...come after 7:30 to avoid the happy hour rush.  Have a Manahattan...so yummy!  The view is wonderful.  What a great way to view the city.  This is the perfect one drink stop before dinner or the perfect one drink stop after dinner.
author: Kari S.

description: Came here at night time, and the view is absolutely gorgeous, almost 360 of san francisco. Obviously for a really nice lounge like this one is going to cost a lot, but they are very generous with the amount of alcohol. The ambiance is really nice and the drinks were all very delicious. Get here early to get a good seat. You pretty much serve yourself if you want drinks only. The valet guy also hooked me up with a nice parking spot, instead of charging the regular price of $18 for the first hour I believe.
author: Phan H.

description: Enjoyed staff, service and food.  A tad expensive but really you're paying for the ambiance.  The night we went there was a slight fog but still a great view over looking the City and the interactions.  Nice wine list which seem to be balanced with the food served there.  Overall it's a great place take a date and forget one's day.
author: Rickye J.

description: This place has a great VIEW. Besides that, it's okay. It was really crowded when I went there with a small group. We couldn't even find a place to sit or check out the view the first time we attempted, and came back later that night. After hovering for a while, we were able to grab a table in the center. The view was beautiful! The service was nowhere to be found. We were there for probably 40 minutes or so and the whole time no one ever came by to pick up the glasses and dishes left on our table by the previous party, and no one ever asked us if we wanted to order drinks. So basically we spent the time just sitting, chatting, and enjoying the view without ordering anything. I suppose we could have ordered at the bar, but none of us wanted to risk losing a chair to the crowd.  We tried to flag someone down to order some drinks or at least clear the table a couple of times, but to no avail.
author: Raizel G.

description:
I mean, it's called "The View", not "The Drink" right? In that regard, I simply cannot complain. I paid my first visit this Tuesday, on the occasion of my birthday, and I believe my friends and I got what we came for, which was a grand vista of a grand city. Who knew this giant chrysanthemum shaped window, 39 floors up, even existed?

French 75: eh..  Smoke on the water: eh?  La Granita (with pomegranite liqueur): eh!  :)
author: Alex B.

description: The name says it all.  What a view.  Didn't have too much to drink and I didn't get any food so I can't effectively review the level of bar and wait service, but everyone seemed courteous and I did get whatever drinks I did order pretty quick.  Nice ambiance to take a date to.
author: Thugnificent M.

description: Great Lounge, geat view, nice atmosphere, ok drinks.  The view is totally worth the trip here.  The drink prices are a little more expensive than at a typical SF lounge, but where else can you get specatular views in a really nice/classy lounge.   My biggest complaint would be the bloody mary that i ordered, which was undrinkable.  The server kindly replaced the drink though for free.  I stuck to beer the rest of the night though.
author: New York R.

description: This place makes a fantastic martini and has a shrimp cocktail to gossip about. I have attended both social and work functions here and it is typically busy but still run fairly well. The only issue is seating, and that varies with each visit. The view is beautiful and if you can snag window seat at sunset you will want to have your camera ready!
author: Carolyn B.

description:
Well, their name says it all. You come to the View for the VIEW, which is amazing.  This place holds some fond memories of my dating days with my husband.

From the street, the windows of this lounge on the 39th floor look like a Jukebox, so I always refer to this hotel as the "Jukebox Marriott".  The retro vibe extends to the waitress uniforms which remind me of the ones from that 80's show "It's a Living".  I'd steer clear of the bar food menu as it's quite limited, but for a late afternoon drink or a late night nightcap, check out the view at the "Jukebox" Marriott.
author: C L.

description:
Great view.  However they got rid of their happy hour.  I had wine, which was fine.  My partner ordered two manhattans.  The first one was just okay and the second one was terrible. He asked for a orange twist in the second one and it came with a lemon twist.

I'd take visitors there for ONE drink and the view, then leave.
author: Dale M.

description:
Gentlemen.....pull your barstools a little closer and I will share with you the secret of The View.

The View is an outdated piano lounge and bar.....with a tremendous view. It's dark, cozy, upscale, and traditional. The comfortable chairs and stools, the candlelight, the professionalism of the staff, and the drinks that are served, all create the perfect environment. This type of environment is the supreme catalyst for completing the ultimate assignment.

That assignment, is to get laid.

It is not Mission Impossible here. It is the EASIEST place in the city to get this done. I've seen and been involved with more 'tang being pulled out of here than in a warehouse at NASA. The hotel is mostly full of convention attendees and tourists. This is the first, last, or only place they ALL go. Keep it simple and stay away from the tourists. The tourists are not going to be easy cuz they have agendas, plans, and time constraints. They want to go places and do things. They are here for the view and nothing else.

Go after the convention attendees. They are easy to spot. Some still have their badges on. That means you already know their NAMES! It doesn't get any easier, gentlemen. They have nothing to do, other than go to their seminars. They need to stay close to their hotel, so they are never late to a meeting, function, workshop, or trade show. They already have a ROOM! 

If they smoke, you smoke. I don't CARE if you don't smoke, it's not about that. The elevator trip down is your first shot at one-on-one conversation with no competition. The time spent outside is what you need to clear the way to a room invite. The elevator up to the room is for building sexual tension. If they don't smoke, then you NEED to move toward the idea of a little fresh air. The scenario will play out the same way.

This place serves very strong, adult cocktails. Your target will not be used to the potency of these drinks, and won't have the tolerance for them. These are professional, career-minded women. Some are married, some have families, ALL of them have taken the necessary measures to be properly groomed for traveling, and NONE of them will see you coming.

You may get lucky and find the one that actually goes to these conventions with the intent of getting laid while they are "away on business". Those types are out there my friends, and chances are they are here, at The View. If you run into that one, it will be the best lay of your life.

Here's the breakdown:
1 star for the view.....half the reason they landed in your "trap".
1 star for the cocktails.....REAL stiff - like you will be in room 3308.
1 star for the environment.....it creates the perfect sex storm.
1 star for the staff.....if you don't get laid, they will.

For any ladies that were listening.....the convention men are even more eager to take you to their room - and you can probably score a little extra cash. If you know what I mean.
author: Big J.

description: A good place to grab a drink for locals and tourists alike. There are plenty of window seats, I prefer the one facing the bay bridge and tall buildings than the other side which has a much plain-er view.  Drinks are expensive ($12-14) but totally worth it for the beautiful view.  Perfect for a date night or a girls night out. Totally reminded me of Chicago...
author: Jen K.

description: This bar is an extraordinary place to take friends visiting the area. It's always the first place I take someone (for happy hour) when they come to visit me in San Francisco. The views are outstanding, and there's plenty of comfortable seating. You may want to get there earlier in the evening rather than later if you want to find an awesome spot right by the window. A good thing to note about this place is their martini happy hour which goes from 4-6pm every evening. They have 3 specific martinis on special for half off at those times. Otherwise, be prepared to pay between $12-14 per drink. The appetizers and food options served here are going to rip your wallet a new one, so I wouldn't suggest getting any of the food here as you can find great food elsewhere for 1/3 of the price.
author: Ashley D.

description:
This really ups the romance factor.
Saturday night with a wildly sexy date can't be missed here.  The view of the bay bridge from the soft lighting of the couch was like heaven.  
Who could resist someone that gives you The City all a twinkle?
What you probably prefer to know...
No draft beer.  
Our server was generally better than what has been previously described, although she would have been more tactful.
The couch is cozy, you can't hear someone sitting across from you without raising your voice. However,  you can hear the one whispering  in your ear perfectly.  Oops, I digress.
This is a classic that could be refreshed to appeal more to the hip generation.  As it is, this is a great way to put the stars in th eyes of the object of your affection.
author: Ann M.

description:
Amazing view....if you are lucky enough to get a seat by the window and the fog hasn't rolled in just yet.
That's probably the only reason I'd head back to this hotel bar...the last of my tour of hotel bars with Eric W and Twee L.  The final stop on our best date ever.
It would have been fun to join all of the couples groping each other in their seats....but that wasn't what this date was about. (at least not the part that im sharing.  ;) )
It might have been weird to ditch Eric and Twee for the guy leering at me at the bar, but he was gross anyway.
Maybe at an earlier hour...when this bar hasn't become a total pick-up joint...or that hotel bar you bring the girl you just met on the street back to...id come back.  The view was pretty outstanding.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Great view!  The drinks - a bit pricey.  Some nights, it can be a struggle to get a romantic seat at the window for the spectacular view, especially on weekends. Come early before sunset and you might be in luck.    
When the lights go down in the City. 
And, the sun shines on the Bay. 
Do I want to be there in my City. 
ohoh ohohoh.
author: Marzan W.

description:
This place was a COMPLETE BIRTHDAY BUZZ KILL. 

After moping all weekend about my upcoming birthday, I decided last night, to just have fun and celebrate, so I go out to grab a drink with my favorite girls. 

First thing I saw was a nice, quiet room. I loved the ambiance... until the service ruined it. We sat there waiting for service for ten minutes before we got up to ask the bartender for a drink. When we get to the bartender and order our drinks, he gave us attitude as if he wanted to say, "Why didn't you just order from the waitress?" I turned around and the waitress told me that she would be "right over", so we go back to our table and wait. Ten minutes pass, no waitress, no drinks and we're thinking the bar is definitely not that busy, so we simply walked out.
author: M W.

description: Great views. Strong (very strong) drinks. This is a great place to bring out-of-towners! The drinks are around $8 during happy hour, but the place fills up quickly.  Even with the place being packed, the ambiance is  nice - very sophisticated.  I hear that the specialty martinis are delicious, but I didn't try one because I don't believe in $15 cocktails outside of NYC.
author: Jazmine S.

description: Wow! The view alone on a clear night is 5 stars. Another 5 stars for the sexy dim lounge. 5 stars for the mojitos. Best I've ever had! Mango, Passion fruit, Raspberry, oh my!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
It's expensive, the people hanging here are business casual and touristy, the cheese plate was just okay and the pita bread they serve with it is cold, but does any of that matter when you are looking at the insane view. Newp. Newp, it doesn't.

Yeah. It's that awesome. Definitely worth a ride up to the 39th floor for a looksee :)
author: Stephy S.

description: Nicer views that Top of the Mark as the windows are bigger. And more couches to lounge on. Great location and great for a drink or small plate of appetizers.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
When I'm feeling classy, I like to come up here. They can make a damn good Martini with Garlic Olives, and what better to gaze at while you sip a dirty martini, than our dirty city, next to our dirty bay. 

Also I love being in a hotel, it makes me feel like i'm on vacation.
author: Jevir G.

description: Definitely has a breath taking view of the city. So romantic at night. It's a MUST SEE.. I love working for a Marriott hotel. =D
author: Love R.

description: Wow, what a view!  This is at the top of the Marriott hotel.  This place is all about the view.  We were there Saturday night and it was very busy.  If there was no view, we would have not been there.  The staff seamed nice and accommodating, they moved a lounge chair over for us.   It was a cool place to hang out and have a drink.  Would totally recommend that you see "the view" at least once.
author: Christine T.

description: Mere days before the 'Jukebox Marriott' was scheduled to open in October 1989, the Loma Prieta quake rocked the city. Aside from some broken glassware, the View suffered no damage, which should reassure those who come here when the wind is strong and sip cocktails next to huge windows that vibrate with every gust. The lounge may not have the same prestige as the Top of the Mark, but it provides a panoramic view of downtown, the Bay Bridge, and Twin Peaks - over which, with any luck, you'll have the opportunity to witness the fog stealthily glide and descend to the neighborhoods below, obscuring them under a blanket of white.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Ahhhhh I love this place!!!! I didn't try the drinks, or the food, except for a mediocre creme brulee, but the view (hence the name) and the romantic vibe give it 5 stars in my book. It's a great place for a date, and it would also be a fun place to go with your girls for happy hour, or to bring your parents who would oooooh and ahhhh at the view. I'm going to state the obvious here, but the drinks are ridiculously overpriced, even at happy hour the cheapest drink would be about $7. But that wouldn't stop me from coming here again.
author: Sonya D.

description:
Nice, but limited View.  My mom used to work for Marriott  (~10 years ago) and I came here for a "Take Your Daughter to Work Day" event.  It used to have a wider view/larger seating area and of course I was not of age to drink.
 
My friends and I came here on Fourth of July after spending an hour driving around downtown to find a venue, we decided to come here since it was the only place that did not have a cover charge or minimum drink purchase.  

It is a very romantic venue, but a tad too dark.  All you could see were shadows and the bar.  The arrangement of the tables were a little cramped.  Street parking is horrible, unless you get extremely lucky [also since we came on Fourth of July, it was twice as bad].  

Since I'm not a heavy drinker, I don't enjoy shots or wine, so I ordered a Mango Puree Mojito and it was definitely THE BEST I EVER HAD!  Ever since then, I've fallen in love with mojitos.  Although it was a bit on the pricier side, $13!!! WTH, but seriously ever since then, I have not had anything comparable.  I would also recommend the Passionfruit Mojito.
author: Steph L.

description:
Perfect place for taking out-of-towners (as an out-of-towner, I know what I'm talking about!!), and for hanging out if you are in town for business. 

The service here is TOTALLY CRAP, though, so be warned! Go for a relaxed evening of hanging out with fun people - don't go if you want immediate service or are with nervous people.
author: Kellee S.

description:
Calling themselves 'The View' is a bit misleading.  It should be called 'Bar at a Higher Altitude than Most Other Bars and You Can See a Bunch of Beautiful Stuff From a Mildly Unspectacular Angle'

Expensive drinks; eat my face!
author: Patrick A.

description: Overpriced, but damn what a view!
author: Michael E.

description: Yes it's overpriced but this is a classy place with mind-blowing views: you get what you pay for. I recommend switching tables so that you can try out the different sides of the building! I can't wait to go back during daylight.
author: Darren O.

description: Aptly named (39th floor view is quite nice) and good wine list.  Had the cheese plate, relaxed in comfortable chairs, and took in how lovely SF looks from that far up.  Very helpful and attentive wait staff - good jump off for the evening or wind down after dinner.
author: K G.

description:
Im giving it a thumbs up as far as hotel bars go. Yes the place is a little dated - it doesnt have all of the carefully created flair of the XYZ at the W, nor does it have the old distinguished feel of, say, the Redwood Room.  I think that is part of its charm....this place is so straight out of the 80's you cant help but appreciate it. 

Hotel bar prices and hotel bar patrons, some may say this is a deal breaker in the land of bars of choice here in the city. I say it has a great view, its never too crowded and its just a good place to sit and have a conversation. Look out the window or at the person you are there with and you wont notice the clientelle. I like this place.
author: Drue C.

description: The drinks are overpriced, the food isn't great, but hey, the view is! The service has also usually been good. We come up here pretty much only for one expensive cocktail or glass of wine to enjoy the city view with people from out of town. It's worth doing every now and then!
author: Kristen L.

description: Great view, but disappointed to see that they serve the exact same menu as the bar in the lobby. Still worth a trip for a drink and great view of the city lights.
author: Regan M.

description:
As the name implies, it has a view.  Now how scenic that view is would be in the eye of the beholder (or in SF terms, depending on when the fog rolls in).  On a clear day/evening, the views are panoramic...if you're nice (or drunk) enough to overlook the skyscrapers looming nearby.  

I warn you, the drinks are STRONG and EXPENSIVE as others have pointed out.  But The View lounge provides a nice spot to enjoy the company of good friends without feeling rushed--or be schmoozed by random conference goers if that's your preference.  Best to sit on the bar side if you want extended service...they close off kitchen service to the non-bar side early so beware of that if you want food.  

The food, by the way, is quite good from what I can tell the times I've gone.  I remember some warm lavosh bread with hummus that we really enjoyed.  Can't remember what else...must've been about the time the drinks kicked in.  

Not sure how to describe the musical ambience here except for perhaps energy eclectic.  It varies from jazz to electronica to alternative and somewhere in between.  I've never found it annoying however.  

The restrooms are clean and seem to smell pleasant as far as I recall...you just need to stumble down a half-lit corridor to use them.  Good photo op for your friends if you choose the door to the opposite gender.  Give that a try next time you go and then post up here to let us all know!

Nothing new to add beyond what others have already posted than worth a visit here at least once.  Parking in the hotel garage is $11/hr.  I recommend using one of the nearby garages instead.
author: Jeff H.

description: Went several times already to the View and definitely would go again, I came couple times during the week around 8pm and its so nice when you can just pick any table and enjoy the evening and the view. Sat on several different spots at the View and there are different views everywhere. Would recommend if you want a quite evening during the week.
author: Anton P.

description: Such an awesome place. I took my girlfriend here during her first time in SF, and we had an amazing time. No reservations or waiting list is a bit of a bummer, but you just have to look for tables asking for their bill. Drinks are delicious, and unsurprisingly a bit steep, but definitely with it. 1 drink quickly turned into 4 at this place, as the view was just breathtaking and didn't get old. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Ned H.

description:
"+" points:
~ phenomenal SF view if you get window-side seating
~ chic-chic ambiance - but they still let us with my cherry-print black rubber galoshes, my friend's green parka, and well, the 3rd one had a tie already from work..
~ patron margarita was muy fabuloso, but d-d-d-d-aaayam $14 ?!
~ their ladies' bathroom had gorgeous, ever-so-sweet & fragrant white lillies in it -- (well shoot, if you charge me $14 for a dang margarita, you best make sure you put some lillies in the ladies room...mm hmm.)
~ free cocktail nuts!! yayyy =)

"-" points
~ my 3rd friend (the tie-wearing one) hopped on the nearby piano stool and busted out some melodious tunes as we were approaching our seats -- and literally 30 seconds after he was done playing and while we were ordering drinks, someone came up behind our table, and "discreetly" snapped the piano shut, and locked it with a key!!! (hahahahahhahahahahahhahhahah!!!) -- my point being: next time, just shut your damn "smoooth jazzzz" music off, and let my friend bust out (in tune) if he wants to.  punks.
~ man, it was pricey.

that's all folks.  fancy-shmancy. pricey. good drinks. not a huuuuuuge selection.  pretty standard.  tres romantique ~ *
author: Anjali V.

description: The pictures of the View do not do it justice.  The second I stepped into the room for a drink after work, I was just blown away.  The view of the city and the colors of the sunset are remarkable.  The place is dimly lit and has a great ambiance.  It wasn't hard to find a table, but perhaps that was because it had been raining all day.  The View has just become one of my new favorite places in the city.
author: Bert N.

description:
San Francisco has a multitude of better places than this, so the only reason to come here is for (surprise) the view!  360 degress of San Fran out the window is pretty nice.  Not having draft beer, the tiniest menu ever, and having to wait 60+ minutes for your food (and sometimes drink, to make a trek up a 39 floor elevator, is not so nice.

It's a place you should go to grab a drink and take in a quick view, but that's about it.
author: Andy F.

description:
Wow, Yelp reviewers are tough . . .   

I stopped here for a drink before the Yelp Holiday Party.  The view at night is gorgeous.    We were not one of the lucky ones seated next to a window, instead we were at a table, but it is still a spectacular view.  The lighting inside is purposely set low enough that the lights from the outside and the moon still overpower the lighting inside.  

It's beautiful and romantic.  I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Where do you go to check out San Francisco in all its magnificent glory?  Well, unless you happen to be driving on Treasure Island, your in-house view would be at, you guessed it, The View.  

On a clear day, if you're lucky to grab a table closer to the window (though I really feel there aren't any bad tables) the giant floor to ceiling windows show you why we San Franciscans love our City by the Bay so much.  And the same view at night seals the deal.  Drinks are drinks.  They're a little expensive, but think of it as paying for the view (which is another thing we San Franciscans do).  The bar offers a light menu of hot and cold snack/finger foods as well.  Nothing special, but it helps cushion the alcohol.

It's a great place to sit back and relax.  Have a cocktail and chat the night away with a group of good friends. 

OH!  Don't forget to look for the Martini glass.  It was the sole survivor of the bar from the 1989 earthquake.
author: Denise M.

description:
I haven't been to every hotel bar in the city because I have lived here for a long time and know the spots that I like to go.

I also for the most part hate anyone that 'travels on business' and doesn't have the guts to brave the world outside of the hotel bar and find some city charm. Most people drinking her are here to unwind and have a drink before bed.... yawn.

All that being said, this place is pretty damn classy and if you are trying to fuck the woman that you are with this place might help you out.  The huge windows that look on SF are tight.  There is usually some live music and the cocktail waitress' are nice and if you tip them will be sure and make you look like Hugh Grant in some RoCo.... thereby making your date cream (ask Katelin).

Anyway, the drinks are drinks.  The prices are high and the view is good.  If you are trying to bang that Mission Hipster that looks like a melting ice cream cone, this isn't the spot.  If you are taking out that girl that you know hasn't spent much time in the city and is willing to 'try new things'... you have her on lock.
author: Thadd L.

description: I have been to this place several times mostly after work with a friend.  The drinks were a bit pricey but good and you get what you pay for.  Their small bites were good too.  Love the spectacular view of this lounge.  Nice to come to especially around sunset or at night.
author: Ann R.

description:
Beautiful view (I'm a sucker for city lights). Seating is first come, first served - were able to steal some comfy arm chairs and two tables for a party of ten on a Sat night so, it worked out beautifully.  The smooth Latin House music wasn't so loud that I had to use a megaphone and sign language to communicate.  Our server was also very attentive - kept coming by to check up on us.  There is a food/dessert menu but, the kitchen had closed by the time we arrived (~10:30pm).  I'd definitely return with friends for a chill/lounge night in SF.

Site note:  The drink menu included a selection of "premium" water - including "10,000 B.C." water which has apparently been "locked in an icy vault for over 10,000 years" in the Coastal Glacier Range in British Columbia and "comes from melted glacier ice,.."  Naturally, my friends and I held a "good ol' free municipal tap water" vs "$14 per bottle 10,000 B.C. water" competition.  It was unanimous.  There was no competition, no comparison - there is NO WAY this 10,000 B.C. water tastes anything like tap water.  In fact, this 10,000 B.C. water tastes like f'ing DIRT.  Dirty water.  Bathwater.  WTF.  I'm surprised I didn't see sediment floating in the bottle.  My untrained, uncouth palate definitely prefers the chemically treated municipal tap water.
author: Nancy L.

description:
What a view!

The view is a beautiful lounge that sits on the top floor of the Marriot. The lounge features huge windows that provides breath taking views of San Francisco. This is definitly a great place to bring a date. Be sure to arrive early to get a nice window seat.

Drinks are great however they are really pricy. The small eats are tasty as well but again they are pricy. I hesistated to give this place 4 stars because the service is pretty lousy. Usually there is only 1 bartender and 1 waitress. They are slow to take orders and you have to constantly grab their attention if you need something. The place is also very very dark at night. It is hard to read the menu or even see your date.

This place is good, but could do better with their service.
author: David W.

description:
I love taking out of towners here. Okay, I love coming here whether I have visiters or not. It's old school swanky, and it's fun. I always feel fancy when I go here. 

I'd give it 5 stars, but sometimes it take FOREVER to get a drink.
author: Kristen H.

description:
Not sure if I would like this place during the day, but I definitely did at night.  After a night on the town, the man and I came to The View for a nightcap.  The atmosphere was chick, and was filled with what seemed to be people out for the night, not tourists or business men with a grudge over life.  Some corners of the lounge were laid back and intimate, others were bumpin with girls in short dress & high heels with strange men buying their cocktails.

Standard cocktail options, I did not like that they made my top shelf  vodka martini with Smirnoff.  The drinks are 8-15 a pop, but this is the same anywhere else in this part of the city.  service sucks, so when it's time to leave go up front and find your tab.

We sat at a dark table, in the corner away from everything, watching the fog roll in over the bay bridge at 1am.  How cool is that?
author: K M.

description: Glorious view! Grab a glass of wine and choose the right corner ..enjoy the Golden Gate bridge or the Bay bridge view while you sip wine and forget everything else. Cozy  and relaxing...also perfect for one of those romantic evenings!
author: S S.

description:
I feel like I'm behind the big clock at the view... you know like every movie that has the villain living behind the big clock in some tall building in some big city. 
Well this is MY big City and this is MY big clock and these are MY expensive drinks and this is MY big view... so go find your own... unless you take me to the view with you.
author: Rada I.

description:
Very nice views, unfortunately obstructed by the metal beams in the window. Honestly though, with a view this nice, you can't really complain. The cocktails we had were $14 each. My friend insisted her cosmo was the strongest ever. For $14, it better be.

My cocktail, the Para View, was really good: pomegranate and vodka and something else, in a chilled martini glass with a sugar rim. Bad thing about the sugar rim, the sugar melts down with the condensation and makes the entire glass sticky. So drink fast!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Like the name, it's all about the VIEW!!

It's nice, quiet, and not crowded.  We had champagne to celebrate my ears piercing, cost $10.00 a glass with free nuts to munch.  Heard that the service is not too good.  We sat at the bar with very nice bartender service though.  Good for a romantic moment or couple friends' chitchat.  Beautiful view of bay bridge and SF.
author: Smiley W.

description:
Views of the city on a clear day makes me happy.

It is a great place for appetizers and cocktails after work. You'll have to come with your own people, because you wont find many here. It doesn't keep a crowd, but attracts a few business peeps for a cocktail none of which will be single.
author: Dee C.

description:
Whenever I have company, ususally my first stop is The View.  Especially on a clear day/night, the view is breathtaking.  That alone gives it 5 stars.  Then you add some mellow music or some nights, dance tracks and one of the BEST sidecars in the city and you have hit the spot.  I try sidecars everywhere I go and The View has stay consistant and delicious EVERY time.  Then a few years back they changed their menu to a more indo/asian faire and I fell in love all over again!!  I've been here for happy hour, to meet a group, or just to hang by myself on a personal night.  I must say, it's a SF Gem.  It can actually be a real fun night when tourist have a few to many and spontaneous dancing erupts....COMEDY!!!

Just an update:

The menu has changed to "American" cuisine & is BORING.I can make a better turkey club sandwich @ home! It loses a star for that!! My sidecar has never been better though!!
author: M G.

description:
Been here numerous times with various people, including my grandma (yes, she likes her coffee spiked with Bailey's) and friends from out of town.  

Drinks are kind of expensive but the service is fairly good-- and the view is, of course, nice.  Not breath taking, but definitely nice, especially for people who aren't from the city.  Seating is either at a table, sofa + coffee table, bar, or bar height table + bar height chairs (I haven't a clue what they're called and think "high chair" is something babies sit in, so please pardon my eloquence).  

I've noticed that during the early afternoon, there isn't as much alcohol in their drinks, but by six p.m.?  Definitely more booze!  Tiramisu is a nice complement to the coffee drinks.  Asian-style rice snacks are included.
author: Lynn O.

description:
Let's be honest, the view is EFFING amazing.

The crowd? More 45+, suit with lapel pin, than sexy. I think there was an American Management Association meeting in the hotel and a lapel pin is an apparent prerequisite. 

Luckily they started playing hip-hop and cleared them out to make room for our Ad Agency happy hour. It's kinda hard to have an impromptu get-together here because they have upholstered chairs around low tables. Inevitably people are perched on arm rests.

The mojitos will get you tore up.
author: Eli B.

description:
What a great place to end up at after long day of work. The view is exactly what it is-a beautiful view. I was supposed to just go for a "drink", but ended up having a bottle of Riesling and admiring the gorgeous view of SF.

I recommend going here if you find yourself frustrated with life in SF, and are considering to move out of this expensive city. Once you step out of those elevators and look around, all of your frustrations will be nothing but a distant memory. 

While you're there, step up to the bar and order yourself one of their many expensive drinks and grab a window seat. The bartenders there in their corporate uniforms are very friendly. I assume its because they  have a beautiful view to look at all day long...

Sigh. So zen.
author: First C.

description:
My husband and I actually went here on our first date....While we were there Gary Coleman (The guy from the CashCall commercials) was sitting a few tables away from us.  He didn't look too happy!

The View, well, has a great view.  We only had a few drinks while we were there.  I think it is a nice place for a first date or if you are looking for somewhere to just hang and get a few drinks....
author: J R.

description: Perfect spot to gaze at an amazing view and enjoy a drink.  A little pricy, but worth it!
author: Janis S.

description: Nice place to take a visitor for views of the city (make sure to sit on the non-Bay Bridge side). Very slow and unapologetic service is the downside.
author: William N.

description: It's definitely a great place to go and have a drink right after work especially on a Friday night. I never got a chance to try out any of there food but would definitely go again maybe with a date. The view is amazing :)
author: Iris M.

description: Great place to go with a group of people or a romantic date. I don't think they take reservations but you don't need to since it's a first come situation. Great views of the city and fantastic full bar selection. The service could be better but it's still better than most bars. It's a classy place but they don't frown upon those who aren't dressy.
author: Hayley H.

description: The view is nice but it was quite crowded and hard to find a seat. The service was good and the dessert we ordered was not bad!
author: L W.

description:
Sometimes you gotta play tourist in your own city. So when that urge hit the other day, my friend and I headed to the View, where neither of us had been before, to partake in a post-work libation.

The view was spectacular and totally worth the visit, but the ambiance was totally lacking.  The little nibbles (some tomato/mozz dealio) also left something to be desired.
author: Marcus C.

description:
I enjoy coming up here for drinks at night. There is nothing like having a drink with a wonderful night view.

However, I don't like the service here. The waiter's I don't find that friendly. The bartenders are friendlier though. Also, if you sit at the back no one serves you and you have to go to the bar. Only if you sit in the front section are you served.

And drinks are pretty pricey, but at least there is a view.
author: Michelle L.

description: The view is about all that is good about that place. I paid $28 for two VERY mediocre cocktails and bitched about it every sip. Seriously, I love booze, and I could barely choke this drink down. Tasted kind of like toilet water (not that I have ever tasted it...). The lady had better things to say about it, and I will agree with her that sitting at a table with a beautiful view is pretty awesome, I just wish they would put a little bit more effort into their specialty drinks. I am willing to shell out some cash for a drink made with fresh ingredients, top quality liquor and love. And the decor. Pretty weird.
author: Natalie D.

description:
5 stars for the decor and view alone.  Comfy lounge where you can unwind, take in the sites of the city and Bay, and have A drink.  I say A as their drinks are a bit pricey and they don't have a Happy Hour (at least none that I noticed).   Their "munchies" menu has less options than it did a few years ago, and start at $13 for eggrolls.  Wow.

They do make a pretty mean passion fruit mojito.  But the small glass and hefty tag limit the amount of time I'll be spending here.  I'm not a cheap date by any means, so if it's going to take over 100 bucks to get me slightly buzzed, I'd rather get inebriated at a place that does have a Happy Hour.
author: Riza A.

description: Stay at this hotel often and one of the main reasons is because of " The View".What else can be said ? Day or Night it is a cool spot to check out the City.The drinks are OK and seating and music is good.Take a ride to the TOP and ck this out !
author: Joe P.

description:
I didn't like anything about this place besides the view (what we came for) and the chocolate mousse cake.. The waitress was quite rude and took my credit card as we ordered our drinks.. Like the two of us were going dine and dash!! I didn't see her taking anyone else's CC before they were ready to leave. That pissed me off. Also i checked my online statement and they charged me extra so i'm going to see whether that is just the "hold" on my cc or it's the payment to them (bullsh*t either way).

A sidenote: the chairs were really uncomfortable, no one in the lounge looked comfortable. Everyone was either perched on the very end of their chair leaning on the table or totally slouched into the back of the chair. 

For the money, view, and experience I prefer the Carnelian Room.
author: rukshan b.

description: Excellent place to have a drink and some bar snacks if you're in the area.  Fantastic view.  Glad to have attended a tweet up here so that I learned of this place's existence!
author: Prettylilredhead H.

description:
Frankly, if I am going to be paying $7 for a Stella, I don't think it's too much to expect that said beverage would come from a tap. Alas, no. It's a bottle and a chilled glass (which I had to pour myself).

Our waitress seemed busy, and our service wasn't great. After giving us our drinks she pretty much slammed a small thing of rice crackers on our table while her back was turned to us, as she was taking orders from the table next to us at the time. But she did redeem herself when my friend left her glasses on the table as we left and she frantically chased us down to return the spectacles.

I do love city views at night (and day), so it is decent for that, but that's about it. Not my type of crowd (think tourists in town for conventions) and not enough bang for your buck.
author: Tara B.

description: I was brought here by a super cute boy the other night :) Man is he smart! The view here was just amazing! Was not expecting that from the Marriott! I ordered a Cosmo.. pretty standard right? No clue what the server brought me- some bitter grapefruit something... I was too distracted by the view to care though ;)
author: maria K.

description:
The whole experience resembles the opening of The Mysteries of Pittsburgh, about riding the elevator up, and the red monkey attendants, and the dirigible of August.  Appropriate period piece too: like 1986.  

It's not cheap, but the prices aren't insulting.  They could have gotten away with charging 50% more, especially with the oligopoly on view bars, and most patrons on expense accounts.  This is San Francisco, right!  And food prices aren't bad.  The food is surprisingly well-prepared. 

I've never been able to extract kindness from the waitstaff.  They hate their jobs, and you're the nth tourist they have to put up with today.  Actually, with the lighting, the staff's dour faces, and the way they march around the room, I think of the old commercial purporting to portray a Soviet fashion show -- eveningvear, svimvear.
author: Non P.

description: My friends and I got here before the crowd and the fog. The 360 view of the city is wonderful. The only happy hour special they had were Skyy Vodka martinis. Didn't try the food, however; I just really enjoyed the company and the view.
author: Devy E.

description: The view is awesome If you are into seeing lots of lights and the view of San Francisco. The service is slow and crowd is very touristy. I guess your paying for the view and the ambiance.
author: Kayla G.

description:
naw ,nope,  no thanks ... I will stick to the ground better yet go to the roof top of my own building...

Overpriced drinks, dirty windows and a convention crowd makes for one hell of a bad time.
author: Teddy d.

description:
If you are local, go here.
If you are visiting SF, go here.
If you want a great place to take your GF/BF, go here.

Basically, anyone will enjoy the beautiful view and the great drinks here except for those scared of heights or those with an empty wallet as drinks can be a little pricey. Even then, it's definitely worth a visit.
author: kat a.

description:
Pit stop back in San Francisco (for like 24 hours). Time to check out the top of the marriot and see what it's all about.

I'll admit, the view up here is pretty unbelievable. And the bar knows it. As a result, they kind of slack on the overall quality (think of the top of the pru in boston). 

the bartender also harassed us about our IDs and started quizzing us on our dates of birth. please dude - if I'm at the view, wearing a velvet blazer, ordering a martini, do you think I'm an underager trying to score booze? 

yeah, no.
author: David D.

description:
It's a great view...
1st impression, WOW - I'm scared!    Look at that view and this drink is pretty good.
2nd visit, i was turned away because of some private function.
3rd visit, they need to refurbish but this drink still good!
4th visit, can't remember as I was too wasted to appreciate any changes or the view...
But I'm coming back.
author: Yamil A.

description: Holy shit, this place is PHASE FOUR! You could literally rent a plane, fly to LA, have a beer, fly back and it would be cheaper than two drinks and a sample platter here but I don't even care, I would go back in two seconds.  We were eating next to Jay-Z and Beyonce, Phil Collins came in and sang every song he wrote for the Tarzan soundtrack (maybe none?), the oxygen was spiked with E, and the views were unfuckingreal. The only thing that pulled me down from cloud nine was that basil drink. Get out of my face, basil. You're an herb.
author: carineve u.

description: Jessica is a very friendly cocktailer :) However, the bartender was working a little sloppy today; we had to send back two poorly made drinks. Jessica was a doll & didn't charge us for them. Lovely view, as always. Also, get the Lemon Drop.
author: Daisy D.

description: Nice view on San Francisco. Ambiance is a bit strict but really a good place to go for a drink in clouds.
author: bastienlatge

description: This place makes me feel like a million bucks!  Not just becasue I spend like a million everytime I come (just kidding)....but it is the kind place that I imagined myself lounging around in when I was 10 years old dreaming of being a grown up with a big,grown up life in the city. When I am having a Dorian Leigh moment and want to get my "Holly Golightly" on- this is where I come.  The views are worth naming the restaruant after, the drinks are consistant, and happy hour is from 4-6 on all Skyy Vodka drinks (about $7)...and if you are hungry you can order a Lobster Roll and pretend it's room service...About $50 for two people...get there before 5:00 to get a prime view.
author: Sarah M.

description: It's pricey, but the view and atmosphere is well worth it. There was a fantastic view of the city and comfortable seating and lighting. The drinks were very expensive and the selection wasn't fantastic (esp. for the price), but the atmosphere makes up for that.
author: Jason K.

description: WOW...what a VIEW! Expensive drinks...but the view is what makes it worth it for a drink or two.  Got there about an hour before closing time and it was pretty busy, but we were still able to get a table by the window.
author: Jaime M.

description: One of my favorite spots to just lounge, have a few drinks, and enjoy the view.  The food is quite tasty and worth the price which can be a little high.   This place is jazzy, classy, laid back, and comfy.  If you're expecting something a little more lively, rowdy, and a bit more sporty, check out the sports pub downstairs in the corner.  .
author: Danny L.

description:
When Mister Chao and out of town friends were denied at the door of the Press Club because of a private event.  Thinking quickly, MIster Chao recommended the View as it was a clear night and has an impressive view.  Unfortunately, since Mister Chao rolls deep, he ended up at the back corner facing CIty Hall as they only had 1 or 2 tables that would accommodate the 10 friends he brought along. 

Unfortunately, Mister Chao was thinking of a glass or bottle of wine, but the wine list at the View was embarrassingly short.  However,  Mister Chao then quickly realized that the whiskey selection at the view was quite robust for a hotel bar, so he decided to switch to whiskey.

Mister Chao's friends enjoyed the view, the drinks, and company and would go back again.   Mister Chao would like to mention that drinks at the View are a little on the expensive side, but well worth the view.
author: Mister Chao ..

description:
5 stars for the view...makes sense considering the name of the place.  At least it lives up to that expectation!

Mango mojito is soo good, but it's a pretty pricey.  Still, a great place to hangout.  I need to come back here...with a date next time.
author: Justin L.

description: Gorgeous view of a gorgeous city! Located at the very top of the Marriott Marquis. The vibe in here is still a very hotel vibe. Mostly an older crowd of business people. Drinks are expensive so I recommend getting a drink, taking in the view and walking to a nearby dive bar (Tempest!).
author: Rochelle I.

description:
If you like a very sexy place to go have a drink with a date or with friends, this is it. The drinks are expensive, but they are massive and strong. The ambiance in the evenings, if you are lucky to get a spot by the window, can't be beat. They have these cool chairs and sofas to lounge on, nice background music, and the view is the best I have seen in the city. I like this place much better than Top of the Mark, unless you are looking for a very high end crowd kinda scene.

The crowd here is always a nice mix . . . its a downtown SF hotel in that regard. I love that there is no cover and just as fun/nice as similar bars that have the nerve to charge $15 on a Saturday (Starlight  . . . really now).

Anyhow . . . I highly recommend. Just try it for a drink once and see what you think!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Decided to check into the hotel and hide for a few days.  After working a few hours, I headed up to The View for a happy hour cocktail.  It was good.  Even better was the waitress who sat down to chat. Very friendly.  I ordered the blood orange side car and the cheese plate both were excellent.  The View is absolutely amazing!  I will be back!
author: Kathryn F.

description: Great for a drink and enjoy the very beautiful view of San Francisco . But not for the food
author: Micky B.

description:
obviously the view is amazing. That's why you go. That's the only reason why you go. The service is terrible. The drinks *are not good*

I'm totally fine with $15 drinks if they are made well, measured, loved. But filling a glass with ice, bourbon, and topping it off with soda water from a soda gun is just wrong.
author: Sachin A.

description:
Had the pleasure of staying at this hotel twice during Macworld. 

I only found this place due to my childlike behavior of riding to the top of the elevator trying to find the roof top. Boy did I ever! As I walked out of the elevator and into The View I was automatically mesmerized. I suddenly didn't even care that I was poorly dressed in my Macworld attire, I went straight in there and got a seat next to the windows and enjoyed a cocktail or two. Breathtaking views! 

Later on during the week I took my sister up to The View, finally a place she hadn't been to in the city yet. We both really enjoyed ourselves. It's really dark during the evening and I appreciated that, you get a better view of the city.

Don't let the staff there make you feel lower class just because you don't order $100 worth of drinks, just let yourself enjoy it and ignore all the snobs.
author: Ericka A.

description:
Alright, I have to be bias here. I work at the Marriot so I have to say good things about the place. Remind you I do get free parking and discount on drinks and food. 

Lets start when you get in, you can choose to valet your car for $11 for 1st hour, add another $6 plus tax for hours preceding after that. If you find that to much then you may park your car across the street at the 5th and mission parking garage for $2.50 an hour.

You make your way to the main lobby where bellmen, concierge greet you and your date. You then make your way to the high rise elevators to the 34/7th floor (#$%^! i forget the floor it says "the view"). 

The View usually has live lounge music. Drinks are nothing great, international cocktails, a bit over priced but you do pay for the service and great view so its ok i guess. Anyhow, just sit back, listen to the hotel lounge music, sip on your international cocktail and enjoy the view with your frined(s).
author: Jose S.

description:
There's a reason why this place is called "The View" - because it's the best thing about the place.  As you walk around the lounge you can see the whole city and wow is it a sight to see.  Sunset is the ideal time to go if you want to see the lights on the Bay Bridge coming on as the sun goes down.

Notice I haven't spoken about much else; that's because there isn't much else to speak of.  The house drinks are mediocre, the service is mediocre, and the food is mediocre.  If you go during a busy time, it will take you an impossibly long time to get your drinks.  They really need to get more servers and/or bartenders.  The food is expensive for the amount you get and the portions are mismatched.  For example, if you choose to get a cheese plate you'll always run out of cheese before you run out of crackers (or vice versa).

This is a great date spot and great group spot as long as you're not going on a Friday or Saturday night.  Go any other night and you won't have any serious issues.  I'm notoriously difficult on hotel bars... mainly because I like them so much.  Will I be going back here?  Definitely.  As I said: the view is amazing.
author: Kurt C.

description: In town to see Cats and had to drop by for a drink and Nosh.  The martini hour was great and the food was contemporary and satisfying.  The seared tuna particularly good and the basil infused oil on this and another dish we had was very pleasant.  Great place to take an out of towner   We arrived at 5:30 on a Friday night and easily found a seat at a window with a great view, comfortable seats and great service.
author: Tony G.

description: Go figure! San Francisco doesn't have many restaurants/bars with a cityscape view. This is one of the few and it's a gem! This place is more of a bar lounge rather than restaurant although they do serve food. I only had a couple glasses of wine so I can't comment on the food. The staff were super nice! The wine list was pretty good. Glasses of wine ranged between $12 to $15. I will definately be returning to this place. It's a good spot to bring out-of-towners.
author: Yara R.

description: It's at the top of the Marriott in Union Square.  You can't go wrong.  Great view, good service, and plenty of drinks to make you good and happy.
author: Joe D.

description:
It can take a while for service to notice you, but once they take your order, it's a pretty decent turn-around and they're friendly.

Drinks are pretty good and the nibbly food is tasty. Bit pricy... but still tasty. I loved the duck pate and the chicken skewers and kobe beef thing was great too. The jars of complementary nut mix was yummy too.

The best part of the restaurant is the view. It's spectacular and there's plenty of tables with views... Actually, I think all tables had a view! Very impressive.
author: Sue T.

description:
I never even knew this place existed, but my buddy Pat P. clued me in.  It's at the top of the Marriott, and has great panoramic views of the FiDi/SOMA districts.

A really mellow vibe, with darkened lighting.  This would be a great place to bring a date or meet up with friends for a drink or two.  A little pricey, but what bar in SF isn't?  

I personally enjoyed a glass of 16 year old Lagavulin and soaked in the spectacular scenery.  

Didn't stay here very long, but would definitely return.
author: Wade Y.

description:
One of the best places to go to mix it up with the touristas!  The View Lounge is located atop the Marriot on 4th Street.  Easily accessible from BART or MUNI, at the Powell Street Station.

This is a great place to go for a quick drink after going shopping or to Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, SFMOMA or the Metreon (ick!).  Sit down and admire the views!  They have an extensive list of house specialty cocktails and full bar, and some snacky-poos as well.

Of course, the View is outstanding because of...  the view!  This is a great place to bring the out of towners for a cocktail and picture taking as well (hopefully on a fogless day/evening).
author: David S.

description:
Specialty drinks are around $14-you're paying for the view. The overall feel of this place is a hip Death Star meets the 60's. Austin Powers, Darth Vader, and Sinatra is what comes to my mind. The giant windows remind me of a scene from The Empire Strikes Back.

Anyway, good view, good decor, mediocre drinks. A must do at least once.
author: Robert V.

description: I love this place. Be ready to play musical chairs as everybody wants to be close to the windows and the beautiful view of the bay... It comes with a price it is not cheap but I think it is worth it.. Great mango mojitos... I will definitely be back
author: Carpe D.

description: Came here with my friends after a long adventurous day in San Francisco. The view at The View (I just wanted to say that because of the name) was just magnificent. It's a really nice place to sit back and enjoy the night view with a few close friends or a date. The drinks were pricey, but they were good. And the place wasn't crazy crowded, so we were able to migrate from one end to the other trying to enjoy the different views.
author: Sandy C.

description: Tourist central of course, so be prepared to be overcharged.  The view is pretty cool though, the service was good, but the tourists and the scammers were enough to put me off the place, i felt like it was crawling with gigolos and call girls cruising for "marks".  Kind of a seedy under current.  My friend and I were approached by several of these people trying to strike up a conversation.  Very weird vibe, not sure I'd recommend visitors go to this bar by themselves!
author: sasha y.

description: Well, a tad pricey, but what'd you expect? It is a hotel bar after all. And the VIEW is amazing. Love the windows and alcoves and the fact that the view is 360. Had a salad and pizza- both were pretty darn tasty. However, $12 for a glass of KJ chard is...lame.
author: Jina E.

description:
First, this place is classified as "Jazz and Blues" on yelp. I have never heard Jazz or Blues in there. The music since Ricky took over as manager is more electronic type (nightmares on wax, air, and other groups like this). Very good lounge music if you ask me (It's not "rave" music btw in case I am not being clear on what electronic means).

The View has "The View"! (thank you captain obvious!). Take out of towners here. They do make great drinks. Not the cheapest things(certainly not the most expensive either), and worth buying at least one just to hang out and relax with. It is a great place to hang out, talk, get to know the people you are with, and experience the beauty of San Francisco.

Just remember that it doesn't open until 4pm. It might be confusing on how to get up there for your first time so just ask one of the people in the lobby where the "high rise elevators" are and take them to the top floor. If you have never been at least go check out the view, even if you don't buy anything. It is a "do not miss" in my book.
author: Matthew D.

description:
I'd give 5 but the appetizers are hella expensive, well for a starving artist/college student.  You can't have it all, since the view is extraordinary!

One of the best views of the city, specially when its raining!
author: J P.

description: Breathtaking! I have been dreaming months to find a lounge bar with a ... view ... like this one. I'm so grateful to my Indian friend who brought me here for a delighting Martini cocktail.  Mandatory experience for anybody not suffering from vertigo!
author: Andrea L.

description: I didn't have much time to spend here, I only had one drink. What a sexy spot! I was surprised how crowded it was on a Tues nite. There must be a spectacular view but of course it's summertime in SF which means we were completely fogged in. Even with the fog it looked pretty cool. I will have to go back another time to see the view and try some food.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Went to the The View on a rainy night --- Looking out those crazy, spiderweb windows onto the city lights, with rivulets of rainwater streaming down the panes of glass, made me feel like I was sitting above Gotham City. 

Except, it was really San Francisco and so I ended up paying $15 for a mediocre drink.
author: TRexALot E.

description:
The view is phenomenal. A great place to take a date for a drink after dinner. The drinks are rather expensive for what you get ($9 well gin and tonics anyone?). 

The atmosphere/music was really laid back on the Monday night we were there. It's listed under blues/jazz so I'll assume that's what they usually do there, but when we were there they just had some really mellow but modern music in the background. It was cool.

 The view is certainly the best thing about the place but that itself makes it worth stopping by for a drink or two. Just be sure to get a seat  facing the Bay Bridge (that's the better view!).
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
For living in the bay area so long, I did not know about this place.  Went here on Saturday night after a birthday dinner, and this place had the most spectacular view.  I think that it was on the 39th floor of the Marriott.  The whole wall is a window which has to be atleast 30 feet high and gives an almost panoramic view of the City on both sides.  

This rating is only for the view itself.  The bar and waiter service is horrible at this place and the drinks are overpriced so don't expect much.
author: daniel j.

description:
The view = Spectacular. The service = underwhelming.

Walking out of the elevator onto the 39th floor of the Marriott building into a swanky lounge that has floor to ceiling windows was breathtaking at sunset. But that's about all that was good.

I am a patient person, who has been in the service industry for quite some time, so I understand when things get busy, it takes time to visit every table. We didn't see our server for almost 15 minutes. I was willing to overlook that but, it just kept getting better. When the waiter came with our cocktails, my friends and I were chit chatting, since we hadn't seen each other in a while. The server said 'I need you to stop talking so I can give you your drinks'. I'm sorry but that is NOT something you say to a customer. How about 'Excuse me?' 

We had our cocktails and I was going to pay out my tab and go. Since the server was no where to be found, I tracked down someone else to ask them to get grab just my tab, because my two friends wanted to stick around. Our server came over and asked me if I just I wanted to pay out or if the whole table did. I said just me, but as the server stepped away everyone decided it was time to go anyway. So I hopped up and caught up with our server and said 'Actually, the whole table wants to close out'. His response was 'Fine' while looking in the opposite direction.
