 When we got our bill I was a little surprised to see that my fairly standard cocktail cost me $20, but whatever, it's a hotel, they over price everything. Well the next morning, I check my bank statement and they charged $50 to my credit card. I tried to call this morning to dispute it with them before I went to my bank and I was transferred to four different people before getting someone's voice mail. Needless to say, not a very good experience.
author: Emma C.

description: I would love to be taken on a date here!! The name of this joint really holds up! DUH. Even if you're from the city, and not an out of towner, is still lovely to come up here! The drinks were strong, well if you ask for a vodka on ice ;). and you need to get here a little early to get a table or sofa next to the window.  Plus you can really chill here for a long time, with bar apps! yum!!
author: Maureen M.

description:
I was so happy i stayed at this hotel and amazed by this bar.
staying at a nice city and viewing it from above is unbeleivable.
didnt order any food here but i went to 18th flr high rise building concierge. complimentary breakfast, snacks and desert was great.
I highly appreciated the buy one night, get one free night stay offer.
i cant wait to be back here.
author: Poorman M.

description:
The view is pretty amazing.

Service is quick. Food is pretty good. Drinks are a bit pricey.

They have lots of lounge chairs and seating. It looks pretty fancy, but the dress code is casual. It's a good place to chill with friends on a Sunday afternoon. It's also a great place to bring folks on a more formal occasion.
author: Daria M.

description: Honestly, a GREAT place to take out of towners to look at the city. The drink prices hovered around 14 dollars, but you're paying for the view. Service was great, everyone seemed nice. I deducted a star for the FILTHY bathroom. It smelled so overpoweringly like urine it was awful. Clean it ASAP!
author: Owen T.

description: This place is one of the best kept secrets in San Francisco!! Amazing views of both the bay and the city.  My husband and I take out of town guests here all the time for a drink and to take in the view.  Not quite as good as Top of the Mark, but for the convenience and lack of crowd factor, it can't be beat!  The drinks are good (a little pricey but you're in a hotel so it's expected) and the appetizers are great too.  We also come here for a cocktail sometimes before heading out to a nice dinner.  Very relaxing, nice atmosphere with amazing views!
author: Alison J.

description:
i think this is the closest i'll ever be to driving the millenium falcon, or standing on the deck of the deathstar.

came here for a work sponsored happy hour.  a little shishi for my tastes, but that has nothing against this bar.  For our little conference sponsored niche, the service wasn't bad, the appetizer food wasn't bad either.  what struck me was the view, it is pretty damn nice.  thus the name of the joint.

because it's simply not my type of joint, i may not be a regular here, but will definitely come when out of town guests are visiting and want a "damn this is pretty nice".
author: Jason J.

description: The View really lives up to it's name.. but that's about all .. When they charge $6 for a cranberry juice.. then that's when you go hmm.. a little over priced!  Their cocktails weren't that great eithe.  it's clear that you come here to enjoy the ambiance and "View" and not the drinks..  amazing at night by the window though..
author: Margie C.

description: This is definitely a good spot to hit up for a date.  The atmosphere is super loungey and the views are obviously amazing, as it's called "The View."  Drinks are pretty ridiculously expensive, but it's definitely a romantical spot and I'd like to go back sometime during sundown.  The server was friendly and you don't need to dress up either.  It looks pretty pretentious when you walk inside, but then you see all the tourists strolling in wearing jeans.
author: Jenny W.

description: I went here on a Saturday night and this lounge was great. We went with a rather large group for someone's birthday and I truly enjoyed it. The place had a great view of the City and wasn't overly crowded to the point where I couldn't walk around. Also the drinks were moderately priced and were not overly expensive.
author: Kunal K.

description: If you seriously want to fall in love with our fair City all over again, just pop up here on a clear night. And the exquisite, recently completed renovations (throughout the entire hotel, actually) make this lounge the poshest spice of them all.
author: Gregor G.

description:
my absolute favorite hotel bar... i love going on a sunday night when the tourists are gone. just amazing views! better than the top of the mark because its darker, smaller and cozier. its a great place for a date, especially if you can get one of those great little tables off to the side but right in front of the window... seating is nice and cushy, especially if you get one of the couches.  just perfect for a quiet night... or whispering suggestive remarks into your dates ear all night.

PS: the bartender told us a fun story about this place. during the 89 quake every single glass broke in the bar except for 1 martini glass... they have that martini glass in glass so you can see it.
author: Michelle I.

description: Service was slow and cocktails were watery. Drinks were $10-13 each.  The view was excellent, but there isn't much else to brag about.  Skip it if you are only in town for a day.
author: Bradley F.

description: You definitely feel like you are in the Death Star... waiting for Darth to sit down for a cocktail. The service is slow, but honestly I like it. They don't try to churn you out. They allow you to enjoy your company, conversation and the outstanding views.
author: Aaron S.

description:
love' the view' of the city! oh so romantico!!!
sipping drinks looking at the most beautiful city in the world w/ ur love!
that is all i want to do there! =)

Had friends visiting out of town last sat.They enjoyed the atmosphere, the drinks and the view of course! So why not, take your guests there for one side of the SF experience!
wd. def. come back here again.
author: C A.

description: I've lived in the city for almost 10 years now, have been working a block away for more than 5 years, and was taken here for the first time yesterday.  It was in the evening and was in awe by the view...it was amazing.  Such a kick-ass perspective of the city.  Ordered my champagne, some cheese, and I was in urban bliss.  Very cool.
author: Adrian N.

description:
Two main things will come to mind when you get off the high-speed elevator to the 39th floor of the Marriott: View and Vertigo. Louisa and I needed a minute before we could approach the windows and enjoy the View lounge properly. We first sat at the west-facing side of the lounge, which we realized had already been closed off to new patrons, so we had to move to the east-facing side. We found a table for 3 pretty easily, but it was in a pretty bad location for viewing the city. We were waiting for a while before a waitress finally came over and apologized for the wait, then waited a bit longer before ordering drinks ($14 for a mango mojito! $7 or 9 or something for a beer, AND they didn't have any beer on tap). We got the drinks pretty quickly, though, and around that time someone in the corner nearby left and offered us his table. So we were able to enjoy our alcohol right next to the window-- a little daunting, but really fun.

This is definitely someplace to go now and then, and to bring touristy friends and dates with you. But seriously I think our 3-drink tab came out to almost $40, and we never saw that waitress again after getting our drinks. Trendy bars are not in short supply, and they're generally cheaper, with better service, than that.
author: Caroline C.

description:
THE VIEW? THE VIEW ... OF WHAHHHHHHHHT? there ain't no 'spectacular' view... pshhhhh

Ehhhh ... coming from the Signature Lounge, on the 96th floor of the John Hancock Building in Chicago to the 39th floor of the Marriott Hotel SF just doesn't do it for me...  that's like 57 more floors (i did the math correctly, right?!)

Sure enough, i'll 'pretend' that i haven't been to the Sig Lounge and write a review of its own...

The view: it was aiight ... i went around 9ish, so the view was just, blah... simply buildings... why not, the GG or Bay Bridge?

BORRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR~iNG!

is it where i was sitting? nonetheless...

my friend was quite pleased with his drink, but i wasn't... average drinks: roughly $10

drinks = 1star... service  = 1 stars... cleanliness = 1 star.
(there was a damn toothpick on the table where i was sitting at: i DID take a pic but it came out all fuzzy, sry)

ambiance = interestingly, i witnessed almost  3 couples, and most of the crowd was a mix... in one part, you see "tourists," then in another section, bunch of f-o-bs who are just trying to "mingle in"... it's funny how everyone was clumped together... business professionals, friends just hanging out, u get the dilio...

for the 3 couples, why'd you choose THIS  place of ALL places?  i JUST hope it wasn't "the first date..."  for first time dating, secret is to pick a place where you can a)actually hear the other person b)somewhere cozy and intimate, but not to the point of having just you two... and c)simply a touch of classical/jazz music in the bkgd... 

**according to the other yelpers, there was a jazz singer, but not when i went...

it was soo packed and to SEE few couples having to clump and scoot in together was pathetic and sad, yes, SHARE a table because seating was limited..and wait a min, we are at a HOTEL...hm...how can you enjoy your time w/your s/o or date when it's like that, or is it just moi?

i wouldn't come back, NOR would i bring out of towners.. i gave it an extra star, just purely for location...
author: Jennifer S.

description: Probably one of the few places in the city where I could spend a lovely Saturday night admiring the city lights from 39 stories above, sipping pomegranate martinis while telling stories, and dancing a revised foxtrot with my dad to a great jazz band playing Alicia Keyes.  A truly classy bar that hails back a few decades and makes you feel rich in life (even if the bill makes you sweat).
author: Kate M.

description:
my roommate, last night: "you're coming.it will be fun. come on."

me: "no,really. i have no desire. it's sunday and it's almost 10 pm"

mr: "karen...you're coming. get pretty."

me: "shit. ok."

2 hours later, way too many shots of southern comfort, a couple glasses of chardonnay, conversations with my roommates' childhood girlfriend about the misery of her marriage (thus, her desire for so co shots), and the bar closing, i demand my roommate never forget this 'favor'. he owes me big time.

besides the drunken thelma and/or louise conversations I had to endure, the bar was really great.  Our server, Cynthia, was phenomenal, and showed incredible empathy for me. At least I think that's why my second glass of wine was twice as full as my first one.   She was also the only one I could see working the tables, and she still managed to check in on us often, bring our drinks promptly, and laugh at my jokes, which can be really bad sometimes.

the bar itself is really laid back...mostly tourists staying in the hotel or around the Union Square area, and wanting to enjoy the incredible view from the 39th floor.  We were lucky enough to score a table right up against the spider man glass window, probably because it was a Sunday night. 

All in all I would highly recommend it, but beware of the prices. it's very spendy...our bill was scary....
author: k. w.

description: A good destination on a clear SF evening for some sunset action and reflection: a great view of Coit Tower and Twin Peaks with a glimpse of the GGB and the Pacific on the horizon.  However, because of the damn tourists the hotel attracts, the drinks are uber expensive!!  Two Kettle One dirties set us back $26 w/o tip... maybe because they thought the 3 olives they threw in would count as an appetizer.  Don't know.  And don't expect table service if you're not in the front room next to the bar... you'll be way parched.
author: Tara G.

description: They've updated the place a bit so it doesn't have that early 90's "brass and glass" look that it was sporting a couple years back.  The drinks have been updated as well.  I was surprised at how good the raspberry mojitos, a recommendation from the cocktail server, were.  Service was friendly and prompt.  It suffers from the same drawbacks that all hotel bars suffer from - that inescapable hotelness, and pricey drinks - but as hotel bars go, this one is solid and certainly has the best view.
author: Michelle A.

description: I like this place but there never seems to be any seating. It's frustrating when you can't find a good seat. Great selection of wine. Staff generally are friend. But I've been here a few times and usually there's no space OR we had to wait for a while or get non view seating.
author: Tiff W.

description: I must agree with everyone who has previously written a review on The View -- the view is spectacular! It is completely breathtaking. Yes, it's located at the top of the Marriot, but that's not important.  It's a good higher end chill spot. The menu items are pricey for sure, but you'll get over it and love 'em anyway.  Cozy, comfy seating, great view, great drinks, tasty appetizers, friendly staff. Good for groups or more intimate evenings/late nights.
author: MJ T.

description: I love this place! Good drinks, Great view, Awesome location. What more can you want? I even have a good time when I don't get a table with a view, that is how much I love this place. You don't have to be a guest to come up and have a drink or a snack, which is a total perk. Yes, it is a bit pricey and is a total splurge for me, but I always have a great time, so it's worth it.
author: Rebecca S.

description: This is a great place to hang out and watch the SF skyline day or night!  Beware of cloudy days because you won't be able to see much.  Friday/Saturday nights have live music.  They are open from 4 pm to midnight.
author: Jeannette S.

description: Beautiful view.. love the Speakeasy beer they serve there.  My bf and I had a nice romantic time there.  Great for dates and also nights out with friends!
author: Marcia D.

description: The view is amazing but it is a place to go for a couple drinks right around sunset and then leave.  The crowd is all over the map and the decor/ambiance is very dated.  Not a place you want to hangout for an evening, definitely feels just like an old hotel bar when you aren't looking out at the city.
author: Brooke K.

description:
I walked in with a head full of Cold War Kids, the whites of my eyes littered with red and my assassin mouth primed to spit. Two elevators to the top, the second has the girl with head-phones and a wry smile. We'll be craigslist lovers tomorrow. To the top we land, stepping out with an impervious hop my maker and I. The bar found two chairs to seat ourselves. A budweiser and margaritah to our beck, two dollars slipped to the side; you've done good, kiddo. The view feels like some other city, it's all out there - but I can't but feel it's all the prettier from a sidewalk with a bent neck and whistling bout of vertigo. There's the trouble of inflated self-importance when standing eye to eye with the fortieth floor, it's a sense that pervades this place. You've all got your spit-shined shoes and beautiful broads, the sort that preen their stereotypes clean. I imagine they were the couple spotted that morning, him swooping up the droppings of their darling pitbull - she whipping out a smarting tissue to wipe the critters arse.

Headphones back in. Floor one.
author: Marc M.

description: Why to go here? For the View! The drinks and food are really pricy but the view itself is free and amazing (hence the one $ sign). Just take the Downtown Marriott elevator to get up there!
author: Janice F.

description: Delicious pomegranate martinis-good views-great place to lounge around with friends and have drinks.
author: Melinda Q.

description: Spectacular view of the city!  I think we will come here for drinks from time to time just to kick back and enjoy the view.  A good place to catch the sunset too. I haven't tried their food, so I can't review that part.
author: Jeff H.

description: Snuck up here last week for a champagne to toast something lovely, followed by some delish martinis.  Not the cheapest but not the priciest.   Plus they carry  Hangar One vodkas, and I'm a fan of any bar that does.  Free snack mix too, which I fished through for all the sesame sticks, before sharing it with my companion.    After several drinks I found myself mesmerized by the projections of the realistic-looking moon on the ceiling along with 2 moving psychedelic glowing orbs.  Good service - not too attentive, but not ignored.  Just right.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Love this place. My bf took me here and this is where he sort of told me he liked me. hahahah!! NGSUN!! The ambiance is great. Love the live Jazz music. We will be back!! The View is so GREAT!!
author: Joanne D.

description:
My guest and I were in awe as the high-speed elevator opened on the 39th floor. Although the both of us have been here before, it's been a while and we've forgotten how special a place it was. We were very happy that there was no greeter at the main entrance. A greeter would definitely take away from the casual, yet elegant feel of this lounge. My guest and I came in a gawked out of the gigantic round window that is directly opposite the bar. At the time, the sun was beginning to set but was still bright out. We then walked to the other side of the lounge to determine which view to enjoy while we'd eat and drink. Being that both views are spectacular, we went back and forth between the sides a few times. We finally settled on the side with the round window when we noticed a couple leaving their table.

I started with the Citrus Crush cocktail. For being a freshly made cocktail that even had orange slices in it, I expected a longer wait. In less than approximately three minutes, our server delivered our drinks along with a glass full of Asian snack mix. After placing cocktail napkins down, and sitting our drinks on them, we ordered some food. He politely noted that some small dishes were three for twenty-two dollars. He also told us that the plates were fairly small, and pointed to a cocktail napkin as reference to the plate size. I truly appreciated this, because some times plate sizes come at a total shock. We ordered the chicken skewers, shrimp and vegetable rolls, and the roasted/grilled veggie medley.

Before I go on to describe the rest of our experience, it might be of some value to note the way my guest and I were dressed. My guest was wearing a pink, flowing long-sleeve top with designer jeans and boots. I was wearing a button-up, long sleeve dress shirt with designer jeans. By looking around the lounge, I'd say fifty percent of the crowd was dressed in a similar manner. The others were in more business attire, probably stopping by right after work nearby or from a convention. I'm not sure how the way we dressed affected our service, but I was never asked to see ID. I'm thirty years old. Also, the server didn't ask to hold a credit card or to open a tab. I appreciated the server treating us like everyone else and not some young kids. Again, had we not been dressed for the part, I'm not sure how service would've differed.

Less than ten minutes after ordering, he came back with our food, table napkins, and forks. The small, square dishes of roasted grilled vegetables and chicken skewers came on a large rectangular dish. Along side on the dish was an oil and vinegar dipping sauce for a complimentary basket of triangle-sliced bread. On a separate plate were the shrimp and vegetable rolls, which came with a vinegar/fish sauce dip and peanut sauce. The presentation was simple, yet brilliant. Clean, white, rectangular dishes, linen napkins, and small appetizer forks accented the beautifully prepared food.

The Asian snacks were a delightfully salty and sweet addition to the enjoyment of my cocktail. In a similar fashion, the bread and olive oil/vinegar dip was a wonderful addition to our meal. The bread was both warm and sweet, and made for a great in between flavor while enjoying the ordered food. The grilled vegetables had a nice mix of flavors, from sweet sun-dried tomatoes to tart artichoke hearts. The chicken skewers seemed a little "out-of-the-box" for my taste. The chicken didn't seem fresh, but it was still tender and tasty. To me, it was the weakest point of the meal. The shrimp rolls were very delicious. One set was so stuffed with vegetables and shrimp that it had broken out of its fresh wrapper. Plus, the variety of dipping sauces made for a different taste with every bite. Overall, this experience at the View Lounge was superb. I can't find one flaw in the experience that would cause us not to come back. Although the prices are a little high, you can't beat the view or the service.
author: Axel G.

description:
The excellent view of the SF downtown and the friendly service is marred only slightly by the high cost of drinks at this upscale hotel lounge.  When I first visited several years ago, I imagine very few people knew of its existence, because on a weekend it was very easy to find a place to sit for our group of ten people.  Things seem to have changed; when I visited the other weekend, a large crowd of (generally attractive and well-heeled) people had taken up residence in most every seat in the house; we were lucky to make do with a tiny table in the corner of the back room, where we enjoyed live vocal jazz music and an inspiring westward view.  Actually, the eastward side has an arguably better view; there's more lights up and down the street on that side, and you're overlooking the shopping and financial districts instead of Civic Center and the 'Loin.  Anyway, how can I not give at least four stars to a place with a window that reminds me of the view from the Death Star?

By the way, if you're the lovely lass who vibed me really hard as I obliviously stepped out of the elevator, please drop me a line  ;)
author: Chuck W.

description: Went there twice for drinks with a friend.  Very nice ambiance - dark and romantic.  Good for friends gathering.  Drinks were strong and the staffs were friendly.  Would go back again.
author: Josie K W.

description:
The saving grace of this place? the view.
The decent? The music was alright most of the night.
The downsides? 
Everyone in our crew being carded, regardless of age.
Requiring a single card to start a tab on.
Friend waiting at least 15 minutes at the bar without acknowledgement.
Dealing with one drink menu for a table of 11. (We 'borrowed' menus from surrounding tables)
Last call at 11pm?  I know it was Sunday night, but 2 hours before closing is last call?
Waiting 30 minutes for a drink order. (granted it looked like they were understaffed, so not so much our server's fault, and we received a free mojito and an apology.  I guess this was why last call was so early)
Overpriced drinks. $12-15 a cocktail.
The swarm of convention goers.  Who knew the National Asphalt and Pavement Association was so popular!
The couches.  Either you leaned forward for conversation, or you leaned back for comfort, you couldn't have both.

Granted, we did have a good time because of the company of friends, but the service was not so great, and it was crowded and expensive.
author: Ed H.

description: There's nothing like watching a sunset here over drinks and good conversation- it reminds me why there's no other place I'd rather live than the Bay Area. Although the $12 Goose and Tonics reminded me why I have no savings living in the Bay Area.
author: Cliff C.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place. I went there friday night with a bunch of friends to hear some Jazz.. God, the first time i stepped out of the elevator, my eyes were immediately transfixed by the glittering SF lights below. It is just so beautiful and the atmosphere is classy (but not snobbish) and chill-its a nice change from a bar/club atmosphere. Seating is very comfortable. I think its cool for a date or for mellow nights or just hanging out. Music and service was great. Me and my friends were very happy!!
author: Iche S.

description: This place should definitely be at the top of my list in terms of best views in San Francisco. You can see every side of the city from here. It reminds of that scene in Ferris Bueller's day off when they are looking down from the Sears Tower and thinking about all the people down on the street.  Reading all the reviews of this place remind me that I really need to get back here soon.
author: Srinivas R.

description: Nice view from the 39th floor of the Marriott Hotel SF on 4th Street. Lovely voice of a sultry woman who sings jazz on weekends. Could be a little loud if you are trying to enjoy small talks or conversation but great evening for a night out with friends and enjoy the music without cover charge.
author: Yan M.

description: Cool places. Music and fantastic views at night. Drinks are a bit pricey (glass of cheap wine was $12, bottled stella artois was $7), but you're paying for the view - I think it's worth it.
author: Steve C.

description: The drinks are INSANELY expensive. The ultimate cosmo wasn't great. really this place should get 2.5 stars. one extra star goes to the view because that is spectacular. the .5 goes to our waitress...my boyfriend accidentally spilled my entire drink on me (i was pissed but got over it after i got into clean clothes)...drenched and sticky, our waitress told me where the bathroom was and when I returned there was a new drink waiting for me. That was super nice.
author: Anita C.

description: A great view (on all sides of the lounge) of The City from SOMA, decent drinks, semi-private seating, good service. What's not to like? It isn't the best bar/lounge in town, but that isn't why you go. You go to sit in a comfy chair with a drink, next a giant window, watching San Francisco from 39 stories above the street.
author: Aaron J.

description: Nice place to have a cocktail with a superior view over San Francisco. You really should go there, they have a huge window (looks somehow like spaceship lookout) for just the view. The drinks are a bit expensive and not as good as the view
author: Joerch 9.

description: Awesome view of the whole city. Great drinks, a little pricey, but that's what you're gonna get at a nice hotel in SF. Mango Mojito is good. Come for the view if anything.
author: J M.

description: A different group of 6 decided to hit up this lovely spot before we went out. We were able to grab a table in the center of the window, the view is so incredible the city looks so breath taking. I had a dirty martini but could careless about it since, I couldn't keep my eyes off the city. It's really dark, so I had to use my cell phone to lead my way back from the bathroom. If you want to impress any guy or girl this is the spot to take them, I think I'm going to have to start dating just to bring people here and earn brownie points. It gets packed out by 7pm so be prepared.
author: Sarah T.

description:
being inside here felt like being in Bruce Wayne's high rise apartment in Gotham City, especially with the huge art deco glass windows.

yummy mojitos and wine.  great view - perfect for a romantic date or a casual drink with some good company.  yea, it's pricey...but go up the 39th floor anyway and check the view free of charge.
author: Paul A.

description: Best view of SF that I've found.....sure Top of the Mark is more glamorous, but if you want to impress out of town guests, this is the place.  The wine list is decent, not great, but the views and atmosphere are incredible.
author: Aaron M.

description: I quit my job (yaaay!).  Yesterday was my last day.  My boyfriend asked me what I wanted to do in celebration, and I said, "Get a drink!"  We debated between the Chieftain and the View Lounge, ultimately settling on the latter.  The view, of course, is AMAZING from both sides.  The drinks, though pricey, are strong and quite good.  We started at the bar, then snagged a table by the window on the west side.  We looked out into the highrises, spotting people in their apartments, and watched the rain.  It was GREAT.  The music was a bit loud, but for a Saturday night, the place wasn't too crowded.  It even emptied out a bit as the hours went on.  I think it's a great place for a crowd or a couple--and an excellent place to take out of town guests OR locals.
author: diana s.

description: we went to this lounge because no one felt like paying $20 for just another day at the club. We were pleasantly surprised to go up to the 39th floor of a building and not have to pay to sit down. We bought a bottle of $48 dollar wine for 5 people. It was good enough for. We are definitely getting old. Anyway we didn't have trouble finding seating for our group. The other people there were older, but in the end, it is your good time depends on who you're with. The views are really and only obstructed in the middle of the giant glass. Moral of the story is that I would go back.
author: Andrew Y.

description: It reminds me of one of my favorite places in Dubai with amazing view. Can sit there for hours and dose off in to the view. Great lounge music very Euro. Drinks are big and strong just how I like them! With one friend or a group on a big yellow couch I am in!
author: Nickolas V.

description: A little cramped. Rusty Nail tastes as advertised. Pricey, but not particularly stylish.
author: Nate L.

description: The view has a great....well view. It also has a real nice astmosphere at night. It's quite dark, but thats what makes it nice with the little lights everywhere. The only downside..i'm only 20 haha. It's more of a lounge for people to talk and have fun. Instead of getting wasted like no tommorow.
author: Terry S.

description:
the view lives up to its name and delivers a memorable view.  
the crowd was a mix of tourists, first dates and business men.
the drinks aren't very creative and selection is limited.
prices are typical of a hotel lounge $15 and up.
a great place to come after a dinner date or with visitors.
author: Audrey C.

description: When you come here and order a couple drinks, you're not paying for the drinks, you're paying for the view. Love the view from here. No wonder they call it the View Lounge. Anyway, the drinks are okay, nothing special, and the service was pretty slow. We had to bug the bartender and remind him that we gave him a $100 bill and needed change. I was wondering if he thought he got an $80 tip. I also like how it's very quiet there and you don't need to talk really loud in order to enjoy a conversation with the person you're with.
author: Zell C.

description: Awsome place to go and unwind after a long hard day. Go before or after the convention crowd gets there and you'll have prime seatting. One reviewer said it's the easiest place in the city to get laid... maybe, maybe not. But one thing I do know for a fact is that the drinks are tasty (-1 star for high price though), music is very chill and it's my new fav after work/ class place.
author: Brennan M.

description: Great view! Otherwise the ambience is caught between the reality of being in a conventioners' hotel yet trying to be a "cool lounge" (think overly loud bad music, ugly blinking projection light). Fortunately, it is pretty dark inside so you can get to the main business of enjoying the view. I'd take out of town visitors there.
author: Amy E.

description: I wouldn't recommend The View on a Friday night, or during a conference at Moscone, but I doubt there are many better places to relax and watch the sunset on a quiet Sunday night. There are plenty of open chairs by the windows and gorgeous, nearly 365 degree, views of the city. Drinks are a bit pricey but you're paying for a beautiful view and the luxury of a nice relaxed drink and conversation.
author: Will A.

description: my entire life, i have never been up there until my best friends/old college roomates from Sac were in town recently and stayed at the Marriott on Fourth St. the view was so spectacular and the vibe was pretty sophisticated but not overly pretentious. i would go back a few more times since the food was good and the drinks were decently priced for such a location. best to go when its dark so you can enjoy downtown san francisco's beautiful night scene! great to bring a date too!
author: Gordon L.

description: not bad...not exactly my scene, but the promo event to showcase specialty skyy martinis was delicious and fun. and, the actual view isn't too bad either. the place needs a little renovations and updates in decor, but not too bad.
author: Marjie T.

description: This lounge is probably the second best spot to see all of San Francisco, second only to Twin Peaks. One side is a view of downtown SF/SOMA and the other is a view of Mission and on. Spectacular view aside, it's just another hotel lounge. Usually its packed with tourists and during busy nights it may be hard to find a seat close to the windows. If you want to impress a date this is definitely the place to do it.
author: Manny V.

description: View of the City from indoors.  Personal favorite because it's where my BF confessed his love but besides that, always a great place to relax and have a drink.
author: Dana C.

description: No surprise here: great views of the city day or night, but you gotta fight for the tables near those views.  Still, once you've secured your own primo spot, it's fun watching all the other suckers scrambling for their share of the pie.  Ha ha, you suck!
author: brewgirl b.

description: The View lives up to its name. INCREDIBLE views of the city! Drink prices aren't bad, you are definitely paying for the ambiance and it is worth every penny. A great place to bring out-of-towners if you are looking to impress!
author: Greggory O.

description: I had a great, classy 21st birthday drink here. A friend and I got a fantastic seat by the window and could oversee the city at night. The waiter brought us a tiramisu when we let slip that it was my birthday, how nice! A bit on the expensive side, but worth it for the view.
author: Lisa N.

description: YES!"THE VIEW" IS really good. I had a drink with a friend from LA here. We got a seat facing the westside. It's a really nice view looking down the SF city. But the drinks is ok and it's kind of crowdy. about $10 to get a good view. I think it's still worthy.
author: Shenn L.

description:
ridiculous jukebox yeah! ridiculous jukebox ohh!
taxi for mr. newsom

seriously save your monies. and throw quarters at this art deco fiasco from atop the cityscape at the hilton, all the while extending a white gloved middle finger to the aforementioned, shitty bloody mary making, sneering service providing hotel, directly north east.

reminder these opinions are my own. please read responsibly.
author: chobs m.

description: nothing is cooler than coming here, enjoying the view, ordering overpriced drinks (like a $7 bottle of century-old water), and playing on your nintendo ds.
author: Jamie C.

description: Spectacular View of the city!  Bring a camera.  The rear section doesn't have bar service only the front section does(overlooking the Bay Bridge),  so you have to go to the bar to order.   Nice place to have a few drinks & relax a bit,  drinks do carry that tourist price however.    We'd come back for sure.
author: Rpm R.

description: Went here with a friend last night - awesome views and a decent lounge atmosphere.  Good service though not I'd put the bar staff as professional as opposed to friendly.  Drinks are on the higher end - $10-15 range for a decent cocktail.
author: Dave L.

description: While visiting San Fran from Chicago we stayed at the Marriott and decided to go to the view for some drinks and a bite to eat. The view was barely a view not the hotels fault it's so foggy but you couldn't see anything. The service is here is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!  Super slow and one of the people I was with had to send his food back not once but twice! Def won't be coming back here next time I visit!
author: Sarah H.

description: awesome views! go at sunset! it would be better if it were an outdoor rooftop bar though... but drinks were pretty standard... hotel prices (expensive)
author: Hannah Y.

description: you know, usually going to the top floor of a well known hotel requires a designer outfit, a snobby attitude and a biiig bank account.....not here! not only do i insist that every out of town guest join me here for the view and a few cocktails, but i enjoy this fab SF location regularly and with pleasure every time! the waitstaff is friendly, unpretencious and genuinly welcoming whether you plan on a big corporate event or just want to sip a glass of wine and watch the sunset. i have never felt rushed or judged nd in this city thats something i don't see often enough. kudos for the marriott for such a fabulous place for the tourists and the locals and kudos to the hardworking waitstaff for creating a friendly and relaxing atmosphere.
author: teala a.

description: ....grand views, 36 stories up, but maybe not grand enough to justify a $12 cocktail. but if you get a seat right by the window and stick to $5 draught beers (with free pretzels and nuts and fried sesame things) you've done alright.
author: michael w.

description: pretty douchy spot. great for a drink in the afternoon when it isn't crowded.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: This place is sweet and not too many people know about it.  They have a BEAUTIFUL view of the City...and the music wasn't bad either.  My friend ordered a mojito that was not made well at all....we couldnt tell what was wrong with it...but they gladly took it back and gave him a Cab instead.  The staff was nice...and we found seating right by the window which was awesome.  They only thing is that they don't stay open very late...and the kitchen closes early as well.  It would be a perfect place to end the night if they changed those things.  I will be going back again for sure:)
author: Marie M.

description: Well I went to the view to check out what the star trek dork was saying about the music.  I love thrill kill kult.  The windows are a bit reminescent of star wars but I had no fantasies about Chewbacca. Never have never will.  The music when I went there was techno.  Whatever I like to drink and couldnt have cared less.  The drinks are pricey, but strong.  I sat in the back where there wasnt wait service at first.  It was a bit of a mess back there.  I moved to the front as soon as a table was available and had a great time.   I recommend going there with a big group when you have something to celebrate.
author: sarah s.

description: The only reason I am giving this bar any stars is because of the incredible view.  I was immediately overwhelmed by the Millinium Falcon window that looks out upon the entire city of San Francisco.  It is amazing!  What would have made this experience SO much better is having the cast of Star Wars serve us drinks.  Lando as the bartender, Leia as the waitress, Chewbacca as the bus boy....whatever!  YOU go there and then tell me you don't fantasize about the same thing.  Anyway, the place was a mess, empty glasses all over the tables, napkins fragments all over the carpet, a motley crew assortment of clientele.  But the most pervasive aspect about the place was the angry, dark, overbearing, industrial noise that someone chose as the listening entertainment for the evening.  On the way out, I asked a waitress what music was playing, she confidently informed me it was Thrill Kill Cult.  I ask you, please listen to your own freak music when you're home..alone...cutting yourself in some pitiful cry for attention.
author: Penny O.
